scen viii southwark

alarum retreat enter cade rabblement

 cade up fish street saint magnu corner kill knock 
 throw thame sound parley what nois is
 i hear dare bold sound retreat parley i
 command kill 

 enter buckingham old clifford attended

 buckingham ay dare disturb thee 
 and therefor yet relent save life 
 know cade come ambassador king
 unto common thou hast misl 
 and pronounc free pardon all
 that forsak thee go home peac 
 clifford what say ye countrymen will ye relent
 and yield merci whilst ti offer 
 or let rebel lead death 
 who love king embrac pardon 
 fling cap say god save majesti 
 who hateth honour father 
 henri fifth made franc quak 
 shake weapon us pass 
 all god save king god save king 
 cade what buckingham clifford ye brave 
 and base peasant ye believ will need be
 hang neck hath sword therefor broke
 london gate leav white hart
 southwark i thought ye would never given arms
 till recov ancient freedom but all
 recreant dastard delight live slaveri the
 nobil let break back burden take your
 hous head ravish wive daughter before
 face for i make shift one god curse
 light upon 
 all we follow cade follow cade 
 clifford is cade son henri fifth 
 that thu exclaim go 
 will conduct heart franc 
 and make meanest earl duke 
 ala hath home place fli 
 nor know live spoil 
 unless rob friend us 
 were shame whilst live jar
 the fear french late vanquish 
 should make start er sea vanquish 
 methink alreadi civil broil
 i see lord london street 
 cri villiago unto meet 
 better ten thousand base born cade miscarry
 than stoop unto frenchman merci 
 to franc franc get lost 
 spare england nativ coast 
 henri hath money strong manli 
 god side doubt victori 
 all a clifford clifford we follow king clifford 
 cade wa ever feather lightli blown fro this
 multitud the name henri fifth hale hundred
 mischief make leav desol i see lay their
 head togeth surpris my sword make way here
 stay in despit devil hell through
 middest heaven honour wit that
 want resolut follow base and
 ignomini treason make betak heel 
 exit
 buckingham what fled go follow 
 and bring head unto king
 shall thousand crown reward 
 exeunt them
 follow soldier devis mean
 to reconcil unto king exeunt

scen ix kill worth castle

sound trumpet enter king queen somerset terrace

 king henri wa ever king joy earthli throne
 and could command content i 
 no sooner i crept cradle
 but i made king nine month old 
 wa never subject long king
 as i long wish subject 

 enter buckingham old clifford

 buckingham health glad tide majesti 
 king henri whi buckingham traitor cade surpri 
 or retir make strong 

 enter multitud halter necks

 clifford he fled lord power yield 
 and humbl thu halter neck 
 expect high doom life death 
 king henri then heaven set ope thi everlast gate 
 to entertain vow thank prais 
 soldier day redeem live 
 and show well love princ countri 
 continu still good mind 
 and henri though infortun 
 assur never unkind 
 and thank pardon 
 i dismiss sever countri 
 all god save king god save king 

 enter messenger

 messeng pleas grace advertised
 the duke york newli come ireland
 and puissant mighti power
 of gallowglass stout kerns
 is march hitherward proud array 
 and still proclaimeth come along 
 hi arm remov thee
 the duke somerset term traitor 
 king henri thu stand state twixt cade york distress 
 like ship scap tempest 
 is straightway calm board pirat 
 but cade driven back men disper 
 and york arm second 
 i pray thee buckingham go meet him
 and ask reason arm 
 tell i send duke edmund tower 
 and somerset commit thee thither
 until armi dismiss 
 somerset my lord 
 i yield prison willingli 
 or unto death countri good 
 king henri in case rough term 
 for fierc can not brook hard languag 
 buckingham i lord doubt deal
 as thing shall redound unto good 
 king henri come wife let learn govern better 
 for yet may england curs wretch reign 
 flourish exeunt

scen x kent iden garden

ent cade

 cade fie ambit fie sword yet am
 readi famish these five day i hid wood and
 durst peep countri laid i
 hungri i might leas life thousand
 year i could stay longer wherefor brick wall i
 climb garden see i eat grass pick sallet
 anoth amiss cool man stomach hot
 weather and i think word sallet born good for
 mani time sallet brain pain cleft a
 brown bill mani time i dri bravely
 march hath serv instead quart pot drink and
 word sallet must serv feed 

 enter iden

 iden lord would live turmoil court
 and may enjoy quiet walk 
 thi small inherit father left me
 contenteth worth monarchi 
 i seek wax great other waning
 or gather wealth i care envi 
 sufficeth i maintain state 
 and send poor well pleas gate 
 cade here lord soil come seiz stray for
 enter fee simpl without leav ah villain thou wilt
 betray get thousand crown king carri my
 head i make thee eat iron like ostrich and
 swallow sword like great pin ere thou i part 
 iden whi rude companion whatso er thou 
 i know thee i betray thee 
 is enough break garden
 and like thief come rob ground 
 climb wall spite owner 
 but thou wilt brave sauci term 
 cade brave thee ay best blood ever broach and
 beard thee look well i eat meat five
 day yet come thou thi five men i leav you
 dead door nail i pray god i may never eat grass
 
 iden nay shall ne er said england stand 
 that alexand iden esquir kent 
 took odd combat poor famish man 
 oppos thi steadfast gaze eye mine 
 see thou canst outfac thi look 
 set limb limb thou art far lesser 
 thi hand finger fist 
 thi leg stick compar truncheon 
 my foot shall fight strength thou hast 
 and mine arm heav air 
 thi grave digg alreadi earth 
 as word whose great answer word 
 let sword report speech forbear 
 cade by valour complet champion ever i heard 
 steel thou turn edg cut burli bon d
 clown chine beef ere thou sleep thi sheath i beseech
 god knee thou mayst turn hobnail here they
 fight cade fall o i slain famin hath slain
 let ten thousand devil come give the
 ten meal i lost i defi wither garden and
 henceforth buri place dwell hous 
 unconqu soul cade fled 
 iden is cade i slain monstrou traitor 
 sword i hallow thee thi deed
 and hang thee er tomb i dead 
 ne er shall blood wipe thi point 
 but thou shalt wear herald coat
 to emblaz honour thi master got 
 cade iden farewel proud thi victori tell kent from
 hath lost best man exhort world be
 coward i never fear vanquish famin 
 valour die 
 iden how much thou wrong st heaven judg 
 die damn wretch curs bare thee 
 and i thrust thi bodi sword 
 so wish i i might thrust thi soul hell 
 henc i drag thee headlong heels
 unto dunghil shall thi grave 
 and cut thi ungraci head 
 which i bear triumph king 
 leav thi trunk crow feed upon exit

act v scene i field dartford blackheath

ent york armi irish drum colours

 york from ireland thu come york claim right
 and pluck crown feebl henri head 
 ring bell aloud burn bonfir clear bright 
 to entertain great england law king 
 ah sancta majesta would buy thee dear 
 let obey know rule 
 thi hand made handl nought gold 
 i can not give due action words
 except sword sceptr balanc 
 a sceptr shall i soul
 on i toss flower de luce franc 

 enter buckingham

 asid whom buckingham disturb 
 the king hath sent sure i must dissembl 
 buckingham york thou meanest well i greet thee well 
 york humphrey buckingham i accept thi greet 
 art thou messeng come pleasur 
 buckingham a messeng henri dread lieg 
 to know reason arm peac 
 or thou subject i 
 against thi oath true allegi sworn 
 should rais great power without leav 
 or dare bring thi forc near court 
 york asid scarc i speak choler great 
 o i could hew rock fight flint 
 i angri abject term 
 and like ajax telamoniu 
 on sheep oxen could i spend furi 
 i far better born king 
 more like king kingli thought 
 but i must make fair weather yet awhil 
 till henri weak i strong 
 buckingham i prithe pardon me
 that i given answer 
 my mind troubl deep melancholi 
 the caus i brought armi hither
 is remov proud somerset king 
 sediti grace state 
 buckingham that much presumpt thi part 
 but thi arm end 
 the king hath yield unto thi demand 
 the duke somerset tower 
 york upon thine honour prison 
 buckingham upon mine honour prison 
 york then buckingham i dismiss pow rs 
 soldier i thank dispers 
 meet morrow saint georg field 
 you shall pay everyth wish 
 and let sovereign virtuou henri 
 command eldest son nay son 
 as pledg fealti love 
 i send will i live 
 land good hors armour anyth i 
 is use somerset may die 
 buckingham york i commend kind submiss 
 we twain go high tent 

 enter king attendants

 king henri buckingham doth york intend harm us 
 that thu marcheth thee arm arm 
 york in submiss humility
 york doth present unto high 
 king henri then intend forc thou dost bring 
 york to heav traitor somerset henc 
 and fight monstrou rebel cade 
 who sinc i heard discomfit 

 enter iden cade head

 iden if one rude mean condition
 may pass presenc king 
 lo i present grace traitor head 
 the head cade i combat slew 
 king henri the head cade great god art thou 
 o let view visag dead 
 that live wrought exceed troubl 
 tell friend art thou man slew 
 iden i like majesti 
 king henri how art thou call and thi degre 
 iden alexand iden name 
 a poor esquir kent love king 
 buckingham so pleas lord twere amiss
 he creat knight good servic 
 king henri iden kneel he kneel rise knight 
 we give thee reward thousand mark 
 and thou thenceforth attend us 
 iden may iden live merit bounti 
 and never live true unto lieg 

 enter queen somerset

 king henri see buckingham somerset come th queen 
 go bid hide quickli duke 
 queen for thousand york shall hide head 
 but boldli stand front face 
 york how is somerset liberti 
 then york unloos thi long imprison thoughts
 and let thi tongu equal thi heart 
 shall i endur sight somerset 
 fals king hast thou broken faith 
 know hardli i brook abus 
 king i call thee no thou art king 
 not fit govern rule multitud 
 which dar st canst rule traitor 
 that head thine doth becom crown 
 thi hand made grasp palmer staff 
 and grace aw princ sceptr 
 that gold must round engirt brow mine 
 whose smile frown like achil spear 
 is abl chang kill cure 
 here hand hold sceptr 
 and act control law 
 give place by heaven thou shalt rule more
 o er heaven creat thi ruler 
 somerset o monstrou traitor i arrest thee york 
 of capit treason gainst king crown 
 obey audaci traitor kneel grace 
 york wouldst kneel first let ask 
 if brook i bow knee man 
 sirrah call son bail exit attendant
 i know ere thi go ward 
 they pawn sword enfranchis 
 queen call hither clifford bid come amain 
 to say bastard boy york
 shall sureti traitor father 
 exit buckingham
 york o blood bespot neapolitan 
 outcast napl england bloodi scourg 
 the son york thi better birth 
 shall father bail bane those
 that sureti refus boy 

 enter edward richard plantagenet

 see come i warrant make good 

 enter clifford son

 queen and come clifford deni bail 
 clifford health happi lord king 
 kneel 
 york i thank thee clifford say news thee 
 nay fright us angri look 
 we thi sovereign clifford kneel 
 for thi mistak pardon thee 
 clifford thi king york i mistak 
 but thou mistak much think i 
 to bedlam is man grown mad 
 king henri ay clifford bedlam ambiti humour
 make oppos king 
 clifford he traitor let tower 
 and chop away factiou pate 
 queen he arrest obey 
 hi son say shall give word 
 york will son 
 edward ay nobl father word serv 
 richard and word weapon shall 
 clifford whi brood traitor 
 york look glass call thi imag 
 i thi king thou fals heart traitor 
 call hither stake two brave bear 
 that shake chains
 they may astonish fell lurk cur 
 bid salisburi warwick come 

 enter earl of warwick salisbury

 clifford are thi bear we bait thi bear death 
 and manacl berard chain 
 if thou dar st bring bait place 
 richard oft i seen hot er ween cur
 run back bite withheld 
 who suffer bear fell paw 
 hath clapp tail leg cri 
 and piec servic 
 if oppos match lord warwick 
 clifford henc heap wrath foul indigest lump 
 as crook thi manner thi shape 
 york nay shall heat thoroughli anon 
 clifford take heed lest heat burn 
 king henri whi warwick hath thi knee forgot bow 
 old salisburi shame thi silver hair 
 thou mad mislead thi brainsick son 
 what wilt thou thi death bed play ruffian
 and seek sorrow thi spectacl 
 o faith o loyalti 
 if banish frosti head 
 where shall find harbour earth 
 wilt thou go dig grave find war
 and shame thine honour age blood 
 whi art thou old want st experi 
 or wherefor dost abus thou hast 
 for shame in duti bend thi knee 
 that bow unto grave mickl age 
 salisburi my lord i consid myself
 the tide renown duke 
 and conscienc reput grace
 the right heir england royal seat 
 king henri hast thou sworn allegi unto 
 salisburi i 
 king henri canst thou dispens heaven oath 
 salisburi it great sin swear unto sin 
 but greater sin keep sin oath 
 who bound solemn vow
 to murd rou deed rob man 
 to forc spotless virgin chastiti 
 to reav orphan patrimoni 
 to wring widow custom right 
 and reason wrong
 but bound solemn oath 
 queen a subtl traitor need sophist 
 king henri call buckingham bid arm 
 york call buckingham friend thou hast 
 i resolv death digniti 
 clifford the first i warrant thee dream prove true 
 warwick you best go bed dream again
 to keep thee tempest field 
 clifford i resolv bear greater storm
 than thou canst conjur day 
 and i write upon thi burgonet 
 might i know thee thi household badg 
 warwick now father badg old nevil crest 
 the rampant bear chain rag staff 
 thi day i wear aloft burgonet 
 as mountain top cedar show 
 that keep leav spite storm 
 even affright thee view thereof 
 clifford and thi burgonet i rend thi bear
 and tread foot contempt 
 despit berard protect bear 
 young clifford and arm victori father 
 to quell rebel complic 
 richard fie chariti shame speak spite 
 for shall sup jesu christ night 
 young clifford foul stigmat thou canst tell 
 richard if heaven sure sup hell 
 exeunt severally

scen ii saint albans

alarum battl enter warwick

 warwick clifford cumberland ti warwick call 
 and thou dost hide thee bear 
 now angri trumpet sound alarum
 and dead men cri fill empti air 
 clifford i say come forth fight 
 proud northern lord clifford cumberland 
 warwick hoars call thee arm 

 enter york

 how nobl lord foot 
 york the deadli hand clifford slew steed 
 but match match i encount red 
 and made prey carrion kite crows
 even bonni beast lov well 

 enter old clifford

 warwick of one us time come 
 york hold warwick seek thee chase 
 for i must hunt deer death 
 warwick then nobli york ti crown thou fight st 
 as i intend clifford thrive day 
 it griev soul leav thee unassail exit
 clifford what seest thou york whi dost thou paus 
 york with thi brave bear i love
 but thou art fast mine enemi 
 clifford nor thi prowess want prais esteem
 but ti shown ignobl treason 
 york so let help thi sword 
 as i justic true right express 
 clifford my soul bodi action 
 york a dread lay address thee instantli 
 they fight clifford fall 
 clifford la fin couronn le oeuvr die 
 york thu war hath given thee peac thou art still 
 peac soul heaven thi exit

 enter young clifford

 young clifford shame confus all rout 
 fear frame disord disord wounds
 where guard o war thou son hell 
 whom angri heaven make minist 
 throw frozen bosom part
 hot coal vengeanc let soldier fli 
 he truli dedic war
 hath self love love himself
 hath essenti circumst 
 the name valour see father bodi 
 o let vile world end
 and premis flame last day
 knit earth heaven togeth 
 now let gener trumpet blow blast 
 particular petti sounds
 to ceas wast thou ordain dear father 
 to lose thi youth peac achieve
 the silver liveri advis age 
 and thi rever thi chair day thus
 to die ruffian battl even sight
 my heart turn stone ti mine
 it shall stoni york old men spare 
 no i babe tear virginal
 shall even dew fire 
 and beauti tyrant oft reclaim 
 shall flame wrath oil flax 
 henceforth i piti 
 meet i infant hous york 
 into mani gobbet i cut it
 as wild medea young absyrtu 
 in cruelti i seek fame 
 come thou new ruin old clifford hous 
 as aenea old anchis bear 
 so bear i thee upon manli shoulder 
 but aenea bare live load 
 noth heavi woe mine 
 exit body

 enter richard somerset fight somerset killed

 richard so lie thou 
 for underneath alehous paltri sign 
 the castl saint alban somerset
 hath made wizard famou death 
 sword hold thi temper heart wrath still 
 priest pray enemi princ kill exit

 fight excurs enter king queen others

 queen away lord you slow shame away 
 king henri can outrun heaven good margaret stay 
 queen what made you fight fli 
 now manhood wisdom defenc 
 to give enemi way secur us
 by fli 
 alarum afar 
 if ta en see bottom
 of fortun hapli scape 
 as well may neglect 
 we shall london get lov 
 and breach fortun made
 may readili stopp 

 re enter young clifford

 young clifford but heart futur mischief set 
 i would speak blasphemi ere bid fli 
 but fli must uncur discomfit
 reign heart present part 
 away relief live
 to see day fortun give 
 away lord away exeunt

scen iii field near saint albans

alarum retreat enter york richard warwick soldier drum
and colours

 york of salisburi report 
 that winter lion rage forgets
 age contus brush time
 and like gallant brow youth 
 repair occas thi happi day
 is one foot 
 if salisburi lost 
 richard my nobl father 
 three time day i holp hors 
 three time bestrid thrice i led 
 persuad act 
 but still danger still i met 
 and like rich hang home hous 
 so old feebl bodi 
 but nobl look come 

 enter salisbury

 salisburi now sword well hast thou fought day 
 by th mass i thank richard 
 god know long i live 
 and hath plea him three time day
 you defend immin death 
 well lord got 
 ti enough foe time fled 
 be opposit repair natur 
 york i know safeti follow 
 for i hear king fled london
 to call present court parliament 
 let us pursu ere writ go forth 
 what say lord warwick shall 
 warwick after nay 
 now faith lord twa gloriou day 
 saint alban battl famou york 
 shall eterniz age come 
 sound drum trumpet london 
 and day us befal exeunt




th third part of king henri the sixth

dramati personae

 king henri the sixth
 edward princ of wale son
 lewi xi king franc duke of somerset
 duke of exet earl of oxford
 earl of northumberland earl of westmoreland
 lord clifford
 richard plantagenet duke of york

 edmund earl of rutland son
 georg afterward duke of clarenc son
 richard afterward duke of gloucest son
 duke of norfolk marqui of montague
 earl of warwick earl of pembroke
 lord hast lord stafford
 sir john mortim uncl duke york
 sir hugh mortim uncl duke york
 henri earl of richmond youth
 lord river brother ladi grey
 sir william stanley sir john montgomery
 sir john somervil tutor rutland
 mayor of york lieuten of the tower
 a nobleman two keepers
 a huntsman
 a son kill father
 a father kill son

 queen margaret
 ladi grey afterward queen edward iv
 bona sister french queen

 soldier attend messeng watchmen etc 

scene england france

act i scene i london the parliament house

alarum enter duke of york edward richard norfolk montagu 
warwick soldier white rose hats

 warwick i wonder king escap hand 
 york while pursu horsemen north 
 he slili stole away left men 
 whereat great lord northumberland 
 whose warlik ear could never brook retreat 
 cheer droop armi 
 lord clifford lord stafford abreast 
 charg main battl front break 
 were sword common soldier slain 
 edward lord stafford father duke buckingham 
 is either slain wound danger 
 i cleft beaver downright blow 
 that true father behold blood 
 montagu and brother earl wiltshir blood 
 whom i encount red battl join 
 richard speak thou tell i 
 throw somerset s head 
 york richard hath best deserv son 
 but grace dead lord somerset 
 norfolk such hope line john gaunt 
 richard thu i hope shake king henri head 
 warwick and i victori princ york 
 befor i see thee seat throne
 which hous lancast usurp 
 i vow heaven eye shall never close 
 thi palac fear king 
 and regal seat possess york 
 for thine king henri heir 
 york assist sweet warwick i 
 for hither broken forc 
 norfolk we assist fli shall die 
 york thank gentl norfolk stay lord 
 and soldier stay lodg night 
 they go 
 warwick and king come offer violenc 
 unless seek thrust perforc 
 york the queen day hold parliament 
 but littl think shall council 
 by word blow let us win right 
 richard arm let stay within hous 
 warwick the bloodi parliament shall call 
 unless plantagenet duke york king 
 and bash henri depo whose cowardice
 hath made us word enemi 
 york then leav lord resolut 
 i mean take possess right 
 warwick neither king love best 
 the proudest hold lancast 
 dare stir wing warwick shake bell 
 i plant plantagenet root dare 
 resolv thee richard claim english crown 
 york occupi throne 

 flourish enter king henri clifford northumberland 
 westmoreland exet other red rose in
 hats

 king henri my lord look sturdi rebel sit 
 even chair state belik mean 
 back power warwick fals peer 
 to aspir unto crown reign king 
 earl northumberland slew thi father 
 and thine lord clifford vow revenge
 on son favourit friend 
 northumberland if i heaven reveng 
 clifford the hope thereof make clifford mourn steel 
 westmoreland what shall suffer let pluck 
 my heart anger burn i can not brook 
 king henri be patient gentl earl westmoreland 
 clifford patienc poltroon 
 he durst sit father liv 
 my graciou lord parliament
 let us assail famili york 
 northumberland well hast thou spoken cousin 
 king henri ah know citi favour 
 and troop soldier beck 
 exet but duke slain quickli fli 
 king henri far thought henri heart 
 to make shambl parliament hous 
 cousin exet frown word threat 
 shall war henri mean use 
 thou factiou duke york descend throne
 and kneel grace merci feet 
 i thi sovereign 
 york i thine 
 exet for shame come made thee duke york 
 york twa inherit earldom 
 exet thi father traitor crown 
 warwick exet thou art traitor crown
 in follow usurp henri 
 clifford whom follow natur king 
 warwick true clifford richard duke york 
 king henri and shall i stand thou sit throne 
 york it must shall content thyself 
 warwick be duke lancast let king 
 westmoreland he king duke lancast 
 and lord westmoreland shall maintain 
 warwick and warwick shall disprov you forget
 that cha field 
 and slew father colour spread
 march citi palac gate 
 northumberland ye warwick i rememb grief 
 and soul thou thi hous shall rue 
 westmoreland plantagenet thee thi son 
 thi kinsmen thi friend i lives
 than drop blood father vein 
 clifford urg lest instead words
 i send thee warwick messenger
 as shall reveng death i stir 
 warwick poor clifford i scorn worthless threat 
 york will show titl crown 
 if sword shall plead field 
 king henri what titl hast thou traitor crown 
 thi father thou art duke york 
 thi grandfath roger mortim earl march 
 i son henri fifth 
 who made dauphin french stoop 
 and seiz upon town provinc 
 warwick talk franc sith thou hast lost 
 king henri the lord protector lost i 
 when i crown i nine month old 
 richard you old enough yet methink lose 
 father tear crown usurp head 
 edward sweet father set head 
 montagu good brother thou lov st honourest arm 
 let fight stand cavil thu 
 richard sound drum trumpet king fli 
 york son peac 
 king henri peac thou give king henri leav speak 
 warwick plantagenet shall speak first hear lord 
 and silent attent 
 for interrupt shall live 
 king henri think st thou i leav kingli throne 
 wherein grandsir father sat 
 no first shall war unpeopl realm 
 ay colour often born franc 
 and england heart great sorrow 
 shall wind sheet whi faint lord 
 my titl good better far 
 warwick prove henri thou shalt king 
 king henri henri fourth conquest got crown 
 york twa rebellion king 
 king henri asid i know say titl weak 
 tell may king adopt heir 
 york what 
 king henri an may i law king 
 for richard view mani lord 
 resign crown henri fourth 
 whose heir father i 
 york he rose sovereign 
 and made resign crown perforc 
 warwick suppos lord unconstrain 
 think twere prejudici crown 
 exet no could resign crown
 but next heir succeed reign 
 king henri art thou us duke exet 
 exet hi right therefor pardon 
 york whi whisper lord answer 
 exet my conscienc tell law king 
 king henri asid all revolt turn 
 northumberland plantagenet claim thou lay st 
 think henri shall depo 
 warwick depo shall despit 
 northumberland thou art deceiv ti thi southern power
 of essex norfolk suffolk kent 
 which make thee thu presumptu proud 
 can set duke despit 
 clifford king henri thi titl right wrong 
 lord clifford vow fight thi defenc 
 may ground gape swallow aliv 
 where i shall kneel slew father 
 king henri o clifford thi word reviv heart 
 york henri lancast resign thi crown 
 what mutter conspir lord 
 warwick do right unto princ duke york 
 or i fill hous arm men 
 and chair state sit 
 write titl usurp blood 
 he stamp foot the
 soldier show 
 king henri my lord warwick hear one word 
 let life time reign king 
 york confirm crown mine heir 
 and thou shalt reign quiet thou liv st 
 king henri i content richard plantagenet 
 enjoy kingdom deceas 
 clifford what wrong unto princ son 
 warwick what good england 
 westmoreland base fear despair henri 
 clifford how hast thou injur thyself us 
 westmoreland i can not stay hear articl 
 northumberland nor i 
 clifford come cousin let us tell queen news 
 westmoreland farewel faint heart degener king 
 in whose cold blood spark honour bide 
 northumberland be thou prey unto hous york
 and die band unmanli deed 
 clifford in dread war mayst thou overcom 
 or live peac abandon despi 
 exeunt northumberland clifford 
 westmoreland
 warwick turn way henri regard 
 exet they seek reveng therefor yield 
 king henri ah exet 
 warwick whi sigh lord 
 king henri not lord warwick son 
 whom i unnatur shall disinherit 
 but may to york i entail
 the crown thee thine heir ever 
 condit thou take oath
 to ceas civil war whilst i live 
 to honour thi king sovereign 
 and neither treason hostility
 to seek put reign thyself 
 york thi oath i willingli take perform 
 come throne 
 warwick long live king henri plantagenet embrac 
 king henri and long live thou thi forward son 
 york now york lancast reconcil 
 exet accur seek make foe 
 sennet here come 
 york farewel graciou lord i castl 
 warwick and i keep london soldier 
 norfolk and i norfolk follow 
 montagu and i unto sea whenc i came 
 exeunt yorkists
 king henri and i grief sorrow court 

 enter queen margaret princ of wales

 exet here come queen whose look bewray anger 
 i steal away 
 king henri exet i 
 queen margaret nay go i follow thee 
 king henri be patient gentl queen i stay 
 queen margaret who patient extrem 
 ah wretch man would i die maid 
 and never seen thee never born thee son 
 see thou hast prov unnatur father 
 hath deserv lose birthright thu 
 hadst thou lov half well i 
 or felt pain i 
 or nourish i blood 
 thou wouldst left thi dearest heart blood there
 rather made savag duke thine heir 
 and disinherit thine son 
 princ of wale father can not disinherit 
 if king i succeed 
 king henri pardon margaret pardon sweet son 
 the earl warwick duke enforc 
 queen margaret enforc thee art thou king wilt be
 forc 
 i shame hear thee speak ah timor wretch 
 thou hast undon thyself thi son 
 and giv n unto hous york head
 as thou shalt reign suffer 
 to entail heir unto crown 
 what make thi sepulchre
 and creep far thi time 
 warwick chancellor lord calai 
 stern falconbridg command narrow sea 
 the duke made protector realm 
 and yet shalt thou safe such safeti finds
 the trembl lamb environ wolv 
 had i silli woman 
 the soldier toss pikes
 befor i would grant act 
 but thou prefer st thi life thine honour 
 and see thou dost i divorc 
 both thi tabl henri thi bed 
 until act parliament repeal d
 wherebi son disinherit 
 the northern lord forsworn thi colours
 will follow mine see spread 
 and spread shall thi foul disgrace
 and utter ruin hous york 
 thu i leav thee come son let away 
 our armi readi come 
 king henri stay gentl margaret hear speak 
 queen margaret thou hast spoke much alreadi get thee gone 
 king henri gentl son edward thou wilt stay 
 queen margaret ay murder enemi 
 princ of wale when i return victori field
 i see grace till i follow 
 queen margaret come son away may linger thu 
 exeunt queen margaret prince
 king henri poor queen how love son
 hath made break term rage 
 reveng may hate duke 
 whose haughti spirit wing desir 
 will cost crown like empti eagle
 tire flesh son 
 the loss three lord torment heart 
 i write unto entreat fair 
 come cousin shall messeng 
 exet and i i hope shall reconcil exeunt

scen ii sandal castl near wakefield yorkshire

flourish enter edward richard montague

 richard brother though i youngest give leav 
 edward no i better play orat 
 montagu but i reason strong forcibl 

 enter duke of york

 york whi son brother strife 
 what quarrel how began first 
 edward no quarrel slight content 
 york about 
 richard about concern grace us 
 the crown england father 
 york mine boy not till king henri dead 
 richard your right depend life death 
 edward now heir therefor enjoy 
 by give hous lancast leav breath 
 it outrun father end 
 york i took oath quietli reign 
 edward but kingdom oath may broken 
 i would break thousand oath reign one year 
 richard no god forbid grace forsworn 
 york i shall i claim open war 
 richard i prove contrari hear speak 
 york thou canst son imposs 
 richard an oath moment took
 befor true law magistrate
 that hath author swear 
 henri none usurp place 
 then see twa made depos 
 your oath lord vain frivol 
 therefor arm and father think
 how sweet thing wear crown 
 within whose circuit elysium
 and poet feign bliss joy 
 whi linger thu i can not rest
 until white rose i wear dy d
 even lukewarm blood henri heart 
 york richard enough i king die 
 brother thou shalt london presently
 and whet warwick enterpris 
 thou richard shalt duke norfolk
 and tell privili intent 
 you edward shall unto lord cobham 
 with kentishmen willingli rise 
 in i trust soldier 
 witti courteou liber full spirit 
 while thu employ resteth more
 but i seek occas rise 
 and yet king privi drift 
 nor hous lancast 

 enter messenger

 but stay what news whi com st thou post 
 messeng the queen northern earl lords
 intend besieg castl 
 she hard twenti thousand men 
 and therefor fortifi hold lord 
 york ay sword what think st thou fear 
 edward richard shall stay 
 my brother montagu shall post london 
 let nobl warwick cobham rest 
 whom left protector king 
 with pow rful polici strengthen themselves
 and trust simpl henri oath 
 montagu brother i go i win fear 
 and thu humbl i take leav exit

 enter sir john sir hugh mortimer

 york sir john sir hugh mortim mine uncl 
 you come sandal happi hour 
 the armi queen mean besieg us 
 sir john she shall need meet field 
 york what five thousand men 
 richard ay five hundr father need 
 a woman gener fear 
 a march afar 
 edward i hear drum let set men order 
 and issu forth bid battl straight 
 york five men twenti though odd great 
 i doubt uncl victori 
 mani battl i franc 
 when enemi hath ten one 
 whi i like success exeunt

scen iii field battl sandal castl wakefield

alarum enter rutland tutor

 rutland ah whither shall i fli scape hand 
 ah tutor look bloodi clifford come 

 enter clifford soldiers

 clifford chaplain away thi priesthood save thi life 
 as brat accurs duke 
 whose father slew father shall die 
 tutor and i lord bear compani 
 clifford soldier away 
 tutor ah clifford murder innoc child 
 lest thou hate god man 
 exit forc soldiers
 clifford how dead alreadi or fear
 that make close eye i open 
 rutland so look pent lion er wretch
 that trembl devour paw 
 and walk insult er prey 
 and come rend limb asund 
 ah gentl clifford kill thi sword 
 and cruel threat ning look 
 sweet clifford hear speak i die 
 i mean subject thi wrath 
 be thou reveng men let live 
 clifford in vain thou speak st poor boy father blood
 hath stopp passag thi word enter 
 rutland then let father blood open 
 he man clifford cope 
 clifford had i thi brethren live thine
 were reveng suffici 
 no i digg thi forefath graves
 and hung rotten coffin chain 
 it could slake mine ire eas heart 
 the sight hous york
 is furi torment soul 
 and till i root accurs line
 and leav one aliv i live hell 
 therefor 
 rutland o let pray i take death 
 to thee i pray sweet clifford piti 
 clifford such piti rapier point afford 
 rutland i never thee harm wilt thou slay 
 clifford thi father hath 
 rutland but twa ere i born 
 thou hast one son sake piti 
 lest reveng thereof sith god 
 he miser slain i 
 ah let live prison day 
 and i give occas offence
 then let die thou hast caus 
 clifford no caus 
 thi father slew father therefor die stab 
 rutland di faciant laudi summa sit ista tuae die 
 clifford plantagenet i come plantagenet 
 and thi son blood cleav blade
 shall rust upon weapon till thi blood 
 congeal make wipe exit

scen iv anoth part field

alarum enter duke of york

 york the armi queen hath got field 
 my uncl slain rescu 
 and follow eager foe
 turn back fli like ship wind 
 or lamb pursu hunger starv wolv 
 my son god know hath bechanc 
 but i know demean themselves
 like men born renown life death 
 three time richard make lane 
 and thrice cri courag father fight 
 and full oft came edward side
 with purpl falchion paint hilt
 in blood encount red 
 and hardiest warrior retir 
 richard cri charg give foot ground 
 and cri a crown els gloriou tomb 
 a sceptr earthli sepulchr 
 with charg ala 
 we bodg i seen swan
 with bootless labour swim tide
 and spend strength match wave 
 a short alarum within 
 ah hark the fatal follow pursu 
 and i faint can not fli furi 
 and i strong i would shun furi 
 the sand numb red make life 
 here must i stay life must end 

 enter queen margaret clifford northumberland 
 princ of wale soldiers

 come bloodi clifford rough northumberland 
 i dare quenchless furi rage 
 i butt i abid shot 
 northumberland yield merci proud plantagenet 
 clifford ay merci ruthless arm
 with downright payment show unto father 
 now phaethon hath tumbl car 
 and made even noontid prick 
 york my ash phoenix may bring forth
 a bird reveng upon 
 and hope i throw mine eye heaven 
 scorn whate er afflict 
 whi come what multitud fear 
 clifford so coward fight fli 
 so dove peck falcon pierc talon 
 so desper thiev hopeless live 
 breath invect gainst offic 
 york o clifford bethink thee 
 and thi thought errun former time 
 and thou canst blush view face 
 and bite thi tongu slander cowardice
 whose frown hath made thee faint fli ere 
 clifford i bandi thee word word 
 but buckler thee blow twice two one 
 queen margaret hold valiant clifford thousand causes
 i would prolong awhil traitor life 
 wrath make deaf speak thou northumberland 
 northumberland hold clifford honour much
 to prick thi finger though wound heart 
 what valour cur doth grin 
 for one thrust hand teeth 
 when might spurn foot away 
 it war prize take vantag 
 and ten one impeach valour 
 they lay hand york struggl 
 clifford ay ay strive woodcock gin 
 northumberland so doth coni struggl net 
 york so triumph thiev upon conquer booti 
 so true men yield robber er match 
 northumberland what would grace done unto 
 queen margaret brave warrior clifford northumberland 
 come make stand upon molehil here
 that raught mountain outstretch arm 
 yet part shadow hand 
 what would england king 
 wa revel parliament
 and made preachment high descent 
 where mess son back 
 the wanton edward lusti georg 
 and valiant crook back prodigi 
 dicki boy grumbl voice
 wa wont cheer dad mutini 
 or rest darl rutland 
 look york i stain napkin blood
 that valiant clifford rapier point
 made issu bosom boy 
 and thine eye water death 
 i give thee dri thi cheek withal 
 ala poor york i hate thee deadli 
 i lament thi miser state 
 i prithe griev make merri york 
 what hath thi fieri heart parch thine entrails
 that tear fall rutland death 
 whi art thou patient man thou shouldst mad 
 and i make thee mad mock thee thu 
 stamp rave fret i may sing danc 
 thou wouldst fee i see make sport 
 york can not speak unless wear crown 
 a crown york lord bow low 
 hold hand whilst i set 
 put paper crown head 
 ay marri sir look like king 
 ay took king henri chair 
 and adopt heir 
 but great plantagenet
 is crown soon broke solemn oath 
 as i bethink king
 till king henri shook hand death 
 and pale head henri glori 
 and rob templ diadem 
 now life holi oath 
 o ti fault too
 off crown crown head 
 and whilst breath take time dead 
 clifford that offic father sake 
 queen margaret nay stay let hear orison make 
 york she wolf franc wors wolv franc 
 whose tongu poison adder tooth 
 how ill beseem thi sex
 to triumph like amazonian trull
 upon woe fortun captiv 
 but thi face visard like unchang 
 made impud use evil deed 
 i would assay proud queen make thee blush 
 to tell thee whenc thou cam st deriv 
 were shame enough shame thee wert thou shameless 
 thi father bear type king napl 
 of sicil jerusalem 
 yet wealthi english yeoman 
 hath poor monarch taught thee insult 
 it need boot thee proud queen 
 unless adag must verifi 
 that beggar mount run hors death 
 ti beauti doth oft make women proud 
 but god he know thi share thereof small 
 ti virtu doth make admir 
 the contrari doth make thee wond red 
 ti govern make seem divin 
 the want thereof make thee abomin 
 thou art opposit everi good
 as antipod unto us 
 or south septentrion 
 o tiger heart wrapp woman hide 
 how couldst thou drain life blood child 
 to bid father wipe eye withal 
 and yet seen bear woman face 
 women soft mild piti flexibl 
 thou stern obdur flinti rough remorseless 
 bid st thou rage whi thou hast thi wish 
 wouldst weep whi thou hast thi 
 for rage wind blow incess shower 
 and rage allay rain begin 
 these tear sweet rutland obsequi 
 and everi drop cri vengeanc death
 gainst thee fell clifford thee fals frenchwoman 
 northumberland beshrew passion move so
 that hardli i check eye tear 
 york that face hungri cannibals
 would touch would stain blood 
 but inhuman inexor 
 o ten time tiger hyrcania 
 see ruthless queen hapless father tear 
 thi cloth thou dipp dst blood sweet boy 
 and i tear wash blood away 
 keep thou napkin go boast 
 and thou tell st heavi stori right 
 upon soul hearer shed tear 
 yea even foe shed fast fall tears
 and say ala piteou deed 
 there take crown crown curs 
 and thi need comfort come thee
 as i reap thi cruel hand 
 hard heart clifford take world 
 my soul heaven blood upon head 
 northumberland had slaughter man kin 
 i life weep 
 to see inli sorrow gripe soul 
 queen margaret what weep ripe lord northumberland 
 think upon wrong us 
 and quickli dri thi melt tear 
 clifford here oath father death 
 stab 
 queen margaret and right gentl heart king 
 stab 
 york open thi gate merci graciou god 
 my soul fli wound seek thee 
 die 
 queen margaret off head set york gate 
 so york may overlook town york 
 flourish exeunt

act ii scene i a plain near mortim cross herefordshire

a march enter edward richard power

 edward i wonder princ father scap 
 or whether scap away no
 from clifford northumberland pursuit 
 had ta en heard news 
 had slain heard news 
 or scap methink heard
 the happi tide good escap 
 how fare brother whi sad 
 richard i can not joy i resolv d
 where right valiant father becom 
 i saw battl rang 
 and watch singl clifford forth 
 methought bore thickest troop
 as doth lion herd neat 
 or bear encompass round dog 
 who pinch made cri 
 the rest stand aloof bark 
 so far father enemi 
 so fled enemi warlik father 
 methink ti prize enough son 
 see morn ope golden gates
 and take farewel gloriou sun 
 how well resembl prime youth 
 trimm like younker pranc love 
 edward dazzl mine eye i see three sun 
 richard three gloriou sun one perfect sun 
 not separ rack cloud 
 but sever pale clear shine sky 
 see see join embrac seem kiss 
 as vow leagu inviol 
 now one lamp one light one sun 
 in heaven figur event 
 edward ti wondrou strang like yet never heard 
 i think cite us brother field 
 that son brave plantagenet 
 each one alreadi blaze meed 
 should notwithstand join light together
 and overshin earth world 
 whate er bode henceforward i bear
 upon target three fair shine sun 
 richard nay bear three daughter leav i speak 
 you love breeder better male 

 enter messeng blowing

 but art thou whose heavi look foretell
 some dread stori hang thi tongu 
 messeng ah one woeful looker on
 when nobl duke york slain 
 your princ father love lord 
 edward o speak i heard much 
 richard say die i hear 
 messeng environ mani foe 
 and stood hope troy
 against greek would ent red troy 
 but hercul must yield odd 
 and mani stroke though littl axe 
 hew fell hardest timber oak 
 by mani hand father subdu 
 but slaught red ire arm
 of unrel clifford queen 
 who crown graciou duke high despit 
 laugh face grief wept 
 the ruthless queen gave dri cheeks
 a napkin steep harmless blood
 of sweet young rutland rough clifford slain 
 and mani scorn mani foul taunt 
 they took head gate york
 they set doth remain 
 the saddest spectacl e er i view 
 edward sweet duke york prop lean upon 
 now thou art gone staff stay 
 o clifford boist rou clifford thou hast slain
 the flow r europ chivalri 
 and treacher hast thou vanquish 
 for hand hand would vanquish thee 
 now soul palac becom prison 
 ah would break henc body
 might ground close rest 
 for never henceforth shall i joy 
 never o never shall i see joy 
 richard i can not weep bodi moisture
 scarc serv quench furnac burn heart 
 nor tongu unload heart great burden 
 for self wind i speak withal
 is kindl coal fire breast 
 and burn flame tear would quench 
 to weep make less depth grief 
 tear babe blow reveng 
 richard i bear thi name i veng thi death 
 or die renown attempt 
 edward hi name valiant duke hath left thee 
 hi dukedom chair left 
 richard nay thou princ eagl bird 
 show thi descent gaze gainst sun 
 for chair dukedom throne kingdom say 
 either thine els thou wert 

 march enter warwick montagu army

 warwick how fair lord what fare what news abroad 
 richard great lord warwick recount
 our bale news word deliverance
 stab poinard flesh till told 
 the word would add anguish wound 
 o valiant lord duke york slain 
 edward o warwick warwick plantagenet
 which held thee dearli soul redemption
 is stern lord clifford done death 
 warwick ten day ago i drown news tear 
 and add measur woe 
 i come tell thing sith befal n 
 after bloodi fray wakefield fought 
 where brave father breath latest gasp 
 tide swiftli post could run 
 were brought loss depart 
 i london keeper king 
 muster soldier gather flock friend 
 and well appoint i thought 
 march toward saint alban intercept queen 
 bear king behalf along 
 for scout i advertised
 that come full intent
 to dash late decre parliament
 touch king henri oath success 
 short tale make saint alban met 
 our battl join side fierc fought 
 but whether twa cold king 
 who look full gentli warlik queen 
 that robb soldier heat spleen 
 or whether twa report success 
 or common fear clifford rigour 
 who thunder captiv blood death 
 i can not judg conclud truth 
 their weapon like lightn came went 
 our soldier like night owl lazi flight
 or like idl thresher flail 
 fell gentli struck friend 
 i cheer justic caus 
 with promis high pay great reward 
 but vain heart fight 
 and hope win day 
 so fled king unto queen 
 lord georg brother norfolk 
 in hast post hast come join 
 for march heard were
 make anoth head fight 
 edward where duke norfolk gentl warwick 
 and came georg burgundi england 
 warwick some six mile duke soldier 
 and brother late sent
 from kind aunt duchess burgundi 
 with aid soldier need war 
 richard twa odd belik valiant warwick fled 
 oft i heard prais pursuit 
 but ne er till scandal retir 
 warwick nor scandal richard dost thou hear 
 for thou shalt know strong right hand mine
 can pluck diadem faint henri head
 and wring aw sceptr fist 
 were famou bold war
 as fam mild peac prayer 
 richard i know well lord warwick blame 
 ti love i bear thi glori make speak 
 but troublou time done 
 shall go throw away coat steel
 and wrap bodi black mourn gown 
 number ave mari bead 
 or shall helmet foes
 tell devot reveng arm 
 if last say ay lord 
 warwick whi therefor warwick came seek 
 and therefor come brother montagu 
 attend lord the proud insult queen 
 with clifford haught northumberland 
 and feather mani moe proud bird 
 have wrought easi melt king like wax 
 he swore consent success 
 hi oath enrol parliament 
 and london crew gone
 to frustrat oath beside
 may make hous lancast 
 their power i think thirti thousand strong 
 now help norfolk 
 with friend thou brave earl march 
 amongst love welshmen canst procur 
 will amount five twenti thousand 
 whi via london march amain 
 and bestrid foam steed 
 and cri charg upon foe 
 but never turn back fli 
 richard ay methink i hear great warwick speak 
 ne er may live see sunshin day
 that cri retir warwick bid stay 
 edward lord warwick thi shoulder i lean 
 and thou fail st god forbid hour 
 must edward fall peril heaven forfend 
 warwick no longer earl march duke york 
 the next degre england royal throne 
 for king england shalt thou proclaim d
 in everi borough pass along 
 and throw cap joy
 shall fault make forfeit head 
 king edward valiant richard montagu 
 stay longer dream renown 
 but sound trumpet task 
 richard then clifford thi heart hard steel 
 as thou hast shown flinti thi deed 
 i come pierc give thee mine 
 edward then strike drum god saint georg us 

 enter messenger

 warwick how news 
 messeng the duke norfolk send word me
 the queen come puissant host 
 and crave compani speedi counsel 
 warwick whi sort brave warrior let away 
 exeunt

scen ii befor york

flourish enter king henri queen margaret princ of wale 
clifford 
northumberland drum trumpets

 queen margaret welcom lord brave town york 
 yonder head arch enemy
 that sought encompass crown 
 doth object cheer heart lord 
 king henri ay rock cheer fear wreck 
 to see sight irk soul 
 withhold reveng dear god ti fault 
 nor wittingli i infr vow 
 clifford my graciou lieg much lenity
 and harm piti must laid asid 
 to lion cast gentl look 
 not beast would usurp den 
 whose hand forest bear doth lick 
 not spoil young face 
 who scape lurk serpent mortal sting 
 not set foot upon back 
 the smallest worm turn trodden 
 and dove peck safeguard brood 
 ambiti york level thi crown 
 thou smile knit angri brow 
 he duke would son king 
 and rais issu like love sire 
 thou king bless goodli son 
 didst yield consent disinherit 
 which argu thee unlov father 
 unreason creatur feed young 
 and though man face fear eye 
 yet protect tender one 
 who hath seen even wings
 which sometim us fear flight 
 make war climb unto nest 
 offer live young defence
 for shame lieg make preced 
 were piti goodli boy
 should lose birthright father fault 
 and long hereaft say unto child
 what great grandfath grandsir got
 my careless father fondli gave away 
 ah shame look boy 
 and let manli face promiseth
 success fortun steel thi melt heart
 to hold thine leav thine 
 king henri full well hath clifford play orat 
 infer argument mighti forc 
 but clifford tell didst thou never hear
 that thing ill got ever bad success 
 and happi alway son
 whose father hoard went hell 
 i leav son virtuou deed behind 
 and would father left 
 for rest held rate
 as bring thousand fold care keep
 than possess jot pleasur 
 ah cousin york would thi best friend know
 how doth griev thi head 
 queen margaret my lord cheer spirit foe nigh 
 and soft courag make follow faint 
 you promi knighthood forward son 
 unsheath sword dub present 
 edward kneel 
 king henri edward plantagenet aris knight 
 and learn lesson draw thi sword right 
 princ of wale my graciou father kingli leav 
 i draw appar crown 
 and quarrel use death 
 clifford whi spoken like toward princ 

 enter messenger

 messeng royal command readi 
 for band thirti thousand men
 come warwick back duke york 
 and town march along 
 proclaim king mani fli 
 darraign battl hand 
 clifford i would high would depart field 
 the queen hath best success absent 
 queen margaret ay good lord leav us fortun 
 king henri whi fortun therefor i stay 
 northumberland be resolut fight 
 princ of wale my royal father cheer nobl lord 
 and hearten fight defenc 
 unsheath sword good father cri saint georg 

 march enter edward georg richard warwick 
 norfolk montagu soldiers

 edward now perjur henri wilt thou kneel grace
 and set thi diadem upon head 
 or bide mortal fortun field 
 queen margaret go rate thi minion proud insult boy 
 becom thee thu bold terms
 befor thi sovereign thi law king 
 edward i king bow knee 
 i adopt heir consent 
 sinc oath broke i hear 
 you king though wear crown 
 have cau new act parliament
 to blot put son 
 clifford and reason 
 who succeed father son 
 richard are butcher o i can not speak 
 clifford ay crook back i stand answer thee 
 or proudest thi sort 
 richard twa kill young rutland 
 clifford ay old york yet satisfi 
 richard for god sake lord give signal fight 
 warwick what say st thou henri wilt thou yield crown 
 queen margaret whi long tongu warwick dare speak 
 when i met saint alban last
 your leg better servic hand 
 warwick then twa turn fli ti thine 
 clifford you said much yet fled 
 warwick twa valour clifford drove thenc 
 northumberland no manhood durst make stay 
 richard northumberland i hold thee rever 
 break parley scarc i refrain
 the execut big swol n heart
 upon clifford cruel child killer 
 clifford i slew thi father call st thou child 
 richard ay like dastard treacher coward 
 as thou didst kill tender brother rutland 
 but ere sunset i make thee curs deed 
 king henri have done word lord hear speak 
 queen margaret defi els hold close thi lip 
 king henri i prithe give limit tongu 
 i king privileg speak 
 clifford my lieg wound bred meet here
 can not cur word therefor still 
 richard then execution unsheath thi sword 
 by him made us i resolv d
 that clifford manhood lie upon tongu 
 edward say henri shall i right 
 a thousand men broke fast day
 that ne er shall dine unless thou yield crown 
 warwick if thou deni blood upon thi head 
 for york justic put armour 
 princ of wale if right warwick say right 
 there wrong everi thing right 
 richard whoever got thee thi mother stand 
 for well i wot thou hast thi mother tongu 
 queen margaret but thou art neither like thi sire dam 
 but like foul misshapen stigmat 
 mark destini avoid 
 as venom toad lizard dread sting 
 richard iron napl hid english gilt 
 whose father bear titl king 
 as channel call sea 
 sham st thou know whenc thou art extraught 
 to let thi tongu detect thi base born heart 
 edward a wisp straw worth thousand crowns
 to make shameless callet know 
 helen greec fairer far thou 
 although thi husband may menelau 
 and ne er agamemmon brother wrong d
 by fals woman king thee 
 hi father revel heart franc 
 and tam king made dauphin stoop 
 and match accord state 
 he might kept glori day 
 but took beggar bed
 and grac thi poor sire bridal day 
 even sunshin brew show r him
 that wash father fortun forth france
 and heap sedit crown home 
 for hath broach tumult thi pride 
 hadst thou meek titl still slept 
 and piti gentl king 
 had slipp claim anoth age 
 georg but saw sunshin made thi spring 
 and thi summer bred us increas 
 we set axe thi usurp root 
 and though edg hath someth hit 
 yet know thou sinc begun strike 
 we never leav till hewn thee 
 or bath thi grow heat blood 
 edward and resolut i defi thee 
 not will longer confer 
 sinc thou deniest gentl king speak 
 sound trumpet let bloodi colour wave 
 and either victori els grave 
 queen margaret stay edward 
 edward no wrangl woman longer stay 
 these word cost ten thousand live day 
 exeunt

scen iii a field battl towton saxton yorkshire

alarum excurs enter warwick

 warwick forspent toil runner race 
 i lay littl breath 
 for stroke receiv mani blow repaid
 have robb strong knit sinew strength 
 and spite spite need must i rest awhil 

 enter edward running

 edward smile gentl heaven strike ungentl death 
 for world frown edward sun cloud 
 warwick how lord what hap what hope good 

 enter george

 georg our hap lost hope sad despair 
 our rank broke ruin follow us 
 what counsel give whither shall fli 
 edward bootless flight follow us wing 
 and weak can not shun pursuit 

 enter richard

 richard ah warwick hast thou withdrawn thyself 
 thi brother blood thirsti earth hath drunk 
 broach steeli point clifford lanc 
 and pang death cri 
 like dismal clangor heard far 
 warwick reveng brother reveng death 
 so underneath belli steed 
 that stain fetlock smoke blood 
 the nobl gentleman gave ghost 
 warwick then let earth drunken blood 
 i kill hors i fli 
 whi stand like soft heart women 
 wail loss while foe doth rage 
 and look upon tragedy
 were play jest counterfeit actor 
 here knee i vow god above
 i never paus never stand still 
 till either death hath clo eye mine
 or fortun given measur reveng 
 edward o warwick i bend knee thine 
 and vow chain soul thine 
 and ere knee rise earth cold face
 i throw hand mine eye heart thee 
 thou setter plucker king 
 beseech thee thi stands
 that foe bodi must prey 
 yet thi brazen gate heaven may ope
 and give sweet passag sin soul 
 now lord take leav meet 
 where er heaven earth 
 richard brother give thi hand gentl warwick 
 let embrac thee weari arm 
 i never weep melt woe
 that winter cut spring time 
 warwick away away onc sweet lord farewel 
 georg yet let us togeth troop 
 and give leav fli stay 
 and call pillar stand us 
 and thrive promis rewards
 as victor wear olympian game 
 thi may plant courag quail breast 
 for yet hope life victori 
 forslow longer make henc amain exeunt

scen iv anoth part field

excurs enter richard clifford

 richard now clifford i singl thee alon 
 suppos arm duke york 
 and rutland bound reveng 
 wert thou environ brazen wall 
 clifford now richard i thee alon 
 thi hand stab thi father york 
 and hand slew thi brother rutland 
 and heart triumph death
 and cheer hand slew thi sire brother
 to execut like upon thyself 
 and thee they fight 

 enter warwick clifford flies

 richard nay warwick singl chase 
 for i hunt wolf death exeunt

scen v anoth part field

alarum enter king henri alone

 king henri thi battl fare like morn war 
 when die cloud contend grow light 
 what time shepherd blow nail 
 can neither call perfect day night 
 now sway way like mighti sea
 forc tide combat wind 
 now sway way like selfsam sea
 forc retir furi wind 
 sometim flood prevail wind 
 now one better anoth best 
 both tug victor breast breast 
 yet neither conqueror conquer 
 so equal pois fell war 
 here molehil i sit 
 to god victori 
 for margaret queen clifford 
 have chid battl swear both
 they prosper best i thenc 
 would i dead god good 
 for world grief woe 
 o god methink happi life
 to better home swain 
 to sit upon hill i 
 to carv dial quaintli point point 
 therebi see minut run 
 how mani make hour full complet 
 how mani hour bring day 
 how mani day finish year 
 how mani year mortal man may live 
 when known divid time 
 so mani hour must i tend flock 
 so mani hour must i take rest 
 so mani hour must i contempl 
 so mani hour must i sport 
 so mani day ewe young 
 so mani week ere poor fool 
 so mani year ere i shall shear fleec 
 so minut hour day month year 
 pass end creat 
 would bring white hair unto quiet grave 
 ah life sweet love 
 give hawthorn bush sweeter shade
 to shepherd look silli sheep 
 than doth rich embroid canopy
 to king fear subject treacheri 
 o ye doth thousand fold doth 
 and conclud shepherd home curd 
 hi cold thin drink leather bottl 
 hi wont sleep fresh tree shade 
 all secur sweetli enjoy 
 is far beyond princ delic 
 hi viand sparkl golden cup 
 hi bodi couch curiou bed 
 when care mistrust treason wait 

 alarum enter son hath kill father at
 one door father hath kill son at
 anoth door

 son ill blow wind profit nobodi 
 thi man hand hand i slew fight
 may possess store crown 
 and i hapli take 
 may yet ere night yield life them
 to man els dead man doth 
 who o god it father face 
 whom conflict i unwar kill 
 o heavi time beget event 
 from london king i press forth 
 my father earl warwick man 
 came part york press master 
 and i hand receiv life 
 have hand life bereav 
 pardon god i knew i 
 and pardon father i knew thee 
 my tear shall wipe away bloodi mark 
 and word till flow fill 
 king henri o piteou spectacl o bloodi time 
 while lion war battl den 
 poor harmless lamb abid enmiti 
 weep wretch man i aid thee tear tear 
 and let heart eye like civil war 
 be blind tear break ercharg grief 

 enter father bear son

 father thou stoutli hath resist 
 give thi gold thou hast gold 
 for i bought hundr blow 
 but let see is foeman face 
 ah mine son 
 ah boy life left thee 
 throw thine eye see see show rs aris 
 blown windi tempest heart
 upon thi wound kill mine eye heart 
 o piti god miser age 
 what stratagem fell butcherli 
 erron mutin unnatur 
 thi deadli quarrel daili doth beget 
 o boy thi father gave thee life soon 
 and hath bereft thee thi life late 
 king henri woe woe grief common grief 
 o death would stay ruth deed 
 o piti piti gentl heaven piti 
 the red rose white face 
 the fatal colour strive hous 
 the one purpl blood right well resembl 
 the pale cheek methink presenteth 
 wither one rose let flourish 
 if contend thousand live must perish 
 son how mother father death
 take ne er satisfi 
 father how wife slaughter son
 shed sea tear ne er satisfi 
 king henri how countri woeful chances
 misthink king satisfi 
 son wa ever son ru father death 
 father wa ever father bemoan son 
 king henri wa ever king griev subject woe 
 much sorrow mine ten time much 
 son i bear thee henc i may weep fill 
 exit body
 father these arm mine shall thi wind sheet 
 my heart sweet boy shall thi sepulchr 
 for heart thine imag ne er shall go 
 my sigh breast shall thi funer bell 
 and obsequi thi father 
 even loss thee 
 as priam valiant son 
 i bear thee henc let fight 
 for i murder i kill 
 exit body
 king henri sad heart men much overgon care 
 here sit king woeful 

 alarum excurs enter queen margaret 
 princ of wale exeter

 princ of wale fli father fli friend fled 
 and warwick rage like chafe bull 
 away death doth hold us pursuit 
 queen margaret mount lord toward berwick post amain 
 edward richard like brace greyhounds
 have fear fli hare sight 
 with fieri eye sparkl wrath 
 and bloodi steel grasp ire hand 
 are back therefor henc amain 
 exet away vengeanc come along 
 nay stay expostul make speed 
 or els come i away 
 king henri nay take thee good sweet exet 
 not i fear stay love go
 whither queen intend forward away exeunt

scen vi anoth part field

a loud alarum enter clifford wounded

 clifford here burn candl ay die 
 which while last gave king henri light 
 o lancast i fear thi overthrow
 more bodi part soul 
 my love fear glu mani friend thee 
 and i fall thi tough commixtur melt 
 impair henri strength ning misproud york 
 the common peopl swarm like summer fli 
 and whither fli gnat sun 
 and shine henri enemi 
 o phoebu hadst thou never given consent
 that phaethon check thi fieri steed 
 thi burn car never scorch earth 
 and henri hadst thou sway king 
 or thi father father 
 give ground unto hous york 
 they never sprung like summer fli 
 i ten thousand luckless realm
 had left mourn widow death 
 and thou day hadst kept thi chair peac 
 for doth cherish weed gentl air 
 and make robber bold much leniti 
 bootless plaint cureless wound 
 no way fli strength hold flight 
 the foe merciless piti 
 for hand i deserv piti 
 the air hath got deadli wound 
 and much effus blood doth make faint 
 come york richard warwick rest 
 i stabb father bosom split breast 
 he faint 

 alarum retreat enter edward georg richard
 montagu warwick soldiers

 edward now breath lord good fortun bid us pause
 and smooth frown war peac look 
 some troop pursu bloodi mind queen
 that led calm henri though king 
 as doth sail fill fret gust 
 command argosi stern wave 
 but think lord clifford fled 
 warwick no ti imposs escap 
 for though face i speak word 
 your brother richard mark grave 
 and whereso er sure dead 
 clifford groan die 
 richard whose soul take heavi leav 
 a deadli groan like life death depart 
 see 
 edward and battl end 
 if friend foe let gentli use 
 richard revok doom merci ti clifford 
 who content lopp branch
 in hew rutland leav put forth 
 but set murd ring knife unto root
 from whenc tender spray sweetli spring 
 i mean princ father duke york 
 warwick from gate york fetch head 
 your father head clifford place 
 instead whereof let suppli room 
 measur measur must answer 
 edward bring forth fatal screech owl hous 
 that noth sung death us 
 now death shall stop dismal threat ning sound 
 and ill bode tongu shall speak 
 warwick i think understand bereft 
 speak clifford dost thou know speak thee 
 dark cloudi death ershad beam life 
 and see hear us say 
 richard o would perhap doth 
 ti polici counterfeit 
 becaus would avoid bitter taunts
 which time death gave father 
 georg if thou think st vex eager word 
 richard clifford ask merci obtain grace 
 edward clifford repent bootless penit 
 warwick clifford devis excus thi fault 
 georg while devis fell tortur thi fault 
 richard thou didst love york i son york 
 edward thou piti st rutland i piti thee 
 georg where captain margaret fenc 
 warwick they mock thee clifford swear thou wast wont 
 richard what oath nay world goe hard
 when clifford can not spare friend oath 
 i know dead soul 
 if right hand would buy two hour life 
 that i despit might rail 
 thi hand chop issu blood
 stifl villain whose unstanch thirst
 york young rutland could satisfi 
 warwick ay dead off traitor head 
 and rear place father stand 
 and london triumphant march 
 there crown england royal king 
 from whenc shall warwick cut sea franc 
 and ask ladi bona thi queen 
 so shalt thou sinew land togeth 
 and franc thi friend thou shalt dread
 the scatt red foe hope rise 
 for though can not greatli sting hurt 
 yet look buzz offend thine ear 
 first i see coron 
 and brittani i cross sea
 to effect marriag pleas lord 
 edward even thou wilt sweet warwick let 
 for thi shoulder i build seat 
 and never i undertak thing
 wherein thi counsel consent want 
 richard i creat thee duke gloucest 
 and georg clarenc warwick ourself 
 shall undo pleaseth best 
 richard let duke clarenc georg gloucest 
 for gloucest dukedom omin 
 warwick tut foolish observ 
 richard duke gloucest now london
 to see honour possess exeunt

act iii scene i a chase north england

ent two keeper cross bow hands

 first keeper under thick grown brake shroud 
 for laund anon deer come 
 and covert make stand 
 cull princip deer 
 second keeper i stay hill may shoot 
 first keeper that can not nois thi cross bow
 will scare herd shoot lost 
 here stand aim best 
 and time shall seem tediou 
 i tell thee befel day
 in self place mean stand 
 second keeper here come man let stay till past 

 enter king henri disguis prayer book

 king henri from scotland i stol n even pure love 
 to greet mine land wish sight 
 no harri harri ti land thine 
 thi place fill thi sceptr wrung thee 
 thi balm wash wherewith thou wast anoint 
 no bend knee call thee caesar 
 no humbl suitor press speak right 
 no man come redress thee 
 for i help 
 first keeper ay deer whose skin keeper fee 
 thi quondam king let seiz upon 
 king henri let embrac thee sour advers 
 for wise men say wisest cours 
 second keeper whi linger let us lay hand upon 
 first keeper forbear awhil hear littl 
 king henri my queen son gone franc aid 
 and i hear great command warwick
 is thither gone crave french king sister
 to wife edward if news true 
 poor queen son labour lost 
 for warwick subtl orat 
 and lewi princ soon move word 
 by account margaret may win 
 for woman piti much 
 her sigh make batt ry breast 
 her tear pierc marbl heart 
 the tiger mild while doth mourn 
 and nero taint remorse
 to hear see plaint brinish tear 
 ay come beg warwick give 
 she left side crave aid henri 
 he right ask wife edward 
 she weep say henri depo 
 he smile say edward instal 
 that poor wretch grief speak 
 while warwick tell titl smooth wrong 
 inferreth argument mighti strength 
 and conclus win king her
 with promis sister els 
 to strengthen support king edward place 
 o margaret thu twill thou poor soul 
 art forsaken thou went st forlorn 
 second keeper say art thou talk st king queen 
 king henri more i seem less i born 
 a man least less i 
 and men may talk king i 
 second keeper ay thou talk st thou wert king 
 king henri whi i mind enough 
 second keeper but thou king thi crown 
 king henri my crown heart head 
 not deck diamond indian stone 
 not seen my crown call content 
 a crown seldom king enjoy 
 second keeper well king crown content 
 your crown content must contented
 to go along us think 
 you king king edward hath depo 
 and subject sworn allegi 
 will apprehend enemi 
 king henri but never swear break oath 
 second keeper no never oath 
 king henri where dwell i king england 
 second keeper here countri remain 
 king henri i anoint king nine month old 
 my father grandfath king 
 and sworn true subject unto 
 and tell broke oath 
 first keeper no 
 for subject king 
 king henri whi i dead do i breath man 
 ah simpl men know swear 
 look i blow feather face 
 and air blow 
 obey wind i blow 
 and yield anoth blow 
 command alway greater gust 
 such light common men 
 but break oath sin
 my mild entreati shall make guilti 
 go king shall command 
 and king command i obey 
 first keeper we true subject king king edward 
 king henri so would henri 
 if seat king edward 
 first keeper we charg god name king 
 to go us unto offic 
 king henri in god name lead king name obey 
 and god let king perform 
 and i humbl yield unto exeunt

scen ii london the palace

ent king edward gloucest clarenc ladi grey

 king edward brother gloucest saint alban field
 thi ladi husband sir richard grey slain 
 hi land seiz conqueror 
 her suit repossess land 
 which justic can not well deni 
 becaus quarrel hous york
 the worthi gentleman lose life 
 gloucest your high shall well grant suit 
 it dishonour deni 
 king edward it less yet i make paus 
 gloucest asid clarenc yea 
 i see ladi hath thing grant 
 befor king grant humbl suit 
 clarenc asid gloucest he know game true he
 keep wind 
 gloucest asid clarenc silenc 
 king edward widow consid suit 
 and come time know mind 
 ladi grey right graciou lord i can not brook delay 
 may pleas high resolv 
 and pleasur shall satisfi 
 gloucest asid ay widow then i warrant your
 land 
 an pleas shall pleasur 
 fight closer good faith catch blow 
 clarenc asid gloucest i fear unless chance
 fall 
 gloucest asid clarenc god forbid take
 vantag 
 king edward how mani children hast thou widow tell 
 clarenc asid gloucest i think mean beg child of
 
 gloucest asid clarenc nay whip rather
 give two 
 ladi grey three graciou lord 
 gloucest asid you shall four rul 
 king edward twere piti lose father land 
 ladi grey be piti dread lord grant 
 king edward lord give us leav i tri widow wit 
 gloucest asid ay good leav have
 leave
 till youth take leav leav crutch 
 gloucest clarenc withdraw 
 king edward now tell madam love children 
 ladi grey ay full dearli i love 
 king edward and would much good 
 ladi grey to good i would sustain harm 
 king edward then get husband land good 
 ladi grey therefor i came unto majesti 
 king edward i tell land got 
 ladi grey so shall bind high servic 
 king edward what servic wilt thou i give 
 ladi grey what command rest 
 king edward but take except boon 
 ladi grey no graciou lord except i can not 
 king edward ay thou canst i mean ask 
 ladi grey whi i grace command 
 gloucest he pli hard much rain wear marbl 
 clarenc as red fire nay wax must melt 
 ladi grey whi stop lord shall i hear task 
 king edward an easi task ti love king 
 ladi grey that soon perform i subject 
 king edward whi thi husband land i freeli give thee 
 ladi grey i take leav mani thousand thank 
 gloucest the match made seal curtsi 
 king edward but stay thee ti fruit love i mean 
 ladi grey the fruit love i mean love lieg 
 king edward ay i fear anoth sens 
 what love thinkst thou i sue much get 
 ladi grey my love till death humbl thank prayer 
 that love virtu beg virtu grant 
 king edward no troth i mean love 
 ladi grey whi mean i thought 
 king edward but partli may perceiv mind 
 ladi grey my mind never grant i perceive
 your high aim i aim aright 
 king edward to tell thee plain i aim lie thee 
 ladi grey to tell plain i rather lie prison 
 king edward whi thou shalt thi husband land 
 ladi grey whi mine honesti shall dower 
 for loss i purchas 
 king edward therein thou wrong st thi children mightili 
 ladi grey herein high wrong 
 but mighti lord merri inclination
 accord sad suit 
 pleas dismiss either ay 
 king edward ay thou wilt say ay request 
 no thou dost say demand 
 ladi grey then lord my suit end 
 gloucest the widow like knit brow 
 clarenc he bluntest wooer christendom 
 king edward asid her look doth argu replet modesti 
 her word doth show wit incompar 
 all perfect challeng sovereignti 
 one way king 
 and shall love els queen 
 say king edward take thee queen 
 ladi grey ti better said done graciou lord 
 i subject fit jest withal 
 but far unfit sovereign 
 king edward sweet widow state i swear thee
 i speak soul intend 
 and enjoy thee love 
 ladi grey and i yield unto 
 i know i mean queen 
 and yet good concubin 
 king edward you cavil widow i mean queen 
 ladi grey twill griev grace son call father 
 king edward no daughter call thee mother 
 thou art widow thou hast children 
 and god mother i bachelor 
 have whi ti happi thing
 to father unto mani son 
 answer thou shalt queen 
 gloucest the ghostli father hath done shrift 
 clarenc when made shriver twa shrift 
 king edward brother muse chat two 
 gloucest the widow like look sad 
 king edward you think strang i marri 
 clarenc to lord 
 king edward whi clarenc 
 gloucest that would ten day wonder least 
 clarenc that day longer wonder last 
 gloucest by much wonder extrem 
 king edward well jest brother i tell both
 her suit grant husband land 

 enter nobleman

 nobleman my graciou lord henri foe taken
 and brought prison palac gate 
 king edward see convey unto tower 
 and go brother man took him
 to question apprehens 
 widow go along lord use honour 
 exeunt gloucester
 gloucest ay edward use women honour 
 would wast marrow bone 
 that loin hope branch may spring
 to cross golden time i look 
 and yet soul desir 
 the lust edward titl buri 
 is clarenc henri son young edward 
 and unlook issu bodi 
 to take room ere i place 
 a cold premedit purpos 
 whi i dream sovereignti 
 like one stand upon promontory
 and spi far shore would tread 
 wish foot equal eye 
 and chide sea sunder thenc 
 say lade dri way 
 so i wish crown far 
 and i chide mean keep 
 and i say i cut caus 
 flatter imposs 
 my eye quick heart erween much 
 unless hand strength could equal 
 well say kingdom richard 
 what pleasur world afford 
 i make heaven ladi lap 
 and deck bodi gay ornament 
 and witch sweet ladi word look 
 o miser thought unlikely
 than accomplish twenti golden crown 
 whi love forswor mother womb 
 and i deal soft law 
 she corrupt frail natur bribe
 to shrink mine arm like wither shrub
 to make enviou mountain back 
 where sit deform mock bodi 
 to shape leg unequ size 
 to disproport everi part 
 like chao unlick bear whelp
 that carri impress like dam 
 and i man belov 
 o monstrou fault harbour thought 
 then sinc earth afford joy me
 but command check erbear such
 as better person 
 i make heaven dream upon crown 
 and while i live account world hell 
 until misshap trunk bear head
 be round impal gloriou crown 
 and yet i know get crown 
 for mani live stand home 
 and i like one lost thorni wood
 that rent thorn rent thorn 
 seek way stray way
 not know find open air 
 but toil desper find 
 torment catch english crown 
 and torment i free myself
 or hew way bloodi axe 
 whi i smile murder while i smile 
 and cri content griev heart 
 and wet cheek artifici tear 
 and frame face occas 
 i drown sailor mermaid shall 
 i slay gazer basilisk 
 i play orat well nestor 
 deceiv slili ulyss could 
 and like sinon take anoth troy 
 i add colour chameleon 
 chang shape protheu advantag 
 and set murder machiavel school 
 can i can not get crown 
 tut farther i pluck exit

scen iii franc the king s palace

flourish enter lewi french king sister bona admiral
cal bourbon princ edward queen margaret earl oxford 
lewi sit riseth again

 lewi fair queen england worthi margaret 
 sit us it ill befit thi state
 and birth thou shouldst stand lewi doth sit 
 queen margaret no mighti king franc now margaret
 must strike sail learn serve
 where king command i i must confess 
 great albion queen former golden day 
 but mischanc hath trod titl down
 and dishonour laid ground 
 where i must take like seat unto fortun 
 and humbl seat conform 
 lewi whi say fair queen whenc spring deep despair 
 queen margaret from caus fill mine eye tears
 and stop tongu heart drown care 
 lewi whate er thou still like thyself 
 and sit thee side seat yield thi neck
 to fortun yoke let thi dauntless mind
 still ride triumph mischanc 
 be plain queen margaret tell thi grief 
 it shall ea franc yield relief 
 queen margaret those graciou word reviv droop thoughts
 and give tongu tie sorrow leav speak 
 now therefor known nobl lewis
 that henri sole possessor love 
 is king becom banish man 
 and forc live scotland forlorn 
 while proud ambiti edward duke york
 usurp regal titl seat
 of england true anoint law king 
 thi caus i poor margaret 
 with son princ edward henri heir 
 am come crave thi law aid 
 and thou fail us hope done 
 scotland hath help can not help 
 our peopl peer misl 
 our treasur seiz soldier put flight 
 and thou seest heavi plight 
 lewi renown queen patienc calm storm 
 while bethink mean break 
 queen margaret the stay stronger grow foe 
 lewi the i stay i succour thee 
 queen margaret o impati waiteth true sorrow 
 and see come breeder sorrow 

 enter warwick

 lewi what approacheth boldli presenc 
 queen margaret our earl warwick edward greatest friend 
 lewi welcom brave warwick what bring thee franc 
 he descend she ariseth 
 queen margaret ay begin second storm rise 
 for move wind tide 
 warwick from worthi edward king albion 
 my lord sovereign thi vow friend 
 i come kind unfeign love 
 first greet thi royal person 
 and crave leagu amiti 
 and lastli confirm amity
 with nuptial knot thou vouchsaf grant
 that virtuou ladi bona thi fair sister 
 to england king law marriag 
 queen margaret asid if go forward henri hope done 
 warwick to bona and graciou madam king behalf 
 i command leav favour 
 humbl kiss hand tongue
 to tell passion sovereign heart 
 where fame late ent ring heed ear 
 hath plac thi beauti imag thi virtu 
 queen margaret king lewi ladi bona hear speak
 befor answer warwick hi demand
 spring edward well meant honest love 
 but deceit bred necess 
 for tyrant safe govern home
 unless abroad purchas great allianc 
 to prove tyrant reason may suffic 
 that henri liveth still dead 
 yet princ edward stand king henri son 
 look therefor lewi leagu marriage
 thou draw thi danger dishonour 
 for though usurp sway rule while
 yet heav ns time suppresseth wrong 
 warwick injuri margaret 
 princ of wale and queen 
 warwick becaus thi father henri usurp 
 and thou art princ queen 
 oxford then warwick disannul great john gaunt 
 which subdu greatest part spain 
 and john gaunt henri fourth 
 whose wisdom mirror wisest 
 and wise princ henri fifth 
 who prowess conquer franc 
 from henri lineal descend 
 warwick oxford hap smooth discourse
 you told henri sixth hath lost
 all henri fifth gotten 
 methink peer franc smile 
 but rest tell pedigree
 of threescor two year silli time
 to make prescript kingdom worth 
 oxford whi warwick canst thou speak thi lieg 
 whom thou obey st thirti six year 
 and betray thi treason blush 
 warwick can oxford ever fenc right
 now buckler falsehood pedigre 
 for shame leav henri call edward king 
 oxford call king whose injuri doom
 my elder brother lord aubrey vere 
 wa done death father 
 even downfal mellow year 
 when natur brought door death 
 no warwick life uphold arm 
 thi arm uphold hous lancast 
 warwick and i hous york 
 lewi queen margaret princ edward oxford 
 vouchsaf request stand aside
 while i use confer warwick
