 they stand aloof 
 queen margaret heaven grant warwick word bewitch 
 lewi now warwick tell even upon thi conscienc 
 is edward true king i loath
 to link law chosen 
 warwick thereon i pawn credit mine honour 
 lewi but graciou peopl eye 
 warwick the henri unfortun 
 lewi then dissembl set asid 
 tell truth measur love
 unto sister bona 
 warwick such seems
 as may beseem monarch like 
 myself often heard say swear
 that love etern plant
 whereof root fix virtu ground 
 the leav fruit maintain beauti sun 
 exempt envi disdain 
 unless ladi bona quit pain 
 lewi now sister let us hear firm resolv 
 bona your grant denial shall mine 
 to warwick yet i confess often ere day 
 when i heard king desert recount 
 mine ear hath tempt judgment desir 
 lewi then warwick thu sister shall edward 
 and forthwith shall articl drawn
 touch jointur king must make 
 which dowri shall counterpoi 
 draw near queen margaret witness
 that bona shall wife english king 
 princ of wale to edward english king 
 queen margaret deceit warwick thi device
 by allianc make void suit 
 befor thi come lewi henri friend 
 lewi and still friend margaret 
 but titl crown weak 
 as may appear edward good success 
 then ti reason i relea d
 from give aid late i promis 
 yet shall kind hand
 that estat requir mine yield 
 warwick henri live scotland case 
 where noth noth lose 
 and quondam queen 
 you father abl maintain 
 and better twere troubl franc 
 queen margaret peac impud shameless warwick 
 proud setter puller king 
 i henc till talk tear 
 both full truth i make king lewi behold
 thi sli convey thi lord fals love 
 for bird self feather 
 post blow horn within 
 lewi warwick post us thee 

 enter post

 post my lord ambassador letter 
 sent brother marqui montagu 
 these king unto majesti 
 and madam i know 
 they read letter 
 oxford i like well fair queen mistress
 smile news warwick frown 
 princ of wale nay mark lewi stamp nettl 
 i hope best 
 lewi warwick thi news and fair queen 
 queen margaret mine fill heart unhop joy 
 warwick mine full sorrow heart discont 
 lewi what king marri ladi grey 
 and sooth forgeri 
 send paper persuad patienc 
 is th allianc seek franc 
 dare presum scorn us manner 
 queen margaret i told majesti much 
 thi proveth edward love warwick honesti 
 warwick king lewi i protest sight heaven 
 and hope i heavenli bliss 
 that i clear misde edward 
 no king dishonour 
 but could see shame 
 did i forget hous york
 my father came untim death 
 did i let pass th abus done niec 
 did i impal regal crown 
 did i put henri nativ right 
 and i guerdon last shame 
 shame desert honour 
 and repair honour lost him
 i renounc return henri 
 my nobl queen let former grudg pass 
 and henceforth i thi true servitor 
 i reveng wrong ladi bona 
 and replant henri former state 
 queen margaret warwick word turn hate love 
 and i forgiv quit forget old fault 
 and joy thou becom st king henri friend 
 warwick so much friend ay unfeign friend 
 that king lewi vouchsaf furnish us
 with band chosen soldier 
 i undertak land coast
 and forc tyrant seat war 
 ti new made bride shall succour 
 and clarenc letter tell 
 he like fall him
 for match wanton lust honour
 or strength safeti countri 
 bona dear brother shall bona reveng d
 but thi help distress queen 
 queen margaret renown princ shall poor henri live
 unless thou rescu foul despair 
 bona my quarrel english queen one 
 warwick and mine fair ladi bona join 
 lewi and mine thine margaret 
 therefor last i firmli resolv d
 you shall aid 
 queen margaret let give humbl thank 
 lewi then england messeng return post
 and tell fals edward thi suppos king 
 that lewi franc send masquers
 to revel new bride 
 thou seest past go fear thi king withal 
 bona tell hope prove widow shortli 
 i wear willow garland sake 
 queen margaret tell mourn weed laid asid 
 and i readi put armour 
 warwick tell hath done wrong 
 and therefor i uncrown ere long 
 there thi reward gone exit post
 lewi but warwick 
 thou oxford five thousand men 
 shall cross sea bid fals edward battl 
 and occas serv nobl queen
 and princ shall follow fresh suppli 
 yet ere thou go answer one doubt 
 what pledg thi firm loyalti 
 warwick thi shall assur constant loyalti 
 that queen young princ agre 
 i join mine eldest daughter joy
 to forthwith holi wedlock band 
 queen margaret ye i agre thank motion 
 son edward fair virtuou 
 therefor delay give thi hand warwick 
 and thi hand thi faith irrevocable
 that warwick daughter shall thine 
 princ of wale ye i accept well deserv 
 and pledg vow i give hand 
 he give hand warwick 
 lewi stay these soldier shall levi 
 and thou lord bourbon high admir 
 shall waft royal fleet 
 i long till edward fall war mischance
 for mock marriag dame franc 
 exeunt warwick
 warwick i came edward ambassador 
 but i return sworn mortal foe 
 matter marriag charg gave 
 but dread war shall answer demand 
 had none els make stale 
 then none i shall turn jest sorrow 
 i chief rai crown 
 and i chief bring 
 not i piti henri miseri 
 but seek reveng edward mockeri exit

act iv scene i london the palace

ent gloucest clarenc somerset montague

 gloucest now tell brother clarenc think you
 of new marriag ladi grey 
 hath brother made worthi choic 
 clarenc ala know ti far henc franc 
 how could stay till warwick made return 
 somerset my lord forbear talk come king 

 flourish enter king edward attend lady
 grey queen pembrok stafford hast 
 other four stand one side four other

 gloucest and well chosen bride 
 clarenc i mind tell plainli i think 
 king edward now brother clarenc like choice
 that stand pensiv half malcont 
 clarenc as well lewi franc earl warwick 
 which weak courag judgment
 that take offenc abus 
 king edward suppos take offenc without caus 
 they lewi warwick i edward 
 your king warwick must 
 gloucest and shall king 
 yet hasti marriag seldom proveth well 
 king edward yea brother richard offend 
 gloucest not i 
 no god forbid i wish sever d
 whom god hath join togeth ay twere pity
 to sunder yoke well togeth 
 king edward set scorn mislik asid 
 tell reason ladi grey
 should becom wife england queen 
 and somerset montagu 
 speak freeli think 
 clarenc then mine opinion king lewis
 becom enemi mock him
 about marriag ladi bona 
 gloucest and warwick gave charg 
 is dishonour new marriag 
 king edward what lewi warwick appea d
 by invent i devis 
 montagu yet join franc alliance
 would strength ned commonwealth
 gainst foreign storm home bred marriag 
 hast whi know montagu itself
 england safe true within 
 montagu but safer ti back franc 
 hast ti better use franc trust franc 
 let us back god seas
 which he hath giv n fenc impregn 
 and help defend 
 in safeti lie 
 clarenc for one speech lord hast well deserves
 to heir lord hungerford 
 king edward ay grant 
 and shall stand law 
 gloucest and yet methink grace hath done well
 to give heir daughter lord scales
 unto brother love bride 
 she better would fit clarenc 
 but bride buri brotherhood 
 clarenc or els would bestow heir
 of lord bonvil new wife son 
 and leav brother go speed elsewher 
 king edward ala poor clarenc is wife
 that thou art malcont i provid thee 
 clarenc in choos show judgment 
 which shallow shall give leave
 to play broker mine behalf 
 and end i shortli mind leav 
 king edward leav tarri edward king 
 and tie unto brother 
 queen elizabeth my lord plea majesty
 to rais state titl queen 
 do right must confess
 that i ignobl descent 
 and meaner like fortun 
 but titl honour mine 
 so dislik i would pleas 
 doth cloud joy danger sorrow 
 king edward my love forbear fawn upon frown 
 what danger sorrow befal thee 
 so long edward thi constant friend
 and true sovereign must obey 
 nay shall obey love thee 
 unless seek hatr hand 
 which yet i keep thee safe 
 and shall feel vengeanc wrath 
 gloucest asid i hear yet say much think 

 enter post

 king edward now messeng letter news
 from franc 
 messeng my sovereign lieg letter word 
 but i without special pardon 
 dare relat 
 king edward go pardon thee therefor brief 
 tell word near thou canst guess 
 what answer make king lewi unto letter 
 messeng at depart word 
 go tell fals edward suppos king 
 that lewi franc send masquers
 to revel new bride 
 king edward is lewi brave belik think henri 
 but said ladi bona marriag 
 messeng these word utt red mild disdain 
 tell hope prove widow shortli 
 i wear willow garland sake 
 king edward i blame could say littl less 
 she wrong but said henri queen 
 for i heard place 
 messeng tell quoth mourn weed done 
 and i readi put armour 
 king edward belik mind play amazon 
 but said warwick injuri 
 messeng he incen majesty
 than rest discharg word 
 tell hath done wrong 
 and therefor i uncrown ere long 
 king edward ha durst traitor breath proud word 
 well i arm thu forewarn 
 they shall war pay presumpt 
 but say warwick friend margaret 
 messeng ay graciou sovereign link friendship
 that young princ edward marri warwick daughter 
 clarenc belik elder clarenc younger 
 now brother king farewel sit fast 
 for i henc warwick daughter 
 that though i want kingdom yet marriage
 i may prove inferior 
 you love warwick follow 
 exit somerset follows
 gloucest asid not i 
 my thought aim matter i
 stay love edward crown 
 king edward clarenc somerset gone warwick 
 yet i arm worst happen 
 and hast need desp rate case 
 pembrok stafford behalf
 go levi men make prepar war 
 they alreadi quickli land 
 myself person straight follow 
 exeunt pembrok stafford
 but ere i go hast montagu 
 resolv doubt you twain rest 
 are near warwick blood allianc 
 tell love warwick 
 if depart 
 i rather wish foe hollow friend 
 but mind hold true obedi 
 give assur friendli vow 
 that i may never suspect 
 montagu so god help montagu prove true 
 hast and hast favour edward caus 
 king edward now brother richard stand us 
 gloucest ay despit shall withstand 
 king edward whi i sure victori 
 now therefor let us henc lose hour
 till meet warwick foreign pow r exeunt

scen ii a plain warwickshire

ent warwick oxford french soldiers

 warwick trust lord hitherto goe well 
 the common peopl number swarm us 

 enter clarenc somerset

 but see somerset clarenc come 
 speak suddenli lord friend 
 clarenc fear lord 
 warwick then gentl clarenc welcom unto warwick 
 and welcom somerset i hold cowardice
 to rest mistrust nobl heart
 hath pawn open hand sign love 
 els might i think clarenc edward brother 
 were feign friend proceed 
 but welcom sweet clarenc daughter shall thine 
 and rest night covertur 
 thi brother carelessli encamp 
 hi soldier lurk town 
 and attend simpl guard 
 we may surpris take pleasur 
 our scout found adventur easi 
 that ulyss stout diomede
 with sleight manhood stole rhesu tent 
 and brought thenc thracian fatal steed 
 so well cover night black mantl 
 at unawar may beat edward guard
 and seiz i say slaughter 
 for i intend surpris 
 you follow attempt 
 applaud name henri leader 
 they cri henri 
 whi let way silent sort 
 for warwick friend god saint georg exeunt

scen iii edward camp near warwick

ent three watchmen guard king s tent

 first watchman come master man take stand 
 the king set sleep 
 second watchman what bed 
 first watchman whi hath made solemn vow
 never lie take natur rest
 till warwick quit suppress 
 second watchman to morrow belik shall day 
 if warwick near men report 
 third watchman but say i pray nobleman that
 that king resteth tent 
 first watchman ti lord hast king chiefest friend 
 third watchman o so but command king
 that chief follow lodg town 
 while keep cold field 
 second watchman ti honour danger 
 third watchman ay give worship quiet 
 i like better danger honour 
 if warwick knew estat stand 
 ti doubt would waken 
 first watchman unless halberd shut passag 
 second watchman ay wherefor els guard royal tent
 but defend person night foe 

 enter warwick clarenc oxford somerset 
 french soldier silent all

 warwick thi tent see stand guard 
 courag master honour never 
 but follow edward shall 
 first watchman who goe 
 second watchman stay thou diest 

 warwick rest cri warwick warwick and
 set upon guard fli cri arm arm warwick
 rest follow them

 the drum play trumpet sound enter warwick
 rest bring king gown 
 sit chair gloucest hast fli stage

 somerset what fli 
 warwick richard hast let go duke 
 king edward the duke whi warwick part 
 thou call dst king 
 warwick ay case alter 
 when disgrac embassad 
 then i degrad king 
 and come creat duke york 
 ala govern kingdom
 that know use ambassador 
 nor content one wife 
 nor use brother brotherli 
 nor studi peopl welfar 
 nor shroud enemi 
 king edward yea brother clarenc art thou 
 nay i see edward need must 
 yet warwick despit mischanc 
 of thee thyself thi complic 
 edward alway bear king 
 though fortun malic overthrow state 
 my mind exce compass wheel 
 warwick then mind edward england king 
 take crown 
 but henri shall wear english crown
 and true king inde thou shadow 
 my lord somerset request 
 see forthwith duke edward convey d
 unto brother archbishop york 
 when i fought pembrok fellow 
 i follow tell answer
 lewi ladi bona send 
 now farewel good duke york 
 king edward what fate impos men must need abid 
 it boot resist wind tide 
 they lead forcibl 
 oxford what remain lord us do
 but march london soldier 
 warwick ay first thing 
 to free king henri imprison 
 and see seat regal throne exeunt

scen iv london the palace

ent queen elizabeth rivers

 river madam make sudden chang 
 queen elizabeth whi brother river yet learn
 what late misfortun befal n king edward 
 river what loss pitch battl warwick 
 queen elizabeth no loss royal person 
 river then sovereign slain 
 queen elizabeth ay almost slain taken prison 
 either betray falsehood guard
 or foe surpri unawar 
 and i understand 
 is new commit bishop york 
 fell warwick brother foe 
 river these news i must confess full grief 
 yet graciou madam bear may 
 warwick may lose hath day 
 queen elizabeth till fair hope must hinder life decay 
 and i rather wean despair
 for love edward offspr womb 
 thi make bridl passion
 and bear mild misfortun cross 
 ay ay i draw mani tear
 and stop rise blood suck sigh 
 lest sigh tear i blast drown
 king edward fruit true heir th english crown 
 river but madam warwick becom 
 queen elizabeth i inform come toward london
 to set crown henri head 
 guess thou rest king edward friend must 
 but prevent tyrant violenc 
 for trust hath broken faith 
 i henc forthwith unto sanctuary
 to save least heir edward right 
 there shall i rest secur forc fraud 
 come therefor let us fli may fli 
 if warwick take us sure die exeunt

scen v a park near middleham castl yorkshire

ent gloucest lord hast sir william stanley others

 gloucest now lord hast sir william stanley 
 leav wonder i drew hither
 into chiefest thicket park 
 thu stand case know king brother 
 is prison bishop whose hands
 he hath good usag great liberti 
 and often attend weak guard
 come hunt way disport 
 i adverti secret means
 that hour make way 
 under colour usual game 
 he shall find friend hors men 
 to set free captiv 

 enter king edward huntsman him

 huntsman thi way lord way lie game 
 king edward nay way man see huntsmen stand 
 now brother gloucest lord hast rest 
 stand thu close steal bishop deer 
 gloucest brother time case requireth hast 
 your hors stand readi park corner 
 king edward but whither shall 
 hast to lynn lord shipt thenc flander 
 gloucest well guess believ mean 
 king edward stanley i requit thi forward 
 gloucest but wherefor stay ti time talk 
 king edward huntsman say st thou wilt thou go along 
 huntsman better tarri hang 
 gloucest come away let ha ado 
 king edward bishop farewel shield thee warwick frown 
 and pray i may repossess crown exeunt

scen vi london the tower

flourish enter king henri clarenc warwick somerset young henri 
earl of richmond oxford montagu lieuten of the tower and
attendants

 king henri master lieuten god friends
 have shaken edward regal seat
 and turn captiv state liberti 
 my fear hope sorrow unto joy 
 at enlarg thi due fee 
 lieuten subject may challeng noth sov reign 
 but humbl prayer may prevail 
 i crave pardon majesti 
 king henri for lieuten for well use 
 nay thou sure i well requit thi kind 
 for made imprison pleasur 
 ay pleasur incag birds
 conceiv mani moodi thought 
 at last note household harmony
 they quit forget loss liberti 
 but warwick god thou set st free 
 and chiefli therefor i thank god thee 
 he author thou instrument 
 therefor i may conquer fortun spite
 by live low fortun can not hurt 
 and peopl bless land
 may punish thwart star 
 warwick although head still wear crown 
 i resign govern thee 
 for thou art fortun thi deed 
 warwick your grace hath still fam virtuou 
 and may seem wise virtuous
 by spi avoid fortun malic 
 for men rightli temper star 
 yet one thing let blame grace 
 for choos clarenc place 
 clarenc no warwick thou art worthi sway 
 to heav ns thi nativity
 adjudg oliv branch laurel crown 
 as like blest peac war 
 and therefor i yield thee free consent 
 warwick and i choos clarenc protector 
 king henri warwick clarenc give hand 
 now join hand hand heart 
 that dissens hinder govern 
 i make protector land 
 while i lead privat life
 and devot spend latter day 
 to sin rebuk creator prais 
 warwick what answer clarenc sovereign 
 clarenc that consent warwick yield consent 
 for thi fortun i repos 
 warwick whi though loath yet must i content 
 we yoke togeth like doubl shadow
 to henri bodi suppli place 
 i mean bear weight govern 
 while enjoy honour eas 
 and clarenc needful
 forthwith edward pronounc traitor 
 and land good confisc 
 clarenc what els and success determin 
 warwick ay therein clarenc shall want part 
 king henri but first chief affair 
 let entreat i command 
 that margaret queen son edward
 be sent return franc speed 
 for till i see doubt fear
 my joy liberti half eclip 
 clarenc it shall done sovereign speed 
 king henri my lord somerset youth 
 of seem tender care 
 somerset my lieg young henri earl richmond 
 king henri come hither england hope 
 lay hand head 
 if secret powers
 suggest truth divin thought 
 thi pretti lad prove countri bliss 
 hi look full peac majesti 
 hi head natur fram wear crown 
 hi hand wield sceptr himself
 like time bless regal throne 
 make much lord he
 must help hurt 

 enter post

 warwick what news friend 
 post that edward escap brother
 and fled hear sinc burgundi 
 warwick unsavouri news but made escap 
 post he convey richard duke gloucester
 and lord hast attend him
 in secret ambush forest side
 and bishop huntsmen rescu 
 for hunt daili exercis 
 warwick my brother careless charg 
 but let us henc sovereign provide
 a salv sore may betid 
 exeunt somerset richmond oxford
 somerset my lord i like flight edward 
 for doubtless burgundi yield help 
 and shall war befor long 
 as henri late presag prophecy
 did glad heart hope young richmond 
 so doth heart misgiv conflict 
 what may befal harm 
 therefor lord oxford prevent worst 
 forthwith send henc brittani 
 till storm past civil enmiti 
 oxford ay edward repossess crown 
 ti like richmond rest shall 
 somerset it shall shall brittani 
 come therefor let speedili exeunt

scen vii befor york

flourish enter king edward gloucest hast soldiers

 king edward now brother richard lord hast rest 
 yet thu far fortun maketh us amend 
 and say i shall interchange
 my wane state henri regal crown 
 well pass repass sea 
 and brought desir help burgundi 
 what remain thu arriv d
 from ravenspurgh gate york 
 but enter dukedom 
 gloucest the gate made fast brother i like 
 for mani men stumbl threshold
 are well foretold danger lurk within 
 king edward tush man abod must affright us 
 by fair foul mean must enter 
 for hither friend repair us 
 hast my lieg i knock summon 

 enter wall mayor of york and
 brethren

 mayor my lord forewarn coming
 and shut gate safeti 
 for owe allegi unto henri 
 king edward but master mayor henri king 
 yet edward least duke york 
 mayor true good lord i know less 
 king edward whi i challeng noth dukedom 
 as well content alon 
 gloucest asid but fox hath got nose 
 he soon find mean make bodi follow 
 hast whi master mayor stand doubt 
 open gate king henri friend 
 mayor ay say the gate shall open 
 he descend 
 gloucest a wise stout captain soon persuad 
 hast the good old man would fain well 
 so twere long ent red 
 i doubt i shall soon persuade
 both brother unto reason 

 enter mayor two aldermen

 king edward so master mayor these gate must shut
 but night time war 
 what fear man yield key 
 take key 
 for edward defend town thee 
 and friend deign follow 

 march enter montgomeri drum soldiers

 gloucest brother sir john montgomeri 
 our trusti friend unless i deceiv 
 king edward welcom sir john but come arm 
 montgomeri to help king edward time storm 
 as everi loyal subject ought 
 king edward thank good montgomeri forget
 our titl crown claim
 our dukedom till god pleas send rest 
 montgomeri then fare well i henc 
 i came serv king duke 
 drummer strike let us march away 
 the drum begin march 
 king edward nay stay sir john debate
 by safe mean crown may recov 
 montgomeri what talk debat in word 
 if proclaim king 
 i leav fortun gone
 to keep back come succour 
 whi shall fight pretend titl 
 gloucest whi brother wherefor stand nice point 
 king edward when grow stronger make claim 
 till ti wisdom conceal mean 
 hast away scrupul wit now arm must rule 
 gloucest and fearless mind climb soonest unto crown 
 brother proclaim hand 
 the bruit thereof bring mani friend 
 king edward then ti right 
 and henri usurp diadem 
 montgomeri ay sovereign speaketh like 
 and i edward champion 
 hast sound trumpet edward shall proclaim 
 come fellow soldier make thou proclam 
 give paper flourish 
 soldier read edward fourth grace god 
 king england franc lord ireland c 
 montgomeri and whoso er gainsay king edward right 
 by i challeng singl fight 
 throw gauntlet 
 all long live edward fourth 
 king edward thank brave montgomeri thank unto 
 if fortun serv i requit kind 
 now night let harbour york 
 and morn sun shall rais car
 abov border horizon 
 we forward toward warwick mate 
 for well i wot henri soldier 
 ah froward clarenc evil beseem the
 to flatter henri forsak thi brother 
 yet may meet thee warwick 
 come brave soldier doubt day 
 and gotten doubt larg pay exeunt

scen viii london the palace

flourish enter king henri warwick montagu clarenc oxford and
exeter

 warwick what counsel lord edward belgia 
 with hasti german blunt holland 
 hath pass safeti narrow seas
 and troop doth march amain london 
 and mani giddi peopl flock 
 king henri let levi men beat back 
 clarenc a littl fire quickli trodden 
 which suffer river can not quench 
 warwick in warwickshir i true heart friend 
 not mutin peac yet bold war 
 those i muster thou son clarenc 
 shalt stir suffolk norfolk kent 
 the knight gentlemen come thee 
 thou brother montagu buckingham 
 northampton leicestershir shalt find
 men well inclin hear thou command st 
 and thou brave oxford wondrou well belov 
 in oxfordshir shalt muster thi friend 
 my sovereign love citizen 
 like island girt ocean
 or modest dian circl nymph 
 shall rest london till come 
 fair lord take leav stand repli 
 farewel sovereign 
 king henri farewel hector troy true hope 
 clarenc in sign truth i kiss high hand 
 king henri well mind clarenc thou fortun 
 montagu comfort lord i take leav 
 oxford kiss king s band and thu i seal truth bid
 adieu 
 king henri sweet oxford love montagu 
 and happi farewel 
 warwick farewel sweet lord let meet coventri 
 exeunt king exeter
 king henri here palac i rest 
 cousin exet think lordship 
 methink power edward hath field
 should abl encount mine 
 exet the doubt seduc rest 
 king henri that fear meed hath got fame 
 i stopp mine ear demand 
 nor post suit slow delay 
 my piti hath balm heal wound 
 my mild hath allay swell grief 
 my merci dri water flow tear 
 i desir wealth 
 nor much oppress great subsidi 
 nor forward reveng though much err 
 then love edward 
 no exet grace challeng grace 
 and lion fawn upon lamb 
 the lamb never ceas follow 
 shout within a lancast a lancast 
 exet hark hark lord what shout 

 enter king edward gloucest soldiers

 king edward seiz shame fac henri bear henc 
 and proclaim us king england 
 you fount make small brook flow 
 now stop thi spring sea shall suck dri 
 and swell much higher ebb 
 henc tower let speak 
 exeunt king henry
 and lord toward coventri bend cours 
 where peremptori warwick remain 
 the sun shine hot use delay 
 cold bite winter mar hop hay 
 gloucest away betim forc join 
 and take great grown traitor unawar 
 brave warrior march amain toward coventri exeunt

act v scene i coventry

ent warwick mayor of coventri two messeng other upon
th walls

 warwick where post came valiant oxford 
 how far henc thi lord mine honest fellow 
 first messeng by dunsmor march hitherward 
 warwick how far brother montagu 
 where post came montagu 
 second messeng by daintri puissant troop 

 enter sir john somerville

 warwick say somervil say love son 
 and thi guess nigh clarenc 
 somervil at southam i leav forc 
 and expect two hour henc 
 drum heard 
 warwick then clarenc hand i hear drum 
 somervil it lord southam lie 
 the drum honour hear marcheth warwick 
 warwick who belik unlook friend 
 somervil they hand shall quickli know 

 march flourish enter king edward gloucest 
 soldiers

 king edward go trumpet wall sound parl 
 gloucest see surli warwick man wall 
 warwick o unbid spite is sport edward come 
 where slept scout seduc d
 that could hear news repair 
 king edward now warwick wilt thou ope citi gate 
 speak gentl word humbl bend thi knee 
 call edward king hand beg merci 
 and shall pardon thee outrag 
 warwick nay rather wilt thou draw thi forc henc 
 confess set thee pluck thee 
 call warwick patron penit 
 and thou shalt still remain duke york 
 gloucest i thought least would said king 
 or make jest 
 warwick is dukedom sir goodli gift 
 gloucest ay faith poor earl give 
 i thee servic good gift 
 warwick twa i gave kingdom thi brother 
 king edward whi ti mine warwick gift 
 warwick thou art atla great weight 
 and weakl warwick take gift 
 and henri king warwick subject 
 king edward but warwick king edward prison 
 and gallant warwick answer 
 what bodi head 
 gloucest ala warwick forecast 
 but while thought steal singl ten 
 the king slili finger deck 
 you left poor henri bishop palac 
 and ten one meet tower 
 king edward ti even yet warwick still 
 gloucest come warwick take time kneel kneel 
 nay strike els iron cool 
 warwick i rather chop hand blow 
 and fling thi face 
 than bear low sail strike thee 
 king edward sail thou canst wind tide thi friend 
 thi hand fast wound thi coal black hair 
 shall while thi head warm new cut 
 write dust sentenc thi blood 
 wind chang warwick chang 

 enter oxford drum colours

 warwick o cheer colour see oxford come 
 oxford oxford oxford lancast 
 he forc enter citi 
 gloucest the gate open let us enter 
 king edward so foe may set upon back 
 stand good array doubt
 will issu bid us battl 
 if citi small defenc 
 we quietli rous traitor 
 warwick o welcom oxford want thi help 

 enter montagu drum colours

 montagu montagu montagu lancast 
 he forc enter citi 
 gloucest thou thi brother shall buy treason
 even dearest blood bodi bear 
 king edward the harder match greater victori 
 my mind presageth happi gain conquest 

 enter somerset drum colours

 somerset somerset somerset lancast 
 he forc enter citi 
 gloucest two thi name duke somerset 
 have sold live unto hous york 
 and thou shalt third sword hold 

 enter clarenc drum colours

 warwick and lo georg clarenc sweep along 
 of forc enough bid brother battl 
 with upright zeal right prevails
 more natur brother love 
 clarenc clarenc clarenc lancast 
 king edward et tu brute wilt thou stab caesar 
 a parley sirrah georg clarenc 
 sound parley richard clarenc whisper 
 warwick come clarenc come thou wilt warwick call 
 clarenc take red rose hat throwing
 warwick 
 father warwick know mean 
 look i throw infami thee 
 i ruinat father hous 
 who gave blood lime stone togeth 
 and set lancast whi trowest thou warwick 
 that clarenc harsh blunt unnatur 
 to bend fatal instrument war
 against brother law king 
 perhap thou wilt object holi oath 
 to keep oath impiety
 than jephtha sacrif daughter 
 i sorri trespass made
 that deserv well brother hand 
 i proclaim thi mortal foe 
 with resolut whereso er i meet thee 
 as i meet thee thou stir abroad 
 to plagu thee thi foul mislead 
 and proud heart warwick i defi thee 
 and brother turn blush cheek 
 pardon edward i make amend 
 and richard frown upon fault 
 for i henceforth unconst 
 king edward now welcom ten time belov 
 than thou never hadst deserv hate 
 gloucest welcom good clarenc brother like 
 warwick o pass traitor perjur unjust 
 king edward what warwick wilt thou leav die town fight 
 or shall beat stone thine ear 
 warwick ala i coop defenc 
 i away toward barnet presently
 and bid thee battl edward thou dar st 
 king edward ye warwick edward dare lead way 
 lord field saint georg victori 
 exeunt yorkists
 march warwick compani follow 

scene ii a field battl near barnet

alarum excurs enter king edward bring forth warwick 
wounded

 king edward so lie thou die thou die fear 
 for warwick bug fear us 
 now montagu sit fast i seek thee 
 that warwick bone may keep thine compani exit
 warwick ah nigh come friend foe 
 and tell victor york warwick 
 whi ask i my mangl bodi show 
 my blood want strength sick heart show 
 that i must yield bodi earth
 and fall conquest foe 
 thu yield cedar axe edg 
 whose arm gave shelter princ eagl 
 under whose shade ramp lion slept 
 whose top branch overp jove spread tree
 and kept low shrub winter pow rful wind 
 these eye dimm death black veil 
 have pierc mid day sun
 to search secret treason world 
 the wrinkl brow fill blood 
 were lik ned oft kingli sepulchr 
 for liv king i could dig grave 
 and durst smile warwick bent brow 
 lo glori smear dust blood 
 my park walk manor i 
 even forsak lands
 is noth left bodi length 
 pomp rule reign earth dust 
 and live yet die must 

 enter oxford somerset

 somerset ah warwick warwick wert thou 
 we might recov loss 
 the queen franc hath brought puissant power 
 even heard news ah couldst thou fli 
 warwick whi i would fli ah montagu 
 if thou sweet brother take hand 
 and thi lip keep soul 
 thou lov st brother thou didst 
 thi tear would wash cold congeal blood
 that glue lip let speak 
 come quickli montagu i dead 
 somerset ah warwick montagu hath breath last 
 and latest gasp cri warwick 
 and said commend valiant brother 
 and would said spoke 
 which sound like clamour vault 
 that mought distinguish last 
 i well might hear deliv groan 
 o farewel warwick 
 warwick sweet rest soul fli lord save 
 for warwick bid farewel meet heaven 
 die 
 oxford away away meet queen great power 
 here bear away bodi 

scene iii anoth part field

flourish enter king triumph gloucest clarenc the
rest

 king edward thu far fortun keep upward cours 
 and grac wreath victori 
 but midst bright shine day
 i spi black suspici threat ning cloud
 that encount gloriou sun
 ere attain eas western bed 
 i mean lord power queen
 hath rai gallia arriv coast
 and hear march fight us 
 clarenc a littl gale soon dispers cloud
 and blow sourc whenc came 
 thi beam dri vapour 
 for everi cloud engend storm 
 gloucest the queen valu thirti thousand strong 
 and somerset oxford fled 
 if time breath well assur d
 her faction full strong 
 king edward adverti love friends
 that hold cours toward tewksburi 
 we best barnet field 
 will thither straight willing rid way 
 and march strength augmented
 in everi counti go along 
 strike drum cri courag away exeunt

scen iv plain wear tewksbury

flourish march enter queen margaret princ edward somerset oxford 
and soldiers

 queen margaret great lord wise men ne er sit wail their
 loss 
 but cheerli seek redress harm 
 what though mast blown overboard 
 the cabl broke hold anchor lost 
 and half sailor swallow flood 
 yet live pilot still is meet he
 should leav helm like fear lad 
 with tear eye add water sea
 and give strength hath much 
 while moan ship split rock 
 which industri courag might sav 
 ah shame ah fault 
 say warwick anchor 
 and montagu top mast 
 our slaught red friend tackl 
 whi oxford anoth anchor 
 and somerset anoth goodli mast 
 the friend franc shroud tackl 
 and though unskil ned i
 for allow skil pilot charg 
 we helm sit weep 
 but keep cours though rough wind say 
 from shelv rock threaten us wreck 
 as good chide wave speak fair 
 and edward ruthless sea 
 what clarenc quicksand deceit 
 and richard rag fatal rock 
 all enemi poor bark 
 say swim ala ti 
 tread sand quickli sink 
 bestrid rock tide wash 
 or els famish threefold death 
 thi speak i lord let understand 
 if case one would fli us 
 that hop merci brothers
 more ruthless wave sand rock 
 whi courag what can not avoided
 twere childish weak lament fear 
 princ of wale methink woman valiant spirit
 should coward hear speak word 
 infus breast magnanimity
 and make nake foil man arm 
 i speak doubt 
 for i suspect fear man 
 he leav go away betim 
 lest need might infect another
 and make like spirit 
 if god forbid 
 let depart need help 
 oxford women children high courag 
 and warrior faint whi twere perpetu shame 
 o brave young princ thi famou grandfather
 doth live thee long mayst thou eve
 to bear imag renew glori 
 somerset and fight hope 
 go home bed like owl day 
 if aris mock wond red 
 queen margaret thank gentl somerset sweet oxford thank 
 princ of wale and take thank yet hath noth els 

 enter messenger

 messeng prepar lord edward hand
 readi fight therefor resolut 
 oxford i thought less it policy
 to hast thu fast find us unprovid 
 somerset but deceiv readi 
 queen margaret thi cheer heart see forward 
 oxford here pitch battl henc budg 

 flourish march enter distanc king edward 
 gloucest clarenc soldiers

 king edward brave follow yonder stand thorni wood
 which heaven assist strength 
 must root hewn yet ere night 
 i need add fuel fire 
 for well i wot ye blaze burn 
 give signal fight lord 
 queen margaret lord knight gentlemen i say
 my tear gainsay everi word i speak 
 ye see i drink water eye 
 therefor henri sovereign 
 is prison foe state usurp 
 hi realm slaughter hous subject slain 
 hi statut cancel treasur spent 
 and yonder wolf make spoil 
 you fight justic then god name lord 
 be valiant give signal fight 
 alarum retreat excurs exeunt

scen v anoth part field

flourish enter king edward gloucest clarenc forc 
with queen margaret oxford somerset prisoners

 king edward now period tumultu broil 
 away oxford hame castl straight 
 for somerset guilti head 
 go bear henc i hear speak 
 oxford for part i troubl thee word 
 somerset nor i stoop patienc fortun 
 exeunt oxford somerset guarded
 queen margaret so part sadli troublou world 
 to meet joy sweet jerusalem 
 king edward is proclam made find edward
 shall high reward life 
 gloucest it lo youth edward come 

 enter soldier princ edward

 king edward bring forth gallant let us hear speak 
 what young man begin prick 
 edward satisfact canst thou make
 for bear arm stir subject 
 and troubl thou hast turn 
 princ of wale speak like subject proud ambiti york 
 suppos i father mouth 
 resign thi chair i stand kneel thou 
 whilst i propos self word the
 which traitor thou wouldst answer 
 queen margaret ah thi father resolv 
 gloucest that might still worn petticoat
 and ne er stol n breech lancast 
 princ of wale let aesop fabl winter night 
 hi currish riddl sort place 
 gloucest by heaven brat i plagu ye word 
 queen margaret ay thou wast born plagu men 
 gloucest for god sake take away captiv scold 
 princ of wale nay take away scold crookback rather 
 king edward peac wil boy i charm tongu 
 clarenc untutor lad thou art malapert 
 princ of wale i know duti unduti 
 lascivi edward thou perjur georg 
 and thou misshapen dick i tell ye all
 i better traitor ye 
 and thou usurp st father right mine 
 king edward take like railer 
 stab 
 gloucest sprawl st thou take end thi agoni 
 stab 
 clarenc and twit perjuri 
 stab 
 queen margaret o kill 
 gloucest marri shall offer kill 
 king edward hold richard hold done much 
 gloucest whi live fill world word 
 king edward what doth swoon use mean recoveri 
 gloucest clarenc excus king brother 
 i henc london seriou matter 
 ere ye come sure hear news 
 clarenc what 
 gloucest the tower tower exit
 queen margaret o ned sweet ned speak thi mother boy 
 canst thou speak o traitor murder 
 they stabb caesar shed blood 
 did offend worthi blame 
 if foul deed equal 
 he man respect child 
 and men ne er spend furi child 
 what wors murder i may name 
 no heart burst i speak 
 and i speak heart may burst 
 butcher villain bloodi cannib 
 how sweet plant untim cropp 
 you children butcher 
 the thought would stirr remors 
 but ever chanc child 
 look youth cut off
 as deathsmen rid sweet young princ 
 king edward away go bear henc perforc 
 queen margaret nay never bear henc dispatch 
 here sheath thi sword i pardon thee death 
 what wilt thou then clarenc thou 
 clarenc by heaven i thee much eas 
 queen margaret good clarenc sweet clarenc thou 
 clarenc didst thou hear swear i would 
 queen margaret ay thou usest forswear thyself 
 twa sin ti chariti 
 what wilt thou where devil butcher 
 hard favour richard richard art thou 
 thou art murder thi alm deed 
 petition blood thou ne er put st back 
 king edward away i say i charg ye bear henc 
 queen margaret so come princ 
 exit led forcibly
 king edward where richard gone 
 clarenc to london post i guess 
 to make bloodi supper tower 
 king edward he sudden thing come head 
 now march henc discharg common sort
 with pay thank let away london
 and see gentl queen well fare 
 by i hope hath son exeunt

scen vi london the tower

ent king henri gloucest lieuten walls

 gloucest good day lord what book hard 
 king henri ay good lord lord i say rather 
 ti sin flatter good littl better 
 good gloucest good devil alik 
 and preposter therefor good lord 
 gloucest sirrah leav us must confer 
 exit lieutenant
 king henri so fli reckless shepherd wolf 
 so first harmless sheep doth yield fleec 
 and next throat unto butcher knife 
 what scene death hath rosciu act 
 gloucest suspicion alway haunt guilti mind 
 the thief doth fear bush offic 
 king henri the bird hath lime bush
 with trembl wing misdoubteth everi bush 
 and i hapless male one sweet bird 
 have fatal object eye
 where poor young lim caught kill 
 gloucest whi peevish fool crete
 that taught son offic fowl 
 and yet wing fool drown 
 king henri i daedalu poor boy icaru 
 thi father mino deni cours 
 the sun sear wing sweet boy 
 thi brother edward thyself sea
 whose enviou gulf swallow life 
 ah kill thi weapon word 
 my breast better brook thi dagger point
 than ear tragic histori 
 but wherefor dost thou come is life 
 gloucest think st thou i execution 
 king henri a persecutor i sure thou art 
 if murder innoc execut 
 whi thou execution 
 gloucest thi son i kill presumpt 
 king henri hadst thou kill first thou didst presum 
 thou hadst liv kill son mine 
 and thu i prophesi mani thousand
 which mistrust parcel fear 
 and mani old man sigh mani widow 
 and mani orphan water stand eye 
 men son wive husband 
 orphan parent timeless death 
 shall rue hour ever thou wast born 
 the owl shriek thi birth evil sign 
 the night crow cri abod luckless time 
 dog howl hideou tempest shook tree 
 the raven rook chimney top 
 and chatt ring pie dismal discord sung 
 thi mother felt mother pain 
 and yet brought forth less mother hope 
 to wit indigest deform lump 
 not like fruit goodli tree 
 teeth hadst thou thi head thou wast born 
 to signifi thou cam st bite world 
 and rest true i heard 
 thou cam st 
 gloucest i hear die prophet thi speech 
 stab 
 for amongst rest i ordain 
 king henri ay much slaughter 
 o god forgiv sin pardon thee die 
 gloucest what aspir blood lancaster
 sink ground i thought would mount 
 see sword weep poor king death 
 o may purpl tear alway shed
 from wish downfal hous 
 if spark life yet remain 
 down hell say i sent thee thither 
 stab 
 i neither piti love fear 
 inde ti true henri told 
 for i often heard mother say
 i came world leg forward 
 had i reason think ye make haste
 and seek ruin usurp right 
 the midwif wonder women cried
 o jesu bless us born teeth 
 and i plainli signified
 that i snarl bite play dog 
 then sinc heaven shap bodi 
 let hell make crook mind answer 
 i brother i like brother 
 and word love greybeard call divin 
 be resid men like one anoth 
 and i alon 
 clarenc bewar thou keep st light 
 but i sort pitchi day thee 
 for i buzz abroad prophecies
 that edward shall fear life 
 and purg fear i thi death 
 king henri princ son gone 
 clarenc thi turn next rest 
 count bad till i best 
 i throw thi bodi anoth room 
 and triumph henri thi day doom 
 exit body

scen vii london the palace

flourish enter king edward queen elizabeth clarenc gloucest 
hast nurs young princ attendants

 king edward onc sit england royal throne 
 repurcha blood enemi 
 what valiant foemen like autumn corn 
 have mow top pride 
 three duke somerset threefold renown d
 for hardi undoubt champion 
 two clifford father son 
 and two northumberland two braver men
 ne er spurr courser trumpet sound 
 with two brave bear warwick montagu 
 that chain fetter kingli lion
 and made forest trembl roar 
 thu swept suspicion seat
 and made footstool secur 
 come hither bess let kiss boy 
 young ned thee thine uncl myself
 have armour watch winter night 
 went afoot summer scald heat 
 that thou might st repossess crown peac 
 and labour thou shalt reap gain 
 gloucest asid i blast harvest head laid 
 for yet i look world 
 thi shoulder ordain thick heav 
 and heav shall weight break back 
 work thou way shall execut 
 king edward clarenc gloucest love love queen 
 and kiss princ nephew brother 
 clarenc the duti i owe unto majesty
 i seal upon lip sweet babe 
 king edward thank nobl clarenc worthi brother thank 
 gloucest and i love tree whenc thou sprang st 
 wit love kiss i give fruit 
 asid to say truth juda kiss master
 and cri all hail meant harm 
 king edward now i seat soul delight 
 have countri peac brother love 
 clarenc what grace done margaret 
 reignier father king france
 hath pawn sicil jerusalem 
 and hither sent ransom 
 king edward away waft henc franc 
 and rest spend time
 with state triumph mirth comic show 
 such befit pleasur court 
 sound drum trumpet farewel sour annoy 
 for i hope begin last joy exeunt




k henri the eighth

 scene 

 london westminst kimbolton

 king henri the eighth

 the prologu 

 i come make laugh thing now
 that bear weighti seriou brow 
 sad high work full state woe 
 such nobl scene draw eye flow 
 we present those piti here
 may think well let fall tear 
 the subject deserv such give
 their money hope may believe
 may find truth those come see
 onli show two agree
 the play may pass still will 
 i undertak may see away shilling
 richli two short hour onli they
 that come hear merri bawdi play 
 a nois target see fellow
 in long motley coat guard yellow 
 will deceiv gentl hearer know 
 to rank chosen truth show
 as fool fight besid forfeiting
 our brain opinion bring
 to make true intend 
 will leav us never understand friend 
 therefor good sake known
 the first happiest hearer town 
 be sad would make ye think ye see
 the person nobl story
 as live think see great 
 and follow gener throng sweat
 of thousand friend moment see
 how soon mighti meet miseri 
 and merri i say
 a man may weep upon wed day 

act i scene 1 

london the palace

ent duke of norfolk one door duke of
buckingham lord abergavenny

 buckingham good morrow well met how ye done
 sinc last saw franc 
 norfolk i thank grace 
 health ever sinc fresh admirer
 of i saw 
 buckingham an untim ague
 stay prison chamber when
 those sun glori two light men 
 met vale andren 
 norfolk twixt guyn ard 
 i present saw salut horseback 
 beheld light clung
 in embrac grew togeth 
 which four thron one could weigh d
 such compound one 
 buckingham all whole time
 i chamber prison 
 norfolk then lost
 the view earthli glori men might say 
 till time pomp singl married
 to one each follow day
 becam next day master till last
 made former wonder to day french 
 all clinquant gold like heathen god 
 shone english morrow they
 made britain india everi man stood
 show like mine their dwarfish page were
 as cherubin gilt madam 
 not us toil almost sweat bear
 the pride upon labour
 wa paint now masque
 wa cri incompar th ensu night
 made fool beggar the two king 
 equal lustr best worst 
 as presenc present eye
 still prais present 
 twa said saw one discerner
 durst wag tongu censur when sun 
 for phrase em herald challeng d
 the nobl spirit arm perform
 beyond thought compass former fabul stori 
 be seen possibl enough got credit 
 that bevi believ 
 buckingham o go far 
 norfolk as i belong worship affect
 in honour honesti tract ev rything
 would good discours lose life
 which action self tongu all royal 
 to dispos nought rebel 
 order gave thing view the offic did
 distinctli full function 
 buckingham who guid 
 i mean set bodi limbs
 of great sport togeth guess 
 norfolk one cert promis element
 in busi 
 buckingham i pray lord 
 norfolk all ord red good discretion
 of right reverend cardin york 
 buckingham the devil speed no man pie freed
 from ambiti finger what he
 to fierc vaniti i wonder
 that keech bulk
 take ray th benefici sun 
 and keep earth 
 norfolk sure sir 
 there stuff put end 
 for propp ancestri whose grace
 chalk successor way call upon
 for high feat done th crown neither allied
 to emin assist spider like 
 out self draw web give us note
 the forc merit make way 
 a gift heaven give buys
 a place next king 
 abergavenni i can not tell
 what heaven hath given let graver eye
 pierc i see pride
 peep part whenc 
 if hell devil niggard
 or given begins
 a new hell 
 buckingham whi devil 
 upon french go took upon 
 without priviti th king appoint
 who attend he make file
 of gentri part such
 to great charg littl honour
 he meant lay upon letter 
 the honour board council 
 must fetch paper 
 abergavenni i know
 kinsmen mine three least have
 by sicken estat never
 they shall abound formerli 
 buckingham o many
 have broke back lay manor em
 for great journey what vanity
 but minist commun of
 a poor issu 
 norfolk grievingli i think
 the peac french us values
 the cost conclud 
 buckingham everi man 
 after hideou storm follow was
 a thing inspir consult broke
 into gener propheci tempest 
 dash garment peac aboded
 the sudden breach 
 norfolk which bud 
 for franc hath flaw leagu hath attach d
 our merchant good bordeaux 
 abergavenni is therefore
 th ambassador silenc 
 norfolk marri 
 abergavenni a proper tide peac purcha d
 at superflu rate 
 buckingham whi business
 our reverend cardin carri 
 norfolk like grace 
 the state take notic privat difference
 betwixt cardin i advis 
 and take heart wish toward you
 honour plenteou safeti read
 the cardin malic potency
 togeth consid that
 what high hatr would effect want not
 a minist power you know natur 
 that reveng i know sword
 hath sharp edg long may said
 it reach far twill extend 
 thither dart bosom counsel
 you find wholesom lo come rock
 that i advis shun 

 enter cardin wolsey purs born certain the

 and let reason choler question
 what ti go to climb steep hills
 requir slow pace first anger like
 a full hot hors allow way

 can advis like yourself
 as would friend

 that swallow much treasur like glass
 did break th wrench

 as plea ratified
 as cri thu let much end
 as give crutch th dead but count cardinal
 ha done ti well worthi wolsey 
 who can not err now follow

 to th old dam treason charl emperor 
 under pretenc see queen aunt 
 for twa inde colour came
 to whisper wolsey make visit 
 hi fear interview betwixt

 breed prejudic league

 doe buy sell honour pleas 
 and advantag

 someth mistaken

act i scene 2

nobl sir thoma lovel other the cardin place himself
und king s feet right side

 never name us half power

 of petit

 are great grievanc commissions
 sent among em hath flaw heart

 most bitterli putter on
 of exact yet king master 
 whose honour heaven shield soil even escap not
 languag unmannerli yea breaks
 the side loyalti almost appears

 norfolk not almost appear 
 it doth appear upon taxat 
 the clothier abl maintain
 the mani long put of

 and lack mean desper manner

 and danger serv among

 i know singl part aught
 pertain th state front file
 where other tell step

 to would know yet must
 perforc acquaint these exact 
 whereof sovereign would note are
 most pestil th hear bear em

 they devi els suffer
 too hard exclam 
 king still exact

 is exact

 in tempt patienc bold ned

 come commiss compel each

 is nam war franc thi make bold mouth 
 tongu spit duti cold heart freeze
 allegi curs now
 live prayer come pass
 thi tractabl obedi slave
 to incens i would highness
 would give quick consider for
 there primer busi 
 king by life 
 thi pleasur 
 wolsey and

 a singl voic pass but
 by learn approb judg if i am
 traduc ignor tongu neither know
 my faculti person yet be

 ti fate place rough brake
 that virtu must go we must stint
 our necessari action fear
 to cope malici censur ever
 as rav nou fish vessel follow
 that new trimm benefit further
 than vainli long what oft best 
 by sick interpret weak one is
 not allow worst oft
 hit grosser qualiti cri up
 for best act if shall stand still 
 in fear motion mock carp 
 we take root sit sit
 state statu

 and care exempt fear 
 thing done without exampl issue
 are fear have precedent
 of commiss i believ

 and stick sixth part

 from everi tree lop bark part th timber

 where question send letter with
 free pardon man denied
 the forc commiss pray look tot

 of great duke buckingham

 buckingham all good peopl 
 you thu far come piti 
 hear i say go home lose 
 i day receiv traitor judgment 
 and name must die yet heaven bear wit 
 and i conscienc let sink me
 even axe fall i faith 
 the law i bear malic death 
 t done upon premis justic 
 but sought i could wish christian 
 be i heartili forgiv em 
 yet let em look glori mischief
 nor build evil grave great men 
 for guiltless blood must cri em 
 for life world i ne er hope
 nor i sue although king mercies
 more i dare make fault you lov me
 and dare bold weep buckingham 
 hi nobl friend fellow leave
 is bitter die

 and lift soul heaven lead god name

 were hid forgiv frankli

 there can not numberless offences
 gainst i can not take peac no black envy
 shall mark grave commend grace 
 and speak buckingham pray tell him

 yet king till soul forsak 
 shall cri bless may live
 longer i time tell year

 good fill one monument

 who undertak end

 and fit furnitur suits
 the great person

 let alon state mock

 that never knew truth meant i seal 
 and blood make em one day groan fort

 who first rai head usurp richard 
 fli succour servant banist 
 be distress wretch betray d
 and without trial fell god peac 
 henri seventh succeed truli pitying

 restor honour ruins
 made name nobl now son 
 henri eighth life honour name all
 that made happi one stroke taken
 for ever world i trial

 fell servant men lov 
 a unnatur faithless servic 
 heaven end yet hear 
 thi die man receiv certain 
 where liber love counsel 
 be sure loos make friends
 and give heart perceive
 the least rub fortun fall away
 like water ye never found again
 but mean sink ye all good peopl 
 pray i must forsak ye last hour
 of long weari life come upon

 and would say someth sad 
 speak i fell i done god forgiv

 would come

 said i girl like i ll
 have els unsay ti hot 
 i put issu exeunt

 chancellor my good lord archbishop i sorry
 to sit present behold
 that chair stand empti men 
 in natur frail capable
 of flesh angel frailty
 and want wisdom best teach us 
 have misdemean littl 
 toward king first law filling
 the whole realm teach chaplain 
 for inform new opinion

 gardin which reform must sudden 
 my nobl lord tame wild horses

 till obey manag if suffer

 of whole state late day neighbour

 cranmer let speak sir 
 for heaven bid word i utter
 let none think flatteri find em truth 
 thi royal infant heaven still move 
 though cradl yet promises
 upon land thousand bless 
 which time shall bring ripe she shall 
 but live behold good 
 a pattern princ live 
 and shall succeed saba never
 more covet wisdom fair virtue
 than pure soul shall all princ graces
 that mould mighti piec 
 with virtu attend good 
 shall still doubl truth shall nurs 
 holi heavenli thought still counsel 
 she shall lov fear her shall bless 
 her foe shake like field beaten corn 
 and hang head sorrow good grow 
 in day everi man shall eat safety
 under vine plant sing
 the merri song peac neighbour 
 god shall truli known her
 from shall read perfect way honour 
 and claim great blood 
 nor shall peac sleep when
 the bird wonder die maiden phoenix
 her ash new creat anoth heir
 as great admir 
 so shall leav blessed one 
 when heaven shall call cloud dark 
 who sacr ash honour
 shall star like rise great fame 
 and stand fix peac plenti love truth terror 
 that servant chosen infant 
 shall like vine grow 
 wherev bright sun heaven shall shine 
 hi honour great name
 shall make new nation shall flourish 
 and like mountain cedar reach branches
 to plain children children
 shall see bless heaven 
 king thou speakest wonder 
 cranmer she shall happi england 
 an age princess mani day shall see 
 and yet day without deed crown 
 would i known but must die 
 she must saint must yet virgin 
 a unspot lili shall pass
 to th ground world shall mourn 
 king o lord archbishop 
 thou hast made man never before
 thi happi child i get anyth 
 thi oracl comfort plea me
 that i heaven i shall desire
 to see child prais maker

 and good brethren i much behold 
 i receiv much honour presenc 
 and ye shall find thank lead way lord 
 ye must see queen must thank ye 
 she sick els thi day man think
 ha busi hous shall stay 
 thi littl one shall make holiday exeunt

king_henry_viii epilogu the epilogu 

 ti ten one play never please
 all some come take ease
 and sleep act two fear 
 w fright trumpet ti clear 
 they say ti nought other hear city
 abu extrem cri that witti 
 which done neither i fear 
 all expect good w like hear
 for play time in
 the merci construct good women 
 for one show em if smile
 and say twill i know within while
 all best men ti ill hap
 if hold ladi bid em clap

act i scene 1

king john palace

ent king john queen elinor pembrok essex salisburi other 
with chatillon

 king john now say chatillon would franc us 
 chatillon thu greet speak king france
 in behaviour majesti 
 the borrow majesti england 
 elinor a strang begin borrow majesti 
 king john silenc good mother hear embassi 
 chatillon philip franc right true behalf
 of thi deceas brother geffrey son 
 arthur plantagenet lay law claim
 to fair island territori 
 to ireland poictier anjou tourain main 
 desir thee lay asid sword
 which sway usurpingli sever titl 
 and put young arthur hand 
 thi nephew right royal sovereign 
 king john what follow disallow 
 chatillon the proud control fierc bloodi war 
 to enforc right forcibl withheld 
 king john here war war blood blood 
 control control answer franc 
 chatillon then take king defianc mouth 
 the farthest limit embassi

 for ere thou canst report i

 and sullen presag decay 
 an honour conduct let 
 pembrok look farewel chatillon 
 exeunt chatillon pembroke
 elinor what son have i ever said
 how ambiti constanc would cease
 till kindl franc world
 upon right parti son 
 thi might prevent made whole
 with easi argument love 
 which manag two kingdom must
 with fear bloodi issu arbitr 
 king john our strong possess right us

 or els must go wrong

 which none heaven i shall hear

 thi expedit charg 

 enter robert faulconbridg philip bastard
 brother

 what men 
 bastard your faith subject i gentleman
 born northamptonshir eldest son 
 as i suppos robert faulconbridg 
 a soldier honour give hand
 of coeur de lion knight field 
 king john what art thou 
 robert the son heir faulconbridg

 you came one mother seem 
 bastard most certain one mother mighti king 
 that well known i think one father 
 but certain knowledg truth
 i put er heaven mother 
 of i doubt men children may 
 elinor out thee rude man thou dost shame thi mother 
 and wound honour diffid 
 bastard i madam no i reason 
 that brother plea none mine 
 the prove pop out
 at least fair five hundr pound year 
 heaven guard mother honour land 
 king john a good blunt fellow whi younger born 
 doth lay claim thine inherit 
 bastard i know except get land 
 but slander bastardi 
 but whe er i true begot 
 that still i lay upon mother head 
 but i well begot lieg 
 fair fall bone took pain 
 compar face judg 
 if old sir robert beget us both
 and father son like

 i give heaven thank i like thee

 elinor he hath trick coeur de lion face 
 the accent tongu affecteth 
 do read token son
 in larg composit man 
 king john mine eye hath well examin parts
 and find perfect richard sirrah speak 
 what doth move claim brother land 
 bastard becaus hath half face like father 
 with half face would land 
 a half fac groat five hundr pound year 
 robert my graciou lieg father liv 
 your brother employ father much 
 bastard well sir can not get land 
 your tale must employ mother 
 robert and dispatch embassy
 to germani emperor
 to treat high affair touch time 
 th advantag absenc took king 
 and meantim sojourn father 
 where prevail i shame speak 
 but truth truth larg length sea shores
 between father mother lay 
 as i heard father speak 
 when lusti gentleman got 
 upon death bed bequeath d
 hi land took death
 that mother son none 
 and came world
 full fourteen week cours time 
 then good lieg let mine 
 my father land father 
 king john sirrah brother legitim 
 your father wife wedlock bear 
 and play fals fault 
 which fault lie hazard husbands
 that marri wive tell brother 
 who say took pain get son 
 had father claim son 
 in sooth good friend father might kept
 thi calf bred cow world 
 in sooth might brother 
 my brother might claim father 
 be none refus thi conclud 
 my mother son get father heir 
 your father heir must father land 
 robert shall father force
 to dispossess child 
 bastard of forc dispossess sir 
 than get i think 
 elinor whether hadst thou rather faulconbridg 
 and like thi brother enjoy thi land 
 or reput son coeur de lion 
 lord thi presenc land besid 
 bastard madam brother shape
 and i sir robert like 
 and leg two ride rod 
 my arm eel skin stuff face thin
 that mine ear i durst stick rose
 lest men say look three farth goe 
 and shape heir land 
 would i might never stir place 
 i would give everi foot face 
 i would sir nob case 
 elinor i like thee well wilt thou forsak thi fortun 
 bequeath thi land follow 
 i soldier bound franc 
 bastard brother take land i take chanc 
 your face hath got five hundr pound year 
 yet sell face fivep ti dear 
 madam i follow unto death 
 elinor nay i would go thither 
 bastard our countri manner give better way 
 king john what thi name 
 bastard philip lieg name begun 
 philip good old sir robert wife eldest son 
 king john from henceforth bear name whose form thou bearest 
 kneel thou philip rise great 
 aris sir richard plantagenet 
 bastard brother th mother side give hand 
 my father gave honour gave land 
 now bless hour night day 
 when i got sir robert away 
 elinor the spirit plantagenet 
 i thi grandam richard call 
 bastard madam chanc truth though 
 someth littl right 
 in window els er hatch 
 who dare stir day must walk night 
 and howev men catch 
 near far well still well shot 
 and i i howe er i begot

 a landless knight make thee land squir 
 come madam come richard must speed
 for franc franc need 
 bastard brother adieu good fortun come thee 
 for thou wast got th way honesti 
 exeunt bastard
 a foot honour better i 
 but mani mani foot land wors 
 well i make joan ladi 
 good den sir richard god merci fellow 
 and name georg i call peter 
 for new made honour doth forget men name 
 ti respect sociable
 for convers now travel 
 he toothpick worship mess 
 and knightli stomach suffic 
 whi i suck teeth catechize
 my pick man countri my dear sir 
 thu lean mine elbow i begin
 i shall beseech that question 
 and come answer like absey book 
 o sir say answer best command 
 at employ servic sir 
 no sir say question i sweet sir 
 and ere answer know question would 
 save dialogu compliment 
 and talk alp apennin 
 the pyrenean river po 
 it draw toward supper conclus 
 but worship societi 
 and fit mount spirit like 
 for bastard time
 that doth smack observ 
 and i whether i smack 
 and alon habit devic 
 exterior form outward accoutr 
 but inward motion deliver
 sweet sweet sweet poison age tooth 
 which though i practis deceiv 
 yet avoid deceit i mean learn 
 for shall strew footstep rise 
 but come hast ride robe 
 what woman post hath husband
 that take pain blow horn

 to make room husband bed

 thou art issu dear offenc 
 which strongli urg past defenc 
 bastard now light i get 
 madam i would wish better father 
 some sin bear privileg earth 
 and doth fault folli 
 need must lay heart dispos 
 subject tribut command love 
 against whose furi unmatch force
 the aweless lion could wage fight
 nor keep princ heart richard hand 
 he perforc rob lion hearts
 may easili win woman ay mother 
 with heart i thank thee father

 when i got i send soul hell

 and shall say richard begot

 who say lie i say twa exeunt

act ii scene 1

franc befor angiers

ent one side austria forc king philip of
franc 
lewi dauphin constanc arthur forces

 king philip befor angier well met brave austria 
 arthur great forerunn thi blood 
 richard robb lion heart
 and fought holi war palestin 
 by brave duke came earli grave 
 and amend poster 
 at import hither come
 to spread colour boy thi behalf 
 and rebuk usurpation
 of thi unnatur uncl english john 
 embrac love give welcom hither 
 arthur god shall forgiv coeur de lion death
 the rather give offspr life 
 shadow right wing war 
 i give welcom powerless hand 
 but heart full unstain love 
 welcom gate angier duke 
 king philip a nobl boy who would thee right 
 austria upon thi cheek lay i zealou kiss
 as seal indentur love 
 that home i return
 till angier right thou hast franc 
 togeth pale white fac shore 
 whose foot spurn back ocean roar tides
 and coop land island 
 even till england hedg main 
 that water wall bulwark still secure
 and confid foreign purpos 
 even till utmost corner west
 salut thee king till fair boy 
 will i think home follow arm 
 constanc o take mother thank widow thank 
 till strong hand shall help give strength
 to make requit love 
 austria the peac heaven lift swords
 in charit war 
 king philip well work our cannon shall bent
 against brow resist town 
 call chiefest men disciplin 
 to cull plot best advantag 
 we lay town royal bone 
 wade market place frenchmen blood 
 but make subject boy 
 constanc stay answer embassi 
 lest unadvi stain sword blood 
 my lord chatillon may england bring
 that right peac urg war 
 and shall repent drop blood
 that hot rash hast indirectli shed 

 enter chatillon

 king philip a wonder ladi lo upon thi wish 
 our messeng chatillon arriv 
 what england say say briefli gentl lord 
 we coldli paus thee chatillon speak 
 chatillon then turn forc paltri siege
 and stir mightier task 
 england impati demand 
 hath put arm the advers wind 
 whose leisur i stay given time
 to land legion soon i 
 hi march expedi town 
 hi forc strong soldier confid 
 with along come mother queen 
 an ate stir blood strife 
 with ladi blanch spain 
 with bastard king decea 
 and th unsettl humour land 
 rash inconsider fieri voluntari 
 with ladi face fierc dragon spleen 
 have sold fortun nativ home 
 bear birthright proudli back 
 to make hazard new fortun 
 in brief braver choic dauntless spirits
 than english bottom waft er
 did never float upon swell tide
 to offenc scath christendom drum beat 
 the interrupt churlish drums
 cut circumst hand 
 to parley fight therefor prepar 
 king philip how much unlook expedit 
 austria by much unexpect much
 we must awak endeavour defenc 
 for courag mounteth occas

 from franc england live peac 
 england love england sake
 with burden armour sweat 
 thi toil work thine

 that thou hast wrought law king 
 cut sequenc poster 
 outfac infant state done rape
 upon maiden virtu crown 
 look upon thi brother geffrey face 
 these eye brow mould 
 thi littl abstract doth contain large
 which die geffrey hand time
 shall draw brief huge volum

 which owe crown thou er masterest 
 king john from hast thou great commiss franc 
 to draw answer thi articl 
 king philip from supern judg stir good thoughts
 in breast strong authority
 to look blot stain right 
 that judg hath made guardian boy

 enter two king power sever doors

 king john franc hast thou yet blood cast away

 whose passag vex thi impedi

 rather lost and hand i swear 
 that sway earth climat overlook

 left finish

 whose ful perfect lie 
 o two silver current join 
 do glorifi bank bound 
 and two shore two stream made one

 to two princ marri 
 thi union shall batteri can
 to fast close gate match
 with swifter spleen powder enforc 
 the mouth passag shall fling wide ope
 and give entranc without match

 lion confid mountain rocks
 more free motion death himself
 in mortal furi half peremptory
 as keep citi 
 bastard here stay
 that shake rotten carcass old death
 out rag here larg mouth inde 
 that spit forth death mountain rock sea 
 talk familiarli roar lions
 as maid thirteen puppi dog 
 what cannon begot lusti blood

 our ear cudgel word his
 but buffet better fist franc 
 zound i never bethump words
 sinc i first call brother father dad

 give niec dowri larg enough 
 for knot thou shalt sure tie
 thi unsur assur crown
 that yon green boy shall sun ripe

 i see yield look franc 
 mark whisper urg souls
 are capabl ambit 
 lest zeal melt windi breath
 of soft petit piti remors 
 cool congeal 
 citizen whi answer doubl majesties

 to speak unto citi say

 can book beauti read i love

 which shadow son 
 becom sun make son shadow

 till infix i beheld myself
 drawn flatter tabl eye

 that i see worthi love

 though churlish thought judg 
 that i find merit hate 
 king john what say young one what say niec 
 blanch that bound honour still do
 what wisdom still vouchsaf say

 for i love unfeignedli

 that i i first assur

 let amiti made 
 for saint mari chapel presently

 is ladi constanc troop 
 i know match made up

 where son tell know 
 lewi she sad passion high tent
