 thu thisb end 
 adieu adieu adieu 

 _di _ 

theseu 
moonshin lion left buri dead 

demetriu 
ay wall 

bottom 
no i assur wall part father will it
pleas see epilogu hear bergomask danc between
two compani 

theseu 
no epilogu i pray play need excus never excus 
for player dead need none blame marri 
if writ play pyramu hang thisb s
garter would fine tragedi truli and
veri notabl discharg but come bergomask let epilogue
alon 

 _here danc clown _ 

the iron tongu midnight hath told twelv 
lover bed ti almost fairi time 
i fear shall outsleep come morn
a much night overwatch 
thi palpabl gross play hath well beguil d
the heavi gait night sweet friend bed 
a fortnight hold solemnity
in nightli revel new jolliti 

 _exeunt _ 

 enter puck 

puck 
 now hungri lion roar 
 and wolf behowl moon 
 whilst heavi ploughman snore 
 all weari task fordon 
 now wast brand glow 
 whilst screech owl screech loud 
 put wretch lie woe
 in remembr shroud 
 now time night
 that grave gape wide 
 everi one let forth sprite 
 in church way path glide 
 and fairi run
 by tripl hecat team
 from presenc sun 
 follow dark like dream 
 now frolic mouse
 shall disturb hallow hous 
 i sent broom 
 to sweep dust behind door 

 enter oberon titania train 

oberon 
 through hous give glimmer light 
 by dead drowsi fire 
 everi elf fairi sprite
 hop light bird brier 
 and ditti 
 sing danc trippingli 

titania 
 first rehears song rote 
 to word warbl note 
 hand hand fairi grace 
 will sing bless place 

 _song danc _ 

oberon 
 now break day 
 through hous fairi stray 
 to best bride bed 
 which us shall blessd 
 and issu create
 ever shall fortun 
 so shall coupl three
 ever true love 
 and blot natur hand
 shall issu stand 
 never mole hare lip scar 
 nor mark prodigi are
 despis nativ 
 shall upon children 
 with field dew consecr 
 everi fairi take gait 
 and sever chamber bless 
 through palac sweet peac 
 and owner blest 
 ever shall safeti rest 
 trip away make stay 
 meet break day 

 _exeunt oberon titania train _ 

puck 
 if shadow offend 
 think mend 
 that slumber here
 while vision appear 
 and weak idl theme 
 no yield dream 
 gentl reprehend 
 if pardon mend 
 and i honest puck 
 if unearnd luck
 now scape serpent tongu 
 we make amend ere long 
 els puck liar call 
 so good night unto 
 give hand friend 
 and robin shall restor amend 

 _exit _ 



 much ado about nothing

 better expect must expect tell

 in practic let us put present

 find bird nest show companion steal

 wilt thou make trust transgress the transgress in
 stealer 


 benedick 
 yet amiss rod made garland
 garland might worn rod he
 might bestow i take stolen his
 bird nest 


 don pedro 
 i teach sing restor owner 


 benedick 
 if sing answer say faith say
 honestli 


 don pedro 
 the ladi beatric hath quarrel gentleman that
 danc told much wrong 


 benedick 
 o misus past endur block oak with
 one green leaf would answer visor began
 assum life scold she told think i
 i princ jester i was
 duller great thaw huddl jest upon jest such
 imposs convey upon i stood like man mark 
 whole armi shoot she speak poniard every
 word stab breath terribl termin 
 live near would infect north
 star i would marri though endow all
 adam left transgress would have
 made hercul turn spit yea cleft club to
 make fire come talk shall find the
 infern ate good apparel i would god scholar would
 conjur certainli man may live as
 quiet hell sanctuari peopl sin upon purpose
 would go thither inde disquiet horror
 perturb follow 


 re enter claudio beatric hero leonato 


 don pedro 
 look come 


 benedick 
 will grace command servic world end i will
 go slightest errand antipod can
 devis send i fetch toothpick the
 furthest inch asia bring length prester john s
 foot fetch hair great cham beard any
 embassag pygmi rather hold three word 
 confer harpi you employ

 none desir good compani

 tongu 


 _exit _ 


 don pedro 
 come ladi come lost heart signior benedick 


 beatric 
 inde lord lent awhil i gave use 
 doubl heart singl one marri of
 fals dice therefor grace may well say i lost

 you put ladi put 


 beatric

 seek

 whi count wherefor sad 


 claudio 
 not sad lord 


 don pedro

 claudio 
 neither lord

 the count neither sad sick merri well but

 father good obtain name day marriag 
 god give thee joy

 count take daughter fortun his
 grace hath made match grace say amen

 speak count ti cue

 silenc perfectest herald joy i littl happi 
 i could say much ladi mine i i
 give away dote upon exchang

 speak cousin can not stop mouth kiss and
 let speak neither

 claudio 
 and doth cousin 


 beatric 
 good lord allianc thu goe everyon world i 
 i sunburnt i may sit corner cri heigh ho a
 husband

 ne er brother like your father got excel husband if
 maid could come 


 don pedro 
 will ladi 


 beatric 
 no lord unless i might anoth work day your
 grace costli wear everi day but i beseech grace 
 pardon i born speak mirth matter 


 don pedro 
 your silenc offend merri best becom 
 question born merri hour

 no sure lord mother cri star
 danc i born cousin god give joy 


 leonato 
 niec look thing i told 


 beatric 
 i cri merci uncl by grace pardon 


 _exit _ 


 don pedro 
 by troth pleasant spirit ladi 


 leonato 
 there littl melancholi element lord is
 never sad sleep ever sad i have
 heard daughter say hath often dream unhappi and
 wake laugh 


 don pedro 
 she can not endur hear tell husband

 o mean mock wooer suit

 mad

 claudio

 not till monday dear son henc seven night 
 time brief thing answer mind

 thee claudio time shall go dulli us i the
 interim undertak one hercul labour bring
 signior benedick ladi beatric mountain of
 affect one i would fain match 
 i doubt fashion three minister
 assist i shall give direct 


 leonato 
 my lord i though cost ten night watch 


 claudio 
 and i lord 


 don pedro 
 and gentl hero 


 hero 
 i modest offic lord help cousin good
 husband 


 don pedro 
 and benedick unhopefullest husband i know thus
 far i prais nobl strain approved
 valour confirm honesti i teach humour
 cousin shall fall love benedick i 
 two help practis benedick in
 despit quick wit queasi stomach shall fall in

 archer glori shall love god 
 go i tell drift

scene ii anoth room leonato hous 

 enter don john borachio 


 don john 
 it count claudio shall marri daughter leonato 


 borachio 
 yea lord i cross

 sick displeasur whatsoev come athwart his

 not honestli lord covertli dishonesti shall

 show briefli

 favour margaret wait gentlewoman hero

 i rememb

 honour marri renown claudio whose estim you
 mightili hold contamin stale one hero

 kill leonato look issu 


 don john 
 onli despit i endeavour anyth

 go find meet hour draw don pedro count
 claudio alon tell know hero love intend
 kind zeal princ claudio love your
 brother honour hath made match friend s
 reput thu like cozen semblanc of
 maid discov thu they scarc believe
 without trial offer instanc shall bear no

 call margaret hero hear margaret term claudio bring them
 see night intend wed in
 meantim i fashion matter hero shall be

scene iii leonato garden 

 enter benedick 


 benedick 
 boy 


 enter boy 


 boy 
 signior 


 benedick 
 in chamber window lie book bring hither the

 boy 
 i alreadi sir

 i know i would thee henc 


 _exit boy _ 


 i much wonder one man see much anoth man a
 fool dedic behaviour love he
 hath laugh shallow folli other becom the
 argument scorn fall love man is
 claudio i known music the
 drum fife rather hear tabor the
 pipe i known would walk ten mile afoot to
 see good armour lie ten night awak carving
 fashion new doublet he wont speak plain to
 purpos like honest man soldier he
 turn orthographi word fantast banquet 
 mani strang dish may i convert see with
 eye i can not tell i think i sworn but
 love may transform oyster i take oath 
 till made oyster shall never make a
 fool one woman fair yet i well anoth wise yet i am
 well anoth virtuou yet i well till grace in
 one woman one woman shall come grace rich shall
 certain wise i none virtuou i never
 cheapen fair i never look mild come not
 near nobl i angel good discours an
 excel musician hair shall colour it
 pleas god ha princ monsieur love i hide in
 arbour 


 _withdraw _ 


 enter don pedro leonato claudio follow balthasar and
 musician 


 don pedro 
 come shall hear music 


 claudio 
 yea good lord how still even 
 as hush purpos grace harmoni 


 don pedro 
 see benedick hath hid 


 claudio 
 o well lord music end 
 we fit kid fox penni worth 


 don pedro 
 come balthasar hear song 


 balthasar 
 o good lord tax bad voice
 to slander music 


 don pedro 
 it wit still excel 
 to put strang face perfect 
 i pray thee sing let woo 


 balthasar 
 becaus talk woo i sing 
 sinc mani wooer doth commenc suit
 to think worthi yet wooe 
 yet swear love 


 don pedro 
 nay pray thee come 
 or thou wilt hold longer argument 
 do note 


 balthasar 
 note note 
 there note mine worth note 


 don pedro 
 whi crotchet speak 
 note note forsooth noth 


 _music _ 


 benedick 
 now divin air soul ravish is strang that
 sheep gut hale soul men bodi well horn
 money done 


 balthasar _sings_ 
 sigh ladi sigh 
 men deceiv ever 
 one foot sea one shore 
 to one thing constant never 
 then sigh let go 
 and blith bonni 
 convert sound woe
 into hey nonni nonni 


 sing ditti sing mo
 of dump dull heavi 
 the fraud men ever 
 sinc summer first leavi 
 then sigh let go 
 and blith bonni 
 convert sound woe
 into hey nonni nonni

 by troth good song

 and ill singer lord 


 don pedro 
 ha faith thou singest well enough shift

 _aside_ and dog howl thu 
 would hang i pray god bad voic bode no
 mischief i lief heard night raven come what
 plagu could come 


 don pedro yea marri dost thou hear balthasar i pray thee 
 get us excel music tomorrow night would it
 ladi hero chamber window 


 balthasar the best i lord 


 don pedro do farewel

 come hither leonato told today your
 niec beatric love signior benedick 


 claudio 
 o ay _asid don pedro_ stalk stalk fowl sit 
 i never think ladi would love man 


 leonato 
 no i neither wonder dote on
 signior benedick hath outward behaviour seemed
 ever abhor 


 benedick 
 _aside_ is possibl sit wind corner 


 leonato 
 by troth lord i can not tell think that
 love enrag affect past infinite
 thought 


 don pedro 
 mayb doth counterfeit 


 claudio 
 faith like enough 


 leonato 
 o god counterfeit there never counterfeit passion came
 near life passion discov 


 don pedro 
 whi effect passion show

 leonato 
 what effect lord she sit _to claudio_ you heard
 daughter tell 


 claudio 
 she inde 


 don pedro 
 how i pray you amaz i would thought her
 spirit invinc assault affect 


 leonato 
 i would sworn lord especi benedick 


 benedick 
 _aside_ i think gull white bearded
 fellow speak knaveri can not sure hide such
 rever 


 claudio 
 _aside_ he hath ta en infect hold 


 don pedro 
 hath made affect known benedick 


 leonato 
 no swear never torment 


 claudio 
 ti true inde daughter say shall i say 
 oft encount scorn write i
 love 


 leonato 
 thi say begin write for
 twenti time night sit her
 smock till writ sheet paper daughter tell us
 


 claudio 
 now talk sheet paper i rememb pretti jest your
 daughter told us 


 leonato 
 o writ read found
 benedick beatric sheet 


 claudio 
 that 


 leonato 
 o tore letter thousand halfpenc rail at
 immodest write one she
 knew would flout i measur say own
 spirit i flout writ yea though i
 love i 


 claudio 
 then upon knee fall weep sob beat heart 
 tear hair pray curs o sweet benedick god give me

 she doth inde daughter say ecstasi hath so
 much overborn daughter sometim afeard will
 desper outrag it true

 it good benedick knew will
 discov 


 claudio 
 to end would make sport torment poor
 ladi wors 


 don pedro 
 and alm hang she excellent
 sweet ladi suspicion virtuou 


 claudio 
 and exceed wise 


 don pedro 
 in everyth love benedick 


 leonato 
 o lord wisdom blood combat tender bodi we
 ten proof one blood hath victori i sorry
 i caus uncl guardian 


 don pedro 
 i would bestow dotag i would daffed
 respect made half i pray tell
 benedick hear say 


 leonato 
 were good think 


 claudio 
 hero think sure die say die he
 love die ere make love known and
 die woo rather bate one breath
 accustom cross 


 don pedro 
 she doth well make tender love ti very
 possibl scorn man know hath a
 contempt spirit 


 claudio 
 he proper man 


 don pedro 
 he hath inde good outward happi 


 claudio 
 fore god mind wise 


 don pedro

 claudio 
 and i take valiant 


 don pedro 
 as hector i assur manag quarrel may
 say wise either avoid great discret 
 undertak christian like fear 


 leonato 
 if fear god must necessarili keep peac break
 peac ought enter quarrel fear and
 trembl 


 don pedro

 larg jest make well i sorri for
 niec shall go seek benedick tell love

 never tell lord let wear good counsel

 nay imposs may wear heart first

 well hear daughter let cool
 i love benedick well i could wish would
 modestli examin see much unworthi good
 ladi

 my lord walk dinner readi 


 claudio 
 _aside_ if dote upon i never trust
 expect 


 don pedro 
 _aside_ let net spread must
 daughter gentlewoman carri the sport when
 hold one opinion anoth dotag matter 
 scene i would see mere dumb
 show let us send call dinner 


 _exeunt don pedro claudio leonato _ 


 benedick 
 _advanc arbour _ thi trick the
 confer sadli born they truth from
 hero they seem piti ladi seem affect have
 full bent love must requit i hear i
 censur say i bear proudli i perceive
 love come say rather die
 give sign affect i never think marri i
 must seem proud happi hear detract 
 put mend they say ladi fair ti a
 truth i bear wit virtuou ti i cannot
 reprov wise love troth no
 addit wit great argument folli i
 horribl love i may chanc odd
 quirk remnant wit broken i rail so
 long marriag doth appetit alter a man
 love meat youth can not endur age 
 shall quip sentenc paper bullet brain
 awe man career humour no world must be
 peopl when i said i would die bachelor i think i
 live till i marri here come beatric by this
 day fair ladi i spi mark love 


 enter beatric 


 beatric 
 against i sent bid come dinner 


 benedick 
 fair beatric i thank pain 


 beatric 
 i took pain thank take pain to
 thank pain i would come 


 benedick 
 you take pleasur messag 


 beatric 
 yea much may take upon knife point choke
 daw withal you stomach signior fare well 


 _exit _ 


 benedick 
 ha against i sent bid come dinner 
 doubl mean i took pain those
 thank took pain thank much to
 say ani pain i take easi thank if i do
 take piti i villain i love i am
 jew i go get pictur 


 _exit _ 





act iii

scen i leonato garden 

 enter hero margaret ursula 


 hero 
 good margaret run thee parlour 
 there shalt thou find cousin beatrice
 propos princ claudio 
 whisper ear tell i ursala
 walk orchard whole discourse
 is say thou overheard st us 
 and bid steal pleach bower 
 where honey suckl ripen sun 
 forbid sun enter like favourit 
 made proud princ advanc pride
 against power bred there hide 
 to listen propos thi thi offic 
 bear thee well leav us alon 


 margaret 
 i make come i warrant present 


 _exit _ 


 hero 
 now ursula beatric doth come 
 as trace alley 
 our talk must benedick 
 when i name let thi part
 to prais ever man merit 
 my talk thee must benedick
 is sick love beatric matter
 is littl cupid crafti arrow made 
 that wound hearsay 


 enter beatric behind 


 now begin 
 for look beatric like lapw runs
 close ground hear confer 


 ursula 
 the pleasant st angl see fish
 cut golden oar silver stream 
 and greedili devour treacher bait 
 so angl beatric even now
 is couch woodbin covertur 
 fear part dialogu 


 hero 
 then go near ear lose nothing
 of fals sweet bait lay 


 _they advanc bower _ 


 no truli ursula disdain 
 i know spirit coy wild
 as haggard rock 


 ursula 
 but sure
 that benedick love beatric entir 


 hero 
 so say princ new troth lord 


 ursula 
 and bid tell madam 


 hero 
 they entreat acquaint 
 but i persuad lov benedick 
 to wish wrestl affect 
 and never let beatric know 


 ursula 
 whi doth gentleman
 deserv full fortun bed
 as ever beatric shall couch upon 


 hero 
 o god love i know doth deserve
 as much may yield man 
 but natur never fram woman heart
 of prouder stuff beatric 
 disdain scorn ride sparkl eye 
 mispris look wit
 valu highli her
 all matter els seem weak she can not love 
 nor take shape project affect 
 she self endear 


 ursula 
 sure i think 
 and therefor certainli good
 she knew love lest make sport 


 hero 
 whi speak truth i never yet saw man 
 how wise nobl young rare featur 
 but would spell backward fair fac 
 she would swear gentleman sister 
 if black natur draw antick 
 made foul blot tall lanc ill head 
 if low agat vile cut 
 if speak vane blown wind 
 if silent block move none 
 so turn everi man wrong side 
 and never give truth virtu that
 which simpl merit purchaseth 


 ursula 
 sure sure carp commend 


 hero 
 no odd fashion 
 as beatric can not commend 
 but dare tell if i speak 
 she would mock air o would laugh me
 out press death wit 
 therefor let benedick like cover fire 
 consum away sigh wast inwardli 
 it better death die mock 
 which bad die tickl 


 ursula 
 yet tell hear say 


 hero 
 no rather i go benedick 
 and counsel fight passion 
 and truli i devis honest slanders
 to stain cousin one doth know
 how much ill word may empoison like 


 ursula 
 o cousin wrong 
 she can not much without true judgment 
 have swift excel wit
 as priz refuse
 so rare gentleman signior benedick 


 hero 
 he man itali 
 alway except dear claudio 


 ursula 
 i pray angri madam 
 speak fanci signior benedick 
 for shape bear argument valour 
 goe foremost report itali 


 hero 
 inde hath excel good name 


 ursula 
 hi excel earn ere 
 when marri madam 


 hero 
 whi everi day tomorrow come go 
 i show thee attir thi counsel
 which best furnish tomorrow 


 ursula 
 she lim i warrant 
 we caught madam 


 hero 
 if prove love goe hap 
 some cupid kill arrow trap 


 _exeunt hero ursula _ 


 beatric 
 _advanc _ what fire mine ear can true 
 stand i condemn pride scorn much 
 contempt farewel maiden pride adieu 
 no glori live behind back 
 and benedick love i requit thee 
 tame wild heart thi love hand 
 if thou dost love kind shall incit thee
 to bind love holi band 
 for other say thou dost deserv i
 believ better reportingli 


 _exit _ 


scene ii a room leonato hous 

 enter don pedro claudio benedick leonato 


 don pedro 
 i stay till marriag consumm go i
 toward arragon 


 claudio 
 i bring thither lord vouchsaf 


 don pedro 
 nay would great soil new gloss your
 marriag show child new coat forbid wear
 i bold benedick compani from
 crown head sole foot mirth 
 hath twice thrice cut cupid bowstr little
 hangman dare shoot he hath heart sound a
 bell tongu clapper heart think 
 tongu speak 


 benedick 
 gallant i i 


 leonato 
 so say i methink sadder 


 claudio 
 i hope love 


 don pedro 
 hang truant true drop blood be
 truli touch love if sad want money 


 benedick 
 i tooth ach 


 don pedro 
 draw 


 benedick 
 hang 


 claudio 
 you must hang first draw afterward 


 don pedro 
 what sigh tooth ach 


 leonato 
 where humour worm 


 benedick 
 well everyon master grief 


 claudio 
 yet say i love 


 don pedro 
 there appear fanci unless fanci that
 hath strang disguis dutchman today a
 frenchman tomorrow shape two countri as
 german waist downward slop spaniard from
 hip upward doublet unless fanci this
 fooleri appear hath fool fanci you
 would appear 


 claudio 
 if love woman believ old
 sign brush hat morn bode 


 don pedro 
 hath man seen barber 


 claudio 
 no barber man hath seen old
 ornament cheek hath alreadi stuf tenni ball 


 leonato 
 inde look younger loss beard 


 don pedro 
 nay rub civet smell 


 claudio 
 that much say sweet youth love 


 don pedro 
 the greatest note melancholi 


 claudio 
 and wont wash face 


 don pedro 
 yea paint i hear say of
 


 claudio 
 nay jest spirit crept a
 lute string govern stop 


 don pedro 
 inde tell heavi tale conclud conclud is
 love 


 claudio 
 nay i know love 


 don pedro 
 that would i know i warrant one know 


 claudio 
 ye ill condit despit die 


 don pedro 
 she shall buri face upward 


 benedick 
 yet charm tooth ach old signior walk aside
 i studi eight nine wise word speak 
 hobbi hors must hear 


 _exeunt benedick leonato _ 


 don pedro 
 for life break beatric 


 claudio 
 ti even hero margaret play parts
 beatric two bear bite one another
 meet 


 enter don john 


 don john 
 my lord brother god save 


 don pedro 
 good den brother 


 don john 
 if leisur serv i would speak 


 don pedro 
 in privat 


 don john 
 if pleas yet count claudio may hear i would
 speak concern 


 don pedro 
 what matter 


 don john 
 _to claudio _ mean lordship marri tomorrow 


 don pedro 
 you know 


 don john 
 i know know i know 


 claudio 
 if impedi i pray discov 


 don john 
 you may think i love let appear hereaft aim
 better i manifest for brother i think
 hold well dear heart hath holp effect
 ensu marriag sure suit ill spent labour ill
 bestow 


 don pedro 
 whi matter 


 don john 
 i came hither tell circumst shorten she
 long talk ladi disloy 


 claudio 
 who hero 


 don john 
 even leonato hero hero everi man hero 


 claudio 
 disloy 


 don john 
 the word good paint wicked i could say she
 wors think wors titl i fit 
 wonder till warrant go tonight you
 shall see chamber window enter even night her
 wed day love tomorrow wed would
 better fit honour chang mind 


 claudio 
 may 


 don pedro 
 i think 


 don john 
 if dare trust see confess know if
 follow i show enough have
 seen heard proceed accordingli 


 claudio 
 if i see anyth tonight i marri tomorrow in
 congreg i wed i shame 


 don pedro 
 and i woo thee obtain i join thee to
 disgrac 


 don john 
 i disparag farther till wit bear
 coldli till midnight let issu show 


 don pedro 
 o day untowardli turn 


 claudio 
 o mischief strang thwart 


 don john 
 o plagu right well prevent so say seen
 sequel 


 _exeunt _ 


scene iii a street 

 enter dogberri verg watch 


 dogberri 
 are good men true 


 verg 
 yea els piti suffer salvat body
 soul 


 dogberri 
 nay punish good should
 allegi chosen princ watch 


 verg 
 well give charg neighbour dogberri 


 dogberri 
 first think desartless man constabl 


 first watch 
 hugh oatcak sir georg seacoal write and
 read 


 dogberri 
 come hither neighbour seacoal god hath bless good
 name well favour man gift fortun to
 write read come natur 


 second watch 
 both master constabl 


 dogberri 
 you i knew would answer well favour 
 sir give god thank make boast your
 write read let appear need of
 vaniti you thought senseless and
 fit man constabl watch therefor bear the
 lanthorn thi charg shall comprehend vagrom
 men bid man stand princ name 


 second watch 
 how stand 


 dogberri 
 whi take note let go presently
 call rest watch togeth thank god rid of
 knave 


 verg 
 if stand bidden none the
 princ subject 


 dogberri 
 true meddl none princ subject 
 you shall also make nois street watch
 babbl talk toler endur 


 second watch 
 we rather sleep talk know belong watch 


 dogberri 
 whi speak like ancient quiet watchman i
 can not see sleep offend care your
 bill stolen well call alehous 
 bid drunk get bed 


 second watch 
 how 


 dogberri 
 whi let alon till sober make you
 better answer may say men you
 took 


 second watch 
 well sir 


 dogberri 
 if meet thief may suspect virtu your
 offic true man kind men less
 meddl make honesti 


 second watch 
 if know thief shall lay hand 


 dogberri 
 truli offic may i think touch pitch
 defil the peaceabl way take a
 thief let show steal of
 compani 


 verg 
 you alway call merci man partner 


 dogberri 
 truli i would hang dog much man who
 hath honesti 


 verg 
 if hear child cri night must call nurse
 bid still 


 second watch 
 how nurs asleep hear us 


 dogberri 
 whi depart peac let child wake with
 cri ewe hear lamb bae 
 never answer calf bleat 


 verg 
 ti true 


 dogberri 
 thi end charg you constabl present the
 princ person meet princ night may
 stay

 thought i thi spirit stronger thi shame

 strike thi life griev i i one

 o one much thee whi i one

 that i mine

 which barr rib iron 
 would two princ lie claudio lie 
 who lov speak foul 
 wash tear henc let die

 hear littl 
 for i silent long 
 and given way unto cours fortun 
 by note ladi i mark d
 a thousand blush apparitions
 to start face thousand innoc shames
 in angel white bear away blush 
 and eye hath appear fire 
 to burn error princ hold
 against maiden truth call fool 
 trust read observ 
 which experiment seal doth warrant
 the tenur book trust age 
 my rever call divin 
 if sweet ladi lie guiltless here
 under bite error

 thou seest grace hath left
 is add damnation
 a sin perjuri deni 
 whi seek st thou cover excuse
 that appear proper naked

 ladi man accu

 if i know man alive
 than maiden modesti doth warrant 
 let sin lack merci o father 
 prove man conver d
 at hour unmeet i yesternight
 maintain chang word creatur 
 refus hate tortur death

 two bent honour 
 and wisdom misl 
 the practic live john bastard 
 whose spirit toil frame villaini 


 leonato 
 i know if speak truth 
 these hand shall tear wrong honour 
 the proudest shall well hear 
 time hath yet dri blood mine 
 nor age eat invent 
 nor fortun made havoc mean 
 nor bad life reft much friend 
 but shall find awak kind 
 both strength limb polici mind 
 abil mean choic friend 
 to quit throughli

 paus awhil 
 and let counsel sway case 
 your daughter princ left dead 
 let awhil secretli kept 
 and publish dead inde 
 maintain mourn ostent 
 and famili old monument
 hang mourn epitaph rites
 that appertain unto burial

 what shall becom what

 marri well carri shall behalf
 chang slander remors good 
 but dream i strang cours 
 but travail look greater birth 
 she die must maintain 
 upon instant accu 
 shall lament piti excu d
 of everi hearer fall out
 that prize worth
 while enjoy lack lost 
 whi rack valu find
 the virtu possess would show us
 while so fare claudio 
 when shall hear die upon word 
 the idea life shall sweetli creep
 into studi imagin 
 and everi love organ life
 shall come apparel preciou habit 
 more move delic full life
 into eye prospect soul 
 than liv inde shall mourn 
 if ever love interest liver 
 and wish accus 
 no though thought accus true 
 let doubt success
 will fashion event better shape
 than i lay likelihood 
 but aim level fals 
 the supposit ladi death
 will quench wonder infami 
 and sort well may conceal 
 as best befit wound reput 
 in reclus religi life 
 out eye tongu mind injuri

 signior leonato let friar advis 
 and though know inward love
 is much unto princ claudio 
 yet mine honour i deal this
 as secretli justli soul
 should bodi

 the smallest twine may lead

 for strang sore strang strain cure 
 come ladi die live wed day
 perhap prolong patienc endur

act v

scene i befor leonato hous 

 enter leonato antonio 


 antonio 
 if go thu kill yourself
 and ti wisdom thu second grief
 against 


 leonato 
 i pray thee ceas thi counsel 
 which fall mine ear profitless
 as water siev give counsel 
 nor let comfort delight mine ear
 but one whose wrong suit mine 
 bring father lov child 
 whose joy overwhelm like mine 
 and bid speak patienc 
 measur woe length breadth mine 
 and let answer everi strain strain 
 as thu thu grief 
 in everi lineament branch shape form 
 if one smile stroke beard 
 bid sorrow wag cri hem groan 
 patch grief proverb make misfortun drunk
 with candl waster bring yet 
 and i gather patienc 
 but man brother men
 can counsel speak comfort grief
 which feel tast 
 their counsel turn passion before
 would give precepti medicin rage 
 fetter strong mad silken thread 
 charm ach air agoni word 
 no ti men offic speak patience
 to wring load sorrow 
 but man virtu sufficiency
 to moral shall endure
 the like therefor give counsel 
 my grief cri louder advertis 


 antonio 
 therein men children noth differ 


 leonato 
 i pray thee peac i flesh blood 
 for never yet philosopher
 that could endur toothach patient 
 howev writ style gods
 and made push chanc suffer 


 antonio 
 yet bend harm upon 
 make offend suffer 


 leonato 
 there thou speak st reason nay i 
 my soul doth tell hero beli 
 and shall claudio know shall princ 
 and thu dishonour 


 antonio 
 here come princ claudio hastili 


 enter don pedro claudio 


 don pedro 
 good den good den 


 claudio 
 good day 


 leonato 
 hear lord 


 don pedro 
 we hast leonato 


 leonato 
 some hast lord well fare well lord 
 are hasti well one 


 don pedro 
 nay quarrel us good old man 


 antonio 
 if could right quarrel 
 some us would lie low 


 claudio 
 who wrong 


 leonato 
 marri thou dost wrong thou dissembl thou 
 nay never lay thi hand upon thi sword 
 i fear thee 


 claudio 
 marri beshrew hand 
 if give age caus fear 
 in faith hand meant noth sword 


 leonato 
 tush tush man never fleer jest 
 i speak like dotard fool 
 as privileg age brag
 what i done young would 
 were i old know claudio thi head 
 thou hast wrong mine innoc child me
 that i forc lay rever 
 and grey hair bruis mani day 
 do challeng thee trial man 
 i say thou hast beli mine innoc child 
 thi slander hath gone heart 
 and lie buri ancestor 
 o tomb never scandal slept 
 save fram thi villaini 


 claudio 
 my villaini 


 leonato 
 thine claudio thine i say 


 don pedro 
 you say right old man 


 leonato 
 my lord lord i prove bodi dare 
 despit nice fenc activ practic

 that sit

 done death slander tongues
 wa hero lie

 so life die shame
 live death gloriou fame

othello the moor of venice



contents

scen i venic a street 
scene ii venic anoth street 
scene iii venic a council chamber

scen i a seaport cypru a platform 
scene ii a street

scene ii cypru a room castl 
scene iii cypru the garden castl 
scene iv cypru befor castl

scen i cypru befor castl 
scene ii cypru a room castl 
scene iii cypru anoth room castl 

act v
scene i cypru a street 
scene ii cypru a bedchamb castl

seaport cypru 


act i

scen i venic a street 

 enter roderigo iago 

roderigo 
tush never tell i take much unkindly
that thou iago hast purs 
a string thine shouldst know 

iago 
 sblood hear 
if ever i dream matter 
abhor 

roderigo 
thou told st thou didst hold thi hate 

iago 
despis i three great one citi 
in person suit make lieuten 
off capp faith man 
i know price i worth wors place 
but love pride purpos 
evad bombast circumst 
horribl stuff epithet war 
and conclus 
nonsuit mediat cert say 
 i alreadi chose offic 
and 
forsooth great arithmetician 
one michael cassio florentin 
a fellow almost damn fair wife 
that never set squadron field 
nor divis battl knows
mor spinster unless bookish theoric 
wherein toge consul propose
a masterli mere prattl without practice
i soldiership but sir elect 
and i eye seen proof
at rhode cypru ground 
christian heathen must bele calm d
bi debitor creditor counter caster 
he good time must lieuten 
and i god bless mark moorship ancient 

roderigo 
bi heaven i rather would hangman 

iago 
whi remedi ti curs servic 
prefer goe letter affect 
and old gradat second
stood heir first now sir judg yourself
wheth i term affin d
to love moor 

roderigo 
i would follow 

iago 
o sir content 
i follow serv turn upon 
we can not master masters
cannot truli follow you shall mark
mani duteou knee crook knave
that dote obsequi bondag 
wear time much like master ass 
for nought provend old cashier 
whip honest knave other are
who trimm form visag duti 
keep yet heart attend 
and throw show servic lord 
do well thrive lin coat 
do homag these fellow soul 
and one i profess for sir 
it sure roderigo 
were i moor i would iago 
in follow i follow 
heaven judg i love duti 
but seem peculiar end 
for outward action doth demonstrate
th nativ act figur heart
in complement extern ti long after
but i wear heart upon sleeve
for daw peck i i 

roderigo 
what full fortun thick lip owe 
if carri thu 

iago 
call father 
rous make poison delight 
proclaim street incens kinsmen 
and though fertil climat dwell 
plagu fli though joy joy 
yet throw chang vexat 
a may lose color 

roderigo 
here father hous i call aloud 

iago 
do like timor accent dire yell
a night neglig fire
i spi popul citi 

roderigo 
what ho brabantio signior brabantio ho 

iago 
awak ho brabantio thiev thiev 
look hous daughter bag 
thiev thiev 

 brabantio appear window 

brabantio 
what reason terribl summon 
what matter 

roderigo 
signior famili within 

iago 
are door lock 

brabantio 
whi wherefor ask 

iago 
zound sir robb shame put gown 
your heart burst lost half soul 
even old black ram
i tup white ewe aris aris 
awak snort citizen bell 
or els devil make grandsir 
aris i say 

brabantio 
what lost wit 

roderigo 
most reverend signior know voic 

brabantio 
not i what 

roderigo 
mi name roderigo 

brabantio 
the worser welcom 
i charg thee haunt door 
in honest plain thou hast heard say
mi daughter thee mad 
be full supper distemp draught 
upon malici braveri dost thou come
to start quiet 

roderigo 
sir sir sir 

brabantio 
but thou must need sure
mi spirit place power
to make bitter thee 

roderigo 
patienc good sir 

brabantio 
what tell st thou rob 
thi venic my hous grang 

roderigo 
most grave brabantio 
in simpl pure soul i come 

iago 
zound sir one serv god devil
bid becaus come servic think are
ruffian daughter cover barbari hors 
you nephew neigh courser cousins
and gennet german 

brabantio 
what profan wretch art thou 

iago 
i one sir come tell daughter moor are
now make beast two back 

brabantio 
thou art villain 

iago 
you senat 

brabantio 
thi thou shalt answer i know thee roderigo 

roderigo 
sir i answer anyth but i beseech 
if pleasur wise consent 
 as partli i find fair daughter 
at odd even dull watch night 
transport wors better guard 
but knave common hire gondoli 
to gross clasp lascivi moor 
if known allow 
we done bold sauci wrong 
but know manner tell 
we wrong rebuk do believe
that sens civil 
i thu would play trifl rever 
your daughter given leav 
i say hath made gross revolt 
ti duti beauti wit fortunes
in extravag wheel stranger
of everywher straight satisfi 
if chamber hous 
let loos justic state
for thu delud 

brabantio 
strike tinder ho 
give taper call peopl 
thi accid unlik dream 
belief oppress alreadi 
light i say light 

 _exit _ 

iago 
farewel i must leav 
it seem meet wholesom place
to produc i stay i shall 
against moor for i know state 
howev may gall check 
cannot safeti cast embark d
with loud reason cypru war 
which even stand act soul 
anoth fathom none
to lead busi in regard 
though i hate i hell pain 
yet necess present life 
i must show flag sign love 
which inde sign that shall sure find 
lead sagittari rais search 
and i so farewel 

 _exit _ 

 enter brabantio servant torch 

brabantio 
it true evil gone 
and come despis time 
i naught bitter now roderigo 
where didst thou see o unhappi girl 
with moor say st thou who would father 
how didst thou know twa o deceiv me
past thought what said get taper 
rais kindr are marri think 

roderigo 
truli i think 

brabantio 
o heaven how got o treason blood 
father henc trust daughter minds
bi see act is charms
bi properti youth maidhood
may abus have read roderigo 
of thing 

roderigo 
ye sir i inde 

brabantio 
call brother o would 
some one way anoth do know
wher may apprehend moor 

roderigo 
i think i discov please
to get good guard go along 

brabantio

othello 
her father lov oft invit 
still question stori life 
from year year battl sieg fortun 
that i pass 
i ran even boyish days
to moment bade tell 
wherein i spake disastr chanc 
of move accid flood field 
of hair breadth scape th immin deadli breach 
of taken insol foe 
and sold slaveri redempt thenc 
and portanc travel histori 
wherein antr vast desert idl 
rough quarri rock hill whose head touch heaven 
it hint speak process 
and cannib eat 
the anthropophagi men whose heads
do grow beneath shoulder thi hear
would desdemona serious inclin 
but still hous affair would draw thenc 
which ever could hast dispatch 
she come greedi ear
devour discours i observ 
took pliant hour found good means
to draw prayer earnest heart
that i would pilgrimag dilat 
whereof parcel someth heard 
but intent i consent 
and often beguil tear

that youth suffer my stori done 
she gave pain world sigh

that heaven made man thank 
and bade i friend lov

and i lov piti 
thi witchcraft i us

which thou hast alreadi heart

to hang clog i done lord 

duke

which grise step may help lovers
into favour 
when remedi past grief ended
bi see worst late hope depend

i next way draw new mischief 
what can not preserv fortun take 
patienc injuri mockeri make

he rob spend bootless grief

but free comfort thenc hear

that pay grief must poor patienc borrow 
these sentenc sugar gall 
be strong side equivoc

that brui heart pierc ear

that i love moor live 
mi downright violenc storm fortunes
may trumpet world heart subdued
even qualiti lord 
i saw othello visag mind 
and honour valiant parts
did i soul fortun consecr

a moth peac go war

and i heavi interim shall support
bi dear absenc let go

to pleas palat appetit 
nor compli heat young affects
in defunct proper satisfact

for no light wing toys

roderigo

and sinc i could distinguish betwixt benefit injuri i never
found man knew love ere i would say i would drown
myself love guinea hen i would chang human a
baboon

in virtu amend

virtu fig ti thu thu our bodies
ar garden will garden so will
plant nettl sow lettuc set hyssop weed thyme suppli it
with one gender herb distract mani either it
steril idl manur industri power and
corrig author lie will if balanc our
liv one scale reason pois anoth sensual the
blood base natur would conduct us preposterous
conclus but reason cool rage motion carnal
st unbit lust whereof i take call love to
b sect scion

it mere lust blood permiss come be
a man drown thyself drown cat blind puppi i profess me
thi friend i confess knit thi deserv cabl of
perdur tough i could never better stead thee put
money thi purs follow thou war defeat thi favour an
usurp beard i say put money thi purs it can not that
desdemona long continu love moor put money thy
purs it violent commenc thou shalt
se answer sequestr put money thi purs these moors
ar changeabl will fill thi purs money the food that
to lusciou locust shall shortli acerb
a coloquintida she must chang youth when sate with
hi bodi find error choic she must chang 
she must therefor put money thi purs if thou wilt need damn
thyself delic way drown make money
th canst if sanctimoni frail vow betwixt er barbarian
and supersubtl venetian hard wit the
trib hell thou shalt enjoy therefor make money a pox of
drown thyself it clean way seek thou rather be
hang compass thi joy drown go without 

roderigo 
wilt thou fast hope i depend issu

retel thee i hate moor my caus heart 
thine hath less reason let us conjunct reveng against
him thou canst cuckold thou dost thyself pleasur a

iago 
thu i ever make fool purs 
for i mine gain knowledg profane
if i would time expend snipe
but sport profit i hate moor 
and thought abroad twixt sheets
h done offic i know true 
but i mere suspicion kind 
will sureti he hold well 
the better shall purpos work 
cassio proper man let see 
to get place plume will
in doubl knaveri how let see 
after time abus othello ear
that familiar wife 
he hath person smooth dispos 
to suspect fram make women fals 
the moor free open nature
that think men honest seem 
and tenderli led nose
a ass 
i it engend hell night
must bring monstrou birth world light

act ii

scen i a seaport cypru a platform 

 enter montano two gentlemen 

montano 
what cape discern sea 

first gentleman 
noth high wrought flood 
i can not twixt heaven main
descri sail 

montano 
methink wind hath spoke aloud land 
a fuller blast ne er shook battlement 
if hath ruffian upon sea 
what rib oak mountain melt 
can hold mortis what shall hear 

second gentleman 
a segreg turkish fleet 
for stand upon foam shore 
the chidden billow seem pelt cloud 
the wind shak surg high monstrou main 
seem cast water burn bear 
and quench guard ever fix pole 
i never like molest view
on enchaf flood 

montano 
if turkish fleet
b enshelt embay drown 
it imposs bear 

 enter third gentleman 

third gentleman 
new lad our war done 
the desper tempest hath bang turks
that design halt a nobl ship venice
hath seen grievou wreck sufferance
on part fleet 

montano 
how is true 

third gentleman 
the ship put 
a veronessa michael cassio 
lieuten warlik moor othello 
i come shore moor sea 
and full commiss cypru

touch turkish loss yet look sadli

with foul violent tempest

for i serv man commands
lik full soldier let sea side ho 
a well see vessel come in
a throw eye brave othello 
even till make main aerial blue
an indistinct regard

for everi minut expectancy
of arriv

com pate birdlim friez

and thu deliv

she find white shall black fit

wors wors 

emilia

iago

for even folli help heir

these old fond paradox make fool laugh alehous what
miser prais hast thou foul foolish 

iago

but foul prank fair wise one 

desdemona 
o heavi ignor thou praisest worst best but praise
couldst thou bestow deserv woman inde one the
author merit justli put vouch malice
itself 

iago 
she ever fair never proud 
had tongu yet never loud 
never lack gold yet went never gay 
fled wish yet said now i may 
she anger reveng nigh 
bade wrong stay displeasur fli 
she wisdom never frail
to chang cod head salmon tail 
she could think ne er disclos mind 
see suitor follow look behind 
she wight ever wight 

desdemona 
to 

iago 
to suckl fool chronicl small beer 

desdemona 
o lame impot conclus do learn emilia 
though thi husband how say cassio profane
and liber counsellor

he speak home madam you may relish soldier in
th scholar 

iago 
 _asid _ he take palm ay well said whisper with as
littl web i ensnar great fli cassio ay smile
upon i gyve thee thine courtship you say true 
 ti inde if trick strip your
lieutenantri better kiss three fingers
so oft apt play sir veri good 
well kiss excel courtesi ti inde yet your
fing lip would clyster pipe sake 

 _trumpet within _

 ti truli 

desdemona

cassio 
lo come 

 enter othello attend 

othello 
o fair warrior 

desdemona 
mi dear othello 

othello 
it give wonder great content
to see o soul joy 
if everi tempest come calm 
may wind blow till waken death 
and let labour bark climb hill seas
olympu high duck low
a hell heaven if die 
 twere happi i fear
mi soul hath content absolute
that anoth comfort like this
succe unknown fate 

desdemona 
the heaven forbid
but love comfort increase
even day grow 

othello 
amen sweet power 
i can not speak enough content 
it stop much joy 
and greatest discord _they kiss _ 
that e er heart shall make 

iago 
 _asid _ o well tun 
but i set peg make music 
a honest i 

othello 
come let us castl 
new friend war done turk drown 
how old acquaint isl 
honey shall well desir cypru 
i found great love amongst o sweet 
i prattl fashion i dote
in mine comfort i prithe good iago 
go bay disembark coffer 
bring thou master citadel 
he good one worthiness
do challeng much respect come desdemona 
onc well met cypru 

 _exeunt othello desdemona attend _ 

iago 
do thou meet present harbour come hither if thou st
valiant say base men love nobil in
their natur nativ list the lieutenant
tonight watch court guard first i must tell thee 
desdemona directli love 

roderigo 
with whi ti possibl 

iago 
lay thi finger thu let thi soul instruct mark what
viol first love moor brag tell her
fantast lie and love still prate let thy
discreet heart think her eye must fed and delight shall
sh look devil when blood made dull act
of sport inflam give satieti a
fresh appetit loveli favour sympathi year manner and
beauti moor defect want these
requir conveni delic tender find abus

iago 
that cassio love i well believ 
that love ti apt great credit 
the moor howbeit i endur 
i constant love nobl natur 
and i dare think prove desdemona
a dear husband now i love 
not absolut lust though peradventure
i stand account great sin 
but partli led diet reveng 
for i suspect lusti moor
hath leap seat the thought whereof
doth like poison miner gnaw inward 
and noth shall content soul
til i even wife wife 
or fail yet i put moor
at least jealousi strong
that judgement can not cure which thing 
if poor trash venic i trash
for quick hunt stand put 
i michael cassio hip 
abus moor rank garb

make moor thank love reward me
for make egregi ass
and practic upon peac quiet
even mad ti yet confu 
knaveri plain face never seen till us

though i bound everi act duti 
i bound slave free 
utter thought whi say vile fals 
a palac whereinto foul things
sometim intrud who breast pure
but uncleanli apprehensions
keep leet law day session sit
with medit law

a stranger thi thought

a i confess natur plague
to spi abus jealousy
shap fault wisdom
from one imperfectli conceit 
would take notic build trouble
out scatter unsur observ 
it quiet good 
nor manhood honesti wisdom 
to let know thought

rob enrich him
and make poor inde

nor shall whilst ti custodi

ha

it green ey monster doth mock
th meat feed that cuckold live bliss
who certain fate love wronger 
but o damn minut tell er
who dote yet doubt suspect yet strongli love 

othello 
o miseri 

iago 
poor content rich rich enough 
but rich fineless poor winter
to ever fear shall poor 
good heaven soul tribe defend
from jealousi 

othello 
whi 
think st thou i make life jealousi 
to follow still chang moon
with fresh suspicion no to doubt
i resolv exchang goat
when i shall turn busi soul
to exsuffl blown surmis 
match thi infer ti make jealou 
to say wife fair feed well love compani 
i free speech sing play danc well 
where virtu virtuou 
nor mine weak merit i draw
th smallest fear doubt revolt 
for eye chose no iago 
i see i doubt i doubt prove 
and proof 
away love jealousi 

iago 
i glad i shall reason
to show love duti i bear you
with franker spirit therefor i bound 
receiv i speak yet proof 
look wife observ well cassio 
wear eye thu jealou secur 
i would free nobl natur 
out self bounti abu look 
i know countri disposit well 
in venic let heaven see pranks
they dare show husband their best conscience
i leav undon keep unknown

dost thou say 

iago 
she deceiv father marri 
and seem shake fear look 
she love 

othello 
and

and palat sweet sour

it and affect 
desir sport frailti men 
then let use us well els let know 
the ill ill instruct us

act v

scene i cypru a street

everi way make gain live roderigo

of gold jewel i bobb 
a gift desdemona

he hath daili beauti life
that make ugli and besid moor

no must die but i hear come

scene ii cypru a bedchamb castl 

desdemona bed asleep light burn 

 enter othello 

othello 
it caus caus soul 
let name chast star 
it caus yet i shed blood 
nor scar whiter skin snow 
and smooth monument alabast 
yet must die els betray men 
put light put light 
if i quench thee thou flame minist 
i thi former light restor 
should i repent but put thi light 
thou cun st pattern excel natur 
i know promethean heat
that thi light relum when i pluck thi rose 
i can not give vital growth 
it must need wither i smell tree 

 _kiss _ 

o balmi breath dost almost persuade
justic break sword one one 
be thu thou art dead i kill thee 
and love thee one last 
so sweet ne er fatal i must weep 
but cruel tear thi sorrow heavenli 
it strike doth love she wake

act i

 enter gower 

 befor palac antioch 

to sing song old sung 
from ash ancient gower come 
assum man infirm 
to glad ear pleas eye 
it hath sung festiv 
on ember eve holi ale 
and lord ladi lives
hav read restor 
the purchas make men gloriou 
_et bonum quo antiquiu eo meliu _
if born latter time 
when wit ripe accept rhyme 
and hear old man sing
may wish pleasur bring 
i life would wish i might
wast like taper light 
thi antioch antiochu great
built citi chiefest seat 
the fairest syria 
i tell mine author say 
thi king unto took fere 
who die left femal heir 
so buxom blith full face 
a heaven lent grace 
with father like took 
and incest provok 
bad child wors father entic own
to evil done none 
but custom begin
wa long use account sin 
the beauti sin dame
mad mani princ thither frame 
to seek bedfellow 
in marriag pleasur playfellow 
which prevent made law 
to keep still men awe 
that whoso ask wife 
hi riddl told lost life 
so mani wight die 
a yon grim look testifi 
what ensu judgement eye
i give caus best justifi 

 _exit _ 



scene i antioch a room palac 

 enter antiochu princ pericl follow 

antiochu 
young princ tyre larg received
th danger task undertak 

pericl 
i antiochu soul
embolden glori prais 
think death hazard enterpris 

antiochu 
music bring daughter cloth like bride 
for embrac even jove 
at whose concept till lucina reign 
natur dowri gave glad presenc 
the senat hous planet sit 
to knit best perfect 

 music enter daughter antiochu 

pericl 
see come apparel like spring 
grace subject thought king
of everi virtu give renown men 
her face book prais read
noth curiou pleasur thence
sorrow ever raze testi wrath
could never mild companion 
you god made man sway love 
that inflam desir breast
to tast fruit yon celesti tree 
or die adventur help 
a i son servant 
to compass boundless happi 

antiochu 
princ pericl 

pericl 
that would son great antiochu 

antiochu 
befor thee stand fair hesperid 
with golden fruit danger touch 
for death like dragon affright thee hard 
her face like heaven enticeth thee view
her countless glori desert must gain 
and without desert thine eye
presum reach whole heap must die 
yon sometim famou princ like thyself 
drawn report adventur desir 
tell thee speechless tongu semblanc pale 
that without cover save yon field star 
here stand martyr slain cupid war 
and dead cheek advis thee desist
for go death net none resist 

pericl 
antiochu i thank thee hath taught
mi frail mortal know 
and fear object prepare
thi bodi like i must 
for death rememb like mirror 
who tell us life breath trust error 
i make sick men do
who know world see heaven feel woe 
gripe earthli joy erst 
so i bequeath happi peac you
and good men everi princ 
mi rich earth whenc came 
 _to daughter antiochu _ but unspot fire love 
thu readi way life death 
i wait sharpest blow antiochu 

antiochu 
scorn advic read conclus 
which read expound ti decre 
a thee thou thyself shalt bleed 

daughter 
of ssay yet mayst thou prove prosper 
of ssay yet i wish thee happi 

pericles
lik bold champion i assum list 
nor ask advic thought
but faith courag 

 _he read riddl _ 

 _i viper yet i feed
 on mother flesh breed 
 i sought husband labour
 i found kind father 
 he father son husband mild 
 i mother wife yet child 
 how may yet two 
 as live resolv _


sharp physic last o powers
that give heaven countless eye view men act 
whi cloud sight perpetu 
if true make pale read 
fair glass light i love could still 

 _take hold hand princess _ 

were gloriou casket store ill 
but i must tell thought revolt 
for man perfect wait
that know sin within touch gate 
you fair viol sens string 
who finger make man law music 
would draw heaven god hearken 
but play upon time 
hell danceth harsh chime 
good sooth i care 

antiochu 
princ pericl touch upon thi life 
for articl within law 
a danger rest your time expir 
either expound receiv sentenc 

pericl 
great king 
few love hear sin love act 
 twould braid near tell 
who book monarch 
he secur keep shut shown 
for vice repeat like wander wind 
blow dust other eye spread 
and yet end bought thu dear 
the breath gone sore eye see clear 
to stop air would hurt the blind mole casts
copp hill toward heaven tell earth throng d
bi man oppress poor worm doth die 
kind earth god vice law 
and jove stray dare say jove doth ill 
it enough know fit 
what known grow wors smother 
all love womb first bred 
then give tongu like leav love head 

antiochu 
 _aside_ heaven i thi head he found mean 
but i gloze young princ tyre 
though tenour strict edict 
your exposit misinterpret 
we might proceed cancel day 
yet hope succeed fair tree
a fair self doth tune us otherwis 
forti day longer respit 
if time secret undon 
thi merci show joy son 
and entertain shall be
a doth befit honour worth 

 _exeunt pericl _ 

pericl 
how courtesi would seem cover sin 
when done like hypocrit 
the good noth sight 
if true i interpret fals 
then certain bad
a foul incest abus soul 
where father son 
bi untim clasp child 
which pleasur fit husband father 
and eater mother flesh 
bi defil parent bed 
and like serpent though feed
on sweetest flower yet poison breed 
antioch farewel wisdom see men
blush action blacker night 
will schew cours keep light 
one sin i know anoth doth provok 
murder near lust flame smoke 
poison treason hand sin 
ay target put shame 
then lest life cropp keep clear 
bi flight i shun danger i fear 

 _exit _ 

 re enter antiochu 

antiochu 
he hath found mean 
for mean head 
he must live trumpet forth infami 
nor tell world antiochu doth sin
in loath manner 
and therefor instantli princ must die 
for fall honour must keep high 
who attend us 

 enter thaliard 

thaliard 
doth high call 

antiochu 
thaliard chamber 
and mind partak privat actions
to secreci faithfulness
w advanc thaliard 
behold poison gold 
we hate princ tyre thou must kill 
it fit thee ask reason 
becaus bid say done 

thaliard 
mi lord ti done 

antiochu 
enough 

 enter messeng 

let breath cool tell hast 

messeng 
mi lord princ pericl fled 

 _exit _ 

antiochu 
a thou wilt live fli like arrow shot
from well experienc archer hit mark
hi eye doth level thou ne er return
unless thou say princ pericl dead 

thaliard 
mi lord i get within pistol length i make sure
enough farewel high 

antiochu

 _exit thaliard _ 

till pericl dead 
mi heart lend succour head 

 _exit _ 



scene ii tyre a room palac 

 enter pericl lord 

pericl 
 _to lord without _ let none disturb us whi chang of
thought 
the sad companion dull eye melancholi 
be use guest hour
in day gloriou walk peac night 
the tomb grief sleep breed quiet 
here pleasur court mine eye mine eye shun 
and danger i fear antioch 
whose arm seem far short hit 
yet neither pleasur art joy spirit 
nor yet distanc comfort 
then thu passion mind 
that first concept misdread 
have nourish life care 
and first fear might done 
grow elder care done 
and great antiochu 
 gainst i littl contend 
sinc great make act 
will think speak though i swear silenc 
nor boot say i honour 
if suspect i may dishonour 
and may make blush known 
he stop cours might known 
with hostil forc erspread land 
and ostent war look huge 
amaz shall drive courag state 
our men vanquish ere resist 
and subject punish ne er thought offenc 
which care piti 
who top tree 
which fenc root grow defend 
make bodi pine soul languish 
and punish would punish 

 enter helicanu lord 

first lord 
joy comfort sacr breast 

second lord 
and keep mind till return us 
peac comfort 

helicanu 
peac peac give experi tongu 
they abus king flatter 
for flatteri bellow blow sin 
the thing flatter spark 
to spark give heat stronger glow 
wherea reproof obedi order 
fit king men may err 
when signior sooth proclaim peac 
he flatter make war upon life 
princ pardon strike pleas 
i can not much lower knee 

pericl 
all leav us els let care erlook
what ship lade 
and return us 

 _exeunt lord _ 

helicanu thou
hast move us seest thou look 

helicanu 
an angri brow dread lord 

pericl 
if dart princ frown 
how durst thi tongu move anger face 

helicanu 
how dare plant look heaven whence
they nourish 

pericl 
thou know st i power
to take thi life thee 

helicanu _kneel _ 
i ground axe 
do strike blow 

pericl 
rise prithe rise 
sit thou art flatter 
i thank thee heaven forbid
that king let ear hear fault hid 
fit counsellor servant princ 
who thi wisdom makest princ thi servant 
what wouldst thou 

helicanu 
to bear patience
such grief lay upon 

pericl 
thou speak st like physician helicanu 
that minist potion unto me
that thou wouldst trembl receiv thyself 
attend i went antioch 
where thou know st face death 
i sought purchas gloriou beauti 
from whenc issu i might propag 
are arm princ bring joy subject 
her face mine eye beyond wonder 
the rest hark thine ear black incest 
which knowledg found sin father
seem strike smooth thou know st 
 ti time fear tyrant seem kiss 
which fear grew i hither fled 
under cover care night 
who seem good protector 
bethought past might succeed 
i knew tyrann tyrant fears
decreas grow faster year 
and doubt doubt doth 
that i open listen air
how mani worthi princ blood shed 
to keep bed black unlaid ope 
to lop doubt fill land arm 
and make pretenc wrong i done 
when mine i may call offenc 
must feel war blow spare innoc 
which love thyself art one 
who reprovest 

helicanu 
ala sir 

pericl 
drew sleep mine eye blood cheek 
muse mind thousand doubts
how i might stop tempest ere came 
and find littl comfort reliev 
i thought princ chariti griev 

helicanu 
well lord sinc given leav speak 
freeli i speak antiochu fear 
and justli i think fear tyrant 
who either public war privat treason
wil take away life 
therefor lord go travel 
till rage anger forgot 
or till destini cut thread life 
your rule direct 
day serv light faith i 

pericl 
i doubt thi faith 
but wrong liberti absenc 

helcanu 
we mingl blood togeth earth 
from whenc birth 

pericl 
tyre i look thee tarsus
intend travel i hear thee 
and whose letter i dispos 
the care i subject good
on thee i lay whose wisdom strength bear 
i take thi word faith ask thine oath 
who shun break one sure crack 
but orb live round safe 
that time truth shall ne er convinc 
thou show dst subject shine i true princ 

 _exeunt _ 



scene iii tyre an ant chamber palac 

 enter thaliard 

thaliard 
so tyre court here must i kill king pericl 
and i i sure hang home ti danger 
well i perceiv wise fellow good discret 
be bid ask would king desir might know none
of secret i see reason king
bid man villain bound indentur oath be
on husht come lord tyre 

 enter helicanu escan lord tyre 

helicanu 
you shall need fellow peer tyre 
further question king departur 
hi seal commiss left trust 
doth speak suffici gone travel 

thaliard 
 _asid _ how king gone 

helicanu 
if yet satisfi 
whi unlicens love 
he would depart i give light unto 
be antioch 

thaliard 
 _asid _ what antioch 

helicanu 
royal antiochu caus i know not
took displeasur least judg 
and doubt lest err sinn 
to show sorrow correct 
so put unto shipman toil 
with minut threaten life death 

thaliard 
 _asid _ well i perceive
i shall hang although i would 
but sinc gone king sea must please
h scape land perish sea 
i present peac lord tyre 

helicanu 
lord thaliard antiochu welcom 

thaliard 
from i come
with messag unto princ pericl 
but sinc land i understood
your lord betook unknown travel 
mi messag must return whenc came 

helicanu 
we reason desir 
commend master us 
yet ere shall depart desir 
a friend antioch may feast tyre 

 _exeunt _ 



scene iv tarsu a room governor hous 

 enter cleon governor tarsu dionyza other 

cleon 
mi dionyza shall rest us 
and relat tale other grief 
see twill teach us forget 

dionyza 
that blow fire hope quench 
for dig hill aspire
throw one mountain cast higher 
o distress lord even grief 
here felt seen mischief eye 
but like grove topp higher rise 

cleon 
o dionyza 
who wanteth food say want 
or conceal hunger till famish 
our tongu sorrow sound deep
our woe air eye weep 
till tongu fetch breath may proclaim louder 
that heaven slumber creatur want 
they may awak help comfort 
i discours woe felt sever year 
and want breath speak help tear 

dionyza 
i best sir 

cleon 
thi tarsu er i govern 
a citi plenti held full hand 
for rich strew even street 
whose tower bore head high kiss cloud 
and stranger ne er beheld wonder 
whose men dame jet adorn 
like one anoth glass trim 
their tabl store full glad sight 
and much feed delight 
all poverti scorn pride great 
the name help grew odiou repeat 

dionyza 
o ti true 

cleon 
but see heaven by chang 
these mouth late earth sea air 
were littl content pleas 
although gave creatur abund 
a hous defil want use 
they starv want exercis 
those palat yet two summer younger 
must invent delight tast 
would glad bread beg 
those mother nousl babe 
thought nought curiou readi now
to eat littl darl love 
so sharp hunger teeth man wife
draw lot first shall die lengthen life 
here stand lord ladi weep 
here mani sink yet see fall
hav scarc strength left give burial 
i true 

dionyza 
our cheek hollow eye wit 

cleon 
o let citi plenti cup
and prosper larg tast 
with superfl riot hear tear 
the miseri tarsu may 

 enter lord 

lord 
where lord governor 

cleon 
here 
speak thi sorrow thou bring st hast 
for comfort far us expect 

lord 
we descri upon neighbour shore 
a portli sail ship make hitherward 

cleon 
i thought much 
one sorrow never come bring heir 
that may succeed inheritor 
and neighbour nation 
take advantag miseri 
that stuff hollow vessel power 
to beat us alreadi 
and make conquest unhappi 
wherea glori got overcom 

lord 
that least fear semblance
of white flag display bring us peac 
and come us favour foe 

cleon 
thou speak st like untutor repeat 
who make fairest show mean deceit 
but bring 
what need fear 
the ground lowest half way 
go tell gener attend 
to know come whenc come 
and crave 

lord 
i go lord 

 _exit _ 

cleon 
welcom peac peac consist 
if war unabl resist 

 enter pericl attend 

pericl 
lord governor hear 
let ship number men
b like beacon fire amaz eye 
we heard miseri far tyre 
and seen desol street 
nor come add sorrow tear 
but reliev heavi load 
and ship happili may think
ar like trojan hors stuff within
with bloodi vein expect overthrow 
are store corn make needi bread 
and give life hunger starv half dead 

all 
the god greec protect 
and pray 

pericl 
aris i pray rise 
we look rever love 
and harbourag ourself ship men 

cleon 
the shall gratifi 
or pay unthank thought 
be wive children 
the curs heaven men succeed evil 
till i hope shall ne er seen 
your grace welcom town us 

pericl 
which welcom accept feast awhil 
until star frown lend us smile 

 _exeunt _ 



act ii

 enter gower 

gower 
here seen mighti king
hi child iwi incest bring 
a better princ benign lord 
that prove aw deed word 
be quiet men 
till hath pass necess 
i show troubl reign 
lose mite mountain gain 
the good convers 
to i give benison 
i still tarsu man
think writ speken 
and rememb 
build statu make gloriou 
but tide contrary
ar brought eye need speak i 

 dumb show enter one door pericl talk cleon the
 train enter anoth door gentleman letter to
 pericl pericl show letter cleon give messeng a
 reward knight exit pericl one door cleon at
 anoth 

good helican stay home 
not eat honey like drone
from other labour though strive
to killen bad keep good aliv 
and fulfil princ desir 
send word hap tyre 
how thaliard came full bent sin
and intent murder 
and tarsu best
long make rest 
he put forth sea 
where men seldom eas 
for wind begin blow 
thunder deep below
mak unquiet ship
should hous safe wreck split 
and good princ lost 
bi wave coast coast tost 
all perishen man pelf 
ne aught escapen 
till fortun tire bad 
threw ashor give glad 
and come what shall next 
pardon old gower long text 

 _exit _ 



scene i pentapoli an open place seasid 

 enter pericl wet 

pericl 
yet ceas ire angri star heaven 
wind rain thunder rememb earthli man
i substanc must yield 
and i fit natur obey 
ala sea hath cast rock 
wash shore shore left breath
noth think ensu death 
let suffic great powers
to bereft princ fortun 
and thrown wateri grave 
here death peac crave 

 enter three fishermen 

first fisherman 
what ho pilch 

second fisherman 
ha come bring away net 

first fisherman 
what patch breech i say 

third fisherman 
what say master 

first fisherman 
look thou stirrest come away i fetch thee a
wanion 

third fisherman 
faith master i think poor men cast away before
u even 

first fisherman 
ala poor soul griev heart hear piti cri they
mad us help well day could scarc help
ourselv 

third fisherman 
nay master said i much i saw porpu bounced
and tumbl they say half fish half flesh plagu 
they ne er come i look wash master i marvel the
fish live sea 

first fisherman 
whi men land great one eat littl one i can
compar rich miser noth fitli whale play and
tumbl drive poor fri last devour all
at mouth such whale i heard land never leave
gap till swallow whole parish church steepl bell and
al 

pericl 
 _asid _ a pretti moral 

third fisherman

th belfri 

second fisherman 
whi man 

third fisherman 
becaus swallow i his
belli i would kept jangl bell should
nev left till cast bell steepl church parish up
again but good king simonid mind 

pericl 
 _asid _ simonid 

third fisherman 
we would purg land drone rob bee honey 

pericl 
 _asid _ how finni subject sea
thes fisher tell infirm men 
and wateri empir recollect
al may men approv men detect 
peac labour honest fishermen 

second fisherman 
honest good fellow if day fit search out
of calendar nobodi look 

pericl 
may see sea hath cast upon coast 

second fisherman 
what drunken knave sea cast thee way 

pericl 
a man water wind 
in vast tenni court made ball
for play upon entreat piti 
he ask never use beg 

first fisherman 
no friend can not beg here countri greec gets
mor beg work 

second fisherman 
canst thou catch fish 

pericl 
i never practis 

second fisherman 
nay thou wilt starv sure noth got
now day unless thou canst fish 

pericl 
what i i forgot know 
but i want teach think 
a man throng cold vein chill 
and life may suffice
to give tongu heat ask help 
which shall refus i dead 
for i man pray see buri 

first fisherman 
die quoth now god forbid i gown come put it
on keep thee warm now afor handsom fellow come thou shalt
go home flesh holiday fish fast day and
moreo er pud flap jack thou shalt welcom 

pericl 
i thank sir 

second fisherman 
hark friend said could beg 

pericl 
i crave 

second fisherman

whi beggar whip 

second fisherman

would wish better offic beadl but master i go
draw net 

 _exit third fisherman _ 

pericl 
 _asid _ how well honest mirth becom labour 

first fisherman 
hark sir know ye 

pericl 
not well 

first fisherman 
whi i tell call pentapoli king good
simonid 

pericl 
the good simonid call 

first fisherman

good govern

govern how far court distant shore

daught tomorrow birth day princ and
knight come part world joust tourney her
lov 

pericl 
were fortun equal desir i could wish make one 

first fisherman

law deal wife soul 

 re enter second third fishermen draw net 

second fisherman 
help master help fish hang net like poor man s
right law twill hardli come ha bot ti come at
last ti turn rusti armour 

pericl 
an armour friend i pray let see 
thank fortun yet cross 
thou givest somewhat repair 
and though mine part heritag 
which dead father bequeath 
with strict charg even left life 
 keep pericl hath shield
 twixt death point brace 
 for save keep like necess 
the god protect thee may defend thee 
it kept i kept i dearli love 
till rough sea spare man 
took rage though calm given 
i thank thee shipwreck ill 
sinc i father gave 

first fisherman 
what mean sir 

pericl 
to beg kind friend coat worth 
for sometim target king 
i know mark he love dearli 
and sake i wish 
and guid sovereign court 
where i may appear gentleman 
and ever low fortun better 
i pay bounti till rest debtor 

first fisherman 
whi wilt thou tourney ladi 

pericl 
i show virtu i born arm 

first fisherman 
whi ye take god give thee good 

second fisherman 
ay hark friend twa made garment through
th rough seam water certain condol certain
vail i hope sir thrive rememb whenc had
them 

pericl 
believ i 
bi further i cloth steel 
and spite raptur sea 
thi jewel hold build arm 
unto thi valu i mount myself
upon courser whose delight steps
shal make gazer joy see tread 
onli friend i yet unprovided
of pair base 

second fisherman 
we sure provid thou shalt best gown make thee pair 
and i bring thee court 

pericl 
then honour goal 
thi day i rise els add ill ill

mi commend great whose merit less

which tell glori

and sun rever

 _the knight danc _

scene iv tyre a room governor hous 

 enter helicanu escan 

helicanu 
no escan know 
antiochu incest live free 
for high god mind longer
to withhold vengeanc store
du heinou capit offenc 
even height pride glori 
when seat chariot
of inestim valu daughter 
a fire heaven came shrivel up
their bodi even loath stunk 
that eye ador ere fall
scorn hand give burial 

escan 
 twa strange

helicanu 
and yet justic though king great 
hi great guard bar heaven shaft 
but sin reward 

escan 
 ti true 

 enter two three lord 

first lord 
see man privat conference
or council respect 

second lord 
it shall longer griev without reproof 

third lord 
and curs second 

first lord 
follow lord helican word 

helicanu 
with welcom happi day lord 

first lord 
know grief risen top 
and length overflow bank 

helicanu 
your grief wrong princ love 

first lord 
wrong nobl helican 
but princ live let us salut 
or know ground made happi breath 
if world live seek 
if grave rest find 
we resolv live govern us 
or dead give caus mourn funer 
and leav us free elect 

second lord 
whose death inde strongest censur 
and know kingdom without head 
like goodli build left without roof
soon fall ruin nobl self 
that best know rule reign 
we thu submit unto sovereign 

all 
live nobl helican 

helicanu 
for honour caus forbear suffrag 
if love princ pericl forbear 
take i wish i leap sea 
where hourli troubl minut eas 
a twelvemonth longer let entreat you
to forbear absenc king 
if time expir return 
i shall age patienc bear yoke 
but i can not win love 
go search like nobl like nobl subject 
and search spend adventur worth 
whom find win unto return 
you shall like diamond sit crown 

first lord 
to wisdom fool yield 
and sinc lord helican enjoineth us 
we travel endeavour us 

helicanu 
then love us clasp hand 
when peer thu knit kingdom ever stand 

 _exeunt _ 



scene v pentapoli a room palac 

 enter simonid read letter one door knight meet 

first knight 
good morrow good simonid 

simonid 
knight daughter i let know 
that twelvemonth undertake
a marri life 
her reason known 
which yet mean i get 

second knight 
may get access lord 

simonid 
faith mean hath strictli tied
her chamber ti imposs 
one twelv moon wear diana liveri 
thi eye cynthia hath vow 
and virgin honour break

 _exeunt knight _ 

simonid 
so well dispatch daughter letter 
she tell wed stranger knight 
or never view day light 
 ti well mistress choic agre mine 
i like well nay absolut 
not mind whether i dislik 
well i commend choic 
and longer delay 
soft come i must dissembl 

 enter pericl 

pericl 
all fortun good simonid 

simonid 
to much sir i behold you
for sweet music last night i do
protest ear never better fed
with delight pleas harmoni

not desert

 ti king subtleti life

that never aim high love daughter 
but bent offic honour

never thought mine levi offenc

a deed might gain love displeasur

traitor

mi action nobl thought 
that never relish base descent 
i came unto court honour caus 
and rebel state 
and otherwis account 
thi sword shall prove honour enemi 

simonid 
no 
here come daughter wit 

 enter thaisa 

pericl

resolv angri father tongue
did e er solicit hand subscribe
to syllabl made love

who take offenc would make glad 

simonid 
yea mistress peremptori

i tame i bring subject 
will consent

upon stranger _asid _ who aught i know
may i think contrari

your mine sir hear 
either rule i make

god give joy what pleas
