act iii

 enter gower 

gower 
now sleep yslake hath rous 
no din snore hous 
made louder erf breast
of pompou marriag feast 
the cat eyn burn coal 
now couch fore mous hole 
and cricket sing oven mouth 
are blither drouth 
hymen hath brought bride bed 
where loss maidenhead 
a babe mould be attent 
and time briefli spent
with fine fanci quaintli ech 
what dumb show i plain speech 

 dumb show enter pericl simonid one door attend 
 messeng meet kneel give pericl letter pericles
 show simonid lord kneel then enter thaisa with
 child lychorida nurs the king show letter she
 rejoic pericl take leav father depart with
 lychorida attend then exeunt simonid rest 

bi mani dern pain perch
of pericl care search 
bi four oppos coigns
which world togeth join 
i made due diligence
that hors sail high expense
can stead quest at last tyre 
fame answer strang enquir 
to th court king simonides
ar letter brought tenour 
antiochu daughter dead 
the men tyru head
of helicanu would set on
th crown tyre none 
the mutini hast oppress 
say em king pericles
com home twice six moon 
he obedi doom 
will take crown the sum 
brought hither pentapolis
i ravish region round 
and everyon clap sound 
 our heir appar king 
who dreamt thought thing 
brief must henc depart tyre 
hi queen child make desir 
which shall cross along go 
omit dole woe 
lychorida nurs take 
and sea their vessel shakes
on neptun billow half flood
hath keel cut fortun mood
vari grisl north
disgorg tempest forth 
that duck life dive 
so poor ship drive 
the ladi shriek well near
do fall travail fear 
and ensu fell storm
shal perform 
i nill relat action may
conveni rest convey 
which might told 
in imagin hold
thi stage ship upon whose deck
th sea tost pericl appear speak 

 _exit _ 



scene i 

 enter pericl shipboard 

pericl 
thou god great vast rebuk surg 
which wash heaven hell thou hast
upon wind command bind brass 
have call deep o still
thi deafen dread thunder gentli quench
thi nimbl sulphur flash o lychorida 
how queen thou stormest venom 
wilt thou spit thyself the seaman whistle
i whisper ear death 
unheard lychorida lucina o 
divinest patro midwif gentle
to cri night convey thi deity
aboard danc boat make swift pangs
of queen travail now lychorida 

 enter lychorida infant 

lychorida 
here thing young place 
who conceit would die i
am like take arm piece
of dead queen 

pericl 
how lychorida 

lychorida 
patienc good sir assist storm 
here left live queen 
a littl daughter sake 
be manli take comfort 

pericl 
o god 
whi make us love goodli gift 
and snatch straight away we below
recal give therein may
vi honour 

lychorida 
patienc good sir 
even charg 

pericl 
now mild may thi life 
for blustrou birth never babe 
quiet gentl thi condit for
thou art rudeliest welcom world
that ever princ child happi follow 
thou hast chide nativity
a fire air water earth heaven make 
to herald thee womb 
even first thi loss can
thi portag quit thou canst find 
now good god throw best eye upon 

 enter two sailors

first sailor 
what courag sir god save 

pericl 
courag enough i fear flaw 
it hath done worst yet love
of poor infant fresh new sea farer 
i would would quiet 

first sailor 
slack bolin thou wilt wilt thou blow split
thyself 

second sailor 
but sea room brine cloudi billow kiss moon i care
not 

first sailor 
sir queen must overboard sea work high wind loud
and lie till ship clear dead 

pericl 
that superstit 

first sailor 
pardon us sir us sea still observ are
strong custom therefor briefli yield must overboard
straight 

pericl 
a think meet most wretch queen 

lychorida 
here lie sir 

pericl 
a terribl childb hast thou dear 
no light fire th unfriendli elements
forgot thee utterli i time
to give thee hallow thi grave straight
must cast thee scarc coffin ooz 
where monument upon thi bone 
and e er remain lamp belch whale
and hum water must erwhelm thi corps 
li simpl shell o lychorida 
bid nestor bring spice ink paper 
mi casket jewel bid nicander
br satin coffer lay babe
upon pillow hie thee while i say
a priestli farewel suddenli woman 

 _exit lychorida _ 

second sailor 
sir chest beneath hatch caulk bitum readi 

pericl 
i thank thee marin say coast 

second sailor 
we near tarsu 

pericl 
thither gentl marin 
alter thi cours tyre when canst thou reach 

second sailor 
bi break day wind ceas 

pericl 
o make tarsu 
there i visit cleon babe
cannot hold tyru there i leav it
at care nurs go thi way good marin 
i bring bodi present 

 _exeunt _ 



scene ii ephesu a room cerimon hous 

 enter cerimon servant person been
 shipwreck 

cerimon 
philemon ho 

 enter philemon 

philemon 
doth lord call 

cerimon 
get fire meat poor men 
 t turbul stormi night 

servant 
i mani night 
till i ne er endur 

cerimon 
your master dead ere return 
there noth minist nature
that recov _to philemon _ give pothecari 
and tell work 

 _exeunt cerimon _ 

 enter two gentlemen 

first gentleman 
good morrow 

second gentleman 
good morrow lordship 

cerimon 
gentlemen stir earli 

first gentleman 
sir lodg stand bleak upon sea 
shook earth quak 
the princip seem rend 
and toppl pure surpris fear
mad quit hous 

second gentleman 
that caus troubl earli 
 ti husbandri 

cerimon 
o say well 

first gentleman 
but i much marvel lordship having
rich tire earli hours
shak golden slumber repos 
 ti strang 
natur convers pain 
be thereto compel 

cerimon 
i hold ever 
virtu cun endow greater
than nobl rich careless heirs
may two latter darken expend 
but immort attend former 
make man god ti known i ever
hav studi physic secret art 
bi turn er author i 
togeth practic made familiar
to aid blest infusions
that dwell veget metal stone 
and i speak disturbances
that natur work cure doth give me
a content cours true delight
than thirsti totter honour 
or tie pleasur silken bag 
to pleas fool death 

second gentleman 
your honour ephesu pour forth
your chariti hundr call themselves
your creatur restor 
and knowledg person pain even
your purs still open hath built lord cerimon
such strong renown time shall never 

 enter two three servant chest 

first servant 
so lift 

cerimon 
what 

first servant 
sir even now
did sea toss upon shore chest 
 ti wreck 

cerimon 
set let look upon 

second gentleman 
 ti like coffin sir 

cerimon 
whate er 
 ti wondrou heavi wrench open straight 
if sea stomach ercharg gold 
 ti good constraint fortun belch upon us 

second gentleman 
 ti lord 

cerimon 
how close ti caulk bitum 
did sea cast 

first servant 
i never saw huge billow sir 
a toss upon shore 

cerimon 
wrench open 
soft smell sweetli sens 

second gentleman 
a delic odour 

cerimon 
a ever hit nostril so 
o potent god corps 

first gentleman 
most strang 

cerimon 
shroud cloth state balm entreasured
with full bag spice a passport 
apollo perfect charact 

 _read scroll _ 

 _here i give understand 
 if e er coffin drive land 
 i king pericl lost
 thi queen worth mundan cost 
 who find give buri 
 she daughter king 
 besid treasur fee 
 the god requit chariti _
if thou livest pericl thou hast heart
that even crack woe thi chanc tonight 

second gentleman 
most like sir 

cerimon 
nay certainli tonight 
for look fresh look they rough
that threw sea make fire within
fetch hither box closet 

 _exit servant _ 

death may usurp natur mani hour 
and yet fire life kindl again
th erpress spirit i heard egyptian
that nine hour lain dead 
who good applianc recov 

 re enter servant napkin fire 

well said well said fire cloth 
the rough woeful music 
caus sound beseech you
th viol thou stirr st thou block 
the music i pray give air 
gentlemen queen live 
natur awak warmth breath 
she hath entranc five hour 
see gin blow life flower 

first gentleman 
the heaven increas wonder
and set fame ever 

cerimon 
she aliv behold eyelid 
case heavenli jewel pericl hath lost 
begin part fring bright gold 
the diamond prais water doth appear 
to make world twice rich live make us weep
to hear fate fair creatur rare seem 

 _she move _ 

thaisa 
o dear diana 
where i where lord what world 

second gentleman 
i strang 

first gentleman 
most rare

for relaps mortal come come 
and aesculapiu guid us 

 _exeunt carri away _ 



scene iii tarsu a room cleon hous 

 enter pericl cleon dionyza lychorida marina arm 

pericl 
most honour cleon i must need gone 
mi twelv month expir tyru stands
in litigi peac you ladi 
take heart thank the gods
mak rest upon 

cleon 
your shaft fortun though hurt mortal 
yet glanc full wanderingli us 

dionyza 
o sweet queen 
that strict fate pleas brought hither 
to bless mine eye 

pericl 
we can not obey
th power us could i rage roar
a doth sea lie yet end
must ti my gentl babe marina 
whom born sea i name 
here i charg chariti withal 
leav infant care 
beseech give princ train 
that may manner born 

cleon 
fear lord think
your grace fed countri corn 
for peopl prayer still fall upon 
must child thought if neglection
should therein make vile common bodi 
bi reliev would forc duti 
but natur need spur 
the god reveng upon mine 
to end gener 

pericl 
i believ 
your honour good teach 
without vow till marri madam 
bi bright diana honour all
unscissor shall hair mine remain 
though i show ill so i take leav 
good madam make bless care
in bring child 

dionyza 
i one 
who shall dear respect
than lord 

pericl 
madam thank prayer 

cleon 
we bring grace e en edg shore 
then give mask neptun and
th gentlest wind heaven 

pericl 
i embrac offer come dearest madam 
o tear lychorida tear 
look littl mistress whose grace
y may depend hereaft come lord 

 _exeunt _ 



scene iv ephesu a room cerimon hous 

 enter cerimon thaisa 

cerimon 
madam letter certain jewel 
lay coffer are
at command know charact 

thaisa 
it lord 
that i shipp sea i well rememb 
even groan time whether there
deliv holi god 
i can not rightli say but sinc king pericl 
mi wed lord i ne er shall see 
a vestal liveri i take 
and never joy 

cerimon 
madam purpos ye speak 
diana templ distant far 
where may abid till date expir 
moreov pleas niec mine
shal attend 

thaisa 
mi recompens thank 
yet good great though gift small 

 _exeunt _ 



act iv

 enter gower 

gower 
imagin pericl arriv tyre 
welcom settl desir 
hi woeful queen leav ephesu 
unto diana votaress 
now marina bend mind 
whom fast grow scene must find
at tarsu cleon train d
in music letter hath gain d
of educ grace 
which make heart place
of gener wonder but alack 
that monster envi oft wrack
of earn prais marina life
seek take treason knife 
and kind cleon hath
on daughter full grown wench
even ripe marriag rite maid
hight philoten said
for certain stori she
would ever marina 
be weav sleid silk
with finger long small white milk 
or would sharp needl wound 
the cambric made sound
bi hurt th lute
sh sung made night bird mute
that still record moan when
sh would rich constant pen
vail mistress dian still
thi philoten contend skill
with absolut marina so
th dove papho might crow
vi feather white marina gets
al prais paid debt 
and given thi darks
in philoten grace mark 
that cleon wife envi rare 
a present murder prepare
for good marina daughter
might stand peerless slaughter 
the sooner vile thought stead 
lychorida nurs dead 
and curs dionyza hath
th pregnant instrument wrath
prest blow the unborn event
i commend content 
onli i carri wing time
post lame feet rhyme 
which never could i convey 
unless thought went way 
dionyza appear 
with leonin murder 

 _exit _ 



scene i tarsu an open place near seashor 

 enter dionyza leonin 

dionyza 
thi oath rememb thou hast sworn 
 ti blow never shall known 
thou canst thing world soon 
to yield thee much profit let conscienc 
which cold inflam love thi bosom 
inflam nice let piti which
even women cast melt thee be
a soldier thi purpos 

leonin 
i yet goodli creatur 

dionyza 
the fitter god here come weep for
her mistress death thou art resolv 

leonin 
i resolv 

 enter marina basket flower 

marina 
no i rob tellu weed
to strew thi green flower yellow blue 
the purpl violet marigold 
shall carpet hang upon thi grave 
while summer day last ay poor maid 
born tempest mother die 
thi world like last storm 
whir friend 

dionyza 
how marina keep alon 
how chanc daughter 
do consum blood sorrow 
have nurs lord favour s
chang unprofit woe 
come give flower ere sea mar 
walk leonin air quick 
and pierc sharpen stomach 
come leonin take arm walk 

marina 
no i pray 
i bereav servant 

dionyza 
come come 
i love king father 
with foreign heart we everi day
expect shall come find
our paragon report thu blast 
he repent breadth great voyag 
blame lord taken
no care best cours go i pray 
walk cheer reserve
that excel complexion steal
th eye young old care 
i go home alon 

marina 
well i go 
but yet i desir 

dionyza 
come come i know ti good 
walk half hour leonin least 
rememb i said 

leonin 
i warrant madam 

dionyza 
i leav sweet ladi 
pray walk softli heat blood 
what i must care 

marina 
mi thank sweet madam 

 _exit dionyza _ 

i wind westerli blow 

leonin 
south west 

marina 
when i born wind north 

leonin 
wa 

marina 
mi father nurs said never fear 
but cri good seamen sailor 
gall kingli hand hale rope 
and clasp mast endur sea
that almost burst deck 

leonin 
when 

marina 
when i born 
never wave wind violent 
and ladder tackl wash off
a canva climber ha say one wolt 
and drop industri skip
from stem stern boatswain whistl and
th master call trebl confus 

leonin 
come say prayer 

marina 
what mean 

leonin 
if requir littl space prayer 
i grant pray tediou 
for god quick ear i sworn
to work hast 

marina 
whi kill 

leonin 
to satisfi ladi 

marina 
whi would kill 
a i rememb troth 
i never hurt life 
i never spake bad word ill turn
to live creatur believ la 
i never kill mous hurt fli 
i trod upon worm 
but i wept how i offend 
wherein death might yield profit 
or life impli danger 

leonin 
mi commission
i reason deed 

marina 
you world i hope 
you well favour look foreshow
y gentl heart i saw late 
when caught hurt part two fought 
good sooth show well 
your ladi seek life come 
and save poor weaker 

leonin 
i sworn 
and dispatch 

 _he seiz _ 

 enter pirat 

first pirat 
hold villain 

 _leonin run away _ 

second pirat 
a prize prize 

third pirat 
half part mate half part 
come let aboard suddenli 

 _exeunt pirat marina _ 

 re enter leonin 

leonin 
these rogu thiev serv great pirat vald 
and seiz marina let go 
there hope return i swear dead
and thrown sea but i see 
perhap pleas upon 
not carri aboard if remain 
whom ravish must slain 

 _exit _ 



scene ii mytilen a room brothel 

 enter pandar bawd boult

they continu action
ar even good rotten

scene iii tarsu a room cleon hous 

 enter cleon dionyza 

dionyza 
whi foolish can undon 

cleon 
o dionyza piec slaughter
th sun moon ne er look upon 

dionyza 
i think turn child 

cleon 
were i chief lord spaciou world 
i give undo deed a ladi 
much less blood virtu yet princess
to equal singl crown earth
i justic compar o villain leonin 
whom thou hast poison 
if thou hadst drunk kindness
becom well thi face what canst thou say
when nobl pericl shall demand child 

dionyza 
that dead nurs fate 
to foster ever preserv 
she die night i say who cross 
unless play piou innoc 
and honest attribut cri out
 she die foul play 

cleon 
o go well well 
of fault beneath heaven gods
do like worst 

dionyza 
be one thinks
th petti wren tarsu fli henc 
and open pericl i shame
to think nobl strain 
and coward spirit 

cleon 
to proceeding
whoev approb ad 
though prime consent flow
from honour sourc 

dionyza 
be 
yet none know came dead 
nor none know leonin gone 
she distain child stood between
h fortun none would look 
but cast gaze marina face 
whilst blurt held malkin
not worth time day it pierc 
and though call cours unnatur 
you child well love yet i find
it greet enterpris kindness
perform sole daughter 

cleon 
heaven forgiv 

dionyza 
and pericl say 
we wept hears yet mourn 
her monument almost finish epitaphs
in glitter golden charact express
a gener prais care us
at whose expens ti done 

cleon 
thou art like harpi 
which betray dost thine angel face 
seiz thine eagl talon 

dionyza 
you like one superstitiously
doth swear god winter kill fli 
but yet i know i advis 

 _exeunt _ 



scene iv 

 enter gower monument marina tarsu 

gower 
thu time wast long leagu make short 
sail sea cockl wish 
make take imagin 
from bourn bourn region region 
bi pardon commit crime
to use one languag sever clime
wher scene seem live i beseech you
to learn stand gap teach 
the stage stori pericles
i thwart wayward seas
attend mani lord knight 
to see daughter life delight 
old helicanu goe along behind
i left govern bear mind 
old escan helicanu late
advanc time great high estat 
well sail ship bounteou wind brought
thi king tarsu think pilot thought 
so steerag shall thought go 
to fetch daughter home first gone 
like mote shadow see move awhil 
your ear unto eye i reconcil 

 dumb show enter pericl one door train cleon and
 dionyza cleon show pericl tomb whereat pericles
 make lament put sackcloth mighti passion depart 
 then exeunt cleon dionyza 

see belief may suffer foul show 
thi borrow passion stand true old woe 
and pericl sorrow devour 
with sigh shot biggest tear ershow 
leav tarsu embark he swears
nev wash face cut hair 
he put sackcloth sea bears
a tempest mortal vessel tear 
and yet ride now pleas wit
th epitaph marina writ
bi wick dionyza 

 _read inscript marina monument _ 

 _the fairest sweet st best lie 
 who wither spring year 
 she tyru king daughter 
 on foul death hath made slaughter 
 marina call birth 
 theti proud swallow part earth 
 therefor earth fear erflow 
 hath theti birth child heaven bestow 
 wherefor swear never stint 
 make rage batteri upon shore flint _

no visor becom black villany
so well soft tender flatteri 
let pericl believ daughter dead 
and bear cours ordered
bi ladi fortun scene must play
hi daughter woe heavi well day
in unholi servic patienc 
and think mytilen 

 _exit _

bring privat place come come

that thought worthi

how some sage 

marina 
for

hav place sti sinc i came 
diseas sold dearer physic 
o gods
would set free unhallow place 
though chang meanest bird
that fli purer air

i think

had i brought hither corrupt mind 
thi speech alter hold gold thee 
persev clear way thou goest 
and god strengthen thee

for thoughten
that i came ill intent me
th door window savour vile

i doubt thi train hath nobl 
hold gold thee 
a curs upon die like thief 
that rob thee thi good if thou dost
hear shall thi good 

 re enter boult

boult

boult 
whi i could wish master rather mistress 

marina

sinc better thee command 
thou hold st place pain st fiend
of hell would reput chang 
thou art damn doorkeep every
coistrel come inquir tib 
to choler fist everi rogue
thi ear liabl thi food such
a hath belch infect lung

serv seven year loss leg money enough in
th end buy wooden one

old receptacl common shore filth 
serv indentur common hangman 
ani way yet better 
for thou professest baboon could speak 
would name dear o gods
would safe deliv place 
here gold thee 
if thi master would gain 
proclaim i sing weav sew danc 
with virtu i keep boast 
and i undertak teach 
i doubt popul citi will
yield mani scholar 

boult 
but teach speak 

marina 
prove i can not take home 
and prostitut basest groom
that doth frequent hous 

boult 
well i see i thee i place thee i 

marina 
but amongst honest women 

boult 
faith acquaint lie littl amongst but sinc master
and mistress bought go consent 
therefor i make acquaint purpos i doubt
not i shall find tractabl enough come i thee what
i come way 

 _exeunt _ 



act v

 enter gower 

gower 
marina thu brothel scape chances
into honest hous stori say 
she sing like one immort dances
a goddess like admir lay 
deep clerk dumb nee le composes
natur shape bud bird branch berri 
that even art sister natur rose 
her inkl silk twin rubi cherri 
that pupil lack none nobl race 
who pour bounti gain
sh give curs bawd here place 
and father turn thought 
where left sea we lost 
whenc driven wind arrived
her daughter dwell coast
suppos anchor the citi strived
god neptun annual feast keep whence
lysimachu tyrian ship espi 
hi banner sabl trimm rich expens 
and barg fervour hie 
in suppos put sight
of heavi pericl think bark 
where done action might 
shall discov pleas sit hark 

 _exit _

 _pericl discov _

and chosen attract would allur

and fellow maid upon
th leafi shelter abut against
th island side 

 _whisper lord goe barg lysimachu _ 

helicanu

that bear recoveri name but sinc kindness
w stretch thu far let us beseech you
that gold may provis 
wherein destitut want 
but weari stale

o sir courtesy
which deni gods
for everi graff would send caterpillar 
and inflict provinc yet more
let entreat know larg cause
of king sorrow

but see i prevent 

 re enter barg lord marina young ladi 

lysimachu

i goodli presenc 

helicanu

lysimachu 
she one i well assured
cam gentl kind nobl stock 
i wish better choic think rare wed 
fair one good consist bounty
expect even kingli patient 
if thi prosper artifici feat
can draw answer thee aught 
thi sacr physic shall receiv pay
a thi desir wish 

marina 
sir i use
mi utmost skill recoveri provided
that none i companion maid
b suffer come near 

lysimachu

and god make prosper 

 _marina sing _ 

lysimachu 
mark music 

marina 
no look us 

lysimachu 
see speak 

marina 
hail sir my lord lend ear 

pericl 
hum ha 

marina 
i maid 
mi lord ne er invit eye 
but gaze like comet speak 
mi lord may hath endur grief
might equal justli weigh 
though wayward fortun malign state 
mi deriv ancestors
who stood equival mighti king 
but time hath root parentag 
and world awkward casualties
bound servitud 
 _asid _ i desist 
but someth glow upon cheek 
and whisper mine ear go till speak 

pericl 
mi fortun parentag good parentag 
to equal mine thu say 

marina 
i said lord know parentag 
you would violenc 

pericl 
i think pray turn eye upon 
you like someth countri woman 
here shore 

marina 
no shore 
yet i mortal brought forth am
no i appear 

pericl 
i great woe shall deliv weep 
mi dearest wife like maid one
mi daughter might queen squar brow 
her statur inch wand like straight 
a silver voic eye jewel like
and case richli pace anoth juno 
who starv ear feed make hungri 
the give speech where live 

marina 
where i stranger deck
you may discern place 

pericl 
where bred 
and achiev endow which
you make rich owe 

marina 
if i tell histori would seem
lik lie disdain report 

pericl 
prithe speak 
fals can not come thee thou look st
modest justic thou seem st palace
for crown truth dwell i believ thee 
and make sens credit thi relation
to point seem imposs thou look st
like one i love inde what thi friend 
didst thou say i push thee back 
which i perceiv thee thou cam st
from good descend 

marina 
so inde i 

pericl 
report thi parentag i think thou said st
thou hadst toss wrong injuri 
and thou thought st thi grief might equal mine 
if open

some thing 
i said said thoughts
did warrant like

of endur thou art man i
hav suffer like girl yet thou dost look
lik patienc gaze king grave smiling

how lost thou thi name kind virgin 
recount i beseech thee come sit

to make world laugh

mi father king

dul sleep

her parentag demand

o erbear shore mortal 
and drown sweet 
 _to marina_ o come hither

for truth never confirm enough 
though doubt ever sleep

sh thi princess who

o er point point yet seem doubt

it good cross give way

 _music _

hang upon mine eye let rest

 diana appear pericl vision

and give repetit life

 re enter helicanu lysimachu marina

turn blown sail eftsoon i tell thee 
 _to lysimachu _ shall refresh us sir upon shore

a intent need

scene ii 

 enter gower templ diana ephesu 

gower 
now sand almost run 
more littl dumb 
thi last boon give 
for kind must reliev 
that aptli suppose
what pageantri feat show 
what minstrelsi pretti din 
the regent made mytilene
to greet king so thrive 
that promis wived
to fair marina wise
til done sacrific 
a dian bade whereto bound 
the interim pray confound 
in feather brief sail fill 
and wish fall 
at ephesu templ see 
our king compani 
that hither come soon 
i fanci thank doom

oth inhabit ephesu attend

 ladi

i confess king tyre 
who fright countri wed
at pentapoli fair thaisa 
at sea childb die brought forth
a maid child call marina o goddess 
wear yet thi silver liveri she tarsus
wa nurs cleon fourteen years
h sought murder better stars
brought mytilen gainst whose shore
rid fortun brought maid aboard us 
where clear remembr she
mad known daughter

voic favour 
you o royal pericl 

 _faint _

what mean nun she die help gentlemen 

cerimon 
nobl sir 
if told diana altar true 
thi wife

reverend appear 
i threw overboard arm

upon coast i warrant 

pericl 
 ti certain

look ladi o er joy 
earli bluster morn ladi was
thrown upon shore i ope coffin 
found rich jewel recov place her
her diana templ 

pericl 
may see 

cerimon 
great sir shall brought hous 
whither i invit look thaisa is
recov 

thaisa 
o let look 
if none mine sanctity
wil sens bend licenti ear 
but curb spite see o lord 
are pericl like spake 
like name tempest 
a birth death 

pericl 
the voic dead thaisa 

thaisa 
that thaisa i suppos dead
and drown

thaisa

when tear part pentapoli 
the king father gave ring 

 _show ring _ 

pericl 
thi god present kindness
mak past miseri sport shall well 
that touch lip i may
melt seen o come buried
a second time within arm 

marina 
mi heart
leap gone mother bosom 

 _kneel thaisa _ 

pericl 
look kneel flesh thi flesh thaisa 
thi burden sea call marina
for yield 

thaisa 
blest mine 

helicanu 
hail madam queen 

thaisa 
i know 

pericl

i left behind ancient substitut 
can rememb i call man
i name oft 

thaisa 
 twa helicanu 

pericl 
still confirm 
embrac dear thaisa 
now i long hear found 
how possibl preserv thank 
besid god great miracl 

thaisa 
lord cerimon lord man 
through god shown power can
from first last resolv 

pericl 
reverend sir 
the god mortal officer
mor like god will deliver
how dead queen reliv 

cerimon 
i lord 
beseech first go hous 
where shall shown found 
how came place templ 
no need thing omit 

pericl 
pure dian bless thee thi vision i
wil offer night oblat thee thaisa 
thi princ fair betroth daughter 
shall marri pentapoli 
and ornament
mak look dismal i clip form 
and fourteen year razor touch d
to grace thi marriag day i beautifi 

thaisa 
lord cerimon hath letter good credit sir 
mi father dead 

pericl 
heaven make star yet queen 
we celebr nuptial ourselves
wil kingdom spend follow day 
our son daughter shall tyru reign 
lord cerimon long stay
to hear rest untold sir lead way 

 _exeunt _ 

 enter gower 

gower 
in antiochu daughter heard
of monstrou lust due reward 
in pericl queen daughter seen 
although assail fortun fierc keen 
virtu preserv fell destruct blast 
led heaven crown joy last 
in helicanu may well descry
a figur truth faith loyalti 
in reverend cerimon well appears
th worth learn chariti aye wear 
for wick cleon wife fame
had spread curs deed honour name
of pericl rage citi turn 
that palac burn 
the god murder seem content
to punish although done meant 
so patienc evermor attend 
new joy wait here play end 

 _exit _ 




the life and death of king richard the second

dramati person

afterward king henri iv
duk of aumerl son duke york

green servant king richard
earl of northumberland
