scen dispersedli england wale 




act i


scen i london a room palac 

 enter king richard john gaunt nobl attend 

king richard 
old john gaunt time honour lancast 
hast thou accord thi oath band 
brought hither henri hereford thi bold son 
here make good boist rou late appeal 
which leisur would let us hear 
against duke norfolk thoma mowbray 

gaunt 
i lieg 

king richard 
tell moreov hast thou sound him
if appeal duke ancient malic 
or worthili good subject 
on known ground treacheri 

gaunt 
a near i could sift argument 
on appar danger seen him
aim high inveter malic 

king richard 
then call presenc face face
and frown brow brow hear
th accus accus freeli speak 
high stomach full ire 
in rage deaf sea hasti fire 

enter bolingbrok mowbray 

bolingbrok 
mani year happi day befall
mi graciou sovereign love lieg 

mowbray 
each day still better happiness
until heaven envi earth good hap 
add immort titl crown 

king richard 
we thank yet one flatter us 
a well appeareth caus come 
name appeal high treason 
cousin hereford dost thou object
against duke norfolk thoma mowbray 

bolingbrok 
first heaven record speech 
in devot subject love 
tend ring preciou safeti princ 
and free misbegotten hate 
come i appel princ presenc 
now thoma mowbray i turn thee 
and mark greet well i speak
mi bodi shall make good upon earth 
or divin soul answer heaven 
thou art traitor miscreant 
too good bad live 
sinc fair crystal sky 
the uglier seem cloud fli 
onc aggrav note 
with foul traitor name stuff i thi throat 
and wish pleas sovereign ere i move 
what tongu speak right drawn sword may prove 

mowbray 
let cold word accus zeal 
 ti trial woman war 
the bitter clamour two eager tongu 
can arbitr caus betwixt us twain 
the blood hot must cool 
yet i tame patienc boast
a hush naught say 
first fair rever high curb me
from give rein spur free speech 
which els would post returned
thes term treason doubl throat 
set asid high blood royalti 
and let kinsman lieg 
i defi i spit 
call slander coward villain 
which maintain i would allow odds
and meet i tie run afoot
even frozen ridg alp 
or ground inhabitable
wherev englishman durst set foot 
meantim let defend loyalti 
bi hope fals doth lie 

bolingbrok 
pale trembl coward i throw gage 
disclaim kindr king 
and lay asid high blood royalti 
which fear rever make thee except 
if guilti dread left thee much strength
a take mine honour pawn stoop 
bi rite knighthood els 
will i make good thee arm arm 
what i spoke thou canst worst devis 

mowbray 
i take sword i swear
which gentli laid knighthood shoulder 
i answer thee fair degree
or chivalr design knightli trial 
and i mount aliv may i light
if i traitor unjustli fight 

king richard 
what doth cousin lay mowbray charg 
it must great inherit us
so much thought ill 

bolingbrok 
look i speak life shall prove true 
that mowbray hath receiv eight thousand nobles
in name lend high soldier 
the hath detain lewd employ 
like fals traitor injuri villain 
besid i say battl prove 
or elsewher furthest verge
that ever survey english eye 
that treason eighteen years
complot contriv land
fetch fals mowbray first head spring 
further i say maintain
upon bad life make good 
that plot duke gloucest death 
suggest soon believ adversari 
and consequ like traitor coward 
sluic innoc soul stream blood 
which blood like sacrif abel cries
even tongueless cavern earth
to justic rough chastis 
and gloriou worth descent 
thi arm shall life spent 

king richard 
how high pitch resolut soar 
thoma norfolk sayst thou 

mowbray 
o let sovereign turn away face
and bid ear littl deaf 
till i told slander blood
how god good men hate foul liar 

king richard 
mowbray imparti eye ear 
were brother nay kingdom heir 
a father brother son 
now sceptr awe i make vow
such neighbour near sacr blood
should noth privileg partialize
th unstoop firm upright soul 
he subject mowbray art thou 
free speech fearless i thee allow 

mowbray 
then bolingbrok low thi heart 
through fals passag thi throat thou liest 
three part receipt i calais
disburs i duli high soldier 
the part reserv i consent 
for sovereign lieg debt
upon remaind dear account
sinc last i went franc fetch queen 
now swallow lie for gloucest death 
i slew disgrace
neglect sworn duti case 
for nobl lord lancast 
the honour father foe 
onc i lay ambush life 
a trespass doth vex griev soul 
but ere i last receiv sacrament
i confess exactli begged
your grace pardon i hope i 
thi fault as rest appeal 
it issu rancour villain 
a recreant degener traitor 
which i boldli defend 
and interchang hurl gage
upon overween traitor foot 
to prove loyal gentleman
even best blood chamber bosom 
in hast whereof heartili i pray
your high assign trial day 

king richard 
wrath kindl gentlemen rule 
let purg choler without let blood 
thi prescrib though physician 
deep malic make deep incis 
forget forgiv conclud agre 
our doctor say month bleed 
good uncl let end begun 
we calm duke norfolk son 

gaunt 
to make peac shall becom age 
throw son duke norfolk gage 

king richard 
and norfolk throw 

gaunt 
when harri 
obedi bid i bid 

king richard 
norfolk throw bid boot 

mowbray 
myself i throw dread sovereign thi foot 
mi life thou shalt command shame 
the one duti owe fair name 
despit death live upon grave 
to dark dishonour use thou shalt 
i disgrac impeach baffl 
pierc soul slander venom spear 
the balm cure heart blood
which breath poison 

king richard 
rage must withstood 
give gage lion make leopard tame 

mowbray 
yea chang spot take shame 
and i resign gage my dear dear lord 
the purest treasur mortal time afford
i spotless reput away 
men gild loam paint clay 
a jewel ten time bar chest
i bold spirit loyal breast 
mine honour life grow one 
take honour life done 
then dear lieg mine honour let tri 
in i live i die 

king richard 
cousin throw gage begin 

bolingbrok 
o god defend soul deep sin 
shall i seem crest fallen father sight 
or pale beggar fear impeach height
befor outdar dastard ere tongue
shal wound honour feebl wrong
or sound base parl teeth shall tear
th slavish motiv recant fear
and spit bleed high disgrac 
where shame doth harbour even mowbray face 

 _exit gaunt _ 

king richard 
we born sue command 
which sinc can not make friend 
be readi live shall answer 
at coventri upon saint lambert day 
there shall sword lanc arbitrate
th swell differ settl hate 
sinc can not aton shall see
justic design victor chivalri 
lord marshal command offic arms
b readi direct home alarm 

 _exeunt _ 

scene ii the a room duke lancast palac 

 enter john gaunt duchess gloucest 

gaunt 
ala part i woodstock blood
doth solicit exclaims
to stir butcher life 
but sinc correct lieth hands
which made fault can not correct 
put quarrel heaven 
who see hour ripe earth 
will rain hot vengeanc offend head 

duchess 
find brotherhood thee sharper spur 
hath love thi old blood live fire 
edward seven son whereof thyself art one 
were seven vial sacr blood 
or seven fair branch spring one root 
some seven dri natur cours 
some branch destini cut 
but thoma dear lord life gloucest 
one vial full edward sacr blood 
one flourish branch royal root 
i crack preciou liquor spilt 
i hack summer leav fade 
bi envi hand murder bloodi axe 
ah gaunt blood thine that bed womb 
that metal self mould fashion thee
mad man though thou livest breathest 
yet art thou slain thou dost consent
in larg measur thi father death
in thou seest thi wretch brother die 
who model thi father life 
call patienc gaunt despair 
in suff ring thu thi brother slaughter 
thou showest nake pathway thi life 
teach stern murder butcher thee 
that mean men entitl patience
i pale cold cowardic nobl breast 
what shall i say to safeguard thine life 
the best way veng gloucest death 

gaunt 
god quarrel god substitut 
hi deputi anoint hi sight 
hath caus death wrong 
let heaven reveng i may never lift
an angri arm hi minist 

duchess 
where ala may i complain 

gaunt 
to god widow champion defenc 

duchess 
whi i farewel old gaunt 
thou goest coventri behold
our cousin hereford fell mowbray fight 
o sit husband wrong hereford spear 
that may enter butcher mowbray breast 
or misfortun miss first career 
be mowbray sin heavi bosom
that may break foam courser back
and throw rider headlong list 
a caitiff recreant cousin hereford 
farewel old gaunt thi sometim brother wife
with companion grief must end life 

gaunt 
sister farewel i must coventri 
a much good stay thee go 

duchess 
yet one word grief boundeth fall 
not empti hollow weight 
i take leav i begun 
for sorrow end seemeth done 
commend thi brother edmund york 
lo nay yet depart 
though quickli go 
i shall rememb bid ah 
with good speed plashi visit 
alack shall good old york see
but empti lodg unfurnish wall 
unpeopl offic untrodden stone 
and hear welcom groan 
therefor commend let come there
to seek sorrow dwell everywher 
desol desol i henc die 
the last leav thee take weep eye 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iii open space near coventri list set throne 
herald c attend 

 enter lord marshal duke aumerl 

marshal 
mi lord aumerl harri hereford arm 

aumerl 
yea point long enter 

marshal 
the duke norfolk spright bold 
stay summon appel trumpet 

aumerl 
whi champion prepar stay
for noth majesti approach 

 enter king richard take seat throne gaunt bushi 
 bagot green other take place a trumpet sound 
 answer anoth trumpet within then enter mowbray armour 
 defend preceed herald 

king richard 
marshal demand yonder champion
th caus arriv arm 
ask name orderli proceed
to swear justic caus 

marshal 
in god name king say thou art 
and thou comest thu knightli clad arm 
against man thou com st thi quarrel 
speak truli thi knighthood thi oath 
a defend thee heaven thi valour 

mowbray 
mi name thoma mowbray duke norfolk 
who hither come engag oath 
which god defend knight violat 
both defend loyalti truth
to god king succeed issu 
against duke hereford appeal 
and grace god mine arm 
to prove defend 
a traitor god king 
and i truli fight defend heaven 

 _he take seat _ 

 trumpet sound enter bolingbrok appel armour preceed by
 herald 

king richard 
marshal ask yonder knight arms
both cometh hither
thu plate habili war 
and formal accord law 
depos justic caus 

marshal 
what thi name and wherefor com st thou hither
befor king richard royal list 
against comest thou thi quarrel 
speak like true knight defend thee heaven 

bolingbrok 
harri hereford lancast derbi 
am i readi stand arms
to prove god grace bodi valour 
in list thoma mowbray duke norfolk 
that traitor foul danger 
to god heaven king richard 
and i truli fight defend heaven 

marshal 
on pain death person bold
or dare hardi touch list 
except marshal officers
appoint direct fair design 

bolingbrok 
lord marshal let kiss sovereign hand
and bow knee majesti 
for mowbray like two men
that vow long weari pilgrimag 
then let us take ceremoni leave
and love farewel sever friend 

marshal 
the appel duti greet highness
and crave kiss hand take leav 

king richard _descend throne_ 
we descend fold arm 
cousin hereford thi caus right 
so thi fortun royal fight 
farewel blood today thou shed 
lament may reveng thee dead 

bolingbrok 
o let nobl eye profan tear
for i gore mowbray spear 
a confid falcon flight
against bird i mowbray fight 
mi love lord i take leav 
of nobl cousin lord aumerl 
not sick although i death 
but lusti young cheerli draw breath 
lo english feast i regreet
th daintiest last make end sweet 
o thou earthli author blood 
whose youth spirit regener 
doth twofold vigour lift up
to reach victori head 
add proof unto mine armour thi prayer 
and thi bless steel lanc point 
that may enter mowbray waxen coat
and furbish new name john gaunt 
even lusti haviour son 

gaunt 
god thi good caus make thee prosper 
be swift like lightn execut 
and let thi blow doubli redoubl 
fall like amaz thunder casque
of thi advers pernici enemi 
rous thi youth blood valiant live 

bolingbrok 
mine innoc saint georg thrive 

 _he take seat _ 

mowbray _rising_ 
howev god fortun cast lot 
there live die true king richard throne 
a loyal upright gentleman 
never captiv freer heart
cast chain bondag embrace
hi golden uncontrol enfranchis 
more danc soul doth celebrate
thi feast battl mine adversari 
most mighti lieg companion peer 
take mouth wish happi year 
a gentl jocund jest
go i fight truth hath quiet breast 

king richard 
farewel lord secur i espy
virtu valour couch thine eye 
order trial marshal begin 

 _the king lord return seat _ 

marshal 
harri hereford lancast derbi 
receiv thi lanc god defend right 

bolingbrok _rising_ 
strong tower hope i cri amen 

marshal 
 _to officer_ go bear lanc thoma duke norfolk 

first herald 
harri hereford lancast derbi 
stand god sovereign 
on pain found fals recreant 
to prove duke norfolk thoma mowbray 
a traitor god king 
and dare set forward fight 

second herald 
here standeth thoma mowbray duke norfolk 
on pain found fals recreant 
both defend approve
henri hereford lancast derbi 
to god sovereign disloy 
courag free desir 
attend signal begin 

marshal 
sound trumpet set forward combat 

 _a charg sound _ 

stay king hath thrown warder 

king richard 
let lay helmet spear 
and return back chair 
withdraw us let trumpet sound
whil return duke decre 

 _a long flourish _ 

 _to combatants_ draw near 
and list council done 
for kingdom earth soiled
with dear blood hath foster 
and eye hate dire aspect
of civil wound plough neighbour sword 
and think eagl wing pride
of sky aspir ambiti thought 
with rival hate envi set you
to wake peac countri cradle
draw sweet infant breath gentl sleep 
which rous boist rou untun drum 
with harsh resound trumpet dread bray 
and grate shock wrath iron arm 
might quiet confin fright fair peace
and make us wade even kindr blood 
therefor banish territori 
you cousin hereford upon pain life 
till twice five summer enrich fields
shal regreet fair dominion 
but tread stranger path banish 

bolingbrok 
your done thi must comfort 
that sun warm shall shine 
and golden beam lent
shal point gild banish 

king richard 
norfolk thee remain heavier doom 
which i unwilling pronounc 
the sli slow hour shall determinate
th dateless limit thi dear exil 
the hopeless word never return 
breath i thee upon pain life 

mowbray 
a heavi sentenc sovereign lieg 
and unlook high mouth 
a dearer merit deep maim
a cast forth common air 
have i deserv high hand 
the languag i learnt forti year 
mi nativ english i must forgo 
and tongu use more
than unstring viol harp 
or like cun instrument case up
or open put hands
that know touch tune harmoni 
within mouth engaol tongu 
doubli portcullis teeth lip 
and dull unfeel barren ignorance
i made gaoler attend 
i old fawn upon nurs 
too far year pupil 
what thi sentenc speechless death 
which rob tongu breath nativ breath 

king richard 
it boot thee compassion 
after sentenc plain come late 

mowbray 
then thu i turn countri light 
to dwell solemn shade endless night 

 _retir _ 

king richard 
return take oath thee 
lay royal sword banish hand 
swear duti owe god 
our part therein banish 
to keep oath administ 
you never shall help truth god 
embrac love banish 
nor never look upon face 
nor never write regreet reconcile
thi lour tempest home bred hate 
nor never advis purpos meet
to plot contriv complot ill
 gainst us state subject land 

bolingbrok 
i swear 

mowbray 
and i keep 

bolingbrok 
norfolk far mine enemi 
bi time king permit us 
one soul wander air 
banish frail sepulchr flesh 
a flesh banish land 
confess thi treason ere thou fli realm 
sinc thou hast far go bear along
th clog burden guilti soul 

mowbray 
no bolingbrok if ever i traitor 
mi name blot book life 
and i heaven banish henc 
but thou art god thou i know 
and soon i fear king shall rue 
farewel lieg now way i stray 
save back england world way 

 _exit _ 

king richard 
uncl even glass thine eyes
i see thi griev heart thi sad aspect
hath number banish years
pluck four away _to bolingbroke_ six frozen winter spent 
return welcom home banish 

bolingbrok 
how long time lie one littl word 
four lag winter four wanton springs
end word breath king 

gaunt 
i thank lieg regard me
h shorten four year son exil 
but littl vantag shall i reap therebi 
for ere six year hath spend
can chang moon bring time 
mi oil dri lamp time bewast light
shal extinct age endless night 
mi inch taper burnt done 
and blindfold death let see son 

king richard 
whi uncl thou hast mani year live 

gaunt 
but minut king thou canst give 
shorten day thou canst sullen sorrow 
and pluck night lend morrow 
thou canst help time furrow age 
but stop wrinkl pilgrimag 
thi word current death 
but dead thi kingdom can not buy breath 

king richard 
thi son banish upon good advic 
whereto thi tongu parti verdict gave 
whi justic seem st thou lour 

gaunt 
thing sweet tast prove digest sour 
you urg judg i rather
y would bid argu like father 
o stranger child 
to smooth fault i mild 
a partial slander sought i avoid 
and sentenc life destroy 
ala i look say
i strict make mine away 
but gave leav unwil tongue
against wrong 

king richard 
cousin farewel uncl bid 
six year banish shall go 

 _flourish exit king richard train _ 

aumerl 
cousin farewel what presenc must know 
from remain let paper show 

marshal 
mi lord leav take i i ride 
a far land let side 

gaunt 
o purpos dost thou hoard thi word 
that thou return st greet thi friend 

bolingbrok 
i take leav 
when tongu offic prodigal
to breath abund dolour heart 

gaunt 
thi grief thi absenc time 

bolingbrok 
joy absent grief present time 

gaunt 
what six winter they quickli gone 

bolingbrok 
to men joy grief make one hour ten 

gaunt 
call travel thou tak st pleasur 

bolingbrok 
mi heart sigh i miscal 
which find enforc pilgrimag 

gaunt 
the sullen passag thi weari steps
esteem foil wherein thou art set
th preciou jewel thi home return 

bolingbrok 
nay rather everi tediou stride i make
wil rememb deal world
i wander jewel i love 
must i serv long apprenticehood
to foreign passag end 
have freedom boast noth else
but i journeyman grief 

gaunt 
all place eye heaven visits
ar wise man port happi haven 
teach thi necess reason thu 
there virtu like necess 
think king banish thee 
but thou king woe doth heavier sit
wher perceiv faintli born 
go say i sent thee forth purchas honour 
and king exil thee suppose
devour pestil hang air 
and thou art fli fresher clime 
look thi soul hold dear imagin it
to lie way thou goest whenc thou com st 
suppos sing bird musician 
the grass whereon thou tread st presenc strew 
the flower fair ladi thi step more
than delight measur danc 
for gnarl sorrow hath less power bite
th man mock set light 

bolingbrok 
o hold fire hand
bi think frosti caucasu 
or cloy hungri edg appetite
bi bare imagin feast 
or wallow nake decemb snow
bi think fantast summer heat 
o apprehens good
giv greater feel wors 
fell sorrow tooth doth never rankl more
than bite lanceth sore 

gaunt 
come come son i bring thee thi way 
had i thi youth caus i would stay 

bolingbrok 
then england ground farewel sweet soil adieu 
mi mother nurs bear yet 
where er i wander boast i 
though banish yet true born englishman 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iv london a room king castle

 enter king richard green bagot one door aumerl anoth 

king richard 
we observ cousin aumerl 
how far brought high hereford way 

aumerl 
i brought high hereford call 
but next highway i left 

king richard 
and say store part tear shed 

aumerl 
faith none except northeast wind 
which blew bitterli face 
awak sleep rheum chance
did grace hollow part tear 

king richard 
what said cousin part 

aumerl 
 farewel 
and heart disdain tongue
should profan word taught craft
to counterfeit oppress grief
that word seem buri sorrow grave 
marri would word farewel lengthen hours
and ad year short banish 
he volum farewel 
but sinc would none 

king richard 
he cousin cousin ti doubt 
when time shall call home banish 
whether kinsman come see friend 
ourself bushi bagot green 
observ courtship common peopl 
how seem dive hearts
with humbl familiar courtesi 
what rever throw away slave 
woo poor craftsmen craft smiles
and patient underbear fortun 
a twere banish affect 
off goe bonnet oyster wench 
a brace draymen bid god speed well 
and tribut suppl knee 
with thank countrymen love friend 
a england revers 
and subject next degre hope 

green 
well gone go thought 
now rebel stand ireland 
expedi manag must made lieg 
ere leisur yield means
for advantag high loss 

king richard 
we ourself person war 
and coffer great court
and liber largess grown somewhat light 
we enforc farm royal realm 
the revenu whereof shall furnish us
for affair hand if come short 
our substitut home shall blank charters
whereto shall know men rich 
they shall subscrib larg sum gold 
and send suppli want 
for make ireland present 

 enter bushi 

bushi news 

bushi 
old john gaunt grievou sick lord 
suddenli taken hath sent post haste
to entreat majesti visit 

king richard 
where lie 

bushi 
at eli hous 

king richard 
now put god physician mind
to help grave immedi 
the line coffer shall make coats
to deck soldier irish war 
come gentlemen let go visit 
pray god may make hast come late 

all 
amen 

 _exeunt _ 




act ii


scen i london an apart eli hous 

gaunt couch duke york other stand 

gaunt 
will king come i may breath last
in wholesom counsel unstaid youth 

york 
vex strive breath 
for vain come counsel ear 

gaunt 
o say tongu die men
enforc attent like deep harmoni 
where word scarc seldom spent vain 
for breath truth breath word pain 
he must say listen more
than youth eas taught glose 
more men end mark live 
the set sun music close 
a last tast sweet sweetest last 
writ remembr thing long past 
though richard life counsel would hear 
mi death sad tale may yet undeaf ear 

york 
no stop flatter sound 
a prais whose state wise fond 
lascivi metr whose venom sound
th open ear youth doth alway listen 
report fashion proud itali 
whose manner still tardi apish nation
limp base imit 
where doth world thrust forth vaniti 
so new respect vile 
that quickli buzz ear 
then late come counsel heard 
where doth mutini wit regard 
direct whose way choos 
 ti breath thou lack st breath wilt thou lose 

gaunt 
methink i prophet new inspir 
and thu expir foretel 
hi rash fierc blaze riot can not last 
for violent fire soon burn 
small shower last long sudden storm short 
he tire betim spur fast betim 
with eager feed food doth choke feeder 
light vaniti insati cormor 
consum mean soon prey upon 
thi royal throne king scepter isl 
thi earth majesti seat mar 
thi eden demi paradis 
thi fortress built natur herself
against infect hand war 
thi happi breed men littl world 
thi preciou stone set silver sea 
which serv offic wall
or moat defens hous 
against envi less happier land 
thi bless plot earth realm england 
thi nurs teem womb royal king 
fear breed famou birth 
renown deed far home 
for christian servic true chivalri 
a sepulchr stubborn jewry
of world ransom bless mari son 
thi land dear soul dear dear land 
dear reput world 
i leas i die pronounc 
like tenement pelt farm 
england bound triumphant sea 
whose rocki shore beat back enviou siege
of wat ry neptun bound shame 
with inki blot rotten parchment bonds
that england wont conquer others
hath made shame conquest 
ah would scandal vanish life 
how happi ensu death 

 enter king richard queen aumerl bushi green bagot ross and
 willoughbi 

york 
the king come deal mildli youth 
for young hot colt rage rage 

queen 
how fare nobl uncl lancast 

king richard 
what comfort man how age gaunt 

gaunt 
o name befit composit 
old gaunt inde gaunt old 
within grief hath kept tediou fast 
and abstain meat gaunt 
for sleep england long time i watch 
watch breed lean lean gaunt 
the pleasur father feed upon
i strict fast i mean children look 
and therein fast hast thou made gaunt 
gaunt i grave gaunt grave 
whose hollow womb inherit nought bone 

king richard 
can sick men play nice name 

gaunt 
no miseri make sport mock 
sinc thou dost seek kill name 
i mock name great king flatter thee 

king richard 
should die men flatter live 

gaunt 
no men live flatter die 

king richard 
thou die sayest thou flatterest 

gaunt 
o thou diest though i sicker 

king richard 
i health i breath see thee ill 

gaunt 
now he made know i see thee ill 
ill see thee see ill 
thi death bed lesser thi land 
wherein thou liest reput sick 
and thou careless patient thou art 
committ st thi anoint bodi cure
of physician first wound thee 
a thousand flatter sit within thi crown 
whose compass bigger thi head 
and yet encag small verg 
the wast whit lesser thi land 
o thi grandsir prophet eye
seen son son destroy son 
from forth thi reach would laid thi shame 
depos thee thou wert possess 
which art possess depos thyself 
whi cousin wert thou regent world 
it shame let land leas 
but thi world enjoy land 
i shame shame 
landlord england art thou king 
thi state law bondslav law 
and thou 

king richard 
a lunat lean wit fool 
presum agu privileg 
darest thi frozen admonition
mak pale cheek chase royal blood
with furi nativ resid 
now seat right royal majesti 
wert thou brother great edward son 
thi tongu run roundli thi head
should run thi head thi unrever shoulder 

gaunt 
o spare brother edward son 
for i father edward son 
that blood alreadi like pelican 
hast thou tap drunkenli carous 
mi brother gloucest plain well mean soul 
whom fair befal heaven mongst happi soul 
may preced wit good
that thou respect st spill edward blood 
join present sick i 
and thi unkind like crook age
to crop long wither flower 
live thi shame die shame thee 
these word hereaft thi tormentor 
convey bed grave 
love live love honour 

 _exit born attend _ 

king richard 
and let die age sullen 
for hast thou becom grave 

york 
i beseech majesti imput words
to wayward sickli age 
he love life hold dear
a harri duke hereford 

king richard 
right say true hereford love 
a mine 

 enter northumberland 

northumberland 
mi lieg old gaunt commend majesti 

king richard 
what say 

northumberland 
nay noth said 
hi tongu stringless instrument 
word life old lancast hath spent 

york 
be york next must bankrupt 
though death poor end mortal woe 

king richard 
the ripest fruit first fall doth 
hi time spent pilgrimag must 
so much now irish war 
we must supplant rough rug head kern 
which live like venom venom else
but privileg live 
and great affair ask charg 
toward assist seiz us
th plate coin revenu moveables
whereof uncl gaunt stand possess 

york 
how long shall i patient ah long
shal tender duti make suffer wrong 
not gloucest death hereford banish 
nor gaunt rebuk england privat wrong 
nor prevent poor bolingbroke
about marriag disgrac 
have ever made sour patient cheek 
or bend one wrinkl sovereign face 
i last nobl edward son 
of thi father princ wale first 
in war never lion rage fierc 
in peac never gentl lamb mild 
than young princ gentleman 
hi face thou hast even look 
accomplish number thi hour 
but frown french
and friend hi nobl hand
did win spend spent that
which triumphant father hand 
hi hand guilti kindr blood 
but bloodi enemi kin 
o richard york far gone grief 
or els never would compar 

king richard 
whi uncl matter 

york 
o lieg 
pardon pleas i pleased
not pardon content withal 
seek seiz gripe hands
th royalti right banish hereford 
i gaunt dead and doth hereford live 
wa gaunt and harri true 
did one deserv heir 
i heir well deserv son 
take hereford right away take time
hi charter customari right 
let tomorrow ensu today 
be thyself art thou king
but fair sequenc success 
now afor god god forbid i say true 
if wrong seiz hereford right 
call letter patent hath
bi attorney gener sue
hi liveri deni offer homag 
you pluck thousand danger head 
you lose thousand well dispos heart 
and prick tender patienc thoughts
which honour allegi can not think 

king richard 
think seiz hands
hi plate good money land 

york 
i my lieg farewel 
what ensu hereof none tell 
but bad cours may understood
that event never fall good 

 _exit _ 

king richard 
go bushi earl wiltshir straight 
bid repair us eli house
to see busi tomorrow next
w ireland ti time i trow 
and creat absenc ourself 
our uncl york lord governor england 
for alway love us well 
come queen tomorrow must part 
be merri time stay short 

 _exeunt king queen bushi aumerl green bagot _ 

northumberland 
well lord duke lancast dead 

ross 
and live son duke 

willoughbi 
bare titl revenu 

northumberland 
richli justic right 

ross 
mi heart great must break silence
er disburden liber tongu 

northumberland 
nay speak thi mind let ne er speak more
that speak thi word thee harm 

willoughbi 
tend thou wouldst speak duke hereford 
if boldli man 
quick mine ear hear good toward 

ross 
no good i 
unless call good piti 
bereft geld patrimoni 

northumberland 
now afor god ti shame wrong borne
in royal princ mani moe
of nobl blood declin land 
the king base led
bi flatter inform 
mere hate gainst us 
that king sever prosecute
 gainst us live children heir 

ross 
the common hath pill grievou tax 
and quit lost heart the nobl hath fined
for ancient quarrel quit lost heart 

willoughbi 
and daili new exact devis 
a blank benevol i wot 
but god name doth becom 

northumberland 
war hath wast war hath 
but base yield upon compromise
that ancestor achiev blow 
more hath spent peac war 

ross 
the earl wiltshir hath realm farm 

willoughbi 
the king grown bankrupt like broken man 

northumberland 
reproach dissolut hangeth 

ross 
he hath money irish war 
hi burden taxat notwithstand 
but rob banish duke 

northumberland 
hi nobl kinsman most degener king 
but lord hear fear tempest sing 
yet seek shelter avoid storm 
we see wind sit sore upon sail 
and yet strike secur perish 

ross 
we see wrack must suffer 
and unavoid danger now
for suffer caus wrack 

northumberland 
not even hollow eye death
i spi life peer i dare say
how near tide comfort 

willoughbi 
nay let us share thi thought thou dost 

ross 
be confid speak northumberland 
we three thyself speak 
thi word thought therefor bold 

northumberland 
then thu i le port blanc bay
in brittani receiv intelligence
that harri duke hereford rainold lord cobham 
that late broke duke exet 
hi brother archbishop late canterburi 
sir thoma erpingham sir john ramston 
sir john norberi sir robert waterton franci coint 
all well furnish duke brittany
with eight tall ship three thousand men war 
are make hither due expedi 
and shortli mean touch northern shore 
perhap ere stay
th first depart king ireland 
if shall shake slavish yoke 
imp droop countri broken wing 
redeem broke pawn blemish crown 
wipe dust hide sceptr gilt 
and make high majesti look like 
away post ravenspurgh 
but faint fear 
stay secret go 

ross 
to hors hors urg doubt fear 

willoughbi 
hold hors i first 

 _exeunt _ 

scene ii the same a room castl 

 enter queen bushi bagot 

bushi 
madam majesti much sad 
you promis part king 
to lay asid life harm heaviness
and entertain cheer disposit 

queen 
to pleas king i pleas myself
i can not yet i know cause
whi i welcom guest grief 
save bid farewel sweet guest
a sweet richard yet methink 
some unborn sorrow ripe fortun womb 
i come toward inward soul
with noth trembl at someth grieves
mor part lord king 

bushi 
each substanc grief hath twenti shadow 
which show like grief 
for sorrow eye glaze blind tear 
divid one thing entir mani object 
like perspect rightli gaze upon 
show noth confus eye awri 
distinguish form so sweet majesti 
look awri upon lord departur 
find shape grief wail 
which look naught shadows
of then thrice graciou queen 
more lord departur weep more seen 
or ti fals sorrow eye 
which thing true weep thing imaginari 

queen 
it may yet inward soul
persuad otherwis how er 
i can not sad heavi sad
a thought think thought i think 
make heavi noth faint shrink 

bushi 
 ti noth conceit graciou ladi 

queen 
 ti noth less conceit still derived
from forefath grief mine 
for noth hath begot someth grief 
or someth hath noth i griev 
 ti revers i possess 
but yet known 
i can not name ti nameless woe i wot 

 enter green 

green 
god save majesti and well met gentlemen 
i hope king yet ship ireland 

queen 
whi hop st thou ti better hope 
for design crave hast hast good hope 
then wherefor dost thou hope ship 

green 
that hope might retir power 
and driven despair enemi hope
who strongli hath set foot land 
the banish bolingbrok repeal 
and uplift arm safe arrived
at ravenspurgh 

queen 
now god heaven forbid 

green 
ah madam ti true wors 
the lord northumberland son young harri perci 
the lord ross beaumond willoughbi 
with power friend fled 

bushi 
whi proclaim northumberland
and rest revolt faction traitor 

green 
we whereupon earl worcester
hath broken staff resign stewardship 
and household servant fled him
to bolingbrok 

queen 
so green thou art midwif woe 
and bolingbrok sorrow dismal heir 
now hath soul brought forth prodigi 
and i gasp new deliv mother 
have woe woe sorrow sorrow join 

bushi 
despair madam 

queen 
who shall hinder 
i despair enmity
with cozen hope he flatter 
a parasit keeper back death 
who gentli would dissolv band life 
which fals hope linger extrem 

 enter york 

green 
here come duke york 

queen 
with sign war age neck 
o full care busi look 
uncl god sake speak comfort word 

york 
should i i beli thought 
comfort heaven earth 
where noth live cross care grief 
your husband gone save far 
whilst other come make lose home 
here i left underprop land 
who weak age can not support 
now come sick hour surfeit made 
now shall tri friend flatter 

 enter servingman 

servingman 
mi lord son gone i came 

york 
he whi go way 
the nobl fled common cold
and i fear revolt hereford side 
sirrah get thee plashi sister gloucest 
bid send present thousand pound 
hold take ring 

servingman 
mi lord i forgot tell lordship 
today i came i call 
but i shall griev report rest 

york 
what knave 

servingman 
an hour i came duchess die 

york 
god merci tide woes
com rush woeful land 
i know i would god 
so untruth provok 
the king cut head brother 
what post dispatch ireland 
how shall money war 
come sister cousin i would say pray pardon 
go fellow get thee home provid carts
and bring away armour 

 _exit servingman _ 

gentlemen go muster men 
if i know way order affairs
thu disorderli thrust hand 
never believ both kinsmen 
th one sovereign oath
and duti bid defend th again
i kinsman king hath wrong 
whom conscienc kindr bid right 
well somewhat must come cousin 
i dispos gentlemen go muster men 
and meet present berkeley castl 
i plashi 
but time permit all uneven 
and everyth left six seven 

 _exeunt york queen _ 

bushi 
the wind sit fair news go ireland 
but none return for us levi power
proportion enemy
i unposs 

green 
besid near king love
i near hate love king 

bagot 
and waver common love
li purs whoso empti 
bi much fill heart deadli hate 

bushi 
wherein king stand gener condemn 

bagot 
if judgment lie 
becaus ever near king 

green 
well i refug straight bristol castl 
the earl wiltshir alreadi 

bushi 
thither i littl office
wil hate common perform us 
except like cur tear us piec 
will go along us 

bagot 
no i ireland majesti 
farewel if heart presag vain 
we three part ne er shall meet 

bushi 
that york thrive beat back bolingbrok 

green 
ala poor duke the task undertakes
i numb ring sand drink ocean dri 
where one side fight thousand fli 
farewel ever 

bushi 
well may meet 

bagot 
i fear never 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iii the wold gloucestershir 

 enter bolingbrok northumberland forc 

bolingbrok 
how far lord berkeley 

northumberland 
believ nobl lord 
i stranger gloucestershir 
these high wild hill rough uneven ways
draw mile make wearisom 
and yet fair discours hath sugar 
make hard way sweet delect 
but i bethink weari way
from ravenspurgh cotshal found
in ross willoughbi want compani 
which i protest hath much beguiled
th tedious process travel 
but sweeten hope have
th present benefit i possess 
and hope joy littl less joy
than hope enjoy by weari lords
shal make way seem short mine hath done
bi sight i nobl compani 

bolingbrok 
of much less valu company
than good word but come 

 enter harri perci 

northumberland 
it son young harri perci 
sent brother worcest whencesoev 
harri fare uncl 

perci 
i thought lord learn health 

northumberland 
whi queen 

perci 
no good lord he hath forsook court 
broken staff offic dispersed
th household king 

northumberland 
what reason 
he resolv last spake togeth 

perci 
becaus lordship proclaim traitor 
but lord gone ravenspurgh
to offer servic duke hereford 
and sent berkeley discover
what power duke york levi 
then direct repair ravenspurgh 

northumberland 
have forgot duke hereford boy 

perci 
no good lord forgot
which ne er i rememb to knowledg 
i never life look 

northumberland 
then learn know thi duke 

perci 
mi graciou lord i tender servic 
such tender raw young 
which elder day shall ripen confirm
to approv servic desert 

bolingbrok 
i thank thee gentl perci sure
i count noth els happy
a soul rememb ring good friend 
and fortun ripen thi love 
it shall still thi true love recompens 
mi heart coven make hand thu seal 

northumberland 
how far berkeley stir
keep good old york men war 

perci 
there stand castl yon tuft tree 
man three hundr men i heard 
and lord york berkeley seymour 
none els name nobl estim 

 enter ross willoughbi 

northumberland 
here come lord ross willoughbi 
bloodi spur fieri red hast 

bolingbrok 
welcom lord i wot love pursues
a banish traitor all treasury
i yet unfelt thank enrich 
shall love labour recompens 

ross 
your presenc make us rich nobl lord 

willoughbi 
and far surmount labour attain 

bolingbrok 
evermor thank exchequ poor 
which till infant fortun come year 
stand bounti but come 

 enter berkeley 

northumberland 
it lord berkeley i guess 

berkeley 
mi lord hereford messag 

bolingbrok 
mi lord answer lancast 
and i come seek name england 
and i must find titl tongue
befor i make repli aught say 

berkeley 
mistak lord ti meaning
to rase one titl honour 
to lord i come lord 
from graciou regent land 
the duke york know prick on
to take advantag absent time 
and fright nativ peac self born arm 

 enter york attend 

bolingbrok 
i shall need transport word 
here come grace person my nobl uncl 

 _kneel _ 

york 
show thi humbl heart thi knee 
whose duti deceiv fals 

bolingbrok 
mi graciou uncl 

york 
tut tut 
grace grace uncl uncl 
i traitor uncl word grace 
in ungraci mouth profan 
whi banish forbidden legs
dar touch dust england ground 
but dare march
so mani mile upon peac bosom 
fright pale face villag war
and ostent despis arm 
com st thou anoint king henc 
whi foolish boy king left behind 
and loyal bosom lie power 
were i lord hot youth
a brave gaunt thi father myself
rescu black princ young mar men 
from forth rank mani thousand french 
o quickli arm mine 
now prison palsi chastis thee
and minist correct thi fault 

bolingbrok 
mi graciou uncl let know fault 
on condit stand wherein 

york 
even condit worst degre 
in gross rebellion detest treason 
thou art banish man art come 
befor expir thi time 
in brave arm thi sovereign 

bolingbrok 
a i banish i banish hereford 
but i come i come lancast 
and nobl uncl i beseech grace
look wrong indiffer eye 
you father methink you
i see old gaunt aliv o father 
will permit i shall stand condemned
a wander vagabond right royalties
pluck arm perforc given away
to upstart unthrift wherefor i born 
if cousin king king england 
it must grant i duke lancast 
you son aumerl nobl cousin 
had first die thu trod 
he found uncl gaunt father
to rous wrong chase bay 
i deni sue liveri 
and yet letter patent give leav 
mi father good distrain sold 
and amiss employ 
what would i subject 
and challeng law attorney deni 
and therefor person i lay claim
to inherit free descent 

northumberland 
the nobl duke hath much abus 

ross 
it stand grace upon right 

willoughbi 
base men endow made great 

york 
mi lord england let tell 
i feel cousin wrongs
and labour i could right 
but kind come brave arm 
be carver cut way
to find right wrong may 
and abet kind
cherish rebellion rebel 

northumberland 
the nobl duke hath sworn come is
but right that
w strongli sworn give aid 
and let never see joy break oath 

york 
well well i see issu arm 
i can not mend i must need confess 
becaus power weak ill left 
but i could him gave life 
i would attach make stoop
unto sovereign merci king 
but sinc i can not known unto you
i remain neuter so fare well 
unless pleas enter castle
and repos night 

bolingbrok 
an offer uncl accept 
but must win grace go us
to bristol castl say held
bi bushi bagot complic 
the caterpillar commonwealth 
which i sworn weed pluck away 

york 
it may i go yet i paus 
for i loath break countri law 
nor friend foe welcom 
thing past redress past care 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iv a camp wale 

 enter earl salisburi welsh captain 

captain 
mi lord salisburi stay ten days
and hardli kept countrymen togeth 
and yet hear tide king 
therefor dispers farewel 

salisburi 
stay yet anoth day thou trusti welshman 
the king reposeth confid thee 

captain 
 ti thought king dead we stay 
the bay tree countri wither 
and meteor fright fix star heaven 
the pale face moon look bloodi earth 
and lean look prophet whisper fear chang 
rich men look sad ruffian danc leap 
the one fear lose enjoy 
the enjoy rage war 
these sign forerun death fall king 
farewel our countrymen gone fled 
a well assur richard king dead 

 _exit _ 

salisburi 
ah richard with eye heavi mind
i see thi glori like shoot star
fal base earth firmament 
thi sun set weep lowli west 
wit storm come woe unrest 
thi friend fled wait upon thi foe 
and crossli thi good fortun goe 

 _exit _ 




act iii


scen i bristol bolingbrok camp 

 enter bolingbrok york northumberland harri perci willoughbi 
 ross offic behind bushi green prison 

bolingbrok 
bring forth men 
bushi green i vex soul 
sinc present soul must part bodi 
with much urg pernici live 
for twere chariti yet wash blood
from hand view men
i unfold caus death 
you misl princ royal king 
a happi gentleman blood lineament 
bi unhappi disfigur clean 
you manner sin hours
mad divorc betwixt queen 
broke possess royal bed 
and stain beauti fair queen cheeks
with tear drawn eye foul wrong 
myself princ fortun birth 
near king blood near love
til make misinterpret 
have stoop neck injuries
and sigh english breath foreign cloud 
eat bitter bread banish 
whilst fed upon signori 
dispark park fell forest wood 
from window torn household coat 
rase impres leav sign
sav men opinion live blood
to show world i gentleman 
thi much much twice 
condemn death see deliv over
to execut hand death 

bushi 
more welcom stroke death me
than bolingbrok england lord farewel 

green 
mi comfort heaven take souls
and plagu injustic pain hell 

bolingbrok 
mi lord northumberland see dispatch 

 _exeunt northumberland other bushi green _ 

uncl say queen hous 
for god sake fairli let entreat 
tell i send kind commend 
take special care greet deliv 

york 
a gentleman mine i dispatched
with letter love larg 

bolingbrok 
thank gentl uncl come lord away 
to fight glendow complic 
a work holiday 

 _exeunt _ 

scene ii the coast wale a castl view 

 flourish drum trumpet enter king richard bishop of
 carlisl aumerl soldier 

king richard 
barkloughli castl call hand 

aumerl 
yea lord how brook grace air
aft late toss break sea 

king richard 
need must i like well i weep joy
to stand upon kingdom 
dear earth i salut thee hand 
though rebel wound thee hors hoof 
a long part mother child
play fondli tear smile meet 
so weep smile greet i thee earth 
and thee favour royal hand 
feed thi sovereign foe gentl earth 
nor thi sweet comfort raven sens 
but let thi spider suck thi venom 
and heavi gait toad lie way 
do annoy treacher feet
which usurp step trampl thee 
yield sting nettl mine enemi 
and thi bosom pluck flower 
guard i pray thee lurk adder
whos doubl tongu may mortal touch
throw death upon thi sovereign enemi 
mock senseless conjur lord 
thi earth shall feel stones
prov arm soldier ere nativ king
shal falter foul rebellion arm 

carlisl 
fear lord that power made king
hath power keep king spite 
the mean heaven yield must embraced
and neglect els heaven would 
and heaven offer refus 
the proffer mean succour redress 

aumerl 
he mean lord remiss 
whilst bolingbrok secur 
grow strong great substanc power 

king richard 
discomfort cousin know st thou not
that search eye heaven hid
behind globe light lower world 
then thiev robber rang abroad unseen
in murder outrag boldli 
but terrestri ball
h fire proud top eastern pines
and dart light everi guilti hole 
then murder treason detest sin 
the cloak night pluck back 
stand bare nake trembl 
so thief traitor bolingbrok 
who hath revel night
whilst wand ring antipod 
shall see us rise throne east 
hi treason sit blush face 
not abl endur sight day 
but self affright trembl sin 
not water rough rude sea
can wash balm anoint king 
the breath worldli men can not depose
th deputi elect lord 
for everi man bolingbrok hath pressed
to lift shrewd steel golden crown 
god richard hath heavenli pay
a gloriou angel then angel fight 
weak men must fall heaven still guard right 

 enter salisburi 

welcom lord how far lie power 

salisburi 
nor near farther graciou lord 
than weak arm discomfort guid tongue
and bid speak noth despair 
one day late i fear nobl lord 
hath cloud thi happi day earth 
o call back yesterday bid time return 
and thou shalt twelv thousand fight men 
today today unhappi day late 
o erthrow thi joy friend fortun thi state 
for welshmen hear thou wert dead 
are gone bolingbrok dispers fled 

aumerl 
comfort lieg whi look grace pale 

king richard 
but blood twenti thousand men
did triumph face fled 
and till much blood thither come again
hav i reason look pale dead 
all soul safe fli side 
for time hath set blot upon pride 

aumerl 
comfort lieg rememb 

king richard 
i forgot am i king 
awak thou coward majesti thou sleepest 
i king name twenti thousand name 
arm arm name a puni subject strikes
at thi great glori look ground 
ye favourit king are high 
high thought i know uncl york
hath power enough serv turn but come 

 enter sir stephen scroop 

scroop 
more health happi betid liege
than care tune tongu deliv 

king richard 
mine ear open heart prepar 
the worst worldli loss thou canst unfold 
say kingdom lost whi twa care 
and loss rid care 
strive bolingbrok great 
greater shall if serv god 
we serv him fellow 
revolt subject that can not mend 
they break faith god well us 
cri woe destruct ruin loss decay 
the worst death death day 

scroop 
glad i high armed
to bear tide calam 
like unseason stormi day
which make silver river drown shores
a world dissolv tear 
so high limit swell rage
of bolingbrok cover fear land
with hard bright steel heart harder steel 
whitebeard arm thin hairless scalps
against thi majesti boy women voices
str speak big clap femal joints
in stiff unwieldi arm thi crown 
thi beadsmen learn bend bows
of doubl fatal yew thi state 
yea distaff women manag rusti bills
against thi seat both young old rebel 
and goe wors i power tell 

king richard 
too well well thou tell st tale ill 
where earl wiltshir where bagot 
what becom bushi where green 
that let danger enemy
measur confin peac step 
if prevail head shall pay 
i warrant made peac bolingbrok 

scroop 
peac made inde lord 

king richard 
o villain viper damn without redempt 
dog easili fawn man 
snake heart blood warm sting heart 
three judas one thrice wors juda 
would make peac terribl hell
mak war upon spot soul 

scroop 
sweet love i see chang properti 
turn sourest deadli hate 
again uncurs soul their peac made
with head hand those curse
hav felt worst death destroy wound
and lie full low grave hollow ground 

aumerl 
i bushi green earl wiltshir dead 

scroop 
ay bristol lost head 

aumerl 
where duke father power 

king richard 
no matter of comfort man speak 
let talk grave worm epitaph 
make dust paper raini eyes
writ sorrow bosom earth 
let choos executor talk will 
and yet bequeath
sav depos bodi ground 
our land live bolingbrok 
and noth call death
and small model barren earth
which serv past cover bone 
for god sake let us sit upon ground
and tell sad stori death king 
how depos slain war 
some haunt ghost depos 
some poison wive sleep kill 
all murder for within hollow crown
that round mortal templ king
keep death court antic sit 
scof state grin pomp 
allow breath littl scene 
to monarch fear kill look 
infus self vain conceit 
a flesh wall life
wer brass impregn humour thu 
come last littl pin
bor castl wall farewel king 
cover head mock flesh blood
with solemn rever throw away respect 
tradit form ceremoni duti 
for mistook 
i live bread like feel want 
tast grief need friend subject thu 
how say i king 

carlisl 
mi lord wise men ne er sit wail woe 
but present prevent way wail 
to fear foe sinc fear oppresseth strength 
give weak strength unto foe 
and folli fight 
fear slain wors come fight 
and fight die death destroy death 
where fear die pay death servil breath 

aumerl 
mi father hath power enquir 
and learn make bodi limb 

king richard 
thou chid st well proud bolingbrok i come
to chang blow thee day doom 
thi agu fit fear overblown 
an easi task win 
say scroop lie uncl power 
speak sweetli man although thi look sour 

scroop 
men judg complexion sky
th state inclin day 
so may dull heavi eye 
mi tongu hath heavier tale say 
i play tortur small small
to lengthen worst must spoken 
your uncl york join bolingbrok 
and northern castl yield 
and southern gentlemen arms
upon parti 

king richard 
thou hast said enough 
 _to aumerle_ beshrew thee cousin didst lead forth
of sweet way i despair 
what say what comfort 
bi heaven i hate everlastingly
that bid comfort 
go flint castl there i pine away 
a king woe slave shall kingli woe obey 
that power i discharg let go
to ear land hath hope grow 
for i none let man speak again
to alter counsel vain 

aumerl 
mi lieg one word 

king richard 
he doubl wrong
that wound flatteri tongu 
discharg follow let henc away 
from richard night bolingbrok fair day 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iii wale befor flint castl 

 enter drum colour bolingbrok forc northumberland
 other 

bolingbrok 
so intellig learn
th welshmen dispers salisbury
i gone meet king late landed
with privat friend upon coast 

northumberland 
the news fair good lord 
richard far henc hath hid head 

york 
it would beseem lord northumberland
to say king richard alack heavi day
when sacr king hide head 

northumberland 
your grace mistak brief
left i titl 

york 
the time hath 
would brief would
hav brief shorten 
for take head whole head length 

bolingbrok 
mistak uncl 

york 
take good cousin 
lest mistak the heaven er head 

bolingbrok 
i know uncl oppos myself
against but come 

 enter harri perci 

welcom harri what castl yield 

perci 
the castl royal man lord 
against thi entranc 

bolingbrok 
royal 
whi contain king 

perci 
ye good lord 
it doth contain king king richard lies
within limit yon lime stone 
and lord aumerl lord salisburi 
sir stephen scroop besid clergyman
of holi rever i can not learn 

northumberland 
o belik bishop carlisl 

bolingbrok 
 _to northumberland_ nobl lord 
go rude rib ancient castl 
through brazen trumpet send breath parley
into ruin ear thu deliv 
henri bolingbroke
on knee doth kiss king richard hand
and send allegi true faith heart
to royal person hither come
even feet lay arm power 
provid banish repealed
and land restor freeli grant 
if i use advantag power
and lay summer dust shower blood
rain wound slaughter englishmen 
the far mind bolingbroke
it crimson tempest bedrench
th fresh green lap fair king richard land 
mi stoop duti tenderli shall show 
go signifi much march
upon grassi carpet plain 
let march without nois threat ning drum 
that castl totter battlements
our fair appoint may well perus 
methink king richard meet
with less terror elements
of fire water thund ring shock
at meet tear cloudi cheek heaven 
be fire i yield water 
the rage whilst earth i rain
mi water earth 
march mark king richard look 

 a parley sound answer trumpet within flourish enter on
 wall king bishop carlisl aumerl scroop and
 salisbury


se see king richard doth appear 
a doth blush discont sun
from fieri portal east 
when perceiv enviou cloud bent
to dim glori stain track
of bright passag occid 

york 
yet look like king behold eye 
a bright eagl lighten forth
control majesti alack alack woe
that harm stain fair show 

king richard 
 _to northumberland _ we amaz thu long stood
to watch fear bend thi knee
becaus thought ourself thi law king 
and dare thi joint forget
to pay aw duti presenc 
if show us hand god
that hath dismiss us stewardship 
for well know hand blood bone
can gripe sacr handl sceptr 
unless profan steal usurp 
and though think done 
have torn soul turn us 
and barren bereft friend 
yet know master god omnipot 
i muster cloud behalf
armi pestil shall strike
your children yet unborn unbegot 
that lift vassal hand head
and threat glori preciou crown 
tell bolingbrok yon methink stand 
that everi stride make upon land
i danger treason he come open
th purpl testament bleed war 
but ere crown look live peac 
ten thousand bloodi crown mother sons
shal ill becom flower england face 
chang complexion maid pale peace
to scarlet indign bedew
h pastur grass faith english blood 

northumberland 
the king heaven forbid lord king
should civil uncivil arms
b rush upon thi thrice nobl cousin 
harri bolingbrok doth humbl kiss thi hand 
and honour tomb swears
that stand upon royal grandsir bone 
and royalti blood 
current spring one graciou head 
and buri hand warlik gaunt 
and worth honour 
compris may sworn said 
hi come hither hath scope
than lineal royalti beg
enfranchis immedi knee 
which thi royal parti grant 
hi glitter arm commend rust 
hi barb steed stabl heart
to faith servic majesti 
thi swear princ 
and i gentleman i credit 

king richard 
northumberland say thu king return 
hi nobl cousin right welcom hither 
and number fair demands
shal accomplish without contradict 
with graciou utter thou hast 
speak gentl hear kind commend 

 _northumberland return bolingbrok _ 

 _to aumerle_ we debas cousin 
to look poorli speak fair 
shall call back northumberland send
defi traitor die 

aumerl 
no good lord let fight gentl words
til time lend friend friend help sword 

king richard 
o god o god e er tongu mine
that laid sentenc dread banishment
on yon proud man take again
with word sooth o i great
a grief lesser name 
or i could forget i 
or rememb i must 
swell st thou proud heart i give thee scope beat 
sinc foe scope beat thee 

aumerl 
northumberland come back bolingbrok 

king richard 
what must king must submit 
the king shall must depos 
the king shall content must lose
th name king i god name let go 
i give jewel set bead 
mi gorgeou palac hermitag 
mi gay apparel almsman gown 
mi figur goblet dish wood 
mi sceptr palmer walk staff 
mi subject pair carv saint 
and larg kingdom littl grave 
a littl littl grave obscur grave 
or i buri king highway 
some way common trade subject feet
may hourli trampl sovereign head 
for heart tread whilst i live 
and buri upon head 
aumerl thou weep st tender heart cousin 
we make foul weather despis tear 
our sigh shall lodg summer corn
and make dearth revolt land 
or shall play wanton woes
and make pretti match shed tear 
a thu drop still upon one place
til fret us pair graves
within earth therein laid lies
two kinsmen dig grave weep eye 
would ill well well well i see
i talk idli laugh 
most mighti princ lord northumberland 
what say king bolingbrok will majesty
g richard leav live till richard die 
you make leg bolingbrok say ay 

northumberland 
mi lord base court doth attend
to speak may pleas come 

king richard 
down i come like glist ring phathon 
want manag unruli jade 
in base court base court king grow base 
to come traitor call grace 
in base court come down court king 
for night owl shriek mount lark sing 

 _exeunt _ 

bolingbrok 
what say majesti 

northumberland 
sorrow grief heart
mak speak fondli like frantic man 
yet come 

 enter king richard attend 

bolingbrok 
stand apart 
and show fair duti majesti _kneeling_ 
mi graciou lord 

king richard 
fair cousin debas princ knee
to make base earth proud kiss 
me rather heart might feel love
than unpleas eye see courtesi 
up cousin your heart i know 
thu high least although knee low 

bolingbrok 
mi graciou lord i come mine 

king richard 
your i 

bolingbrok 
so far mine redoubt lord 
a true servic shall deserv love 

king richard

that know strong st surest way get

what i give will

set toward london cousin

yea good lord
