 _flourish exeunt _ 

scene iv langley the duke york garden 

 enter queen two ladi 

queen 
what sport shall devis garden
to drive away heavi thought care 

ladi 
madam play bowl 

queen 
 twill make think world full rubs
and fortun run bia 

ladi 
madam danc 

queen 
mi leg keep measur delight
when poor heart measur keep grief 
therefor danc girl sport 

ladi 
madam tell tale 

queen 
of sorrow joy 

ladi 
of either madam 

queen 
of neither girl 
for joy altogeth want 
it doth rememb sorrow 
or grief altogeth 
it add sorrow want joy 
for i i need repeat 
and i want boot complain 

ladi 
madam i sing 

queen 
 ti well thou hast caus 
but thou shouldst pleas better wouldst thou weep 

ladi 
i could weep madam would good 

queen 
and i could sing would weep good 
and never borrow tear thee 
but stay come garden 
let step shadow tree 
mi wretched unto row pin 
they talk state everyon doth so
against chang woe forerun woe 

 _queen ladi retir _ 

 enter garden two servant 

garden 
go bind thou young dangl apricock 
which like unruli children make sire
stoop oppress prodig weight 
give support bend twig 
go thou like executioner
cut head fast grow sprays
that look lofti commonwealth 
all must even govern 
you thu employ i go root away
th noisom weed without profit suck
th soil fertil wholesom flower 

servant 
whi compass pale
keep law form due proport 
show model firm estat 
when sea wall garden whole land 
i full weed fairest flower choke 
her fruit tree unprun hedg ruin 
her knot disord wholesom herbs
swarm caterpillar 

garden 
hold thi peac 
he hath suffer disord spring
hath met fall leaf 
the weed broad spread leav shelter 
that seem eat hold 
are pluck root bolingbrok 
i mean earl wiltshir bushi green 

servant 
what dead 

garden 
they and bolingbroke
hath seiz wast king o piti it
that trim dress land
a garden we time year
do wound bark skin fruit tree 
lest proud sap blood 
with much rich confound 
had done great grow men 
they might live bear taste
their fruit duti superflu branches
w lop away bear bough may live 
had done home crown 
which wast idl hour hath quit thrown 

servant 
what think king shall depos 

garden 
depress alreadi deposed
 ti doubt letter came last night
to dear friend good duke york s
that tell black tide 

queen 
o i press death want speak 

 _come forward _ 

thou old adam like set dress garden 
how dare thi harsh rude tongu sound unpleas news 
what eve serpent hath suggest thee
to make second fall curs man 
whi dost thou say king richard depos 
dar st thou thou littl better thing earth 
divin downfal say 
cam st thou ill tide speak thou wretch 

garden 
pardon madam littl joy i
to breath news yet i say true 
king richard mighti hold
of bolingbrok their fortun weigh 
in lord scale noth 
and vaniti make light 
but balanc great bolingbrok 
besid english peer 
and odd weigh king richard 
post london find 
i speak everyon doth know 

queen 
nimbl mischanc art light foot 
doth thi embassag belong 
and i last know o thou thinkest
to serv last i may longest keep
thi sorrow breast come ladi go
to meet london london king woe 
what i born sad look
should grace triumph great bolingbrok 
gard ner tell news woe 
pray god plant thou graft st may never grow 

 _exeunt queen ladi _ 

garden 
poor queen thi state might wors 
i would skill subject thi curs 
here fall tear here place
i set bank rue sour herb grace 
rue even ruth shortli shall seen
in remembr weep queen 

 _exeunt _ 




act iv


scen i westminst hall 

 the lord spiritu right side throne lords
 tempor left common enter bolingbrok aumerl 
 surrey northumberland harri perci fitzwat anoth lord the
 bishop carlisl abbot westminst attend 

bolingbrok 
call forth bagot 

 enter offic bagot 


now bagot freeli speak thi mind 
what thou dost know nobl gloucest death 
who wrought king performed
th bloodi offic timeless end 

bagot 
then set face lord aumerl 

bolingbrok 
cousin stand forth look upon man 

bagot 
mi lord aumerl i know dare tongue
scorn unsay hath deliv 
in dead time gloucest death plot 
i heard say is arm length 
that reacheth rest english court
a far calai mine uncl head 
amongst much talk time
i heard say rather refuse
th offer hundr thousand crowns
than bolingbrok return england 
ad withal blest land would be
in cousin death 

aumerl 
princ nobl lord 
what answer shall i make base man 
shall i much dishonour fair stars
on equal term give chastis 
either i must mine honour soiled
with attaind slander lip 
there gage manual seal death
that mark thee hell i say thou liest 
and maintain thou hast said false
in thi heart blood though base
to stain temper knightli sword 

bolingbrok 
bagot forbear thou shalt take 

aumerl 
except one i would best
in presenc hath move 

fitzwat 
if thi valour stand sympathi 
there gage aumerl gage thine 
bi fair sun show thou stand st 
i heard thee say vauntingli thou spak st 
that thou wert caus nobl gloucest death 
if thou deniest twenti time thou liest 
and i turn thi falsehood thi heart 
where forg rapier point 

aumerl 
thou dar st coward live see day 

fitzwat 
now soul i would hour 

aumerl 
fitzwat thou art damn hell 

harri perci 
aumerl thou liest hi honour true
in appeal thou art unjust 
and thou art i throw gage 
to prove thee extremest point
of mortal breath seiz thou dar st 

aumerl 
and i may hand rot off
and never brandish reveng steel
ov glitter helmet foe 

anoth lord 
i task earth like forsworn aumerl 
and spur thee full mani lies
a may holloa thi treacher ear
from sun sun there honour pawn 
engag trial thou dar st 

aumerl 
who set els by heaven i throw 
i thousand spirit one breast
to answer twenti thousand 

surrey 
mi lord fitzwat i rememb well
th time aumerl talk 

fitzwat 
 ti true you presenc 
and wit true 

surrey 
a fals heaven heaven true 

fitzwat 
surrey thou liest 

surrey 
dishonour boy 
that lie shall lie heavi sword
that shall render vengeanc revenge
til thou lie giver lie lie
in earth quiet thi father skull 
in proof whereof honour pawn 
engag trial thou dar st 

fitzwat 
how fondli dost thou spur forward hors 
if i dare eat drink breath live 
i dare meet surrey wilderness
and spit upon whilst i say lie 
and lie lie there bond faith
to tie thee strong correct 
a i intend thrive new world 
aumerl guilti true appeal 
besid i heard banish norfolk say
that thou aumerl didst send two thi men
to execut nobl duke calai 

aumerl 
some honest christian trust gage 
that norfolk lie i throw 
if may repeal tri honour 

bolingbrok 
these differ shall rest gage
til norfolk repeal repeal shall 
and though mine enemi restor again
to land signori when return 
against aumerl enforc trial 

carlisl 
that honour day shall ne er seen 
mani time hath banish norfolk fought
for jesu christ gloriou christian field 
stream ensign christian cross
against black pagan turk saracen 
and toil work war retir himself
to itali venic gave
hi bodi pleasant countri earth
and pure soul unto captain christ 
under whose colour fought long 

bolingbrok 
whi bishop norfolk dead 

carlisl 
a sure i live lord 

bolingbrok 
sweet peac conduct sweet soul bosom
of good old abraham lord appel 
your differ shall rest gage
til assign day trial 

 enter york attend 

york 
great duke lancast i come thee
from plume pluck richard will soul
adopt thee heir high sceptr yields
to possess thi royal hand 
ascend throne descend 
and long live henri name fourth 

bolingbrok 
in god name i ascend regal throne 

carlisl 
marri god forbid 
worst royal presenc may i speak 
yet best beseem speak truth 
would god nobl presence
wer enough nobl upright judge
of nobl richard then true nobless would
learn forbear foul wrong 
what subject give sentenc king 
and sit richard subject 
thiev judg hear 
although appar guilt seen 
and shall figur god majesti 
hi captain steward deputi elect 
anoint crown plant mani year 
be judg subject inferior breath 
and present o forfend god 
that christian climat soul refined
should show heinou black obscen deed 
i speak subject subject speak 
stir god thu boldli king 
mi lord hereford call king 
i foul traitor proud hereford king 
and crown let prophesy
th blood english shall manur ground
and futur age groan foul act 
peac shall go sleep turk infidel 
and seat peac tumultu wars
shal kin kin kind kind confound 
disord horror fear mutiny
shal inhabit land called
th field golgotha dead men skull 
o rais hous hous 
it woefullest divis prove
that ever fell upon curs earth 
prevent resist let 
lest child child children cri woe 

northumberland 
well argu sir pain 
of capit treason arrest 
mi lord westminst charge
to keep safe till day trial 
may pleas lord grant common suit 

bolingbrok 
fetch hither richard common view
h may surrend so shall proceed
without suspicion 

york 
i conduct 

 _exit _ 

bolingbrok 
lord arrest 
procur sureti day answer 
littl behold love 
and littl look help hand 

 enter york king richard offic bear crown c 

king richard 
alack i sent king
befor i shook regal thoughts
wherewith i reign i hardli yet learned
to insinu flatter bow bend knee 
give sorrow leav awhil tutor me
to submiss yet i well remember
th favour men were mine 
did sometim cri all hail 
so juda christ he twelv 
found truth one i twelv thousand none 
god save king will man say amen 
am i priest clerk well amen 
god save king although i 
and yet amen heaven think 
to servic i sent hither 

york 
to offic thine good will
which tire majesti make thee offer 
the resign thi state crown
to henri bolingbrok 

king richard 
give crown here cousin seiz crown 
here cousin 
on side hand side thine 
now golden crown like deep well
that owe two bucket fill one anoth 
the emptier ever danc air 
the unseen full water 
that bucket full tear i 
drink grief whilst mount high 

bolingbrok 
i thought will resign 

king richard 
mi crown i still grief mine 
you may glori state depos 
but grief still i king 

bolingbrok 
part care give crown 

king richard 
your care set pluck care 
mi care loss care old care done 
your care gain care new care 
the care i give i though given away 
they tend crown yet still stay 

bolingbrok 
are content resign crown 

king richard 
ay ay i must noth 
therefor i resign thee 
now mark i undo 
i give heavi weight head 
and unwieldi sceptr hand 
the pride kingli sway heart 
with mine tear i wash away balm 
with mine hand i give away crown 
with mine tongu deni sacr state 
with mine breath releas duteou oath 
all pomp majesti i forswear 
mi manor rent revenu i forgo 
mi act decre statut i deni 
god pardon oath broke 
god keep vow unbrok made thee 
make noth noth griev 
and thou pleas hast achiev 
long mayst thou live richard seat sit 
and soon lie richard earthli pit 
god save king henri unking richard say 
and send mani year sunshin day 
what remain 

northumberland 
 _offer paper_ no read
thes accus grievou crimes
commit person followers
against state profit land 
that confess soul men
may deem worthili depos 

king richard 
must i and must i ravel out
mi weav folli gentl northumberland 
if thi offenc upon record 
would shame thee fair troop
to read lectur if thou wouldst 
there shouldst thou find one heinou article
contain depos king
and crack strong warrant oath 
mark blot damn book heaven 
nay stand look upon me
whilst wretched doth bait 
though pilat wash hand 
show outward piti yet pilates
hav deliv sour cross 
and water can not wash away sin 

northumberland 
mi lord dispatch read er articl 

king richard 
mine eye full tear i can not see 
and yet salt water blind much
but see sort traitor 
nay i turn mine eye upon 
i find traitor rest 
for i given soul consent
t undeck pompou bodi king 
made glori base sovereignti slave 
proud majesti subject state peasant 

northumberland 
mi lord 

king richard 
no lord thine thou haught insult man 
nor man lord i name titl 
no name given font 
but ti usurp alack heavi day 
that i worn mani winter out
and know name call 
o i mockeri king snow 
stand sun bolingbrok 
to melt away water drop 
good king great king yet greatli good 
an word sterl yet england 
let command mirror hither straight 
that may show face i 
sinc bankrupt majesti 

bolingbrok 
go fetch look glass 

 _exit attend _ 

northumberland 
read er paper glass doth come 

king richard 
fiend thou torment ere i come hell 

bolingbrok 
urg lord northumberland 

northumberland 
the common satisfi 

king richard 
they shall satisfi i read enough
when i see book indeed
wher sin writ 

 re enter attend glass 

give glass therein i read 
no deeper wrinkl yet hath sorrow struck
so mani blow upon face mine
and made deeper wound o flatt ring glass 
like follow prosper 
thou dost beguil wa face face
that everi day household roof
did keep ten thousand men wa face
that like sun make behold wink 
i face face mani folli 
that last outfac bolingbrok 
a brittl glori shineth face 
a brittl glori face 

 _dash glass ground _ 

for crack hundr shiver 
mark silent king moral sport 
how soon sorrow hath destroy face 

bolingbrok 
the shadow sorrow hath destroyed
th shadow face 

king richard 
say 
the shadow sorrow ha let see 
 ti true grief lie within 
and extern manner laments
ar mere shadow unseen grief
that swell silenc tortur soul 
there lie substanc and i thank thee king 
for thi great bounti giv st
me caus wail teachest way
how lament caus i beg one boon 
and gone troubl 
shall i obtain 

bolingbrok 
name fair cousin 

king richard 
 fair cousin i greater king 
for i king flatterers
wer subject be subject 
i king flatter 
be great i need beg 

bolingbrok 
yet ask 

king richard 
and shall i 

bolingbrok 
you shall 

king richard 
then give leav go 

bolingbrok 
whither 

king richard 
whither i sight 

bolingbrok 
go convey tower 

king richard 
o good convey convey 
that rise thu nimbl true king fall 

 _exeunt king richard guard _ 

bolingbrok 
on wednesday next solemnli set down
our coron lord prepar 

 _exeunt bishop carlisl abbot westminst and
 aumerl _ 

abbot 
a woeful pageant beheld 

carlisl 
the woe come the children yet unborn
shal feel day sharp thorn 

aumerl 
you holi clergymen plot
to rid realm pernici blot 

abbot 
mi lord 
befor i freeli speak mind herein 
you shall take sacrament
to buri mine intent also effect
whatev i shall happen devis 
i see brow full discont 
your heart sorrow eye tear 
come home supper i lay
a plot shall show us merri day 

 _exeunt _ 




act v


scene i london a street lead tower 

 enter queen ladi 

queen 
thi way king come thi way
to juliu caesar ill erect tower 
to whose flint bosom condemn lord
i doom prison proud bolingbrok 
here let us rest rebelli earth
hav rest true king queen 

 enter king richard guard 

but soft see rather see
mi fair rose wither yet look behold 
that piti may dissolv dew
and wash fresh true love tear 
ah thou model old troy stand 
thou map honour thou king richard tomb 
and king richard thou beauteou inn 
whi hard favour grief lodg thee 
when triumph becom alehous guest 

king richard 
join grief fair woman 
to make end sudden learn good soul 
to think former state happi dream 
from awak truth are
show us i sworn brother sweet 
to grim necess i
wil keep leagu till death hie thee franc 
and cloister thee religi hous 
our holi live must win new world crown 
which profan hour thrown 

queen 
what richard shape mind
transform weaken hath bolingbroke
depos thine intellect hath thi heart 
the lion die thrusteth forth paw
and wound earth noth els rage
to erpow wilt thou pupil like 
take correct mildli kiss rod 
and fawn rage base humil 
which art lion king beast 

king richard 
a king beast inde if aught beast 
i still happi king men 
good sometim queen prepar thee henc franc 
think i dead even thou tak st 
a death bed thi last live leav 
in winter tediou night sit fire
with good old folk let tell thee tales
of woeful age long ago betid 
and ere thou bid good night quit grief 
tell thou lament tale 
and send hearer weep bed 
for senseless brand sympathize
th heavi accent thi move tongu 
and compass weep fire 
and mourn ash coal black 
for depos right king 

 enter northumberland attend 

northumberland 
mi lord mind bolingbrok chang 
you must pomfret unto tower 
and madam order ta en 
with swift speed must away franc 

king richard 
northumberland thou ladder wherewithal
th mount bolingbrok ascend throne 
the time shall mani hour age
mor ere foul sin gather head 
shall break corrupt thou shalt think 
though divid realm give thee half
it littl help 
and shall think thou knowst way
to plant unright king wilt know 
be ne er littl urg anoth way
to pluck headlong usurp throne 
the love wick men convert fear 
that fear hate hate turn one both
to worthi danger deserv death 

northumberland 
mi guilt head end 
take leav part must part forthwith 

king richard 
doubli divorc bad men violate
a twofold marriag twixt crown 
and betwixt marri wife 
let unkiss oath twixt thee 
and yet kiss twa made 
part us northumberland i toward north 
where shiver cold sick pine clime 
mi wife franc whenc set forth pomp 
she came adorn hither like sweet may 
sent back like hallowma short st day 

queen 
and must divid must part 

king richard 
ay hand hand love heart heart 

queen 
banish us send king 

northumberland 
that love littl polici 

queen 
then whither goe thither let go 

king richard 
so two togeth weep make one woe 
weep thou franc i thee 
better far near ne er near 
go count thi way sigh i mine groan 

queen 
so longest way shall longest moan 

king richard 
twice one step i groan way short 
and piec way heavi heart 
come come woo sorrow let brief 
sinc wed length grief 
one kiss shall stop mouth dumbl part 
thu give i mine thu take i thi heart 

 _they kiss _ 

queen 
give mine twere good part
to take keep kill thi heart 

 _they kiss _ 

so i mine gone 
that i may strive kill groan 

king richard 
we make woe wanton fond delay 
onc adieu the rest let sorrow say 

 _exeunt _ 

scene ii the a room duke york palac 

 enter york duchess 

duchess 
mi lord told would tell rest 
when weep made break stori off
of two cousin come london 

york 
where i leav 

duchess 
at sad stop lord 
where rude misgovern hand window tops
threw dust rubbish king richard head 

york 
then i said duke great bolingbrok 
mount upon hot fieri steed 
which aspir rider seem know 
with slow state pace kept cours 
whilst tongu cri god save thee bolingbrok 
you would thought window spake 
so mani greedi look young old
through casement dart desir eyes
upon visag walls
with paint imageri said once
 jesu preserv thee welcom bolingbrok 
whilst one side turn 
barehead lower proud steed neck 
bespak thu i thank countrymen 
and thu still thu pass along 

duchess 
alack poor richard where rode whilst 

york 
a theatr eye men
aft well grace actor leav stage 
are idli bent enter next 
think prattl tediou 
even much contempt men eyes
did scowl gentl richard no man cri god save 
no joy tongu gave welcom home 
but dust thrown upon sacr head 
which gentl sorrow shook 
hi face still combat tear smile 
the badg grief patienc 
that god strong purpos steeled
th heart men must perforc melt 
and barbar piti 
but heaven hath hand event 
to whose high bound calm content 
to bolingbrok sworn subject 
whose state honour i aye allow 

 enter aumerl 

duchess 
here come son aumerl 

york 
aumerl 
but lost richard friend 
and madam must call rutland 
i parliament pledg truth
and last fealti new made king 

duchess 
welcom son who violet now
that strew green lap new come spring 

aumerl 
madam i know i greatli care 
god know i lief none one 

york 
well bear well new spring time 
lest crop come prime 
what news oxford do joust triumph hold 

aumerl 
for aught i know lord 

york 
you i know 

aumerl 
if god prevent i purpos 

york 
what seal hang without thi bosom 
yea look st thou pale let see write 

aumerl 
mi lord ti noth 

york 
no matter see 
i satisfi let see write 

aumerl 
i beseech grace pardon 
it matter small consequ 
which reason i would seen 

york 
which reason sir i mean see 
i fear i fear 

duchess 
what fear 
 ti noth bond enter into
for gay apparel gainst triumph day 

york 
bound what doth bond
that bound wife thou art fool 
boy let see write 

aumerl 
i beseech pardon i may show 

york 
i satisfi let see i say

duchess

peac foolish woman

good mother content it more

 re enter servant boot

 _exit servant _ 

york 
give boot i say 

duchess 
whi york wilt thou 
wilt thou hide trespass thine 
have son or like 
i teem date drunk time 
and wilt thou pluck fair son mine age
and rob happi mother name 
i like thee is thine 

york 
thou fond mad woman 
wilt thou conceal dark conspiraci 
a dozen ta en sacrament
and interchang set hands
to kill king oxford 

duchess 
he shall none 
we keep then 

york 
away fond woman were twenti time son 
i would appeach 

duchess 
hadst thou groan him
a i done thou wouldst piti 
but i know thi mind thou dost suspect
that i disloy thi bed
and bastard thi son 
sweet york sweet husband mind 
he like thee man may 
not like kin 
and yet i love 

york 
make way unruli woman 

 _exit _ 

duchess 
after aumerl mount thee upon hors 
spur post get king 
and beg thi pardon ere accus thee 
i long behind though i old 
i doubt ride fast york 
and never i rise ground
til bolingbrok pardon thee away gone 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iii windsor a room castl 

 enter bolingbrok king harri perci lord 

king henri 
can man tell unthrifti son 
 ti full three month sinc i see last 
if plagu hang us ti 
i would god lord might found 
inquir london mongst tavern 
for say daili doth frequent
with unrestrain loos companion 
even say stand narrow lanes
and beat watch rob passeng 
while young wanton effemin boy 
take point honour support
so dissolut crew 

perci 
mi lord two day sinc i saw princ 
and told triumph held oxford 

king henri 
and said gallant 

perci 
hi answer would unto stew 
and common st creatur pluck glove
and wear favour that
h would unhors lustiest challeng 

king henri 
a dissolut desper yet both
i see spark better hope elder years
may happili bring forth but come 

 enter aumerl

 _exeunt harri perci lord _ 

what matter cousin

mi tongu cleav roof within mouth 
unless pardon ere i rise speak 

king henri 
intend commit fault 
if first heinou e er 
to win thi love i pardon thee 

aumerl 
then give leav i may turn key 
that man enter till tale done 

king henri 
have thi desir 

 _aumerl lock door _ 

york 
 _within_ my lieg bewar look thyself 
thou hast traitor thi presenc 

king henri 
 _drawing_ villain i make thee safe 

aumerl 
stay thi reveng hand thou hast caus fear 

york 
 _within_ open door secur foolhardi king 
shall i love speak treason thi face 
open door i break open 

 _king henri unlock door afterward relock _ 

 enter york 

king henri 
what matter uncl speak 
recov breath tell us near danger 
that may arm us encount 

york 
perus write thou shalt know
th treason hast forbid show 

aumerl 
rememb thou read st thi promis pass 
i repent read name 
mi heart confeder hand 

york 
it villain ere thi hand set 
i tore traitor bosom king 
fear love beget penit 
forget piti lest thi piti prove
a serpent sting thee heart 

king henri 
o heinou strong bold conspiraci 
o loyal father treacher son 
thou sheer immacul silver fountain
from whenc stream muddi passages
hath held current defil 
thi overflow good convert bad 
and thi abund good shall excuse
thi deadli blot thi digress son 

york 
so shall virtu vice bawd 
and shall spend mine honour shame 
a thriftless son scrape father gold 
mine honour live dishonour die 
or shame life dishonour lie 
thou kill st life give breath 
the traitor live true man put death 

duchess 
 _within_ what ho lieg for god sake let 

king henri 
what shrill voic suppliant make eager cri 

duchess 
 _within_ a woman thine aunt great king ti i 
speak piti open door 
a beggar beg never beg 

king henri 
our scene alter seriou thing 
and chang the beggar king 
mi danger cousin let mother 
i know come pray foul sin 

 enter duchess 

york 
if thou pardon whosoev pray 
more sin forgiv prosper may 
thi fester joint cut rest rest sound 
thi let alon rest confound 

duchess 
o king believ hard heart man 
love love none 

york 
thou frantic woman dost thou make 
shall thi old dug traitor rear 

duchess 
sweet york patient _kneels_ hear gentl lieg 

king henri 
rise good aunt 

duchess 
not yet i thee beseech 
for ever i walk upon knees
and never see day happi see 
till thou give joy thou bid joy
bi pardon rutland transgress boy 

aumerl 
unto mother prayer i bend knee 

 _kneel _ 

york 
against true joint bend 

 _kneel _ 

ill mayst thou thrive thou grant grace 

duchess 
plead earnest look upon face 
hi eye drop tear prayer jest 
hi word come mouth breast 
he pray faintli would deni 
we pray heart soul besid 
hi weari joint would gladli rise i know 
our knee still kneel till ground grow 
hi prayer full fals hypocrisi 
our true zeal deep integr 
our prayer outpray let have
that merci true prayer ought 

king henri 
good aunt stand 

duchess 
nay say stand 
say pardon first afterward stand 
an i thi nurs thi tongu teach 
 pardon first word thi speech 
i never long hear word till 
say pardon king let piti teach thee 
the word short short sweet 
no word like pardon king mouth meet 

york 
speak french king say pardonn moy 

duchess 
dost thou teach pardon pardon destroy 
ah sour husband hard heart lord 
that set word word 
speak pardon ti current land 
the chop french understand 
thine eye begin speak set thi tongu 
or thi piteou heart plant thou thine ear 
that hear plaint prayer pierc 
piti may move thee pardon rehears 

king henri 
good aunt stand 

duchess 
i sue stand 
pardon suit i hand 

king henri 
i pardon god shall pardon 

duchess 
o happi vantag kneel knee 
yet i sick fear speak 
twice say pardon doth pardon twain 
but make one pardon strong 

king henri 
with heart
i pardon 

duchess 
a god earth thou art 

king henri 
but trusti brother law abbot 
with rest consort crew 
destruct straight shall dog heel 
good uncl help order sever powers
to oxford er traitor 
they shall live within world i swear 
but i i know 
uncl farewel cousin adieu 
your mother well hath pray prove true 

duchess 
come old son i pray god make thee new 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iv anoth room castl 

 enter exton servant 

exton 
didst thou mark king word spake 
 have i friend rid live fear 
wa 

servant 
these word 

exton 
 have i friend quoth he spake twice
and urg twice togeth 

servant 
he 

exton 
and speak wishtli look 
a say i would thou wert man
that would divorc terror heart 
mean king pomfret come let go 
i king friend rid foe 

 _exeunt _ 

scene v pomfret the dungeon castl 

 enter richard 

richard 
i studi i may compare
thi prison i live unto world 
and world populous
and creatur 
i can not yet i hammer 
mi brain i prove femal soul 
mi soul father two beget
a gener still breed thought 
and thought peopl littl world 
in humour like peopl world 
for thought content the better sort 
a thought thing divin intermixed
with scrupl set word itself
against word thu come littl one 
and 
 it hard come camel
to thread postern needl eye 
thought tend ambit plot
unlik wonder vain weak nails
may tear passag flinti ribs
of hard world rag prison wall 
and can not die pride 
thought tend content flatter themselves
that first fortun slave 
nor shall last like silli beggars
who sit stock refug shame
that mani other must sit 
and thought find kind eas 
bear misfortun back
of endur like 
thu play i one person mani peopl 
and none content sometim i king 
then treason make wish beggar 
and i then crush penury
persuad i better king 
then i king by
think i unking bolingbrok 
and straight noth but whate er i 
nor i man man is
with noth shall pleas till eased
with noth 
music i hear _music_ 
ha ha keep time how sour sweet music is
when time broke proport kept 
so music men live 
and i dainti ear
to check time broke disord string 
but concord state time
had ear hear true time broke 
i wast time doth time wast 
for hath time made numb ring clock 
mi thought minut sigh jar
their watch unto mine eye outward watch 
whereto finger like dial point 
i point still cleans tear 
now sir sound tell hour is
ar clamor groan strike upon heart 
which bell so sigh tear groans
show minut time hour but time
run post bolingbrok proud joy 
while i stand fool jack clock 
thi music mad let sound 
for though holp madmen wit 
in seem make wise men mad 
yet bless heart give 
for ti sign love love richard
i strang brooch hate world 

 enter groom stabl 

groom 
hail royal princ 

richard 
thank nobl peer 
the cheapest us ten groat dear 
what art thou comest thou hither
wher man never come sad dog
that bring food make misfortun live 

groom 
i poor groom thi stabl king 
when thou wert king travel toward york 
with much ado length gotten leave
to look upon sometim royal master face 
o ern heart i beheld
in london street coron day 
when bolingbrok rode roan barbari 
that hors thou often hast bestrid 
that hors i care dress 

richard 
rode barbari tell gentl friend 
how went 

groom 
so proudli disdain ground 

richard 
so proud bolingbrok back 
that jade hath eat bread royal hand 
thi hand hath made proud clap 
would stumbl would fall 
sinc pride must fall break neck
of proud man usurp back 
forgiv hors whi i rail thee 
sinc thou creat awe man 
wast born bear i made hors 
and yet i bear burden like ass 
spur gall tire jaunc bolingbrok 

 enter keeper dish 

keeper _to groom_ 
fellow give place here longer stay 

richard 
if thou love ti time thou wert away 

groom 
mi tongu dare heart shall say 

 _exit _ 

keeper 
mi lord pleas fall 

richard 
tast first thou art wont 

keeper 
mi lord i dare sir pierc exton 
who late came king command contrari 

richard 
the devil take henri lancast thee 
patienc stale i weari 

 _strike keeper _ 

keeper 
help help help 

 enter exton servant arm 

richard 
how what mean death rude assault 
villain thi hand yield thi death instrument 

 _snatch weapon kill one _ 

go thou fill anoth room hell 

 _he kill anoth exton strike _ 

that hand shall burn never quench fire
that stagger thu person exton thi fierc hand
hath king blood stain king land 
mount mount soul thi seat high 
whilst gross flesh sink downward die 

 _di _ 

exton 
a full valour royal blood 
both i spill o would deed good 
for devil told i well
say deed chronicl hell 
thi dead king live king i bear 
take henc rest give burial 

 _exeunt _ 

scene vi windsor an apart castl 

 flourish enter king henri york lord attend 

king henri 
kind uncl york latest news hear
i rebel consum fire
our town cicest gloucestershir 
but whether ta en slain hear 

 enter northumberland 

welcom lord what news 

northumberland 
first thi sacr state wish i happi 
the next news i london sent
th head salisburi spencer blunt kent 
the manner take may appear
at larg discours paper 

king henri 
we thank thee gentl perci thi pain 
and thi worth add right worthi gain 

 enter fitzwat 

fitzwat 
mi lord i oxford sent london
th head broca sir bennet seeli 
two danger consort traitors
that sought oxford thi dire overthrow 

king henri 
thi pain fitzwat shall forgot 
right nobl thi merit well i wot 

 enter harri perci bishop carlisl 

perci 
the grand conspir abbot westminst 
with clog conscienc sour melancholi 
hath yield bodi grave 
but carlisl live abide
thi kingli doom sentenc pride 

king henri 
carlisl doom 
choos secret place reverend room 
more thou hast joy thi life 
so thou liv st peac die free strife 
for though mine enemi thou hast ever 
high spark honour thee i seen 

 enter exton attend bear coffin 

exton 
great king within coffin i present
thi buri fear herein breathless lies
th mightiest thi greatest enemi 
richard bordeaux hither brought 

king henri 
exton i thank thee thou hast wrought
a deed slander thi fatal hand
upon head famou land 

exton 
from mouth lord i deed 

king henri 
they love poison poison need 
nor i thee though i wish dead 
i hate murder love murder 
the guilt conscienc take thou thi labour 
but neither good word princ favour 
with cain go wander thorough shade night 
and never show thi head day light 
lord i protest soul full woe
that blood sprinkl make grow 
come mourn i lament 
and put sullen black incontin 
i make voyag holi land
to wash blood guilti hand 
march sadli grace mourn here
in weep untim bier 

 _exeunt _

scen england

k richard third

act i scene 1 

london a street

ent richard duke of gloucest solus

 gloucest now winter discontent
 made gloriou summer sun york 
 and cloud lour upon house
 in deep bosom ocean buri 
 now brow bound victori wreath 
 our bruis arm hung monument 
 our stern alarum chang merri meet 
 our dread march delight measur 
 grim visag war hath smooth wrinkl front 
 and instead mount barb steeds
 to fright soul fear adversari 
 he caper nimbl ladi chamber
 to lascivi pleas lute 
 but i shap sportiv trick 
 nor made court amor look glass 
 i rude stamp want love majesty
 to strut wanton ambl nymph 
 i curtail fair proport 
 cheat featur dissembl natur 
 deform unfinish sent time
 into breath world scarc half made 
 and lame unfashionable
 that dog bark i halt 
 whi i weak pipe time peac 
 have delight pass away time 
 unless spi shadow sun
 and descant mine deform 
 and therefor sinc i can not prove lover
 to entertain fair well spoken day 
 i determin prove villain
 and hate idl pleasur day 
 plot i laid induct danger 
 by drunken propheci libel dream 
 to set brother clarenc king
 in deadli hate one 
 and king edward true just
 as i subtl fals treacher 
 thi day clarenc close mew 
 about propheci say g
 of edward heir murder shall 
 dive thought soul here clarenc come 

 enter clarenc guard brakenbury

 brother good day what mean arm guard
 that wait upon grace 
 clarenc hi majesti 
 tend ring person safeti hath appointed
 thi conduct convey th tower 
 gloucest upon caus 
 clarenc becaus name georg 
 gloucest alack lord fault none 
 he commit godfath 
 o belik majesti hath intent
 that new christ ned tower 
 but matter clarenc may i know 
 clarenc yea richard i know i protest
 as yet i i learn 
 he hearken propheci dream 
 and cross row pluck letter g 
 and say wizard told g
 hi issu disinherit 
 and name georg begin g 
 it follow thought i 
 these i learn like toy these
 hath mov high commit 
 gloucest whi men rul women 
 ti king send tower 
 my ladi grey wife clarenc ti she
 that temper extrem 
 wa good man worship 
 antoni woodvil brother 
 that made send lord hast tower 
 from whenc present day deliv 
 we safe clarenc safe 
 clarenc by heaven i think man secure
 but queen kindr night walk heralds
 that trudg betwixt king mistress shore 
 heard humbl suppliant
 lord hast deliveri 
 gloucest humbl complain deity
 got lord chamberlain liberti 
 i tell i think way 
 if keep favour king 
 to men wear liveri 
 the jealou er worn widow 
 sinc brother dubb gentlewomen 
 are mighti gossip monarchi 
 brakenburi i beseech grace pardon 
 hi majesti hath straitli given charge
 that man shall privat confer 
 of degre soever brother 
 gloucest even pleas worship brakenburi 
 you may partak thing say 
 we speak treason man say king
 is wise virtuou nobl queen
 well struck year fair jealou 
 we say shore wife hath pretti foot 
 a cherri lip bonni eye pass pleas tongu 
 and queen kindr made gentlefolk 
 how say sir can deni 
 brakenburi with lord naught 
 gloucest naught mistress shore i tell thee 
 fellow 
 he doth naught except one 
 were best secretli alon 
 brakenburi what one lord 
 gloucest her husband knave wouldst thou betray 
 brakenburi i beseech grace pardon and
 withal
 forbear confer nobl duke 
 clarenc we know thi charg brakenburi will
 obey 
 gloucest we queen abject must obey 
 brother farewel i unto king 
 and whatso er employ 
 were call king edward widow sister 
 i perform enfranchis 
 meantim deep disgrac brotherhood
 touch deeper imagin 
 clarenc i know pleaseth neither us well 
 gloucest well imprison shall long 
 i deliv els lie 
 meantim patienc 
 clarenc i must perforc farewel 
 exeunt clarenc brakenburi guard
 gloucest go tread path thou shalt ne er return 
 simpl plain clarenc i love thee so
 that i shortli send thi soul heaven 
 if heaven take present hand 
 but come the new deliv hast 

 enter lord hastings

 hast good time day unto graciou lord 
 gloucest as much unto good lord chamberlain 
 well welcom open air 
 how hath lordship brook imprison 
 hast with patienc nobl lord prison must 
 but i shall live lord give thanks
 that caus imprison 
 gloucest no doubt doubt shall clarenc 
 for enemi 
 and prevail much 
 hast more piti eagl mew d
 while kite buzzard prey liberti 
 gloucest what news abroad 
 hast no news bad abroad home 
 the king sickli weak melancholi 
 and physician fear mightili 
 gloucest now saint john news bad inde 
 o hath kept evil diet long
 and overmuch consum royal person 
 ti grievou thought upon 
 where in bed 
 hast he 
 gloucest go i follow 
 exit hastings
 he can not live i hope must die
 till georg pack posthors heaven 
 i urg hatr clarence
 with lie well steel weighti argument 
 and i fail deep intent 
 clarenc hath anoth day live 
 which done god take king edward merci 
 and leav world bustl 
 for i marri warwick youngest daughter 
 what though i kill husband father 
 the readiest way make wench amends
 is becom husband father 
 the i much love
 as anoth secret close intent
 by marri i must reach unto 
 but yet i run hors market 
 clarenc still breath edward still live reign 
 when gone must i count gain exit

scen 2 

london anoth street

ent corps king henri the sixth halberd guard 
ladi ann mourner attend tressel berkeley

 ann set set honour load 
 if honour may shroud hears 
 whilst i awhil obsequi lament
 th untim fall virtuou lancast 
 poor key cold figur holi king 
 pale ash hous lancast 
 thou bloodless remnant royal blood 
 be law i invoc thi ghost
 to hear lament poor ann 
 wife thi edward thi slaughter son 
 stabb self hand made wound 
 lo window let forth thi life
 i pour helpless balm poor eye 
 o curs hand made hole 
 curs heart heart 
 curs blood let blood henc 
 more dire hap betid hate wretch
 that make us wretch death thee
 than i wish adder spider toad 
 or creep venom thing live 
 if ever child abort 
 prodigi untim brought light 
 whose ugli unnatur aspect
 may fright hope mother view 
 and heir unhappi 
 if ever wife let made
 more miser death him
 than i made young lord thee 
 come toward chertsey holi load 
 taken paul inter 
 and still weari weight
 rest while i lament king henri cors 
 the bearer take coffin 

 enter gloucester

 gloucest stay bear cors set 
 ann what black magician conjur fiend
 to stop devot charit deed 
 gloucest villain set cors saint paul 
 i make cors disobey 
 first gentleman my lord stand back let coffin
 pass 
 gloucest unmannerd dog stand thou i command 
 advanc thi halberd higher breast 
 or saint paul i strike thee foot
 and spurn upon thee beggar thi bold 
 the bearer set coffin 
 ann what trembl are afraid 
 ala i blame mortal 
 and mortal eye can not endur devil 
 avaunt thou dread minist hell 
 thou hadst power mortal bodi 
 hi soul thou canst therefor gone 
 gloucest sweet saint chariti curst 
 ann foul devil god sake henc troubl us 
 for thou hast made happi earth thi hell
 fill curs cri deep exclaim 
 if thou delight view thi heinou deed 
 behold pattern thi butcheri 
 o gentlemen see see dead henri wounds
 open congeal mouth bleed afresh 
 blush blush thou lump foul deform 
 for ti thi presenc exhal blood
 from cold empti vein blood dwell 
 thi deed inhuman unnatural
 provok delug unnatur 
 o god blood mad st reveng death 
 o earth blood drink st reveng death 
 either heav n lightn strike murd rer dead 
 or earth gape open wide eat quick 
 as thou dost swallow good king blood 
 which hell govern arm hath butcher 
 gloucest ladi know rule chariti 
 which render good bad bless curs 
 ann villain thou knowest law god man 
 no beast fierc know touch piti 
 gloucest but i know none therefor beast 
 ann o wonder devil tell truth 
 gloucest more wonder angel angri 
 vouchsaf divin perfect woman 
 of suppos crime give leave
 by circumst acquit 
 ann vouchsaf diffu infect man 
 of known evil give leave
 by circumst accus thi curs self 
 gloucest fairer tongu name thee let have
 some patient leisur excus 
 ann fouler heart think thee thou canst make
 no excus current hang thyself 
 gloucest by despair i accus 
 ann and despair shalt thou stand excused
 for worthi vengeanc thyself
 that didst unworthi slaughter upon other 
 gloucest say i slew 
 ann then say slain 
 but dead devilish slave thee 
 gloucest i kill husband 
 ann whi aliv 
 gloucest nay dead slain edward hand 
 ann in thi foul throat thou liest queen margaret saw
 thi murd rou falchion smoke blood 
 the thou didst bend breast 
 but thi brother beat asid point 
 gloucest i provok sland rou tongue
 that laid guilt upon guiltless shoulder 
 ann thou wast provok thi bloodi mind 
 that never dream st aught butcheri 
 didst thou kill king 
 gloucest i grant ye 
 ann dost grant hedgehog then god grant to
 thou mayst damn wick deed 
 o gentl mild virtuou 
 gloucest the better king heaven hath
 
 ann he heaven thou shalt never come 
 gloucest let thank holp send him
 thither 
 for fitter place earth 
 ann and thou unfit place hell 
 gloucest ye one place els hear name 
 ann some dungeon 
 gloucest your bed chamber 
 ann ill rest betid chamber thou liest 
 gloucest so madam till i lie 
 ann i hope 
 gloucest i know but gentl ladi ann 
 to leav keen encount wit 
 and fall someth slower method 
 is causer timeless deaths
 of plantagenet henri edward 
 as blame execution 
 ann thou wast caus accur effect 
 gloucest your beauti caus effect 
 your beauti haunt sleep
 to undertak death world
 so i might live one hour sweet bosom 
 ann if i thought i tell thee homicid 
 these nail rend beauti cheek 
 gloucest these eye could endur beauti s
 wreck 
 you blemish i stood 
 as world cheer sun 
 so i day life 
 ann black night ershad thi day death thi life 
 gloucest curs thyself fair creatur thou art 
 ann i would i reveng thee 
 gloucest it quarrel unnatur 
 to reveng loveth thee 
 ann it quarrel reason 
 to reveng kill husband 
 gloucest he bereft thee ladi thi husband
 did help thee better husband 
 ann hi better doth breath upon earth 
 gloucest he live love thee better could 
 ann name 
 gloucest plantagenet 
 ann whi 
 gloucest the self name one better natur 
 ann where 
 gloucest here she spit whi dost thou spit
 
 ann would mortal poison thi sake 
 gloucest never came poison sweet place 
 ann never hung poison fouler toad 
 out sight thou dost infect mine eye 
 gloucest thine eye sweet ladi infect mine 
 ann would basilisk strike thee dead 
 gloucest i would i might die 
 for kill live death 
 those eye thine mine drawn salt tear 
 sham aspect store childish drop 
 these eye never shed remors tear 
 no father york edward wept
 to hear piteou moan rutland made
 when black fac clifford shook sword 
 nor thi warlik father like child 
 told sad stori father death 
 and twenti time made paus sob weep
 that stander wet cheeks
 like tree bedash rain sad time
 my manli eye scorn humbl tear 
 and sorrow could thenc exhale
 thi beauti hath made blind weep 
 i never su friend enemi 
 my tongu could never learn sweet smooth word 
 but thi beauti propo fee 
 my proud heart sue prompt tongu speak 
 she look scorn 
 teach thi lip scorn made
 for kiss ladi contempt 
 if thi reveng heart can not forgiv 
 lo i lend thee sharp point sword 
 which thou pleas hide true breast
 and let soul forth adoreth thee 
 i lay nake deadli stroke 
 and humbl beg death upon knee 
 he lay breast open offer sword 
 nay paus i kill king henri 
 but twa thi beauti provok 
 nay dispatch twa i stabb young edward 
 but twa thi heavenli face set 
 she fall sword 
 take sword take 
 ann aris dissembl though i wish thi death 
 i thi execution 
 gloucest then bid kill i 
 ann i alreadi 
 gloucest that thi rage 
 speak even word
 thi hand thi love kill thi love 
 shall thi love kill far truer love 
 to death shalt thou accessari 
 ann i would i knew thi heart 
 gloucest ti figur tongu 
 ann i fear fals 
 gloucest then never man true 
 ann well put sword 
 gloucest say peac made 
 ann that shalt thou know hereaft 
 gloucest but shall i live hope 
 ann all men i hope live 
 gloucest vouchsaf wear ring 
 ann to take give put ring 
 gloucest look ring encompasseth thi finger 
 even thi breast encloseth poor heart 
 wear thine 
 and thi poor devot servant may
 but beg one favour thi graciou hand 
 thou dost confirm happi ever 
 ann what 
 gloucest that may pleas leav sad designs
 to hath caus mourner 
 and present repair crosbi hous 
 where i solemnli interr d
 at chertsey monast ry nobl king 
 and wet grave repent tear 
 i expedi duti see 
 for diver unknown reason i beseech 
 grant boon 
 ann with heart much joy too
 to see becom penit 
 tressel berkeley go along 
 gloucest bid farewel 
 ann ti deserv 
 but sinc teach flatter 
 imagin i said farewel alreadi 
 exeunt two gentlemen with ladi anne
 gloucest sir take cors 
 gentlemen toward chertsey nobl lord 
 gloucest no white friar attend come 
 exeunt gloucester
 wa ever woman humour woo 
 wa ever woman humour 
 i i keep long 
 what i kill husband father 
 to take heart extremest hate 
 with curs mouth tear eye 
 the bleed wit hatr 
 have god conscienc bar 
 and i friend back suit all
 but plain devil dissembl look 
 and yet win world noth 
 ha 
 hath forgot alreadi brave princ 
 edward lord i three month sinc 
 stabb angri mood tewksburi 
 a sweeter loveli gentleman 
 fram prodig natur 
 young valiant wise doubt right royal 
 the spaciou world can not afford 
 and yet abas eye 
 that cropp golden prime sweet prince
 and made widow woeful bed 
 on whose equal edward moieti 
 on halt misshapen thu 
 my dukedom beggarli denier 
 i mistak person 
 upon life find although i can not 
 myself marv llou proper man 
 i charg look glass 
 and entertain score two tailors
 to studi fashion adorn bodi 
 sinc i crept favour 
 i maintain littl cost 
 but first i turn yon fellow grave 
 and return lament love 
 shine fair sun till i bought glass 
 that i may see shadow i pass exit

scen 4 

london the tower

ent clarenc keeper

 keeper whi look grace heavili day 
 clarenc o i pass miser night 
 so full fear dream ugli sight 
 that i christian faith man 
 i would spend anoth night
 though twere buy world happi day 
 so full dismal terror time 
 keeper what dream lord i pray you
 tell 
 clarenc methought i broken tower
 and embark cross burgundi 
 and compani brother gloucest 
 who cabin tempt walk
 upon hatch thenc look toward england 
 and cite thousand heavi time 
 dure war york lancast 
 that befal n us as pac along
 upon giddi foot hatch 
 methought gloucest stumbl falling
 struck thought stay overboard
 into tumbl billow main 
 o lord methought pain drown 
 what dread nois water ear 
 what sight ugli death within eye 
 methought i saw thousand fear wreck 
 a thousand men fish gnaw upon 
 wedg gold great anchor heap pearl 
 inestim stone unvalu jewel 
 all scatt red bottom sea 
 some lay dead men skull holes
 where eye inhabit crept 
 as twere scorn eye reflect gem 
 that woo slimi bottom deep
 and mock dead bone lay scatt red 
 keeper had leisur time death
 to gaze upon secret deep 
 clarenc methought i often i strive
 to yield ghost still enviou flood
 stopp soul would let forth
 to find empti vast wand ring air 
 but smother within pant bulk 
 who almost burst belch sea 
 keeper awak sore agoni 
 clarenc no dream lengthen life 
 o began tempest soul 
 i pass methought melancholi flood
 with sour ferryman poet write 
 unto kingdom perpetu night 
 the first greet stranger soul
 wa great father law renown warwick 
 who spake aloud what scourg perjury
 can dark monarchi afford fals clarenc 
 and vanish then came wand ring by
 a shadow like angel bright hair
 dabbl blood shriek aloud
 clarenc come fals fleet perjur clarenc 
 that stabb field tewksburi 
 seiz furi take unto torment 
 with methought legion foul fiends
 environ howl mine ears
 such hideou cri nois 
 i trembl wak season after
 could believ i hell 
 such terribl impress made dream 
 keeper no marvel lord though affright 
 i afraid methink hear tell 
 clarenc ah keeper keeper i done things
 that give evid soul
 for edward sake see requit 
 o god if deep prayer can not appeas thee 
 but thou wilt aveng misde 
 yet execut thi wrath alon 
 o spare guiltless wife poor children 
 keeper i prithe sit awhil 
 my soul heavi i fain would sleep 
 keeper i lord god give grace good rest 
 clarenc sleep

act ii scene 1

 work

 dissembl hatr swear love

 and hand i seal true heart love 
 hast so thrive i i truli swear like

 lest he suprem king kings
 confound hidden falsehood award
 either end

 of nobl cousin buckingham

 they start

 enter derby

 derbi a boon sovereign servic done 
 king edward i prithe peac soul full sorrow 
 derbi i will rise unless high hear 
 king edward then say thou request 
 derbi the forfeit sovereign servant life 
 who slew day riotou gentleman
 late attend duke norfolk 
 king edward have i tongu doom brother death 
 and shall tongu give pardon slave 
 my brother kill man fault thought 
 and yet punish bitter death 
 who su who wrath 
 kneel feet bid advi 
 who spoke brotherhood who spoke love 
 who told poor soul forsake
 the mighti warwick fight 
 who told field tewksbury
 when oxford rescu me
 and said dear brother live king 
 who told lay field
 frozen almost death lap me
 even garment give 
 all thin nake numb cold night 
 all remembr brutish wrath
 sin pluck man you
 had much race put mind 
 but carter wait vassals
 have done drunken slaughter defac d
 the preciou imag dear redeem 
 you straight knee pardon pardon 
 and i unjustli must grant derbi rise 
 but brother man would speak 
 nor i ungraci speak unto myself
 for poor soul the proudest all
 have behold life 
 yet none would beg life 
 o god i fear thi justic take hold
 on mine 
 come hast help closet ah poor clarenc 
 exeunt king queen
 gloucest thi fruit rash mark not
 how guilti kindr queen
 look pale hear clarenc death 
 o urg still unto king

 to comfort edward compani

scen 2 

london the palace

ent old duchess of york son daughter clarence

 son good grandam tell us father dead 
 duchess no boy 
 daughter whi weep oft beat breast 
 and cri o clarenc unhappi son 
 son whi look us shake head 
 and call us orphan wretch castaway 
 if nobl father aliv 
 duchess my pretti cousin mistak 
 i lament sick king 
 as loath lose father death 
 it lost sorrow wail one lost 
 son then conclud grandam dead 
 the king mine uncl blame 
 god reveng i importune
 with earnest prayer effect 
 daughter and i 
 duchess peac children peac the king doth love you
 well 
 incap shallow innoc 
 you can not guess cau father death 
 son grandam good uncl gloucester
 told king provok queen 
 devi impeach imprison 
 and uncl told wept 
 and piti kindli kiss cheek 
 bade reli father 
 and would love dearli child 
 duchess ah deceit steal gentl shape 
 and virtuou vizor hide deep vice 
 he son ay therein shame 
 yet dug drew deceit 
 son think uncl dissembl grandam 
 duchess ay boy 
 son i can not think hark nois 

 enter queen elizabeth hair her
 ear river dorset her

 queen elizabeth ah shall hinder wail and
 weep 
 to chide fortun torment 
 i join black despair soul
 and becom enemi 
 duchess what mean scene rude impati 
 queen elizabeth to make act tragic violenc 
 edward lord thi son king dead 
 whi grow branch root gone 
 whi wither leav want sap 
 if live lament die brief 
 that swift wing soul may catch king 
 or like obedi subject follow him
 to new kingdom ne er chang night 
 duchess ah much interest i thi sorrow
 as i titl thi nobl husband 
 i bewept worthi husband death 
 and liv look imag 
 but two mirror princ semblance
 are crack piec malign death 
 and i comfort one fals glass 
 that griev i see shame 
 thou art widow yet thou art mother
 and hast comfort thi children left 
 but death hath snatch husband mine arms
 and pluck two crutch feebl hand 
 clarenc edward o caus i 
 thine moieti moan 
 to overgo thi woe drown thi cri 
 son ah aunt wept father death 
 how aid kindr tear 
 daughter our fatherless distress left unmoan 
 your widow dolour likewis unwept 
 queen elizabeth give help lament 
 i barren bring forth complaint 
 all spring reduc current mine eyes
 that i govern wateri moon 
 may send forth plenteou tear drown world 
 ah husband dear lord edward 
 children ah father dear lord clarenc 
 duchess ala mine edward clarenc 
 queen elizabeth what stay i edward s
 gone 
 children what stay clarenc gone 
 duchess what stay i gone 
 queen elizabeth wa never widow dear loss 
 children were never orphan dear loss 
 duchess wa never mother dear loss 
 ala i mother grief 
 their woe parcel mine gener 
 she edward weep i 
 i clarenc weep doth 
 these babe clarenc weep i 
 i edward weep 
 ala three threefold distress 
 pour tear i sorrow nurs 
 and i pamper lament 
 dorset comfort dear mother god much displea d
 that take unthank 
 in common worldli thing ti call ungrateful
 with dull unwilling repay debt
 which bounteou hand kindli lent 
 much thu opposit heaven 
 for requir royal debt lent 
 river madam bethink like care mother 
 of young princ son send straight 
 let crown comfort live 
 drown desper sorrow dead edward grave 
 and plant joy live edward throne 

 enter gloucest buckingham derbi 
 hast ratcliff

 gloucest sister comfort all us cause
 to wail dim shine star 
 but none help harm wail 
 madam mother i cri merci 
 i see grace humbl knee
 i crave bless 
 duchess god bless thee put meek thi breast 
 love chariti obedi true duti 
 gloucest amen asid and make die good old
 man 
 that butt end mother bless 
 i marvel grace leav 
 buckingham you cloudi princ heart sorrowing
 peer 
 that bear heavi mutual load moan 
 now cheer love 
 though spent harvest king 
 we reap harvest son 
 the broken rancour high swol n heart 
 but late splinter knit join togeth 
 must gentli preserv cherish kept 
 me seemeth good littl train 
 forthwith ludlow young princ fet
 hither london crown king 

 river whi littl train lord of
 buckingham 
 buckingham marri lord lest multitude
 the new heal wound malic break 
 which would much dangerous
 by much estat green yet ungovern 
 where everi hors bear command rein
 and may direct cours pleas 
 as well fear harm harm appar 
 in opinion ought prevent 
 gloucest i hope king made peac us 
 and compact firm true 
 river and i think 
 yet sinc green put
 to appar likelihood breach 
 which hapli much compani might urg 
 therefor i say nobl buckingham
 that meet fetch princ 
 hast and say i 
 gloucest then go determine
 who shall straight shall post ludlow 
 madam sister go
 to give censur busi 
 exeunt buckingham gloucester
 buckingham my lord whoever journey princ 
 for god sake let us two stay home 
 for way i sort occas 
 as index stori late talk 
 to part queen proud kindr princ

 my oracl prophet dear cousin 
 i child go thi direct 
 toward ludlow stay behind exeunt

scen 3 

london a street

ent one citizen one door anoth other

 first citizen good morrow neighbour whither away so
 fast

 hear news abroad 
 first citizen ye king dead 
 second citizen ill news r ladi seldom come the
 better 
 i fear i fear twill prove giddi world 

 enter anoth citizen

 third citizen neighbour god speed 
 first citizen give good morrow sir 
 third citizen doth news hold good king edward s
 death 
 second citizen ay sir true god help 
 third citizen then master look see troublous
 world 
 first citizen no god good grace son shall
 reign 
 third citizen woe land govern child 
 second citizen in hope govern 
 which nonag council 
 and full ripen year 
 no doubt shall till govern well 
 first citizen so stood state henri sixth
 wa crown pari nine month old 
 third citizen stood state no good friend 
 god wot 
 for land famous enrich d
 with polit grave counsel king
 had virtuou uncl protect grace 
 first citizen whi hath father and
 mother 
 third citizen better came father 
 or father none 
 for emul shall nearest
 will touch us near god prevent 
 o full danger duke gloucest 
 and queen son brother haught proud 
 and rul rule 
 thi sickli land might solac 
 first citizen come come fear worst be
 well 
 third citizen when cloud seen wise men put on
 cloak 
 when great leav fall winter hand 
 when sun set doth look night 
 untim storm make men expect dearth 
 all may well god sort 
 ti deserv i expect 
 second citizen truli heart men fun fear 
 you can not reason almost man
 that look heavili fun dread 
 third citizen befor day chang still 
 by divin instinct men mind mistrust
 ensu danger proof see
 the water swell boist rou storm 
 but leav god whither away 
 second citizen marri sent justic 
 third citizen and i i bear compani

london the palace

ent archbishop of york young duke of york queen elizabeth 
and duchess of york

 and northampton rest night 
 to morrow next day

 i hope much grown sinc last i saw 
 queen elizabeth but i hear say son york
 ha almost overta en growth 
 york ay mother i would 
 duchess whi good cousin good grow 
 york grandam one night sit supper 
 my uncl river talk i grow
 more brother ay quoth uncl gloucester
 small herb grace great weed grow apac 
 and sinc methink i would grow fast 
 becaus sweet flow rs slow weed make hast 
 duchess good faith good faith say hold
 in object thee 
 he wretch st thing young 
 so long grow leisurely
 that rule true graciou 
 archbishop and doubt graciou madam 
 duchess i hope yet let mother doubt 
 york now troth i rememb red 
 i could given uncl grace flout
 to touch growth nearer touch mine 
 duchess how young york i prithe let hear 
 york marri say uncl grew fast
 that could gnaw crust two hour old 
 twa full two year ere i could get tooth 
 grandam would bite jest

 york grandam nurs

 born

 shrewd

 are sent pomfret them
 sir thoma vaughan prison

 insult tyranni begin jet

 my husband lost life get crown 
 and often son toss d
 for joy weep gain loss 
 and seat domest broils
 clean blown conquerors
 make war upon brother brother

 sanctuari

act iii scene 1 

london a street

th trumpet sound enter princ of wale gloucest buckingham 
catesbi cardin bourchier others

 buckingham welcom sweet princ london your
 chamber 
 gloucest welcom dear cousin thought sovereign 
 the weari way hath made melancholi 
 princ no uncl cross way
 have made tediou wearisom heavi 
 i want uncl welcom 
 gloucest sweet princ untaint virtu your
 years
 hath yet div world deceit 
 nor distinguish man
 than outward show god he know 
 seldom never jumpeth heart 
 those uncl want danger 
 your grace attend sug red words
 but look poison heart 
 god keep fals friend 
 princ god keep fals friend were
 none 
 gloucest my lord mayor london come greet
 

 enter lord mayor train

 mayor god bless grace health happi day 
 princ i thank good lord thank 
 i thought mother brother york
 would long ere met us way 
 fie slug hast come not
 to tell us whether come 

 enter lord hastings

 buckingham and good time come sweating
 lord 
 princ welcom lord what mother come 
 hast on occas god he know i 
 the queen mother brother york
 have taken sanctuari the tender prince
 would fain come meet grace 
 but mother perforc withheld 
 buckingham fie indirect peevish course
 is lord cardin grace
 persuad queen send duke york
 unto princ brother present 
 if deni lord hast go him
 and jealou arm pluck perforc 
 cardin my lord buckingham weak oratory
 can mother win duke york 
 anon expect obdurate
 to mild entreati god heaven forbid
 we infring holi privilege
 of bless sanctuari not land
 would i guilti deep sin 
 buckingham you senseless obstin lord 
 too ceremoni tradit 
 weigh gross age 
 you break sanctuari seiz 
 the benefit thereof alway granted
 to whose deal deserv place
 and wit claim place 
 thi princ hath neither claim deserv 
 and therefor mine opinion can not 
 then take thenc 
 you break privileg charter 
 oft i heard sanctuari men 
 but sanctuari children never till 
 cardin my lord shall errul mind 
 come lord hast go 
 hast i go lord 
 princ good lord make speedi hast may 
 exeunt cardin hastings
 say uncl gloucest brother come 
 where shall sojourn till coron 
 gloucest where seem best unto royal self 
 if i may counsel day two
 your high shall repos tower 
 then pleas shall thought fit
 for best health recreat 
 princ i like tower place 
 did juliu caesar build place lord 
 buckingham he graciou lord begin place 
 which sinc succeed age edifi 
 princ is upon record els reported
 success age age built 
 buckingham upon record graciou lord 
 princ but say lord regist red 
 methink truth eve age age 
 as twere retail poster 
 even gener end day 
 gloucest asid so wise young say never
 live long 
 princ what say uncl 
 gloucest i say without charact fame live long 
 asid thu like formal vice iniqu 
 i moral two mean one word 
 princ that juliu caesar famou man 
 with valour enrich wit 
 hi wit set make valour live 
 death make conquest conqueror 
 for live fame though life 
 i tell cousin buckingham 
 buckingham what graciou lord 
 princ an i live i man 
 i win ancient right franc 
 or die soldier i liv king 
 gloucest asid short summer lightli forward
 spring 

 enter hast young york cardinal

 buckingham now good time come duke of
 york 
 princ richard york fare love brother 
 york well dread lord must i 
 princ ay brother grief 
 too late die might kept titl 
 which death hath lost much majesti 
 gloucest how fare cousin nobl lord york 
 york i thank gentl uncl o lord 
 you said idl weed fast growth 
 the princ brother hath outgrown far 
 gloucest he hath lord 
 york and therefor idl 
 gloucest o fair cousin i must say 
 york then behold i 
 gloucest he may command sovereign 
 but power kinsman 
 york i pray uncl give dagger 
 gloucest my dagger littl cousin with heart 
 princ a beggar brother 
 york of kind uncl i know give 
 and toy grief give 
 gloucest a greater gift i give cousin 
 york a greater gift o sword 
 gloucest ay gentl cousin light enough 
 york o i see part light gift 
 in weightier thing say beggar nay 
 gloucest it heavi grace wear 
 york i weigh lightli heavier 
 gloucest what would weapon little
 lord 
 york i would i might thank call 
 gloucest how 
 york littl 
 princ my lord york still cross talk 
 uncl grace know bear 
 york you mean bear bear 
 uncl brother mock 
 becaus i littl like ape 
 he think bear shoulder 
 buckingham with sharp provid wit reason 
 to mitig scorn give uncle
 he prettili aptli taunt 
 so cun young wonder 
 gloucest my lord pleas pass along 
 myself good cousin buckingham
 will mother entreat her
 to meet tower welcom 
 york what go unto tower lord 
 princ my lord protector need 
 york i shall sleep quiet tower 
 gloucest whi fear 
 york marri uncl clarenc angri ghost 
 my grandam told murder 
 princ i fear uncl dead 
 gloucest nor none live i hope 
 princ an live i hope i need fear 
 but come lord heavi heart 
 think go i unto tower 
 a sennet 
 exeunt gloucest buckingham catesby
 buckingham think lord littl prate york
 wa incens subtl mother
 to taunt scorn thu opprobri 
 gloucest no doubt doubt o ti peril boy 
 bold quick ingeni forward capabl 
 he mother top toe 
 buckingham well let rest come hither catesbi 
 thou art sworn deepli effect intend
 as close conceal impart 
 thou know st reason urg upon way 
 what think st thou is easi matter
 to make william lord hast mind 
 for instal nobl duke
 in seat royal famou isl 
 catesbi he father sake love prince
 that aught 
 buckingham what think st thou stanley will
 
 catesbi he hast doth 
 buckingham well go gentle
 catesbi 
 and far sound thou lord hastings
 how doth stand affect purpos 
 and summon morrow tower 
 to sit coron 
 if thou dost find tractabl us 
 encourag tell reason 
 if leaden ici cold unwil 
 be thou break talk 
 and give us notic inclin 
 for morrow hold divid council 
 wherein thyself shalt highli employ 
 gloucest commend lord william tell 
 catesbi 
 hi ancient knot danger adversaries
 to morrow let blood pomfret castl 
 and bid lord joy good news 
 give mistress shore one gentl kiss 
 buckingham good catesbi go effect busi soundli 
 catesbi my good lord heed i 
 gloucest shall hear catesbi ere sleep 
 catesbi you shall lord 
 gloucest at crosbi hous shall find us 
 exit catesby
 buckingham now lord shall we
 perceive
 lord hast yield complot 
 gloucest chop head someth will
 determin 
 and look i king claim thou me
 the earldom hereford movables
 whereof king brother possess 
 buckingham i claim promis grace hand 
 gloucest and look yield kind 
 come let us sup betim afterwards
 we may digest complot form exeunt

scen 2 

befor lord hast s house

ent messeng door hastings

 messeng my lord lord knock 
 hast within who knock 
 messeng one lord stanley 
 hast within what clock 
 messeng upon stroke four 

 enter lord hastings

 hast can not lord stanley sleep tedious
 night 
 messeng so appear i say 
 first commend nobl self 
 hast what 
 messeng then certifi lordship night
 he dreamt boar raze helm 
 besid say two council kept 
 and may determin one
 which may make rue th 
 therefor send know lordship pleasur 
 if present take hors him
 and speed post toward north
 to shun danger soul divin 
 hast go fellow go return unto thi lord 
 bid fear separ council 
 hi honour one 
 and good friend catesbi 
 where noth proceed toucheth us
 whereof i shall intellig 
 tell fear shallow without instanc 
 and dream i wonder simple
 to trust mock ry unquiet slumber 
 to fli boar boar pursues
 were incens boar follow us
 and make pursuit mean chase 
 go bid thi master rise come 
 and togeth tower 
 where shall see boar use us kindli 
 messeng i go lord tell say 
 exit

 enter catesby

 catesbi mani good morrow nobl lord 
 hast good morrow catesbi earli stir 
 what news news tott ring state 
 catesbi it reel world inde lord 
 and i believ never stand upright
 till richard wear garland realm 
 hast how wear garland dost thou mean the
 crown 
 catesbi ay good lord 
 hast i crown mine cut my
 shoulders
 befor i see crown foul misplac 
 but canst thou guess doth aim 
 catesbi ay life hope find forward
 upon parti gain thereof 
 and thereupon send good news 
 that day enemi 
 the kindr queen must die pomfret 
 hast inde i mourner news 
 becaus still adversari 
 but i give voic richard side
 to bar master heir true descent 
 god know i death 
 catesbi god keep lordship graciou mind 
 hast but i shall laugh twelv month henc 
 that brought master hate 
 i live look upon tragedi 
 well catesbi ere fortnight make older 
 i send pack yet think 
 catesbi ti vile thing die graciou lord 
 when men unprepar look 
 hast o monstrou monstrou and fall out
 with river vaughan grey twill do
 with men els think safe
 as thou i thou knowest dear
 to princ richard buckingham 
 catesbi the princ make high account 
 asid for account head upon bridg 
 hast i know i well deserv 

 enter lord stanley

 come come boar spear man 
 fear boar go unprovid 
 stanley my lord good morrow good morrow catesbi 
 you may jest holi rood 
 i like sever council i 
 hast my lord i hold life dear 
 and never day i protest 
 wa preciou ti 
 think i know state secur 
 i would triumphant i 
 stanley the lord pomfret rode from
 london 
 were jocund suppo state sure 
 and inde caus mistrust 
 but yet see soon day ercast 
 thi sudden stab rancour i misdoubt 
 pray god i say i prove needless coward 
 what shall toward tower the day spent 
 hast come come wot my
 lord 
 to day lord talk behead 
 stanley they truth might better wear their
 heads
 than accu wear hat 
 but come lord let away 

 enter hast pursuivant

 hast go i talk good fellow

 how hast how goe world thee 
 pursuiv the better lordship pleas ask 
 hast i tell thee man ti better now
 than thou met st last meet 
 then i go prison tower
 by suggest queen alli 
 but i tell thee keep thyself 
 thi day enerni put death 
 and i better state e er i

 hast gramerci hast drink 
 throw purs

scen 3 

pomfret castle

ent sir richard ratcliff halberd carri nobl 
river grey vaughan death

 river sir richard ratcliff let tell thee 
 to day shalt thou behold subject die
 for truth duti loyalti 
 grey god bless princ pack 
 a knot damn blood sucker 
 vaughan you live shall cri woe hereaft 
 ratcliff dispatch limit live 
 river o pomfret pomfret o thou bloodi prison 
 fatal omin nobl peer 
 within guilti closur thi walls
 richard second hack death 
 and slander thi dismal seat 
 we give thee guiltless blood drink 
 grey now margaret curs fall n upon head 
 when exclaim hast i 
 for stand richard stabb son 
 river then cur richard cur she
 buckingham

 and sister princ son

london the tower

ent buckingham derbi hast bishop eli ratcliff lovel 
with other seat table

 hast now nobl peer caus met
 is determin coron 
 in god name speak royal day
