the prologue

 enter choru 

choru 
two household alik digniti 
in fair verona lay scene 
from ancient grudg break new mutini 
where civil blood make civil hand unclean 
from forth fatal loin two foes
a pair star cross lover take life 
whose misadventur piteou overthrows
doth death buri parent strife 
the fear passag death mark love 
and continu parent rage 
which children end nought could remov 
i two hour traffic stage 
the patient ear attend 
what shall miss toil shall strive mend 

 _exit _ 



act i

scen i a public place 

 enter sampson gregori arm sword buckler 

sampson 
gregori word carri coal 

gregori 
no collier 

sampson 
i mean choler draw 

gregori 
ay live draw neck collar 

sampson 
i strike quickli move 

gregori 
but thou art quickli move strike 

sampson 
a dog hous montagu move 

gregori 
to move stir valiant stand therefor thou
art move thou runn st away 

sampson 
a dog hous shall move stand 
i take wall man maid montagu 

gregori 
that show thee weak slave weakest goe wall 

sampson 
true therefor women weaker vessel ever thrust to
th wall therefor i push montagu men wall and
thrust maid wall 

gregori 
the quarrel master us men 

sampson 
 ti one i show tyrant i fought the
men i civil maid i cut head 

gregori 
the head maid 

sampson 
ay head maid maidenhead take sense
th wilt 

gregori 
they must take sens feel 

sampson 
me shall feel i abl stand ti known i a
pretti piec flesh 

gregori 
 ti well thou art fish thou hadst thou hadst poor john 
draw thi tool come hous montagu 

 enter abram balthasar 

sampson 
mi nake weapon quarrel i back thee 

gregori 
how turn thi back run 

sampson 
fear 

gregori 
no marri i fear thee 

sampson 
let us take law side let begin 

gregori 
i frown i pass let take list 

sampson 
nay dare i bite thumb disgrac to
them bear 

abram 
do bite thumb us sir 

sampson 
i bite thumb sir 

abram 
do bite thumb us sir 

sampson 
i law side i say ay 

gregori 
no 

sampson 
no sir i bite thumb sir i bite thumb sir 

gregori 
do quarrel sir 

abram 
quarrel sir no sir 

sampson 
but sir i serv good man 

abram 
no better 

sampson 
well sir 

 enter benvolio 

gregori 
say better come one master kinsmen 

sampson 
ye better sir 

abram 
you lie 

sampson 
draw men gregori rememb thi wash blow 

 _they fight _ 

benvolio 
part fool put sword know 

 _beat sword _ 

 enter tybalt 

tybalt 
what art thou drawn among heartless hind 
turn thee benvolio look upon thi death 

benvolio 
i keep peac put thi sword 
or manag part men 

tybalt 
what drawn talk peac i hate word
a i hate hell montagu thee 
have thee coward 

 _they fight _ 

 enter three four citizen club 

first citizen 
club bill partisan strike beat 
down capulet down montagu 

 enter capulet gown ladi capulet 

capulet 
what nois give long sword ho 

ladi capulet 
a crutch crutch whi call sword 

capulet 
mi sword i say old montagu come 
and flourish blade spite 

 enter montagu ladi montagu 

montagu 
thou villain capulet hold let go 

ladi montagu 
thou shalt stir one foot seek foe 

 enter princ escalu attend 

princ 
rebelli subject enemi peac 
profan neighbour stain steel 
will hear what ho you men beast 
that quench fire pernici rage
with purpl fountain issu vein 
on pain tortur bloodi hands
throw mistemp weapon ground
and hear sentenc move princ 
three civil brawl bred airi word 
bi thee old capulet montagu 
have thrice disturb quiet street 
and made verona ancient citizens
cast grave beseem ornament 
to wield old partisan hand old 
canker peac part canker hate 
if ever disturb street 
your live shall pay forfeit peac 
for time rest depart away 
you capulet shall go along 
and montagu come afternoon 
to know farther pleasur case 
to old free town common judgement place 
onc pain death men depart 

 _exeunt princ attend capulet ladi capulet tybalt 
 citizen servant _ 

montagu 
who set ancient quarrel new abroach 
speak nephew began 

benvolio 
here servant adversary
and close fight ere i approach 
i drew part instant came
th fieri tybalt sword prepar 
which breath defianc ear 
he swung head cut wind 
who noth hurt withal hiss scorn 
while interchang thrust blows
cam fought part part 
till princ came part either part 

ladi montagu 
o romeo saw today 
right glad i fray 

benvolio 
madam hour worshipp sun
peer forth golden window east 
a troubl mind drave walk abroad 
where underneath grove sycamore
that westward rooteth citi side 
so earli walk i see son 
toward i made ware 
and stole covert wood 
i measur affect 
which sought might found 
be one mani weari self 
pursu humour pursu 
and gladli shunn gladli fled 

montagu 
mani morn hath seen 
with tear augment fresh morn dew 
ad cloud cloud deep sigh 
but soon cheer sun
should farthest east begin draw
th shadi curtain aurora bed 
away light steal home heavi son 
and privat chamber pen 
shut window lock fair daylight out
and make artifici night 
black portent must humour prove 
unless good counsel may caus remov 

benvolio 
mi nobl uncl know caus 

montagu 
i neither know learn 

benvolio 
have importun mean 

montagu 
both mani friend 
but affect counsellor 
i i say true 
but secret close 
so far sound discoveri 
a bud bit enviou worm
er spread sweet leav air 
or dedic beauti sun 
could learn whenc sorrow grow 
we would willingli give cure know 

 enter romeo 

benvolio 
see come so pleas step asid 
i know grievanc much deni 

montagu 
i would thou wert happi thi stay
to hear true shrift come madam let away 

 _exeunt montagu ladi montagu _ 

benvolio 
good morrow cousin 

romeo 
i day young 

benvolio 
but new struck nine 

romeo 
ay sad hour seem long 
wa father went henc fast 

benvolio 
it what sad lengthen romeo hour 

romeo 
not make short 

benvolio 
in love 

romeo 
out 

benvolio 
of love 

romeo 
out favour i love 

benvolio 
ala love gentl view 
should tyrann rough proof 

romeo 
ala love whose view muffl still 
should without eye see pathway 
where shall dine o what fray 
yet tell i heard 
here much hate love 
whi o brawl love o love hate 
o anyth noth first creat 
o heavi light seriou vaniti 
misshapen chao well seem form 
feather lead bright smoke cold fire sick health 
still wake sleep 
thi love feel i feel love 
dost thou laugh 

benvolio 
no coz i rather weep 

romeo 
good heart 

benvolio 
at thi good heart oppress 

romeo 
whi love transgress 
grief mine lie heavi breast 
which thou wilt propag prest
with thine thi love thou hast shown
doth add grief much mine 
love smoke made fume sigh 
be purg fire sparkl lover eye 
be vex sea nourish lover tear 
what els a mad discreet 
a choke gall preserv sweet 
farewel coz 

 _go _ 

benvolio 
soft i go along 
and leav wrong 

romeo 
tut i lost i 
thi romeo 

benvolio 
tell sad love 

romeo 
what shall i groan tell thee 

benvolio 
groan whi sadli tell 

romeo 
bid sick man sad make 
a word ill urg one ill 
in sad cousin i love woman 

benvolio 
i aim near i suppo lov 

romeo 
a right good markman fair i love 

benvolio 
a right fair mark fair coz soonest hit 

romeo 
well hit miss hit
with cupid arrow hath dian wit 
and strong proof chastiti well arm 
from love weak childish bow live uncharm 
she stay sieg love terms
nor bide th encount assail eye 
nor ope lap saint seduc gold 
o rich beauti poor
that die beauti die store 

benvolio 
then hath sworn still live chast 

romeo 
she hath spare make huge wast 
for beauti starv sever 
cut beauti poster 
she fair wise wise fair 
to merit bliss make despair 
she hath forsworn love vow
do i live dead live tell 

benvolio 
be rul forget think 

romeo 
o teach i forget think 

benvolio 
bi give liberti unto thine eye 
examin beauti 

romeo 
 ti way
to call exquisit question 
these happi mask kiss fair ladi brow 
be black put us mind hide fair 
he strucken blind can not forget
th preciou treasur eyesight lost 
show mistress pass fair 
what doth beauti serv note
wher i may read pass pass fair 
farewel thou canst teach forget 

benvolio 
i pay doctrin els die debt 

 _exeunt _ 

scene ii a street 

 enter capulet pari servant 

capulet 
but montagu bound well i 
in penalti alik ti hard i think 
for men old keep peac 

pari 
of honour reckon 
and piti ti liv odd long 
but lord say suit 

capulet 
but say er i said 
mi child yet stranger world 
she hath seen chang fourteen year 
let two summer wither pride
er may think ripe bride 

pari 
younger happi mother made 

capulet 
and soon marr earli made 
the earth hath swallow hope 
she hope ladi earth 
but woo gentl pari get heart 
mi consent part 
and agre within scope choice
li consent fair accord voic 
thi night i hold old accustom feast 
whereto i invit mani guest 
such i love among store 
one welcom make number 
at poor hous look behold night
earth tread star make dark heaven light 
such comfort lusti young men feel
when well apparel april heel
of limp winter tread even delight
among fresh femal bud shall night
inherit hous hear see 
and like whose merit shall 
which view mani mine one 
may stand number though reckon none 
come go go sirrah trudg about
through fair verona find person out
whos name written _give paper_ say 
mi hous welcom pleasur stay 

 _exeunt capulet pari _ 

servant 
find whose name written it written the
shoemak meddl yard tailor last the
fish pencil painter net i sent to
find person whose name writ never find what
nam write person hath writ i must learn in good
tim 

 enter benvolio romeo 

benvolio 
tut man one fire burn anoth burn 
one pain lessen anoth anguish 
turn giddi holp backward turn 
one desper grief cure anoth languish 
take thou new infect thi eye 
and rank poison old die 

romeo 
your plantain leaf excel 

benvolio 
for i pray thee 

romeo 
for broken shin 

benvolio 
whi romeo art thou mad 

romeo 
not mad bound madman 
shut prison kept without food 
whipp torment god den good fellow 

servant 
god gi go den i pray sir read 

romeo 
ay mine fortun miseri 

servant 
perhap learn without book 
but i pray read anyth see 

romeo 
ay if i know letter languag 

servant 
ye say honestli rest merri 

romeo 
stay fellow i read 

 _he read letter _ 

_signior martino wife daughter 
counti anselmo beauteou sister 
the ladi widow utruvio 
signior placentio love niec 
mercutio brother valentin 
mine uncl capulet wife daughter 
mi fair niec rosalin livia 
signior valentio cousin tybalt 
lucio live helena _


a fair assembl _give back paper_ whither come 

servant 
up 

romeo 
whither supper 

servant 
to hous 

romeo 
whose hous 

servant 
mi master 

romeo 
inde i ask 

servant 
now i tell without ask my master great rich capulet 
and hous montagu i pray come crush a
cup wine rest merri 

 _exit _ 

benvolio 
at ancient feast capulet s
sup fair rosalin thou lov st 
with admir beauti verona 
go thither unattaint eye 
compar face i shall show 
and i make thee think thi swan crow 

romeo 
when devout religion mine eye
maintain falsehood turn tear fire 
and often drown could never die 
transpar heret burnt liar 
one fairer love the see sun
n er saw match sinc first world begun 

benvolio 
tut saw fair none els 
herself poi either eye 
but crystal scale let weigh d
your ladi love maid
that i show shine feast 
and shall scant show well show best 

romeo 
i go along sight shown 
but rejoic splendour 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iii room capulet hous 

 enter ladi capulet nurs 

ladi capulet 
nurs daughter call forth 

nurs 
now maidenhead twelv year old 
i bade come what lamb what ladybird 
god forbid where girl what juliet 

 enter juliet 

juliet 
how call 

nurs 
your mother 

juliet 
madam i what 

ladi capulet 
thi matter nurs give leav awhil 
we must talk secret nurs come back 
i rememb thou hear counsel 
thou knowest daughter pretti age 

nurs 
faith i tell age unto hour 

ladi capulet 
she fourteen 

nurs 
i lay fourteen teeth 
and yet teen spoken i four 
she fourteen how long now
to lamma tide 

ladi capulet 
a fortnight odd day 

nurs 
even odd day year 
come lamma eve night shall fourteen 
susan god rest christian soul 
were age well susan god 
she good but i said 
on lamma eve night shall fourteen 
that shall marri i rememb well 
 ti sinc earthquak eleven year 
and wean i never shall forget 
of day year upon day 
for i laid wormwood dug 
sit sun dovehous wall 
mi lord mantua 
nay i bear brain but i said 
when tast wormwood nipple
of dug felt bitter pretti fool 
to see tetchi fall dug 
shake quoth dovehous twa need i trow 
to bid trudg 
and sinc time eleven year 
for could stand alon nay th rood
sh could run waddl 
for even day broke brow 
and husband god soul 
a merri man took child 
 yea quoth dost thou fall upon thi face 
thou wilt fall backward thou hast wit 
wilt thou jule holidam 
the pretti wretch left cri said ay 
to see jest shall come 
i warrant i live thousand year 
i never forget wilt thou jule quoth 
and pretti fool stint said ay 

ladi capulet 
enough i pray thee hold thi peac 

nurs 
ye madam yet i can not choos laugh 
to think leav cri say ay 
and yet i warrant upon brow
a bump big young cockerel stone 
a peril knock cri bitterli 
 yea quoth husband fall st upon thi face 
thou wilt fall backward thou comest age 
wilt thou jule stint said ay 

juliet 
and stint thou i pray thee nurs say i 

nurs 
peac i done god mark thee grace
th wast prettiest babe e er i nur 
and i might live see thee marri i wish 

ladi capulet 
marri marri theme
i came talk tell daughter juliet 
how stand disposit marri 

juliet 
it honour i dream 

nurs 
an honour were i thine nurs 
i would say thou hadst suck wisdom thi teat 

ladi capulet 
well think marriag younger 
here verona ladi esteem 
are made alreadi mother by count
i mother much upon years
that maid thu brief 
the valiant pari seek love 

nurs 
a man young ladi ladi man
a world man wax 

ladi capulet 
verona summer hath flower 

nurs 
nay flower faith flower 

ladi capulet 
what say love gentleman 
thi night shall behold feast 
read er volum young pari face 
and find delight writ beauti pen 
examin everi marri lineament 
and see one anoth lend content 
and obscur fair volum lie 
find written margent eye 
thi preciou book love unbound lover 
to beautifi lack cover 
the fish live sea ti much pride
for fair without fair within hide 
that book mani eye doth share glori 
that gold clasp lock golden stori 
so shall share doth possess 
bi make less 

nurs 
no less nay bigger women grow men 

ladi capulet 
speak briefli like pari love 

juliet 
i look like look like move 
but deep i endart mine eye
than consent give strength make fli 

 enter servant 

servant 
madam guest come supper serv call young lady
ask nurs curs pantri everyth extrem 
i must henc wait i beseech follow straight 

ladi capulet 
we follow thee 

 _exit servant _ 

juliet counti stay 

nurs 
go girl seek happi night happi day 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iv a street 

 enter romeo mercutio benvolio five six masker 
 torch bearer other 

romeo 
what shall speech spoke excus 
or shall without apolog 

benvolio 
the date prolix 
we cupid hoodwink scarf 
bear tartar paint bow lath 
scare ladi like crow keeper 
nor without book prologu faintli spoke
aft prompter entranc 
but let measur us 
we measur measur gone 

romeo 
give torch i ambl 
be heavi i bear light 

mercutio 
nay gentl romeo must danc 

romeo 
not i believ danc shoe 
with nimbl sole i soul lead
so stake ground i can not move 

mercutio 
you lover borrow cupid wing 
and soar common bound 

romeo 
i sore enpierc shaft
to soar light feather bound 
i can not bound pitch dull woe 
under love heavi burden i sink 

mercutio 
and sink burden love 
too great oppress tender thing 

romeo 
i love tender thing it rough 
too rude boister prick like thorn 

mercutio 
if love rough rough love 
prick love prick beat love 
give case put visag _put mask _ 
a visor visor what care i
what curiou eye doth quot deform 
here beetl brow shall blush 

benvolio 
come knock enter sooner in
but everi man betak leg 

romeo 
a torch let wanton light heart 
tickl senseless rush heel 
for i proverb grandsir phrase 
i candl holder look 
the game ne er fair i done 

mercutio 
tut dun mous constabl word 
if thou art dun draw thee mire
or save rever love wherein thou stickest
up ear come burn daylight ho 

romeo 
nay 

mercutio 
i mean sir delay
w wast light vain light light day 
take good mean judgment sits
fiv time ere five wit 

romeo 
and mean well go mask 
but ti wit go 

mercutio 
whi may one ask 

romeo 
i dreamt dream tonight 

mercutio 
and i 

romeo 
well 

mercutio 
that dreamer often lie 

romeo 
in bed asleep dream thing true 

mercutio 
o i see queen mab hath 
she fairi midwif comes
in shape bigger agat stone
on fore finger alderman 
drawn team littl atomies
ov men nose lie asleep 
her waggon spoke made long spinner leg 
the cover wing grasshopp 
her trace smallest spider web 
the collar moonshin wateri beam 
her whip cricket bone lash film 
her waggon small grey coat gnat 
not half big round littl worm
prick lazi finger maid 
her chariot empti hazelnut 
made joiner squirrel old grub 
time mind fairi coachmak 
and state gallop night night
through lover brain dream love 
o er courtier knee dream curtsi straight 
o er lawyer finger straight dream fee 
o er ladi lip straight kiss dream 
which oft angri mab blister plagu 
becaus breath sweetmeat taint 
sometim gallop er courtier nose 
and dream smell suit 
and sometim come tith pig tail 
tickl parson nose lie asleep 
then dream anoth benefic 
sometim driveth er soldier neck 
and dream cut foreign throat 
of breach ambuscado spanish blade 
of health five fathom deep anon
drum ear start wake 
and thu fright swear prayer two 
and sleep thi mab
that plat mane hors night 
and bake elf lock foul sluttish hair 
which untangl much misfortun bode 
thi hag maid lie back 
that press learn first bear 
make women good carriag 
thi 

romeo 
peac peac mercutio peac 
thou talk st noth 

mercutio 
true i talk dream 
which children idl brain 
begot noth vain fantasi 
which thin substanc air 
and inconst wind wooes
even frozen bosom north 
and anger puff away thenc 
turn side dew drop south 

benvolio 
thi wind talk blow us 
supper done shall come late 

romeo 
i fear earli mind misgives
som consequ yet hang star 
shall bitterli begin fear date
with night revel expir term
of despis life clo breast
bi vile forfeit untim death 
but hath steerag course
direct suit on lusti gentlemen 

benvolio 
strike drum 

 _exeunt _ 

scene v a hall capulet hous 

 musician wait enter servant

he shift trencher he scrape trencher

 enter capulet c guest gentlewomen masker

unplagu corn bout 
ah mistress all
wil deni danc she make dainti 
she i swear hath corn am i come near ye

that i worn visor could tell
a whisper tale fair ladi ear 
such would pleas ti gone ti gone ti gone 
you welcom gentlemen come musician play 
a hall hall give room and foot girl

more light knave turn tabl 
and quench fire room grown hot

wer mask

what ladi doth enrich hand
of yonder knight

i know sir 

romeo 
o doth teach torch burn bright 
it seem hang upon cheek night
a rich jewel ethiop ear 
beauti rich use earth dear 
so show snowi dove troop crows
a yonder ladi er fellow show 
the measur done i watch place stand 
and touch make bless rude hand 
did heart love till forswear sight 
for i ne er saw true beauti till night 

tybalt 
thi voic montagu 
fetch rapier boy what dare slave
com hither cover antic face 
to fleer scorn solemn 
now stock honour kin 
to strike dead i hold sin

whi kinsman 
wherefor storm

young romeo

a bear like portli gentleman 
and say truth verona brag him
to virtuou well govern youth 
i would wealth town
her hous disparag

it thou respect 
show fair presenc put frown 
an ill beseem semblanc feast

it fit villain guest 
i endur 

capulet

what goodman boy i say shall go 
am i master go 
you endur god shall mend soul 
you make mutini among guest 
you set cock hoop man

whi uncl ti shame 

capulet 
go go 
you sauci boy is inde 
thi trick may chanc scath i know

well said heart you princox go

i make quiet what cheerli heart

patienc perforc wil choler meeting
mak flesh trembl differ greet 
i withdraw intrus shall 
now seem sweet convert bitter gall

romeo 
 _to juliet _ if i profan unworthiest hand
thi holi shrine gentl sin 
mi lip two blush pilgrim readi stand
to smooth rough touch tender kiss 

juliet

which mannerli devot show 
for saint hand pilgrim hand touch 
and palm palm holi palmer kiss

they pray grant thou lest faith turn despair 

juliet

romeo

thu lip thine sin purg 
 _kiss _ 

juliet

give sin

 _exeunt _ 



act ii

 enter choru 

choru 
now old desir doth deathb lie 
and young affect gape heir 
that fair love groan would die 
with tender juliet match fair 
now romeo belov love 
alik bewitch charm look 
but foe suppo must complain 
and steal love sweet bait fear hook 
be held foe may access
to breath vow lover use swear 
and much love mean much less
to meet new belov anywher 
but passion lend power time mean meet 
temper extrem extrem sweet 

 _exit _ 

scene i an open place adjoin capulet garden 

 enter romeo 

romeo 
can i go forward heart 
turn back dull earth find thi centr 

 _he climb wall leap within _ 

 enter benvolio mercutio 

benvolio 
romeo my cousin romeo romeo 

mercutio 
he wise 
and life hath stol n home bed 

benvolio 
he ran way leap orchard wall 
call good mercutio 

mercutio 
nay i conjur 
romeo humour madman passion lover 
appear thou like sigh 
speak one rhyme i satisfi 
cri ah pronounc love dove 
speak gossip venu one fair word 
one nicknam purblind son heir 
young abraham cupid shot trim
when king cophetua lov beggar maid 
he heareth stirreth moveth 
the ape dead i must conjur 
i conjur thee rosalin bright eye 
bi high forehead scarlet lip 
bi fine foot straight leg quiver thigh 
and demesn adjac lie 
that thi like thou appear us 

benvolio 
an hear thee thou wilt anger 

mercutio 
thi can not anger twould anger him
to rais spirit mistress circl 
of strang natur let stand
til laid conjur 
that spite my invocation
i fair honest mistress name 
i conjur rais 

benvolio 
come hath hid among trees
to consort humor night 
blind love best befit dark 

mercutio 
if love blind love can not hit mark 
now sit medlar tree 
and wish mistress kind fruit
a maid call medlar laugh alon 
o romeo o were
an open ars thou poperin pear 
romeo good night i truckl bed 
thi field bed cold sleep 
come shall go 

benvolio 
go ti vain
to seek mean found 

 _exeunt _ 

scene ii capulet garden 

 enter romeo 

romeo 
he jest scar never felt wound 

 juliet appear window 

but soft light yonder window break 
it east juliet sun 
aris fair sun kill enviou moon 
who alreadi sick pale grief 
that thou maid art far fair 
be maid sinc enviou 
her vestal liveri sick green 
and none fool wear cast 
it ladi o love 
o knew 
she speak yet say noth what 
her eye discours i answer 
i bold ti speak 
two fairest star heaven 
have busi entreat eyes
to twinkl sphere till return 
what eye head 
the bright cheek would shame star 
a daylight doth lamp eye heaven
would airi region stream bright
that bird would sing think night 
see lean cheek upon hand 
o i glove upon hand 
that i might touch cheek 

juliet 
ay 

romeo 
she speak 
o speak bright angel thou art
a gloriou night er head 
a wing messeng heaven
unto white upturn wonder eyes
of mortal fall back gaze him
when bestrid lazi puf clouds
and sail upon bosom air 

juliet 
o romeo romeo wherefor art thou romeo 
deni thi father refus thi name 
or thou wilt sworn love 
and i longer capulet 

romeo 
 _asid _ shall i hear shall i speak 

juliet 
 ti thi name enemi 
thou art thyself though montagu 
what montagu it hand foot 
nor arm face part
belong man o name 
what name that call rose
bi name would smell sweet 
so romeo would romeo call 
retain dear perfect owes
without titl romeo doff thi name 
and thi name part thee 
take 

romeo 
i take thee thi word 
call love i new bapti 
henceforth i never romeo 

juliet 
what man art thou thu bescreen night
so stumblest counsel 

romeo 
bi name
i know tell thee i 
mi name dear saint hate 
becaus enemi thee 
had i written i would tear word 

juliet 
mi ear yet drunk hundr words
of thi tongu utter yet i know sound 
art thou romeo montagu 

romeo 
neither fair maid either thee dislik 

juliet 
how cam st thou hither tell wherefor 
the orchard wall high hard climb 
and place death consid thou art 
if kinsmen find thee 

romeo 
with love light wing i erperch wall 
for stoni limit can not hold love 
and love dare love attempt 
therefor thi kinsmen stop 

juliet 
if see thee murder thee 

romeo 
alack lie peril thine eye
than twenti sword look thou sweet 
and i proof enmiti 

juliet 
i would world saw thee 

romeo 
i night cloak hide eye 
and thou love let find 
mi life better end hate
than death prorogu want thi love 

juliet 
bi whose direct found st thou place 

romeo 
bi love first prompt enquir 
he lent counsel i lent eye 
i pilot yet wert thou far
a vast shore wash farthest sea 
i adventur merchandis 

juliet 
thou knowest mask night face 
els would maiden blush bepaint cheek
for thou hast heard speak tonight 
fain would i dwell form fain fain deny
what i spoke farewel compliment 
dost thou love i know thou wilt say ay 
and i take thi word yet thou swear st 
thou mayst prove fals at lover perjuri 
they say jove laugh o gentl romeo 
if thou dost love pronounc faith 
or thou thinkest i quickli 
i frown pervers say thee nay 
so thou wilt woo but els world 
in truth fair montagu i fond 
and therefor thou mayst think haviour light 
but trust gentleman i prove true
than cun strang 
i strang i must confess 
but thou overheard st ere i ware 
mi true love passion therefor pardon 
and imput yield light love 
which dark night hath discov 

romeo 
ladi yonder bless moon i vow 
that tip silver fruit tree top 

juliet 
o swear moon th inconst moon 
that monthli chang circl orb 
lest thi love prove likewis variabl 

romeo 
what shall i swear 

juliet 
do swear 
or thou wilt swear thi graciou self 
which god idolatri 
and i believ thee 

romeo 
if heart dear love 

juliet 
well swear although i joy thee 
i joy contract tonight 
it rash unadvi sudden 
too like lightn doth ceas be
er one say it lighten sweet good night 
thi bud love summer ripen breath 
may prove beauteou flower next meet 
good night good night as sweet repos rest
com thi heart within breast 

romeo 
o wilt thou leav unsatisfi 

juliet 
what satisfact canst thou tonight 

romeo 
th exchang thi love faith vow mine 

juliet 
i gave thee mine thou didst request 
and yet i would give 

romeo 
would st thou withdraw for purpos love 

juliet 
but frank give thee 
and yet i wish thing i 
mi bounti boundless sea 
mi love deep i give thee 
the i infinit 
i hear nois within dear love adieu 
 _nurs call within _ 
anon good nurs sweet montagu true 
stay littl i come 

 _exit _ 

romeo 
o bless bless night i afeard 
be night dream 
too flatter sweet substanti 

 enter juliet 

juliet 
three word dear romeo good night inde 
if thi bent love honour 
thi purpos marriag send word tomorrow 
bi one i procur come thee 
where time thou wilt perform rite 
and fortun thi foot i lay
and follow thee lord throughout world 

nurs 
 _within _ madam 

juliet

i beseech thee 

nurs 
 _within _ madam 

juliet 
bi i come

tomorrow i send

so thrive soul

romeo 
a thousand time wors want thi light 
love goe toward love schoolboy book 
but love love toward school heavi look 

 _retir slowli _ 

 re enter juliet 

juliet 
hist romeo hist o falcon voice
to lure tassel gentl back 
bondag hoars may speak aloud 
els would i tear cave echo lie 
and make airi tongu hoars mine
with repetit romeo name 

romeo 
it soul call upon name 
how silver sweet sound lover tongu night 
like softest music attend ear 

juliet 
romeo

mi nya 

juliet 
what clock tomorrow
shal i send thee

bi hour nine 

juliet 
i fail ti twenti year till 
i forgot i call thee back 

romeo 
let stand till thou rememb 

juliet 
i shall forget thee still stand 
rememb i love thi compani 

romeo 
and i still stay thee still forget 
forget home 

juliet 
 ti almost morn i would thee gone 
and yet farther wanton bird 
that let hop littl hand 
like poor prison twist gyve 
and silk thread pluck back 
so love jealou liberti 

romeo 
i would i thi bird 

juliet 
sweet would i 
yet i kill thee much cherish 
good night good night part sweet sorrow
that i shall say good night till morrow 

 _exit _ 

romeo 
sleep dwell upon thine eye peac thi breast 
would i sleep peac sweet rest 
the grey ey morn smile frown night 
chequer eastern cloud streak light 
and dark fleckl like drunkard reels
from forth day pathway made titan wheels
henc i ghostli sire cell 
hi help crave dear hap tell 

 _exit _ 

scene iii friar lawrenc cell 

 enter friar lawrenc basket 

friar lawrenc 
now ere sun advanc burn eye 
the day cheer night dank dew dri 
i must upfil osier cage ours
with bale weed preciou juic flower 
the earth natur mother tomb 
what buri grave womb 
and womb children diver kind
w suck natur bosom find 
mani mani virtu excel 
none yet differ 
o mickl power grace lies
in plant herb stone true qualiti 
for naught vile earth doth live
but earth special good doth give 
nor aught good strain fair use 
revolt true birth stumbl abus 
virtu turn vice misappli 
and vice sometim action dignifi 

 enter romeo 

within infant rind weak flower
poison hath resid medicin power 
for smelt part cheer part 
be tast slay sens heart 
two oppos king encamp still
in man well herb grace rude 
and worser predomin 
full soon canker death eat plant 

romeo 
good morrow father 

friar lawrenc 
benedicit 
what earli tongu sweet saluteth 
young son argu distemp head
so soon bid good morrow thi bed 
care keep watch everi old man eye 
and care lodg sleep never lie 
but unbruis youth unstuff brain
doth couch limb golden sleep doth reign 
therefor thi earli doth assure
th art uprou distemperatur 
or i hit right 
our romeo hath bed tonight 

romeo 
that last true sweeter rest mine 

friar lawrenc 
god pardon sin wast thou rosalin 

romeo 
with rosalin ghostli father no 
i forgot name name woe 

friar lawrenc 
that good son but hast thou 

romeo 
i tell thee ere thou ask 
i feast mine enemi 
where sudden one hath wound me
that wound both remedies
within thi help holi physic lie 
i bear hatr bless man lo 
mi intercess likewis stead foe 

friar lawrenc 
be plain good son home thi drift 
riddl confess find riddl shrift 

romeo 
then plainli know heart dear love set
on fair daughter rich capulet 
a mine set mine 
and combin save thou must combine
bi holi marriag when how
w met woo made exchang vow 
i tell thee pass i pray 
that thou consent marri us today 

friar lawrenc 
holi saint franci what chang 
i rosalin thou didst love dear 
so soon forsaken young men love lies
not truli heart eye 
jesu maria deal brine
hath wash thi sallow cheek rosalin 
how much salt water thrown away wast 
to season love doth tast 
the sun yet thi sigh heaven clear 
thi old groan yet ring mine ancient ear 
lo upon thi cheek stain doth sit
of old tear wash yet 
if ere thou wast thyself woe thine 
thou woe rosalin 
and art thou chang pronounc sentenc 
women may fall strength men 

romeo 
thou chidd st oft love rosalin 

friar lawrenc 
for dote love pupil mine 

romeo 
and bad st buri love 

friar lawrenc 
not grave
to lay one anoth 

romeo 
i pray thee chide i love now
doth grace grace love love allow 
the 

friar lawrenc 
o knew well
thi love read rote could spell 
but come young waver come go 
in one respect i thi assist 
for allianc may happi prove 
to turn household rancour pure love 

romeo 
o let us henc i stand sudden hast 

friar lawrenc 
wise slow stumbl run fast 

 _exeunt _

 enter romeo

stal hoar ere spent 
 _sing _ 
 an old hare hoar 
 and old hare hoar 
 is good meat lent 
 but hare hoar
 is much score
 when hoar ere spent 
romeo come father we dinner thither

i follow

 _exeunt mercutio benvolio _ 

nurs 
i pray sir sauci merchant full his
roperi 

romeo 
a gentleman nurs love hear talk speak
mor minut stand month 

nurs 
and speak anyth i take lustier
than twenti jack and i can not i find those
that shall scurvi knave i none flirt gill i none of
hi skain mate and thou must stand suffer everi knave to
us pleasur 

peter 
i saw man use pleasur i weapon should
quickli i warrant i dare draw soon another
man i see occas good quarrel law side 

nurs 
now afor god i vex everi part quiver scurvy
knav pray sir word i told young ladi bid me
enquir bade say i keep but first
let tell ye ye lead fool paradis they
say gross kind behaviour say the
gentlewoman young and therefor deal doubl with
her truli ill thing offer gentlewoman and
veri weak deal 

romeo nurs commend thi ladi mistress i protest unto
the 

nurs 
good heart faith i tell much lord lord will
b joy woman 

romeo

nurs

gentlemanlik offer 

romeo 
bid devise
som mean come shrift afternoon 
and shall friar lawrenc cell
b shriv marri here thi pain 

nurs 
no truli sir penni 

romeo 
go i say shall 

nurs 
thi afternoon sir well shall 

romeo 
and stay good nurs behind abbey wall 
within hour man shall thee 
and bring thee cord made like tackl stair 
which high topgal joy
must convoy secret night 
farewel trusti i quit thi pain 
farewel commend thi mistress 

nurs 
now god heaven bless thee hark sir 

romeo 
what say st thou dear nurs 

nurs 
i man secret did ne er hear say 
two may keep counsel put one away 

romeo 
i warrant thee man true steel 

nurs 
well sir mistress sweetest ladi lord lord when twa a
littl prate thing o nobleman town one pari that
would fain lay knife aboard good soul lief see a
toad toad see i anger sometim tell that
pari proper man i warrant i say she
look pale clout versal world doth rosemari and
romeo begin letter 

romeo 
ay nurs both r 

nurs 
ah mocker that dog name r i know begins
with letter hath prettiest sententi 
of rosemari would good hear 

romeo 
commend thi ladi 

nurs 
ay thousand time peter 

 _exit romeo _ 

peter 
anon 

nurs 
befor apac 

 _exeunt _ 

scene v capulet garden 

 enter juliet 

juliet 
the clock struck nine i send nurs 
in half hour promis return 
perchanc can not meet that 
o lame love herald thought 
which ten time faster glide sun beam 
drive back shadow lower hill 
therefor nimbl pinion dove draw love 
and therefor hath wind swift cupid wing 
now sun upon highmost hill
of day journey nine till twelve
i three long hour yet come 
had affect warm youth blood 
she swift motion ball 
mi word would bandi sweet love 
and 
but old folk mani feign dead 
unwieldi slow heavi pale lead 

 enter nurs peter 

o god come o honey nurs news 
hast thou met send thi man away 

nurs 
peter stay gate 

 _exit peter _ 

juliet 
now good sweet nurs o lord look st thou sad 
though news sad yet tell merrili 
if good thou sham st music sweet news
bi play sour face 

nurs 
i aweari give leav awhil 
fie bone ach what jaunt i 

juliet 
i would thou hadst bone i thi news 
nay come i pray thee speak good good nurs speak 

nurs 
jesu hast can stay do see i am
out breath 

juliet 
how art thou breath thou hast breath
to say thou art breath 
the excus thou dost make delay
i longer tale thou dost excus 
i thi news good bad answer 
say either i stay circumst 
let satisfi good bad 

nurs 
well made simpl choic know choos man 
romeo no though face better man yet his
leg excel men hand foot bodi though
they talk yet past compar he the
flow courtesi i warrant gentl lamb go thy
way wench serv god what dine home 

juliet 
no but i know 
what say marriag what 

nurs 
lord head ach what head i 
it beat would fall twenti piec 
mi back side o back back 
beshrew heart send about
to catch death jaunc 

juliet 
i faith i sorri thou art well 
sweet sweet sweet nurs tell say love 

nurs 
your love say like honest gentleman 
and courteou kind handsom 
and i warrant virtuou where mother 

juliet 
where mother whi within 
where how oddli thou repliest 
 your love say like honest gentleman 
 where mother 

nurs 
o god ladi dear 
are hot marri come i trow 
i poultic ach bone 
henceforward messag 

juliet 
here coil come say romeo 

nurs 
have got leav go shrift today 

juliet 
i 

nurs 
then hie henc friar lawrenc cell 
there stay husband make wife 
now come wanton blood cheek 
they scarlet straight news 
hie church i must anoth way 
to fetch ladder love
must climb bird nest soon dark 
i drudg toil delight 
but shall bear burden soon night 
go i dinner hie cell 

juliet 
hie high fortun honest nurs farewel 

 _exeunt _ 

scene vi friar lawrenc cell 

 enter friar lawrenc romeo 

friar lawrenc 
so smile heaven upon holi act
that hour sorrow chide us 

romeo 
amen amen come sorrow 
it can not countervail exchang joy
that one short minut give sight 
do thou close hand holi word 
then love devour death dare 
it enough i may call mine 

friar lawrenc 
these violent delight violent end 
and triumph die like fire powder 
which kiss consum the sweetest honey
i loathsom delici 
and tast confound appetit 
therefor love moder long love doth 
too swift arriv tardi slow 

 enter juliet 

here come ladi o light foot
wil ne er wear everlast flint 
a lover may bestrid gossamers
that idl wanton summer air
and yet fall light vaniti 

juliet 
good even ghostli confessor 

friar lawrenc 
romeo shall thank thee daughter us 

juliet 
a much els thank much 

romeo 
ah juliet measur thi joy
b heap like mine thi skill more
to blazon sweeten thi breath
thi neighbour air let rich music tongue
unfold imagin happi both
rec either dear encount 

juliet 
conceit rich matter word 
brag substanc ornament 
they beggar count worth 
but true love grown excess 
i can not sum sum half wealth 

friar lawrenc 
come come make short work 
for leav shall stay alone
til holi church incorpor two one 

 _exeunt _ 



act iii

scen i a public place 

 enter mercutio benvolio page servant 

benvolio 
i pray thee good mercutio let retir 
the day hot capulet abroad 
and meet shall scape brawl 
for hot day mad blood stir 

mercutio 
thou art like one fellow enter confin of
a tavern clap sword upon tabl say god send no
ne thee oper second cup draw the
draw inde need 

benvolio 
am i like fellow 

mercutio 
come come thou art hot jack thi mood itali as
soon move moodi soon moodi move 

benvolio 
and 

mercutio 
nay two none shortli one would
kil thou whi thou wilt quarrel man hath a
hair hair less beard thou hast thou wilt quarrel
with man crack nut reason thou
hast hazel eye what eye eye would spi quarrel 
thi head full quarrel egg full meat yet thy
head hath beaten addl egg quarrel thou hast
quarrel man cough street hath
waken thi dog hath lain asleep sun didst thou fall
out tailor wear new doublet easter with
anoth tie new shoe old riband and yet thou wilt
tutor quarrel 

benvolio 
and i apt quarrel thou art man buy fee
simpl life hour quarter 

mercutio 
the fee simpl o simpl 

 enter tybalt other 

benvolio 
bi head come capulet 

mercutio 
bi heel i care 

tybalt 
follow close i speak 
gentlemen good den word one 

mercutio 
and one word one us coupl someth make a
word blow 

tybalt 
you shall find apt enough sir give me
occas 

mercutio 
could take occas without give 

tybalt 
mercutio thou consortest romeo 

mercutio 
consort what dost thou make us minstrel and thou make minstrel of
u look hear noth discord here fiddlestick s
that shall make danc zound consort 

benvolio 
we talk public haunt men 
either withdraw unto privat place 
and reason coldli grievanc 
or els depart eye gaze us 

mercutio 
men eye made look let gaze 
i budg man pleasur i 

 enter romeo 

tybalt 
well peac sir come man 

mercutio 
but i hang sir wear liveri 
marri go field follow 
your worship sens may call man 

tybalt 
romeo love i bear thee afford
no better term thou art villain 

romeo 
tybalt reason i love thee
doth much excus appertain rage
to greet villain i none 
therefor farewel i see thou know st 

tybalt 
boy shall excus injuries
that thou hast done therefor turn draw 

romeo 
i protest i never injur thee 
but love thee better thou canst devise
til thou shalt know reason love 
and good capulet name i tender
a dearli mine satisfi 

mercutio 
o calm dishonour vile submiss 
 _draw _ alla stoccata carri away 
tybalt rat catcher walk 

tybalt 
what wouldst thou 

mercutio 
good king cat noth one nine live i mean to
mak bold withal shall use hereaft dri beat rest
of eight will pluck sword pilcher ear 
make hast lest mine ear ere 

tybalt 
 _draw _ i 

romeo 
gentl mercutio put thi rapier 

mercutio

 _they fight _ 

romeo

gentlemen shame forbear outrag 
tybalt mercutio princ expressli hath
forbid bandi verona street 
hold tybalt good mercutio 

 _exeunt tybalt partizan _

i hurt 
a plagu hous i sped 
i gone hath noth

where page go villain fetch surgeon 

 _exit page _ 

romeo

no ti deep well wide church door tis
enough twill serv ask tomorrow shall find a
grav man i pepper i warrant world a plagu both
your hous zound dog rat mous cat scratch man to
death a braggart rogu villain fight book of
arithmet whi devil came us i hurt your
arm

i thought best 

mercutio 
help hous benvolio 
or i shall faint a plagu hous 
they made worm meat 
i soundli your hous 

 _exeunt mercutio benvolio _ 

romeo 
thi gentleman princ near alli 
mi friend hath got mortal hurt
in behalf reput stain d
with tybalt slander tybalt hour
hath cousin o sweet juliet 
thi beauti hath made effeminate
and temper soften valour steel 

 re enter benvolio 

benvolio 
o romeo romeo brave mercutio dead 
that gallant spirit hath aspir cloud 
which untim scorn earth 

romeo 
thi day black fate mo day doth depend 
thi begin woe other must end 

 re enter tybalt 

benvolio 
here come furiou tybalt back 

romeo 
again triumph mercutio slain 
away heaven respect leniti 
and fire ey furi conduct 
now tybalt take villain back again
that late thou gav st mercutio soul
i littl way head 
stay thine keep compani 
either thou i must go 

tybalt 
thou wretch boy didst consort 
shalt henc 

romeo 
thi shall determin 

 _they fight tybalt fall _ 

benvolio 
romeo away gone 
the citizen tybalt slain 
stand amaz the princ doom thee death
if thou art taken henc gone away 

romeo 
o i fortun fool 

benvolio

 _exit romeo _ 

 enter citizen 

first citizen 
which way ran kill mercutio 
tybalt murder way ran 

benvolio 
there lie tybalt 

first citizen 
up sir go 
i charg thee princ name obey 

 enter princ attend montagu capulet wive other 

princ 
where vile beginn fray 

benvolio 
o nobl princ i discov all
th unlucki manag fatal brawl 
there lie man slain young romeo 
that slew thi kinsman brave mercutio 

ladi capulet 
tybalt cousin o brother child 
o princ o husband o blood spill d
of dear kinsman princ thou art true 
for blood shed blood montagu 
o cousin cousin 

princ 
benvolio began bloodi fray 

benvolio 
tybalt slain romeo hand slay 
romeo spoke fair bid bethink
how nice quarrel urg withal
your high displeasur all uttered
with gentl breath calm look knee humbl bow d
could take truce unruli spleen
of tybalt deaf peac tilts
with pierc steel bold mercutio breast 
who hot turn deadli point point 
and martial scorn one hand beats
cold death asid sends
it back tybalt whose dexterity
retort romeo cri aloud 
 hold friend friend part swifter tongu 
hi agil arm beat fatal point 
and twixt rush underneath whose arm
an enviou thrust tybalt hit life
of stout mercutio tybalt fled 
but come back romeo 
who newli entertain reveng 
and go like lightn ere i
could draw part stout tybalt slain 
and fell romeo turn fli 
thi truth let benvolio die 

ladi capulet 
he kinsman montagu 
affect make fals speak true 
some twenti fought black strife 
and twenti could kill one life 
i beg justic thou princ must give 
romeo slew tybalt romeo must live 

princ 
romeo slew slew mercutio 
who price dear blood doth owe 

montagu 
not romeo princ mercutio friend 
hi fault conclud law end 
the life tybalt 

princ 
and offence
immedi exil henc 
i interest hate proceed 
mi blood rude brawl doth lie bleed 
but i amerc strong fine
that shall repent loss mine 
i deaf plead excus 
nor tear prayer shall purchas abus 
therefor use none let romeo henc hast 
els found hour last 
bear henc bodi attend 
merci murder pardon kill 

 _exeunt _ 

scene ii a room capulet hous 

 enter juliet 

juliet 
gallop apac fieri foot steed 
toward phoebu lodg such waggoner
a phaeton would whip west
and bring cloudi night immedi 
spread thi close curtain love perform night 
that runaway eye may wink romeo
leap arm untalk unseen 
lover see amor rites
bi beauti love blind 
it best agre night come civil night 
thou sober suit matron black 
and learn lose win match 
play pair stainless maidenhood 
hood unmann blood bate cheek 
with thi black mantl till strang love grow bold 
think true love act simpl modesti 
come night come romeo come thou day night 
for thou wilt lie upon wing night
whit new snow upon raven back 
come gentl night come love black brow night 
give romeo i shall die 
take cut littl star 
and make face heaven fine
that world love night 
and pay worship garish sun 
o i bought mansion love 
but possess though i sold 
not yet enjoy so tediou day
a night festival
to impati child hath new robes
and may wear o come nurs 
and bring news everi tongu speaks
but romeo name speak heavenli eloqu 

 enter nurs cord 

now nurs news what hast thou 
the cord romeo bid thee fetch 

nurs 
ay ay cord 

 _throw _ 

juliet 
ay news whi dost thou wring thi hand 

nurs 
ah well day dead dead dead 
we undon ladi undon 
alack day gone kill dead 

juliet 
can heaven enviou 

nurs 
romeo 
though heaven can not o romeo romeo 
who ever would thought romeo 

juliet 
what devil art thou dost torment thu 
thi tortur roar dismal hell 
hath romeo slain say thou ay 
and bare vowel i shall poison more
than death dart eye cockatric 
i i i 
or eye shut make thee answer ay 
if slain say ay no 
brief sound determin weal woe 

nurs 
i saw wound i saw mine eye 
god save mark manli breast 
a piteou cors bloodi piteou cors 
pale pale ash bedaub blood 
all gore blood i swound sight 

juliet 
o break heart poor bankrout break 
to prison eye ne er look liberti 
vile earth earth resign end motion 
and thou romeo press one heavi bier 

nurs 
o tybalt tybalt best friend i 
o courteou tybalt honest gentleman 
that ever i live see thee dead 

juliet 
what storm blow contrari 
i romeo slaughter tybalt dead 
mi dearest cousin dearer lord 
then dread trumpet sound gener doom 
for live two gone 

nurs 
tybalt gone romeo banish 
romeo kill banish 

juliet 
o god did romeo hand shed tybalt blood 

nurs 
it ala day 

juliet 
o serpent heart hid flower face 
did ever dragon keep fair cave 
beauti tyrant fiend angel 
dove feather raven wolvish raven lamb 
despis substanc divinest show 
just opposit thou justli seem st 
a damn saint honour villain 
o natur hadst thou hell
when thou didst bower spirit fiend
in mortal paradis sweet flesh 
wa ever book contain vile matter
so fairli bound o deceit dwell
in gorgeou palac 

nurs 
there trust 
no faith honesti men all perjur 
all forsworn naught dissembl 
ah man give aqua vita 
these grief woe sorrow make old 
shame come romeo 

juliet 
blister thi tongue
for wish he born shame 
upon brow shame asham sit 
for ti throne honour may crown d
sole monarch univers earth 
o beast i chide 

nurs 
will speak well kill cousin 

juliet 
shall i speak ill husband 
ah poor lord tongu shall smooth thi name 
when i thi three hour wife mangl 
but wherefor villain didst thou kill cousin 
that villain cousin would kill husband 
back foolish tear back nativ spring 
your tributari drop belong woe 
which mistak offer joy 
mi husband live tybalt would slain 
and tybalt dead would slain husband 
all comfort wherefor weep i 
some word worser tybalt death 
that murder i would forget fain 
but o press memory
lik damn guilti deed sinner mind 
tybalt dead romeo banish 
that banish one word banish 
hath slain ten thousand tybalt tybalt death
wa woe enough end 
or sour woe delight fellowship 
and needli rank grief 
whi follow said tybalt dead 
thi father thi mother nay 
which modern lament might mov 
but rear ward follow tybalt death 
 romeo banish speak word
i father mother tybalt romeo juliet 
all slain dead romeo banish 
there end limit measur bound 
in word death word woe sound 
where father mother nurs 

nurs 
weep wail tybalt cors 
will go i bring thither 

juliet 
wash wound tear mine shall spent 
when dri romeo banish 
take cord poor rope beguil 
both i romeo exil 
he made highway bed 
but i maid die maiden widow 
come cord come nurs i wed bed 
and death romeo take maidenhead 

nurs 
hie chamber i find romeo
to comfort i wot well 
hark ye romeo night 
i hid lawrenc cell 

juliet 
o find give ring true knight 
and bid come take last farewel 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iii friar lawrenc cell 

 enter friar lawrenc 

friar lawrenc 
romeo come forth come forth thou fear man 
afflict enanmour thi parts
and thou art wed calam 

 enter romeo 

romeo 
father news what princ doom 
what sorrow crave acquaint hand 
that i yet know 

friar lawrenc 
too familiar
i dear son sour compani 
i bring thee tide princ doom 

romeo 
what less doomsday princ doom 

friar lawrenc 
a gentler judgment vanish lip 
not bodi death bodi banish 

romeo 
ha banish be merci say death 
for exil hath terror look 
much death do say banish 

friar lawrenc 
henc verona art thou banish 
be patient world broad wide 

romeo 
there world without verona wall 
but purgatori tortur hell 
henc banish banish world 
and world exil death then banished
i death misterm call death banish 
thou cutt st head golden axe 
and smilest upon stroke murder 

friar lawrenc 
o deadli sin o rude unthank 
thi fault law call death kind princ 
take thi part hath brush asid law 
and turn black word death banish 
thi dear merci thou see st 

romeo 
 ti tortur merci heaven here
wher juliet live everi cat dog 
and littl mous everi unworthi thing 
live heaven may look 
but romeo may more valid 
more honour state courtship lives
in carrion fli romeo they may seize
on white wonder dear juliet hand 
and steal immort bless lip 
who even pure vestal modesty
stil blush think kiss sin 
but romeo may banish 
thi may fli i must fli 
they free men i banish 
and say st thou yet exil death 
hadst thou poison mix sharp ground knife 
no sudden mean death though ne er mean 
but banish kill banish 
o friar damn use word hell 
howl attend how hast thou heart 
be divin ghostli confessor 
a sin absolv friend profess 
to mangl word banish 

friar lawrenc 
thou fond mad man hear speak littl 

romeo 
o thou wilt speak banish 

friar lawrenc 
i give thee armour keep word 
advers sweet milk philosophi 
to comfort thee though thou art banish 

romeo 
yet banish hang philosophi 
unless philosophi make juliet 
displant town revers princ doom 
it help prevail talk 

friar lawrenc 
o i see mad men ear 

romeo 
how wise men eye 

friar lawrenc 
let disput thee thi estat 

romeo 
thou canst speak thou dost feel 
wert thou young i juliet thi love 
an hour marri tybalt murder 
dote like like banish 
then mightst thou speak mightst thou tear thi hair 
and fall upon ground i 
take measur unmad grave 

 _knock within _ 

friar lawrenc 
aris one knock good romeo hide thyself 

romeo 
not i unless breath heartsick groans
mist like infold search eye 

 _knock _ 

friar lawrenc 
hark knock who romeo aris 
thou wilt taken stay awhil stand 

 _knock _ 

run studi by god 
what simpl i come i come 

 _knock _ 

who knock hard whenc come 

nurs 
 _within _ let come shall know errand 
i come ladi juliet 

friar lawrenc 
welcom 

 enter nurs 

nurs 
o holi friar o tell holi friar 
where ladi lord romeo 

friar lawrenc 
there ground tear made drunk 

nurs 
o even mistress case 
just case o woeful sympathi 
piteou predica even lie 
blubber weep weep blubber 
stand stand stand man 
for juliet sake sake rise stand 
whi fall deep o 

romeo 
nurs 

nurs 
ah sir ah sir death end 

romeo 
spakest thou juliet how 
doth think old murder 
now i stain childhood joy
with blood remov littl 
where and doth and says
mi conceal ladi cancel love 

nurs 
o say noth sir weep weep 
and fall bed start 
and tybalt call romeo cri 
and fall 

romeo 
a name 
shot deadli level gun 
did murder name curs hand
murd kinsman o tell friar tell 
in vile part anatomy
doth name lodg tell i may sack
th hate mansion 

 _draw sword _ 

friar lawrenc 
hold thi desper hand 
art thou man thi form cri thou art 
thi tear womanish thi wild act denote
th unreason furi beast 
unseemli woman seem man 
and ill beseem beast seem 
thou hast amaz by holi order 
i thought thi disposit better temper 
hast thou slain tybalt wilt thou slay thyself 
and slay thi ladi thi life live 
bi damn hate upon thyself 
whi rail st thou thi birth heaven earth 
sinc birth heaven earth three meet
in thee thou wouldst lose 
fie fie thou sham st thi shape thi love thi wit 
which like usur abound st 
and usest none true use indeed
which bedeck thi shape thi love thi wit 
thi nobl shape form wax 
digress valour man 
thi dear love sworn hollow perjuri 
kill love thou hast vow cherish 
thi wit ornament shape love 
misshapen conduct 
like powder skilless soldier flask 
i set afir thine ignor 
and thou dismemb thine defenc 
what rous thee man thi juliet aliv 
for whose dear sake thou wast late dead 
there art thou happi tybalt would kill thee 
but thou slew st tybalt art thou happi 
the law threaten death becom thi friend 
and turn exil art thou happi 
a pack bless light upon thi back 
happi court thee best array 
but like misshap sullen wench 
thou putt st thi fortun thi love 
take heed take heed die miser 
go get thee thi love decre 
ascend chamber henc comfort 
but look thou stay till watch set 
for thou canst pass mantua 
where thou shalt live till find time
to blaze marriag reconcil friend 
beg pardon princ call thee back
with twenti hundr thousand time joy
than thou went st forth lament 
go nurs commend thi ladi 
and bid hasten hous bed 
which heavi sorrow make apt unto 
romeo come 

nurs 
o lord i could stay night
to hear good counsel o learn 
mi lord i tell ladi come 

romeo 
do bid sweet prepar chide 

nurs 
here sir ring bid give sir 
hie make hast grow late 

 _exit _ 

romeo 
how well comfort reviv 

friar lawrenc 
go henc good night stand state 
either gone watch set 
or break day disgui henc 
sojourn mantua i find man 
and shall signifi time time
everi good hap chanc 
give thi hand ti late farewel good night 

romeo 
but joy past joy call 
it grief brief part thee 
farewel 

 _exeunt _ 

scene iv a room capulet hous 

 enter capulet ladi capulet pari 

capulet 
thing fallen sir unluckily
that time move daughter 
look lov kinsman tybalt dearli 
and i well born die 
 ti late come tonight 
i promis compani 
i would abe hour ago 

pari 
these time woe afford tune woo 
madam good night commend daughter 

ladi capulet 
i know mind earli tomorrow 
tonight mew heavi 

capulet 
sir pari i make desper tender
of child love i think rul d
in respect nay i doubt 
wife go ere go bed 
acquaint son pari love 
and bid mark wednesday next 
but soft day 

pari 
monday lord 

capulet 
monday ha ha well wednesday soon 
a thursday let thursday tell 
she shall marri nobl earl 
will readi do like hast 
we keep great ado friend two 
for hark tybalt slain late 
it may thought held carelessli 
be kinsman revel much 
therefor half dozen friend 
and end but say thursday 

pari 
mi lord i would thursday tomorrow 

capulet 
well get gone a thursday 
go juliet ere go bed 
prepar wife wed day 
farewel lord light chamber ho 
afor late we
may call earli good night 

 _exeunt _ 

scene v an open galleri juliet chamber overlook garden 

 enter romeo juliet 

juliet 
wilt thou gone it yet near day 
it nightingal lark 
that pierc fear hollow thine ear 
nightli sing yond pomegran tree 
believ love nightingal 

romeo 
it lark herald morn 
no nightingal look love enviou streaks
do lace sever cloud yonder east 
night candl burnt jocund day
stand tipto misti mountain top 
i must gone live stay die 

juliet 
yond light daylight i know i 
it meteor sun exhales
to thee night torchbearer
and light thee thi way mantua 
therefor stay yet thou need st gone 

romeo 
let ta en let put death 
i content thou wilt 
i say yon grey morn eye 
 ti pale reflex cynthia brow 
nor lark whose note beat
th vaulti heaven high head 
i care stay go 
come death welcom juliet will 
how soul let talk it day 

juliet 
it hie henc gone away 
it lark sing tune 
strain harsh discord unpleas sharp 
some say lark make sweet divis 
thi doth divideth us 
some say lark loath toad chang eye 
o i would chang voic 
sinc arm arm voic doth us affray 
hunt thee henc hunt day 
o gone light light grow 

romeo 
more light light dark dark woe 

 enter nurs 

nurs 
madam 

juliet 
nurs 

nurs

the day broke wari look

juliet

 _descend _ 

juliet

i must hear thee everi day hour 
for minut mani day 
o count i shall much years
er i behold romeo

that may convey greet love thee 

juliet

for sweet discours time come

that renown faith be fickl fortun 
for i hope thou wilt keep long
but send back

 _within _ ho daughter 

juliet

i late earli 
what unaccustom caus procur hither 

 enter ladi capulet 

ladi capulet 
whi juliet 

juliet 
madam i well 

ladi capulet

what wilt thou wash grave tear 
and thou couldst thou couldst make live

but much grief show still want wit

which weep

ladi capulet

then weep i send one mantua 
where banish runag doth live 
shall give unaccustom dram
that shall soon keep tybalt compani 
and i hope thou wilt satisfi 

juliet 
inde i never shall satisfied
with romeo till i behold dead 
i poor heart kinsman vex 
madam could find man
to bear poison i would temper 
that romeo upon receipt thereof 
soon sleep quiet o heart abhors
to hear nam can not come 
to wreak love i bore cousin
upon bodi hath slaughter

but i tell thee joy tide girl 

juliet

what i beseech ladyship

hath sort sudden day joy 
that thou expect i look 

juliet

th gallant young nobl gentleman

now saint peter church peter 
he shall make joy bride

er husband come woo

i marri yet i i swear
it shall romeo know i hate 
rather pari these news inde

and see take hand 

 enter capulet nurs 

capulet 
when sun set air doth drizzl dew 
but sunset brother son
it rain downright 
how a conduit girl what still tear 
evermor shower in one littl body
th counterfeit bark sea wind 
for still thi eye i may call sea 
do ebb flow tear bark thi bodi 
sail salt flood wind thi sigh 
who rage thi tear 
without sudden calm overset
thi tempest toss bodi how wife 
have deliv decre

how none doth give us thank 
i proud doth count blest 
unworthi wrought
so worthi gentleman bridegroom

but thank even hate meant love 

capulet 
how chopp logic what 
proud i thank i thank 
and yet proud mistress minion 
thank thank proud proud 
but fettl fine joint gainst thursday next
to go pari saint peter church 
or i drag thee hurdl thither 
out green sick carrion out baggag 
you tallow face

fie fie what mad 

juliet

and curs

for need

you hot 

capulet 
god bread make mad 
day night hour ride time work play 
alon compani still care hath been
to match provided
a gentleman nobl parentag 
of fair demesn youth nobli alli 
stuff say honour part 
proport one thought would wish man 
and wretch pule fool 
a whine mammet fortun tender 
to answer i wed i can not love 
i young i pray pardon 
but wed i pardon 
graze shall hous 
look think i use jest 
thursday near lay hand heart advis 
and mine i give friend 
and hang beg starv die street 
for soul i ne er acknowledg thee 
nor mine shall never thee good 
trust bethink i forsworn 

 _exit _ 

juliet

that see bottom grief

or make bridal bed
in dim monument tybalt lie

 _exit _ 

juliet 
o god o nurs shall prevent 
mi husband earth faith heaven 
how shall faith return earth 
unless husband send heaven
bi leav earth comfort counsel 
alack alack heaven practis stratagems
upon soft subject 
what say st thou hast thou word joy 
some comfort nurs 

nurs 
faith

that dare ne er come back challeng 
or need must stealth 
then sinc case stand doth

o love gentleman

hath green quick fair eye
a pari hath beshrew heart

a live use

which hath prai compare
so mani thousand time go counsellor

i friar know remedi 
if els fail power die

act iv

scen i friar lawrenc cell 

 enter friar lawrenc pari 

friar lawrenc 
on thursday sir the time short 

pari 
mi father capulet 
and i noth slow slack hast 

friar lawrenc 
you say know ladi mind 
uneven cours i like 

pari 
immoder weep tybalt death 
and therefor i littl talk love 
for venu smile hous tear 
now sir father count dangerous
that give sorrow much sway 
and wisdom hast marriag 
to stop inund tear 
which much mind alon 
may put societi 
now know reason hast 

friar lawrenc 
 _asid _ i would i knew slow 
look sir come ladi toward cell 

 enter juliet 

pari 
happili met ladi wife 

juliet 
that may sir i may wife 

pari 
that may must love thursday next 

juliet 
what must shall 

friar lawrenc 
that certain text 

pari 
come make confess father 

juliet 
to answer i confess 

pari 
do deni love 

juliet 
i confess i love 

pari 
so ye i sure love 

juliet 
if i price 
be spoke behind back face 

pari 
poor soul thi face much abu tear 

juliet 
the tear got small victori 
for bad enough spite 

pari 
thou wrong st tear report 

juliet 
that slander sir truth 
and i spake i spake face 

pari 
thi face mine thou hast slander 

juliet 
it may mine 
are leisur holi father 
or shall i come even mass 

friar lawrenc 
mi leisur serv pensiv daughter 
mi lord must entreat time alon 

pari 
god shield i disturb devot 
juliet thursday earli i rous ye 
till adieu keep holi kiss 

 _exit _ 

juliet 
o shut door thou hast done 
come weep past hope past cure past help 

friar lawrenc 
o juliet i alreadi know thi grief 
it strain past compass wit 
i hear thou must noth may prorogu 
on thursday next marri counti 

juliet 
tell friar thou hear st 
unless thou tell i may prevent 
if thi wisdom thou canst give help 
do thou call resolut wise 
and knife i help present 
god join heart romeo thou hand 
and ere hand thee romeo seal 
shall label anoth deed 
or true heart treacher revolt
turn anoth shall slay 
therefor thi long experienc time 
give present counsel behold
 twixt extrem bloodi knife
shal play empir arbitr that
which commiss thi year art
could issu true honour bring 
be long speak i long die 
if thou speak st speak remedi 

friar lawrenc 
hold daughter i spi kind hope 
which crave desper execution
a desper would prevent 
if rather marri counti paris
th hast strength slay thyself 
then like thou wilt undertake
a thing like death chide away shame 
that cop st death scape 
and thou dar st i give thee remedi 

juliet 
o bid leap rather marri pari 
from battlement yonder tower 
or walk thievish way bid lurk
wher serpent chain roar bear 
or hide nightli charnel hous 
o er cover quit dead men rattl bone 
with reeki shank yellow chapless skull 
or bid go new made grave 
and hide dead man shroud 
thing hear told made trembl 
and i without fear doubt 
to live unstain wife sweet love 

friar lawrenc 
hold go home merri give consent
to marri pari wednesday tomorrow 
tomorrow night look thou lie alon 
let thi nurs lie thee thi chamber 
take thou vial bed 
and distil liquor drink thou 
when present thi vein shall run
a cold drowsi humour pulse
shal keep nativ progress surceas 
no warmth breath shall testifi thou livest 
the rose thi lip cheek shall fade
to pali ash thi eye window fall 
like death shut day life 
each part depriv suppl govern 
shall stiff stark cold appear like death 
and borrow like shrunk death
thou shalt continu two forti hour 
and awak pleasant sleep 
now bridegroom morn comes
to rous thee thi bed art thou dead 
then manner countri 
in thi best robe uncov bier 
thou shalt born ancient vault
wher kindr capulet lie 
in meantim thou shalt awak 
shall romeo letter know drift 
and hither shall come i
wil watch thi wake night
shal romeo bear thee henc mantua 
and shall free thee present shame 
if inconst toy womanish fear
ab thi valour act 

juliet 
give give o tell fear 

friar lawrenc 
hold get gone strong prosperous
in resolv i send friar speed
to mantua letter thi lord 

juliet 
love give strength strength shall help afford 
farewel dear father 

 _exeunt _

scene iii juliet chamber 

 enter juliet nurs

 _exeunt ladi capulet nurs _ 

juliet

i faint cold fear thrill veins
that almost freez heat life 
i call back comfort 
nurs what 
mi dismal scene i need must act alon 
come vial 
what mixtur work 
shall i marri tomorrow morn 
no no thi shall forbid lie thou 

 _lay dagger _ 

what poison friar
subtli hath minist dead 
lest marriag dishonour 
becaus marri romeo 
i fear and yet methink 
for hath still tri holi man 
how i laid tomb 
i wake time romeo
com redeem there fear point 
shall i stifl vault 
to whose foul mouth healthsom air breath 
and die strangl ere romeo come 
or i live like 
the horribl conceit death night 
togeth terror place 
a vault ancient receptacl 
where mani hundr year bones
of buri ancestor pack 
where bloodi tybalt yet green earth 
li fester shroud say 
at hour night spirit resort 
alack alack like i 
so earli wake loathsom smell 
and shriek like mandrak torn earth 
that live mortal hear run mad 
o i wake shall i distraught 
environ hideou fear 
and madli play forefath joint 
and pluck mangl tybalt shroud 
and rage great kinsman bone 
a club dash desper brain 
o look methink i see cousin ghost
seek romeo spit body
upon rapier point stay tybalt stay 
romeo romeo romeo drink i drink thee 

 _throw bed _

 enter capulet

life lip long separ 
death lie like untim frost
upon sweetest flower field

o lament day 

ladi capulet

capulet

ti tongu let speak 

 enter friar lawrenc pari musician 

friar lawrenc

capulet 
readi go never return 
o son night thi wed day
hath death lain thi bride there lie 
flower deflow 
death son law death heir 
mi daughter hath wed i die 
and leav life live death 

pari 
have i thought long see morn face 
and doth give sight 

ladi capulet 
accur unhappi wretch hate day 
most miser hour e er time saw
in last labour pilgrimag 
but one poor one one poor love child 
but one thing rejoic solac 
and cruel death hath catch sight 

nurs 
o woe o woeful woeful woeful day 
most lament day woeful day
that ever ever i yet behold 
o day o day o day o hate day 
never seen black day 
o woeful day o woeful day 

pari 
beguil divorc wrong spite slain 
most detest death thee beguil 
bi cruel cruel thee quit overthrown 
o love o life not life love death 

capulet 
despi distress hate martyr kill 
uncomfort time cam st thou now
to murder murder solemn 
o child o child my soul child 
dead art thou alack child dead 
and child joy buri 

friar lawrenc 
peac ho shame confus cure live not
in confus heaven yourself
had part fair maid heaven hath 
and better maid 
your part could keep death 
but heaven keep part etern life 
the sought promot 
for twa heaven advanc 
and weep ye see advanc d
abov cloud high heaven 
o love love child ill
that run mad see well 
she well marri live marri long 
but best marri die marri young 
dri tear stick rosemary
on fair cors custom 
and best array bear church 
for though fond natur bid us lament 
yet natur tear reason merriment 

capulet 
all thing ordain festival
turn offic black funer 
our instrument melancholi bell 
our wed cheer sad burial feast 
our solemn hymn sullen dirg chang 
our bridal flower serv buri cors 
and thing chang contrari 

friar lawrenc 
sir go madam go 
and go sir pari everyon prepare
to follow fair cors unto grave 
the heaven lower upon ill 
move cross high 

 _exeunt capulet ladi capulet pari friar _

put iron dagger answer like men 
 when gripe grief heart doth wound

 then music silver sound 
whi silver sound whi music silver sound what say 
simon catl

 music silver sound musician gold for

 with speedi help doth lend redress
